Title: Social Science Analyst
Description: DutiesSummaryThe incumbent will report to the Branch Chief, Research and Analysis within the Judiciary Data and Analysis Office of the Department of Program Services at the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts. The incumbent will conduct advanced analytical research and analysis in predictive modeling, data mining, and machine learning methodologies in a collaborative environment.ResponsibilitiesDuties of this position include, but are not limited to:Conducting advanced analytical research and analysis with expertise in predictive modeling, data mining, and machine learning methodologies in a collaborative environment, leveraging both structured and unstructured data sources.Formulating and disseminating short-term forecasts used in the development of the Judiciary's budget submission to Congress and long-range forecasts used for policy and program management using data-oriented techniques and software.Responding to questions from business users concerning the budget and program forecasts.Responding to complex data inquires from the Judiciary, the Executive and Legislative Branches, academia, and the general public.Producing deliverables under tight deadlines and shifting priorities.Collaborating in a team environment and exercising independent judgment and initiative.Travel RequiredNot requiredSupervisory statusNoPromotion Potential00Job family (Series)0101 Social ScienceRequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentCONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:All information is subject to verification. Applicants are advised that false answers or omissions of information on application materials or inability to meet the following conditions may be grounds for non-selection, withdrawal of an offer of employment, or dismissal after being employed.Selection for this position is contingent upon completion of OF-306, Declaration of Federal Employment during the pre-employment process and proof of U.S. citizenship for competitive status positions or conversion to a competitive status position with the Administrative Office of the US Courts. In instances where non-citizens are considered for hire into temporary or any other position with non competitive status or when it is confirmed by the AO's Human Resources Office that there are no qualified U.S. citizens for a competitive status position (unless prohibited by a law or statue), non-citizens must provide proof of authorization to work in the United States and proof of entitlement to receive compensation. Additional information on the employment of non-citizens can be found at http://ww.usajobs.gov/Help/working-in-government/non-citizens. For a list of documents that may be used to provide proof of citizenship or authorization to work in the United States, please refer to Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification.All new AO employees will be required to complete a FBI fingerprint-based national criminal database and records check and pass a public trust suitability check.All new AO employees must identify a financial institution for direct deposit of pay before appointment.You will be required to serve a trial period if selected for a first-time appointment to the Federal government, transferring from another Federal agency, or serving as a first-time supervisor. Failure to successfully complete the trial period may result in termination of employment.If appointed to a temporary position, management may have the discretion of converting the position to permanent depending upon funding and staffing allocation.Relocation expenses may be provided, but only if authorized by the Director of the AO.QualificationsApplicants must have demonstrated experience as listed below. This requirement is according to the AO Classification, Compensation, and Recruitment Systems which include interpretive guidance and reference to the OPM Operating Manual for Qualification Standards for General Schedule Positions.Specialized Experience: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience which is in or directly related to the line of work of this position. Specialized experience is demonstrated experience using complex and large data sets to design reports and dashboards, (that are easily understood and visually attractive), collaborating in team environments and experience using Business Objects and Structured Query Language (SQL). Applicants must possess excellent communication and written skills and be able to present information to a group.Desired (not required): Candidates will have a Ph.D. or Master degree that includes at least six credits in statistics or data science or the equivalent in work experience (a minimum of six years of practical experience in statistics, forecasting, or data science).EducationBasic Requirement: The basic requirement can be met in one of three ways.Degree in behavioral or social science; or related disciplines appropriate to the position; orA combination of education and experience that has provided the applicant with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field; orFour years of appropriate experience that demonstrated that the applicant has acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.Additional informationThe AO is an Equal Opportunity Employer.How You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.We will review your resume and supporting documentation and compare this information to your responses on the occupational questionnaire to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications for this job. If you meet the minimum qualifications for this job, we will evaluate your application package, to assess the quality, depth, and complexity of your accomplishments, experience, and education as they relate to the requirements listed in this vacancy announcement.You should be aware that your ratings are subject to evaluation and verification. If a determination is made that you have rated yourself higher than is supported by your resume and/or narrative responses, you will be assigned a rating commensurate to your described experience. Failure to submit the mandatory narrative responses will result in not receiving full consideration and/or rating credit. Deliberate attempts to falsify information may be grounds for not selecting you, withdrawing an offer of employment, or dismissal after being employed.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceNot RequiredDrug test requiredNoRequired DocumentsRequired DocumentsFor this job announcement the following documents and/or information are required:Resume - Any written format you choose to describe your job-related qualifications.Citizenship - Include country of citizenship on resume.Notification of Personnel Action (SF-50) - All applicants outside of the AO must submit a copy of your latest SF-50 to verify current or former Federal employment status.Veterans Preference documentation - Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (DD Form 214), if applicable Application for 10-Point Veteran Preference (SF-15) and an official statement, dated 1991 or later, from the Department of Veterans Affairs or from a branch of the Armed Forces, certifying to the veteran's present receipt of compensation.If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.BenefitsBenefitsA career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.Review our benefitsEligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.HelpThis job is open toThe publicU.S. citizens, nationals or those who owe allegiance to the U.S.Clarification from the agencyThis vacancy is open to U.S. citizens.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description: TitleData Center EngineerJob typeFull timeLocation(s)Washington DCWork Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19Purpose: Position with an Award-winning Government Technology Solutions provider Rated#4 in Systems Development by Inc 2018, looking to expand team for a seven year long Government project to support the U.S. Department of State (DoS) in Washington DC.Requirements:Assist with operations of the two DoS' Data Center infrastructure.Minimize impact to operations during planned Data Center maintenance.Plan for buildout of new infrastructure for the Data Center to include space, power, network and storage.Coordinate delivery and implementation of equipment.Manage the Data Center Access Control List and access to the Data Center.Coordinate, review and manage POC information with IRM for all Enterprise Server Operations Center (ESOC) Outage notifications.Coordinate the deployment of new hardware assets to replace aging equipment, which required organizing the migration of virtual infrastructure assets in such a way that data center resources could continue to be available for new hardware without causing any outages or downtime for the services still operating on the old hardware, while still minimizing the physical data center footprint.Coordinate hardware installation and power connection requests with site facility engineers.Receive and account for all line items of newly purchased equipment.Perform site asset management and auditing to account for all procured equipment.Perform complex troubleshooting to accurately diagnose the cause of service interruptions and quickly implement resolutions.Develop, maintain, and communicate diagrams, system configurations and technical documentation.Provide and ensure availability, efficiency and effectiveness of systems, Software/Hardware and data as well as technical support for testing and evaluation purposes.Document, track and report on the support provided to the Consular facilities; report and follow-up on all trouble calls.Qualifications:8+ years of demonstrated experience in Information Technology or related field.Alternatively please apply through our website at www.skilled-hire.com/career to be considered for this position.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Ridgeline International is looking for a Data Scientist to help us boldly innovate through data.This is a strategic hire. You should be curious by design, think of yourself as a data artist and storyteller, have an ownership, solution and action mindset, can impact the cross functional team that moves fast with intent and purpose. We are particularly interested in your portfolio of data innovation in the geo-political, national issue or brand campaigns.If this is you then then we should talk.What youÈll do:Build data products that solve hard problems and reveal opportunity through creative sourcing, model development and visualization.What youÈll need:Four or more years of experience in a data science role, with a concentration on social sciences, demographic analysis and anthropology.Experience with creation of visual data displays.Expert in Python; R; ScalaNice to Haves:MA in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; or experience. Self-taught coders are welcome. Bring your portfolio and impress us.Credentials in machine learning, AI, probabilities, statistical inference and linear modelsFamiliarity with Unix shell scriptingVisualization to tell a story and explain a pointHere are some Perks of being a Ridgeliner!20% 401K contribution regardless of employee matchFlexible PTO + HolidaysOpportunities for professional development to attend conferences, classes, and workshops.$1,000 every month for discretionary team building stipend.$2,500 Annual Clothing Allowance$2,000 Hobby AllowanceMedical, dental, vision, disability, life insuranceFree daily snacks & fancy sparkling water and nitro cold brew on tapCompany-wide events, including team building, holiday party, and off-sites.Free gym membershipGet the technology you want to do your jobFlexible work schedules

Title: Data Scientist II
Description: OCC Senior Analyst/Facilitator (PID 1429)ActivitiesSupport the VA Office of Electronic Health Records Modernization (OEHRM) Command Center as a Senior Analyst/Facilitator. Responsibilities include:Develop briefings on topics pertaining to VA electronic health record solution, including Executive status briefings, Course of Action briefings, other decision briefingsTailor content to multiple audiences using slides to tell the storyÈ of the topic, such as status, challenges and opportunitiesDraft narrative and create graphics to communicate key information on topics such as program status, risks, action items, technical challenges, milestones across functional and technical areas of the programMaintain slide libraries for efficient assembly of decks for senior leader speaking engagementsWork under deadline and in close contact with senior government and contract leadershipWork across the team to identify collect information and coordinate inputs for meetings and briefings as neededTrack action items for VA OEHRM Command Center Lead and collect updates on assigned action itemsFacilitate meetings (virtual and in-person) for Executive audiences including capturing of meeting minutes and action itemsConduct ad hoc working sessions with VA clients to capture live changes in documentation or presentationSupport the development of internal document management policies, standard operating procedures, business process diagrams, and strategic plansRequirementsBasic qualifications:Minimum of 4 years of experience is required. An additional 8 years of relevant experience may be substituted for degree requirementExpert knowledge of PowerPointExperience supporting Executive-level clientsKnowledge of Electronic Health RecordsMeeting facilitation experience (virtual and in-person) for ExecutivesKnowledge of appropriate data sources to address the specific requirements of projects for monitoring, characterization, analysis and modelingAble to perform research, writing and editing, including the writing and editing of project products to established government standardsAble to work independentlyAble to present at meetings and workshops on project work and participate in discussionsMasterÈs degree in Healthcare, Science, Computer Engineering or related scientific, technical, or clinical disciplineAdditional qualifications:Experience in the VA, DoD or bothExperience integrating electronic health records a plusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $130,000.00 /yearExperience:data scientist: 4 years (Preferred)Education:Master's (Required)Benefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.emergingtech.coCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/Emerging-Tech-LLC-107591787617776/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Graduate Studies Program - Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist Graduate Intern for the CIA, you will work side-by-side with other Data Scientists to organize and interpret data to inform US decision makers, drive successful operations, and shape technology and resource investments. Through CIA's global mission, the Agency has access to unique and highly specialized data. You will work with advanced hardware, software, and techniques to develop computational algorithms and statistical methods to identify patterns and relationships in large volumes of data. Data Scientists clearly communicate their conclusions to a diverse audience and develop technical expertise via hands-on experience and continuous learning, including Agency-sponsored training, academic conferences, and other professional development activities.The Graduate Studies Program allows you and the Agency to assess opportunities for permanent employment following your completion of Graduate school.Offices of the CIA  Directorate of Digital InnovationThe Directorate of Digital Innovation (DDI) is at the forefront of defining the future of digital expertise within the CIA. DDI focuses on developing the workforce with cutting-edge skills, investing in IT infrastructure, and modernizing the way the Agency does business. DDI officers help accelerate the integration of innovative methods and tools to enhance the CIA's cyber and digital capabilities on a global scale and ultimately help safeguard our nation. Learn more about the Directorate of Digital Innovation.See our work in action:Life at CIAIn addition to a comprehensive benefits package, the CIA offers exciting career opportunities and a dynamic environment. We're on the forefront of world-altering events  as they happen. So working here isn't just a job, it's a mindset and a lifestyle.US citizenship required (dual-national US citizens eligible). All positions require relocation to the Washington, DC metro area.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degreeEnrolled in a graduate program of study as a full-time studentGPA of at least 3.0 on a 4-point scaleExpertise in working with data using a combination of mathematics, computation, or visualization and interactionExperience through thesis research, internships, or work experience in a science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM) related field, such as:Computational social scienceComputer scienceData analyticsEconomicsEngineeringGeospatial analysisMathematicsOperations researchPhysicsQuantitative financeStatisticsAvailability to work at least one 90-day tour prior to graduationAttending school on a full-time basis before/following this internshipCreativityInitiativeIntegrityLeadership abilitiesProblem solving skillsAbility to work in a diverse team environmentAll applicants must successfully complete:A thorough medical and psychological examA polygraph interviewA comprehensive background investigationTo be considered suitable for Agency employment, applicants must generally not have used illegal drugs within the last 12 months. The issue of illegal drug use prior to 12 months ago is carefully evaluated during the medical and security processing.

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Note: The Data Engineer can work remotely from anywhere, even after Covid-19 related telework has passed.About UsAE Strategies is a Mclean, VA based consulting firm, founded in 2003, providing management consulting to federal clients. We are a proven small business with an established reputation and a track record of supporting critical initiatives across a wide range of federal clients. Employees will work on challenging and impactful federal initiatives in a positive and collaborative work environment with competitive compensation and benefits and a collaborative and supportive company culture that is designed to support client success and employee development. Find out more at www.aestrategies.com.OverviewThe Data Engineer will join our growing data analytics practice, helping federal clients to apply mathematical modeling and advanced techniques to integrate, process, analyze, and visualize data. We use optical character recognition (OCR) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques to enable more automated, data-driven information management. The Data Engineer will:Provide data engineering, analysis, and visualization support, including predictive modeling, graph analysis, social network analysis.Assist project teams with identifying, gathering, and understanding relevant data to support analysis, as well as, assess relative quality and reliability of the data.Assist with data preparation, including data cleansing, transformation, combination, aggregation, and scripts for recurring ingestion in preparation for modeling and analysis.Assist with developing data visualizations of results for ease of use and adoption of analytics.Examine large data sets to identify trends, develop charts, and create visual presentations to help the organization make more strategic decisions.Qualifications:BS plus 8 years or MS plus 5 yearsÈ experience.Active Secret Clearance.Direct experience creating sustainable, automated processes for data analysis.Experience creating high level architectural specifications.Advanced technical expertise with programmatically manipulating data.Proficiency in data management systems and statistical packages such as Cloudera Hadoop (priority): Hive, PIG, Sqoop, and Flume.R (priority) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) within R, Spark, SAS programming.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $120,000.00 to $170,000.00 /yearExperience:creating sustainable, automated processes for data analysis: 5 years (Required)R and Natural Language Processing (R, Spark and SAS): 1 year (Required)creating high level architectural specifications: 1 year (Required)Cloudera Hadoop: Hive, PIG, Sqoop and Flume: 1 year (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)License:Do you have an Active Secret Clearance (Required)Work Remotely:Yes

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description: As an Internet Data Center Engineer, you are ACTION ORIENTED  understand task priority and the urgency of meeting deadlines. You know Who, When, How to troubleshoot network system and hardware updates. Not only do you have a TEAM PLAYER mentality, but you are ready to infuse PASSION into your work.The IDC Engineer will work closely with PM and NOC Services staff to perform in-field inventory, installation, diagnostics and repairs for all network equipment, data centers, and co-location facilities that serve Zenlayer Services and its client. The ideal candidate will have experience/knowledge in maintenance and monitoring of server systems, working within a data center or network operation center environment as well as project management and leadership.Our team will provide provide total service training within the first month of onboarding to ensure comfort-ability and success in the position!About ZenlayerZenlayer is an edge cloud services provider headquartered in Los Angeles and Shanghai with offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, Beijing, Hangzhou and Shenzhen. Businesses utilize our software-defined platform to instantly enable worldwide connectivity and deliver superior user experience. We offer on-demand bare metal cloud, cloud net-working, SD-WAN and managed services in more than 150 data centers on six continents.At Zenlayer, we strive to be better every day by providing services that exceeds the expectations of those we serve. This includes internal and external customers!Let us know if you think you are the one!Duties & Responsibilities:Install servers and networking equipment both Domestic and International as required.Providing accurate and timely processing of service orders that could adversely impact customer satisfaction and company revenue.Racking/Mounting of Switches and Servers with standardized cabling structure for easy troubleshooting and neat, well establish connectivity. Perform routine operational support and system maintenance. Respond to customer requests quickly and resolve technical problems effectively.Participate in coordinated, scheduled maintenance activities with multiple parties in multiple locations with standard procedure.Upgrade software/firmware on production hardware during maintenance windows, with step by step and coordinated flow.Flexible with schedule and travel both domestic and international.Required Qualifications:AssociateÈs Degree with between 6 months to 1 year of working experience in a data center.Must be self-motivated, detail oriented, positive in approach, professional and help create, develop and implement project process improvement(s).Excellent communication skills.Basic network, servers, and OS knowledge. Understand TCP/IP.Ability to use hand tools.Ability to lift heavy loads, up to 50 lbs. Must be able to work at heights, off of a ladder and in confined space.Ability to travel data centers in state.Ability to rotate shift including holiday, off hours (i.e., graveyard shift), weekend and vacation.Fluent in Mandarin Chinese (listen, speak, read, and write) is highly preferred.Preferred Qualification:Any server, OS, Network or data center certifications.Additional Information:Job Type: ContractorWork Location: Ashburn and Reston, VASalary: Compensation package will be commensurate with experience.

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description: Principal Data ScientistWashington, DC$170,000-190,000 base salary + bonus + equityHarnham are partnered exclusively with a data and software firm who are continuing to grow despite the current climate. They're an established business which is unique has they have a plethora of proprietary data which they provide their clients as DaaS and also build into platforms as SaaS. They have a blossoming data science team which is in need of a technical leader to be the right-hand person to their VP of Data Science.THE ROLEYou will be responsible for machine learning, NLP and deep learning model development for support across different areas of the businessYou will report directly into the VP of Data Science and work closely on technical directionYou will implement and design code and build out to production using various advanced statistical techniques with access to proprietary dataWork closely with the Product/Marketing/Engineering teams building models from concept to productionRole will be responsible for production grade code and researchYOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEThe successful Principal Data Scientist will likely have the following skills and experience:Heavy experience using Python, R, Spark, Hadoop and AWS for predictive modeling and data manipulationCommercial experience building machine learning (supervised/unsupervised/reinforcement) models in a production settingPrior experience leading projects is necessaryExperience mentoring junior team members highly desiredHistory of thinking outside-the-box with minimal direction for project executionExperience with analyzing large-scale datasets a mustMS/PhD in Computer Science or quantitative field highly preferredMachine Learning expertise required; Deep Learning or Natural Language Processing experience a plusTHE BENEFITSA competitive base salary of $170,000-190,000 + bonus + equityHOW TO APPLYPlease register your interest by sending your r©sum© to Tim Jonas via the Apply link on this page.This role is only able to support Green Card Holders or US Citizens. No visa sponsorship available.KEYWORDSMachine Learning | Python | SQL | AWS | Technology | Data Science | Big Data | Spark

Title: Data Center Technician/Customer Engineer
Description: About Maintech and the Role:Maintech provides computer system and LAN/WAN services to mission critical, multi-vendor, multi-site applications in the Financial, Telecommunications and Research and Development markets. Maintech's broad spectrum of IT design, procurement, project management and maintenance services, includes 24/7 managed network and systems support.We have an opening for a technical professional to function as a Data Center Technician/Customer Engineer. We are looking for a self-motivated, dedicated individual who is ready to put their technical skills to work in a fast-paced, customer focused environment. Utilizing your technical knowledge, you will have the responsibility of responding to customer calls in a timely and efficient manner to troubleshoot, analyze and diagnose servers within critical environments.Key Responsibilities:Install, troubleshoot, and maintain client equipmentIdentify, analyze, and repair hardware product failuresRacking/stacking, updating and configuring server hardwareTroubleshoot and document technical issues using ticketing systemUse "Crash cart" or remote KVMÈs to connect and troubleshoot hardwareFollow Maintech and customer data center policies and proceduresMaintain and order spare parts as neededExperience and Skills Required:1 to 5 years working within large data center environmentsMust be a self-starter who is able to work independently without supervision and within a team environmentMust possess a professional demeanor and willingness to learnUnderstand fundamental PC and server hardware troubleshootingAbility to independently and regularly lift items weighing up to 35lbs or in partnership for items over 35lbs in weightCompTia A+ and/or CompTia Server+ certification a plusBasic understanding of Linux a plusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $20.00 to $27.00 /hourExperience:large data center: 1 year (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offParental leaveTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to FridayHolidays requiredBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:No

Utilizing your technical knowledge, you will have the responsibility of responding to customer calls in a timely and efficient manner to troubleshoot, analyze and diagnose servers within critical environments.Key Responsibilities:Install, troubleshoot, and maintain client equipmentIdentify, analyze, and repair hardware product failuresRacking/stacking, updating and configuring server hardwareTroubleshoot and document technical issues using ticketing systemUse "Crash cart" or remote KVMÈs to connect and troubleshoot hardwareFollow Maintech and customer data center policies and proceduresMaintain and order spare parts as neededExperience and Skills Required:1 to 5 years working within large data center environmentsMust be a self-starter who is able to work independently without supervision and within a team environmentMust possess a professional demeanor and willingness to learnUnderstand fundamental PC and server hardware troubleshootingAbility to independently and regularly lift items weighing up to 35lbs or in partnership for items over 35lbs in weightCompTia A+ and/or CompTia Server+ certification a plusBasic understanding of Linux a plusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $20.00 to $27.00 /hourExperience:large data center: 1 year (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offParental leaveTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to FridayHolidays requiredBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:No

Title: DATA SCIENCE & TAGGING ANALYST
Description: DATA SCIENCE & TAGGING ANALYSTBETHESDA, MARYLANDDESCRIPTIONMission Essential is currently seeking Data Science & Tagging Analysts.REQUIREMENTSÎà Applicable degree(s): Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Database Administration, Data Science, Engineering, IT Management, Mathematics, or Statistics (or another quantitative field).Îà Minimum five (5) years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, and familiarity with:Îà Coding knowledge and experience with several languages (C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc.);Îà Statistical and data mining techniques (Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.);Îà Querying databases and using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.);Îà Using web services (Redshift, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.); andÎà Creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics (regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc)Îà These five (5) years may be concurrent with requisite years of experience.Îà Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Îà Proven ability to drive business results with data-based insights.Îà Demonstrated expertise with developing and implementing data management strategies, processes, and technical solutions.Îà Demonstrated expertise with one of the key data management knowledge areas: data management, data quality, metadata management, data governance, data modeling and design, data storage and operations, data integration and operability, document and content management, reference and master data.Îà Outstanding oral and written communication skills with the ability to conduct independent research, filter and synthesize data, and produce clear, logical, and concise recommendations to policy and decision-making data management and governance professionals.Îà Outstanding interpersonal skills, including the ability to work independently and in a team or collaborative environment, to work with all levels of employees from support staff to senior leadership, and to be proactive and responsive in communicating with all stakeholders.Îà Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.Îà Expert Level Must have Masters + 10 yrs experience, OR BA + 12 yrs experience, OR, AA +14 yrs experience, OR No degree +20 yrsÎà Senior Level Must Have Masters + 8 yrs experience, OR BA +10 yrs, OR AA +12 yrs, OR No degree +18 yrsÎà Mid-Level Must Have Masters + 2yrs, OR BA +4 yrs, OR AA +6 yrsÎà TS/SCI Clearance with CI Polygraph RequiredÎà Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers (Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.)Îà Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using (Periscope, Business Objects, etc.).Îà Demonstrated expertise managing competing priorities while maintaining a high level of attention to detail; demonstrated ability to work effectively with senior leaders in a high profile and demanding office.Îà Outstanding analytical and critical thinking skills, including the demonstrated ability to think strategically, identify needs and requirements, and develop recommendations and solutions.Îà Outstanding leadership and managerial capabilities, including the ability to effectively direct tasking, and assess and manage performance.Îà Knowledge of the IC, ODNI, DoD, and the overall national security apparatus.Îà Assist the Government to mine and analyze data from various databases to drive optimization and improvement of strategy and policy development.Îà Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Recommend, develop and support implementation of best practices for standardizing data across its lifecycle through engineering, development and governance.Îà Advise on a range of Enterprise and IC data management matters through their application of substantive, analytical, operational, program management, and/or IC expertise.Mission Essential considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Mission Essential is an EEO/AA employer and a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $1,200.00 to $4,200.00 /monthExperience:data science: 1 year (Preferred)analytics: 1 year (Preferred)data scientist: 1 year (Preferred)hadoop: 1 year (Preferred)full agile sdlc methodology: 1 year (Preferred)Benefits:OtherSchedule:Other

Title: Experienced Data Scientist (locals only)
Description: *******Please Apply using this link: https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/2cb8018ed6a041b0870e3cd056c286abOur FocusIn aviation safety, we seek to minimize the potential for harm to the flying public. To support thiseffort, we collect vast amounts of operational and simulation data. How can we use statisticalanalyses and data science to analyze this data and effect meaningful change to aviation safety? Ifthis sounds interesting to you, GGTI seeks a Data Scientist to join its Data Science & Analytics Team.WhatÈs the Job?Îà Preprocessing, cleansing, and verifying integrity of data that can be provided as input foradvanced analyticsÎà Ad-hoc analysis and presentations of results for technical and non-technical audiencesÎà Feature selection, model building and optimization using machine learning techniquesÎà Building regression, classification, association modelsÎà Building anomaly detection systemsAbout YouYou are an experienced Data Scientist with an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline. You will be able to discover information hidden in vast amounts of aviation data, including operation and simulated data, and provide recommendations to managements at various levels. Along with working with air traffic domain experts, you will be able to apply data mining techniques, perform statistical analyses, and build high quality predictive models and causal analyses of safety issues. You can analyze large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with R and/or Python and Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau. In addition, you have some familiarity with SQL.What do you need to qualify?*Îà 10+ years of professional work experience in a quantitative fieldÎà A Ph.D. or MasterÈs Degree in operations research, applied statistics, Computer Science (data mining, machine learning stream) or a related quantitative disciplineÎà Deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithmsÎà Excellent applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.Îà Excellent understanding of common machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as K-means, k-NN, Bayesian Networks, SVM, Decision trees, ensemble methods etc.Îà Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Python, R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Proficiency in at least one of these (preferably Python)Îà Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, Tableau etc.Îà Some experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, or HBaseÎà Ability to pass a Federal Government background investigation to obtain a Public Trust clearance.Îà Current U.S. Citizen/Green Card-holderStand-out SkillsDeep learning with TensorFlow, Torch, or similarSpark, Hadoop, or similarSQL, Java or C/C++.*******Please Apply using this link: https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/2cb8018ed6a041b0870e3cd056c286abJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $100,000.00 to $145,000.00 /yearExperience:Data Science: 10 years (Preferred)Education:Master's (Required)Location:Washington, DC (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Application Question:This job is for locals only. Are you a local of the DC, VA, MD area?Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://ggti.com/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:No

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Lyteworx Automation Systems is looking for a Data Scientist or Data Curation to join our team.Description:Participate in the development of machine learning, data mining, and statistical or graph-based algorithms designed to fuse and analyze massive data sets. Use expertise to ensure the proper implementation and usage of employed algorithms and bring in cutting-edge innovations from industry and academia. Leverage knowledge of requirements analysis, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and diagnosis or resolution. Conduct software development, software integration, statistical analysis, modeling, and simulation all in a rapid DevOps environment. Sync across functional teams, ensuring data science is supporting mission-focused analytic teams and work with rapid prototyping teams on site to deploy new data science capabilities through existing toolsets.Basic Qualification:Îà TS / SCI (Active CI poly preferred)Îà BachelorÈs degree or higher in Science or Engineering fieldÎà 5 to 10 years of Linux / Unix Command line experience using the following commands: ssh, scp, chmod, chown, git, cp, rm. Must be able to use the command line to explore file structures, move files on different file systems and execute applications remotely or locally.Îà Experience using Git for version control to include pushing code to remote server, building branches, and merging branches.Îà 5 to 10 years of experience using Python 3.6 / 3.7Îà Experience in the following Python packages: Pandas, gdal, Numpy, Shapely, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, mysql, beautifulsoup, seaborn and built-in packages pathlib, ast, traceback, zipfile, json, shutil, hashlib, datetime, time, subprocess, csv, sys, os, collections (namedtuple, OrderedDict), pprint, and timeit.Îà Experience cleaning labeled data in preparation for use in machine learning ensuring, there are no duplicate files, ensure there are no labels that overlap each other, versioning duplicate labels by creation date, removing older version of labels from delivery, casting proper data types, and tracking deliverable for rollback capabilityÎà Experience in creating parallel processing operations by managing the number of processors used in an operation given memory limitationsÎà Experience in generating automated reports using the groupby, value_counts, plotting, time indexing, cumsum, and unstack commands within PandasÎà Experience in automating all data preparation methods and creating a CLI for turnkey operation from a non-technical user.Additional Qualification:Îà Experience working on DoD or IC networks.Îà Experience in dealing with detected, CMETAA, and SCID format of SAR data. Converting from CMETAA to SCID format and properly rotating SCID polygons to account for changes made during the conversion from CMETTA to SCID. Testing and visualizing the polygon rotations to ensure accuracy.Îà Experience in capturing, parsing, storing NITF metadata using GDAL and also by capturing the Extended Metadata unique to airborne SAR NITF files not available in the GDAL standard parsingÎà Experience in understanding and using the TCPED processÎà Experience in tasking multiple national assets to include IMINT, ELINT, LOS Radar, OTH Radar, COMINT, and HUMINT collection methods and resources.Îà Experience in Image Science understanding sensor modalities such as Panchromatic, Multi-spectral, Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR), InfraredÎà Experience in the developing the architecture of a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), to include training the CNN, modifying the architecture of the CNN, adjusting to the hyper-parameters of the training process in order to create a CNN that can be used in operationsÎà Experience in developing tools to evaluate and visualize the functionality of a trained neural network for purpose of further enhancing the performance of the network to include visualizing the various layers of a CNN, recognizing the thinking flaws of the network and developing an executing a plan to address the flawsPreferred DOD 8570 IAT LEVEL II ComplianceJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $160,000.00 to $175,000.00 /yearExperience:data science: 5 years (Preferred)analytics: 5 years (Preferred)data scientist: 7 years (Preferred)full agile sdlc methodology: 5 years (Preferred)Security Clearance Required:Top Secret (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offRelocation assistanceProfessional development assistanceThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureSchedule:Monday to FridayBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Systems Engineer / Data Analyst (TS/SCI w/POLY)
Description: Job Title: Systems Engineer/Data AnalystClearance required: TS/SCI with polygraph (active within last 24 months)What youÈll get to do in this role:As a Systems Engineer/Data Analyst you will supporting the customer, you will be trusted to do the following:Create and maintain weekly and monthly metric dashboards for the CustomerÈs enterprise help desk. Dashboards include data such as overall call volume, ticket types, optimal staffing, and individual agent performance.Metrics include Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) such as answer speed, abandon rate, and first call resolutionDashboards also include Quality Assurance measures. Analysis is conducted using customer surveys, follow-ups, and call monitoring.Perform data analysis and trend interpretation to help achieve CustomerÈs goals, along with development of KPIs based on Customer needs and mission.Presents reports to senior Customer management as well as communicate the meaning of the analysis results and present strategies for future steps.Responsible for set up and management of Amazon Web Services.What you need to bring to the table:Years of Experience: Full Performance  1-2 years with BS;Education: BS degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science, or IT-related fieldDemonstrate skills and experience requirements from all of the following:as a junior systems engineer/analyst who can run metrics, knows Excel, and can do basic data analysis.Requires an active Top Secret/SCI with favorable poly (TS/SCI w/Poly)Who are we? Ardent Eagle Solutions (AES), a dynamic and growing companyrecipient of the 2019 Inc. 5000-- supporting critical U.S. Intelligence Community and DoD customers in the U.S and around the world is looking to expand its NoVA office with multiple openings. If you want to be a part of mission critical programs that has the potential life span of over five years and is at the heart of big data and analytical tools for the customer, then this program is for you. AES has been helping our customers meet their challenges by offering expert services in systems development, field IT operations, software development, network engineering, PMO support, cloud engineering, and data management/analysis. We are a leading VA certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) focused on the success and growth of our employees, maintaining the family feel and nimble responsiveness of a smaller company, while providing outstanding support to our customers and their missions for over seven years.Where we are going? AES is anticipating multiple new programs throughout the first half of 2020. All these programs involve challenging positions in high-end IT and data programs that will directly support mission partners. Title: Systems Engineer / Data Analyst (TS/SCI w/POLY)
Description: Job Title: Systems Engineer/Data AnalystClearance required: TS/SCI with polygraph (active within last 24 months)What youÈll get to do in this role:As a Systems Engineer/Data Analyst you will supporting the customer, you will be trusted to do the following:Create and maintain weekly and monthly metric dashboards for the CustomerÈs enterprise help desk. Dashboards include data such as overall call volume, ticket types, optimal staffing, and individual agent performance.Metrics include Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) such as answer speed, abandon rate, and first call resolutionDashboards also include Quality Assurance measures. Analysis is conducted using customer surveys, follow-ups, and call monitoring.Perform data analysis and trend interpretation to help achieve CustomerÈs goals, along with development of KPIs based on Customer needs and mission.Presents reports to senior Customer management as well as communicate the meaning of the analysis results and present strategies for future steps.Responsible for set up and management of Amazon Web Services.What you need to bring to the table:Years of Experience: Full Performance  1-2 years with BS;Education: BS degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science, or IT-related fieldDemonstrate skills and experience requirements from all of the following:as a junior systems engineer/analyst who can run metrics, knows Excel, and can do basic data analysis.Requires an active Top Secret/SCI with favorable poly (TS/SCI w/Poly)Who are we? Title: Data Scientist (TS/SCI w/CI POLY) / D2P20
Description: Job Title: Data Scientist (Junior to Expert levels)Work Location: Herndon and Reston, VA areas as well as Joint Base AndrewsClearance: Clearance required: TS/SCI with CI polygraph (active within last 24 months)Position/Program Highlights:Support Intelligence Community customer and play a critical role in developing information systems that support data ingest, management and analysis.Be a part of one of the premier programs supporting the warfighter.If you want to be involved in helping the Customer work with its data and develop systems that use data to meet mission objectives, you can be a part of a new contract to make your mark in the IC.More about your role:AES has an exciting opportunity for a senior data scientist roles, you will work in collaboration with other existing client staff and contractors to analyze incoming data and create a product that is useful and relevant. You will be expected to possess a variety of statistical analysis techniques coupled with an intuitive nature in a Big Data Environment. These positions have no travel requirements and work will be performed in the Herndon, Reston, Chantilly, VA areas as well as Joint Base Andrews.Required KSAs:Active/current TS/SCI with CI polygraphB.S. degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering related discipline0-3 (Junior), 3-5 (Full Performance), 5+ (Senior), or 10+ (Expert) years of data engineering or data management/science experienceExperience supporting science and technology (S&T) programs or engineering programs supporting U.S military intelligence or the Intelligence CommunityPrior methodological experience in some of the following areas:Relationships and discovery (correlating, enriching and prioritizing data about activity among actors, devices or facilities to enable the discovery of structure, roles, key relationships and targets)Situational awareness (unifying data into a single context, allowing the current situation to be accurately and quickly understood)Systems modeling (building a computational analog of a real-world system  political, military, economic, social or technical  to understand how it operates, what it is capable of, and how it may react to shocks)Business analytics (supporting data-driven decisions about how we can improve the business of intelligence).Demonstrated knowledge of appropriate analytic methods and methodological tools in two or more (Junior-Senior)/all three (Expert) of the following areas:Applied mathematics (e.g. probability and statistics, multivariable calculus, linear algebra, ordinary and partial differential equations, stochastic processes, graph theory)Computer programming (e.g., scripting, data parsing/ETL, artificial intelligence, machine learning, math/statistics packages, natural language processing, software versioning, distributed computing)Visualization (e.g., dashboard creation, network analysis, GIS/geospatial analysis, telemetry analysis)Demonstrated knowledge of Python and some of the following software/tools: SQL, R, Hadoop, Spark, Java, C/C++, Git, Bash, Tableau, ArcGIS, Unix commandsKnowledge of research design principlesKnowledge of intelligence collection methods, capabilities, and tasking process.Desired Skills and Experience (demonstrate skills and experience from some of the following requirements):Creativity and innovation to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solution to complex problems.Ability to leverage multiple data management tools to organize relevant information and make decisions.Ability to develop comprehensive software applications.Ability to translate complex, technical findings into an easily-understood narrative (i.e. tell a story with the data) in graphical, verbal, or written form.Ability to multitask and change focus quickly as mission needs change.Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment.Ability to establish and maintain internal and external professional networks including subject matter experts, collectors, and decision makers that are necessary to carry out tasks or projects.Familiarity with project management concepts and principlesFamiliarity with cloud environments.Who are we? Ardent Eagle Solutions (AES), a dynamic and growing companyrecipient of the 2019 Inc. 5000-- supporting critical U.S. Intelligence Community and DoD customers in the U.S and around the world is looking to expand its NoVA office with multiple openings. If you want to be a part of mission critical programs that has the potential life span of over five years and is at the heart of big data and analytical tools for the customer, then this program is for you. AES has been helping our customers meet their challenges by offering expert services in systems development, field IT operations, software development, network engineering, PMO support, cloud engineering, and data management/analysis. We are a leading VA certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) focused on the success and growth of our employees, maintaining the family feel and nimble responsiveness of a smaller company, while providing outstanding support to our customers and their missions for over seven years.Where we are going? AES is anticipating multiple new programs throughout the first half of 2020. All these programs involve challenging positions in high-end IT and data programs that will directly support mission partners. We are looking for the best to be a part of new programs from the ground up where you can have a lasting impact on the CustomersÈ needs.If our position is of interest letÈs connect to discuss the Ardent winning culture and how we can partner together.At Ardent Eagle Solutions, we offer a comprehensive benefits package to our employees and their families:Medical/Dental/Vision CoverageMatching 401(k) PlanContinuing Education AssistancePaid Time Off (Enhanced)This job description is intended to describe the general scope of work and level of work that is needed to perform while on task. Other duties may be assigned.Ardent Eagle Solutions is an Equal Opportunity EmployerJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $85,000.00 to $165,000.00 /yearApplication Question:Do you have an active TS/SCI CI POLY within the last 24 months?Additional Compensation:BonusesWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeSchedule:Monday to FridayDay shiftCompany's website:https://ardenteaglesolutions.com/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

Title: Analyst & Data Scientist - CDC Contact Tracing
Description: SummaryThe Analyst and Data Scientist will apply statistical theory and methods to collect, interpret, and summarize data as well as make predictions and recommend actions based on data.Essential FunctionsInvolved in the analysis of unstructured and semi-structured data, including latent semantic indexing (LSI), entity identification and tagging, complex event processing, and the application of analysis algorithms on distributed, clustered, and cloud-based infrastructurescreativity in applying non-traditional approaches to large-scale analysis of unstructured data in support of high-value use cases visualized through multi-dimensional interfacesHandles processing and index requests against high-volume collections of data and high-velocity data streamsHas the ability to make discoveries in the world of big dataRequires strong technical and computational skills - engineering, physics, mathematics, coupled with the ability to code design, develop, and deploy sophisticated applications using advanced unstructured and semi-structured data analysis techniques and utilizing high-performance computing environmentsHas the ability to utilize advance tools and computational skills to interpret, connect, predict, and make discoveries in complex data and deliver recommendations for business and analytic decisionsPerform other duties as assignedCompetenciesConfidenceFlexibilityInitiativeStress managementCommunicationInformation gatheringSupervisory ResponsibilityNone required for this positionWork EnvironmentThis job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Îà Must be able to remain in a stationary position 75% of the time.Îà Occasionally moves about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.Îà Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer.Îà Expresses or exchanges ideas by means of the spoken word. Those activities in which they must convey detailed or important spoken instructions to other workers accurately, loudly or quickly.Îà Frequently moves standard office equipment up to 25 pounds.Îà Must be able to work indoor conditions 90% of the time.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.Position Type/Expected Hours of WorkThis is a full-time position. Typical days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Evening and weekend hours required, as required by business need.TravelMay be requiredExperienceRequires 5-7 yearsÈ experienceExperience with software development, either an open-source enterprise software development stack (Java/Linux/Ruby/Python) or a Windows development stack (.NET, C#, C++).Experience with data transport and transformation APIs and technologies such as JSON, XML, XSLT, JDBC, SOAP and REST.Experience with geospatial analytics, geospatial programming, and established GIS platforms such as Esri ArcGIS, MapBox and Carto, as well as custom and open-source alternatives (e.g., OpenLayers, Leaflet, GDAL/OGR, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, GeoServer and QGIS).Experience with Cloud-based data analysis tools including Hadoop and Mahout, Acumulo, Hive, Impala, Pig, and similar.Experience with visual analytic tools like Microsoft Pivot, Palantir, or Visual Analytics.Experience with open source textual processing such as Lucene, Sphinx, Nutch or Solr.Experience with entity extraction and conceptual search technologies such as LSI, LDA, etc.Experience with machine learning, algorithm analysis, and data clusteringExperience using business intelligence tools and data frameworksEducationBachelorsÈ degree with 5-7 yearsÈ experience desiredPreferred; MasterÈs degree with 3-5 yearsÈ experiencePreferred; PHD with 0-2 yearsÈ experienceAdditional Eligibility QualificationsBackground in data mining and statistical analysisExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent organizational skills and attention to detailAble to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectivelyStrong math skillsProblem-solving aptitudeSecurity ClearanceAbility to obtainOther DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $145,000.00 to $165,000.00 /yearExperience:total: 1 year (Preferred)analytics: 1 year (Preferred)manager/lead: 1 year (Preferred)marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Benefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Data Science Capabilities Expert
Description: Data Science Capability ExpertFind meaning in your work and join a collaborative company with challenging and innovative opportunities in Customer Experience and IT Strategy. Blue Compass, LLC blends strategy and analytics with customer insights, design and creative thinking to help our clients discover, implement and improve their products and services. Blue Compass colleagues apply their natural curiosity to the companyÈs culture of customer-focused trusted advisory and thought leadership.Position Summary:Be an executiveÈs best friend. Articulate the vision for an organizationÈs data science capabilities, identify the capability gaps, and create a roadmap of how to achieve the vision. A Data Science Capability Expert will diplomatically work with existing teams to help them achieve their mission with a range of methods and data science solutions. This Expert will also support the Government Product Owner for Data Science capabilities by driving and defining the development priorities and technical requirements for new products in the government environment.Roles and Responsibilities:Design data science capabilities and accompanying action plan through whitepapers and briefs.Design research projects to help teams and executives achieve their goals.Identify problem sets to which data science can be applied and help teams initiate a solution.Broker between program teams and technology experts to leverage the available data science products to support data objectives across products lines and corporate functions.Brief the benefits and constraints of technology solutions to technology partners, stakeholders, team members, and senior levels of management.Be comfortable with ambiguity and lead innovation with a customer-focus mindset.Identify opportunities for machine learning and predictive analysis.Mentor teams to effectively implement data science best practices.Convey the vision and goals at the beginning of every release and sprint.Facilitate an integrated team of key stakeholders, software users, and product vendors.Lead backlog grooming to decompose and estimate storiesWork closely with engineering and operations to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources.Develop the voice of customer information through customer interviews.Work with ETL developers to design initial dashboards for data science customers.Other duties as assigned.Required Qualifications:TS or above government clearanceBS in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, or related scientific or technical discipline15+ years IT SE&I&A (e.g., planning, scheduling, analysis, capability implementation, process) experience, with 10 years recent government experience10 years SE&I experience working with GEOINT capabilities, Portfolios, PORs, systems, segmentsEight (8) years of experience in Conceptual/Logical/Physical data modeling.Agile or SAFe CertificationStrong understanding of cloud architecture, as it relates to data processing (i.e., EC2, S3, Redshift, etc.)Experience leading and architecting enterprise wide initiativesExperience modeling solutions in AWS is a plusEffective communicator and able to present complex information to non-technical audiences.Why Blue Compass?Opportunity for growth within position and companyWork for innovative government clientsComprehensive Benefits PackageFlexible schedule (*depending on client)Regular company training and team building activities regarding design-thinking, customer service, and work-life balanceCollaborative, creative, inclusive and fun team environmentJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $125,000.00 to $155,000.00 /yearExperience:government: 10 years (Preferred)SE&I: 10 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)License:TS/SCI security clearance (Required)Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offOtherSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:http://bluecompass-llc.com/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligible

government clearanceBS in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, or related scientific or technical discipline15+ years IT SE&I&A (e.g., planning, scheduling, analysis, capability implementation, process) experience, with 10 years recent government experience10 years SE&I experience working with GEOINT capabilities, Portfolios, PORs, systems, segmentsEight (8) years of experience in Conceptual/Logical/Physical data modeling.Agile or SAFe CertificationStrong understanding of cloud architecture, as it relates to data processing (i.e., EC2, S3, Redshift, etc.)Experience leading and architecting enterprise wide initiativesExperience modeling solutions in AWS is a plusEffective communicator and able to present complex information to non-technical audiences.Why Blue Compass?Opportunity for growth within position and companyWork for innovative government clientsComprehensive Benefits PackageFlexible schedule (*depending on client)Regular Title: Big Data Analyst (TS/SCI w/POLY)
Description: Job Title/experience Level: BIG Data Analyst  Senior/ExpertWork Location: Chantilly, VAClearance required: Active/current TS/SCI with polygraph (within last 24 months) / Clearance sponsorship may be available for US Citizens.Position/Program Highlights:Support Intelligence Community customer and play a lead role in providing data analysis directly to the mission customers.Be a part of one of the premier big data projects within the Customer space.If you have a passion for data analytics and a creative aptitude for developing scalable and adaptable solutions in a collaborative multi-functional environment, this program is a great fit for you.What youÈll get to do in this role:Support ongoing mission specific data need and work with the latest technologies.Work with large data-sets to provide real time value to ongoing mission support staff.Work with an outstanding team of data managers, system engineers, NLP developers, and project managers with a distinct dedication to the mission.When you have completed this assignment, below are several other career options you can transition into: (ask about our proactive career development program - PCDP)Position yourself as AESÈ lead data scientist as the company expands its data science work.Expand your big data expertise through training and taking on new assignmentsWork with AES executive management as a key lead with data science and help establish the company as a thought leader.What you need to bring to the table:Years of Experience: 5+ yearsÈ experience working with big data.Education: BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering related disciplineDemonstrate skills and experience requirements from some of the following:Demonstrated Experience in big data analyticsStrong data management, data mining, algorithms and analytical abilities.Data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large datasets.Experience with ElasticSearch.Experience directly supporting Customer in an ops tempo environment.These experiences are nice to have:Good working knowledge of scripting languages (sh, Bash, Perl).Experience with VMWare vSphere.Experience with VMWare storage technologies (e.g., VMDK, vSAN).Red Hat Certified Systems Administrator.Experience with Splunk.Experience administering Oracle RDBMS and PostgreSQL.Experience administering in AWS environment.Interpersonal skills and strong communication experience.Who are we? Ardent Eagle Solutions (AES), a dynamic and growing companyrecipient of the 2019 Inc. 5000-- supporting critical U.S. Intelligence Community and DoD customers in the U.S and around the world is looking to expand its NoVA office with multiple openings. If you want to be a part of mission critical programs that has the potential life span of over five years and is at the heart of big data and analytical tools for the customer, then this program is for you. AES has been helping our customers meet their challenges by offering expert services in systems development, field IT operations, software development, network engineering, PMO support, cloud engineering, and data management/analysis. We are a leading VA certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) focused on the success and growth of our employees, maintaining the family feel and nimble responsiveness of a smaller company, while providing outstanding support to our customers and their missions for over seven years.Where we are going? AES is anticipating multiple new programs throughout the first half of 2020. All these programs involve challenging positions in high-end IT and data programs that will directly support mission partners. We are looking for the best to be a part of new programs from the ground up where you can have a lasting impact on the CustomersÈ needs.If our position is of interest letÈs connect to discuss the Ardent winning culture and how we can partner together.At Ardent Eagle Solutions, we offer a comprehensive benefits package to our employees and their families:Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage401(k) PlanContinuing Education AssistancePaid Time Off (Enhanced)This job description is intended to describe the general scope of work and level of work that is needed to perform while on task. Other duties may be assigned. AES-ICKEY!Ardent Eagle Solutions is an Equal Opportunity EmployerJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $100,000.00 to $200,000.00 /yearApplication Question:Do you have an active TS/SCI with POLY (within the last 24 months)?Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Title: Business Data Quality Engineer
Description: Responsibilities:Support data Migration & ConversionEnable & support Data AnalysisData Quality Management incl. standardized proceduresUphold Data Governance standardsCustomer focus: keep internal audience in mind when building processes (user input) and solution design (presentation layer of quality control process & monitoring)Understand physical database structures (Schema, indexes, etc.)Create database objects (tables, indexes, etc.)Perform data analysis  source/ target data assetsPerform data migration plan analysis  source/ target data assetsData migration results assessment  Data Quality evaluation, to include discrepancy analysis and resolutionDevelop complex SQL and PL/SQL scriptsTune SQL for improved performanceWork with data scientist to ensure time to market of analytics requests and trials by ensuring proper data formatting and data availabilityBusiness Collaboration: work with stakeholders across the enterprise and members of the data science community to define data quality expectations, status of quality based on data assets and assist in quality standardization of existing and new data assetsIT Collaboration: work with developers and architects to implement proper data quality process and quality measurement goalsWork cross-functional to define and automate data quality measurement and assurance processIdentify & detect data quality issues and prioritize fix across roadmapDefine data quality measurement system (e.g. certification of data sources based on quality standards)Create awareness amongst stakeholders, partners and affiliates about importance of data quality and existing data quality management proceduresCreate reports and analysis to define state of data quality by data assetLeverage and enhance existing standards for data profiling and monitoring for data assetsWork with data owners and Customer 360, product 360 and operations 360 experts to ensure enablement and usability of enterprise data assetsResearch, collect and inform practices and innovations for data quality managementCreate technical documentation supporting sharing of understanding and flow of data quality management processLeverage existing tools to document data related processes across the organization by working with respective stakeholdersActively involve and leverage other team members of the Data & Analytics team to assist with deliverables and responsibilitiesIdentify data quality issues and root causeQuantify issues and impact and work with IT delivery team on sustainable resolutionDefine escalation process to resolve underlying data discrepancies by working with Data StewardQualifications:Required: B.S. + continued learning via e.g. MOOCs,Desired: B.S. Communications, Business Analytics, Computer Science or degree in a discipline that fosters structured problem solving and creativityAbility to triage and troubleshoot data consumption and data quality problemsAbility to timely identify and escalate issues/risksExtensive knowledge + certification in following technologies:Understand databases & structures (oracle, SAP, Hadoop)Understanding of both batch and stream processes and tools e.g. Kafka, ETLs, SFTPs, APIsExperience with end to end data testing &/or data analysis as well as knowledge of best practices & methodologies for data QAExperience with scripting (Python, Perl, Ruby, bash, etc.)Experience with REST based services and testingExperience with JSON, CSV, and other data exchange formats (e.g., YAML)Ability to develop test plans, test cases, test scripts and test resultsExtensive knowledge + certification in following technologies: SQL, python, Informatica Data Quality, AXON, process and quality assurance, Six SigmaOptional:Reach out directly to hien.ksor@asocietygroup with an updated resume if interested.Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $80,000.00 to $130,000.00 /yearEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Washington, DC (Required)Contract Length:More than 1 yearVariesFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:One locationBenefits:NoneThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://www.asociety.se/en-us/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Engineer
Description: As a Data Engineer for the CIA, you will focus on the design, implementation, and operation of data management systems to meet the CIA's business needs. This includes designing how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated, and managed by different data entities and digital systems. Data Engineers work together with data consumers to determine, create, and populate optimal data architectures, structures, and systems.Data Engineers must also plan, design, and optimize for data throughput and query performance issues. This requires constantly updating expertise in areas such as platform, network and storage technologies, bandwidth management, data bus implications, and design.Additionally, you will play a key role in the selection of backend database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, HPC, etc), their configuration and utilization, and the optimization of the full data pipeline infrastructure to support the actual content, volume, ETL, and periodicity of data to support the intended kinds of queries and analysis to match expected responsiveness.Offices of the CIA  Directorate of Digital InnovationThe Directorate of Digital Innovation (DDI) is at the forefront of defining the future of digital expertise within the CIA. DDI focuses on developing the workforce with cutting-edge skills, investing in IT infrastructure, and modernizing the way the Agency does business. DDI officers help accelerate the integration of innovative methods and tools to enhance the CIA's cyber and digital capabilities on a global scale and ultimately help safeguard our nation. Learn more about the Directorate of Digital Innovation.See our work in action:Life at CIAIn addition to a comprehensive benefits package, the CIA offers exciting career opportunities and a dynamic environment. We're on the forefront of world-altering events  as they happen. So working here isn't just a job, it's a mindset and a lifestyle.US citizenship required (dual-national US citizens eligible). All positions require relocation to the Washington, DC metro area.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in one of the following fields or related studies:MathematicsComputer ScienceEngineeringManagement Information SystemsGPA of at least 3.0 on a 4-point scaleKnowledge of the following:data manipulationdatabasesdata structuresdata managementbest engineering practicesAll applicants must successfully complete:A thorough medical and psychological examA polygraph interviewA comprehensive background investigationTo be considered suitable for Agency employment, applicants must generally not have used illegal drugs within the last 12 months. The issue of illegal drug use prior to 12 months ago is carefully evaluated during the medical and security processing.

How is it useful to mission customers, where does it need to go, and who has what role in the data transfer process?Gain direct experience in moving data sets into the cloud environment.Work with an outstanding team of data managers, system engineers, developers, and project managers with a distinct dedication to the mission.When you have completed this assignment, below are several other career options you can transition into: (ask about our proactive career development program - PCDP)Position yourself to take on more sophisticated operational support roles in the mission arena.Expand your technical big data expertise through training and taking on new assignmentsMove your career into working with data in the cloud  become an expert in a rapidly growing field. We are a leading VA certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) focused on the success and growth of our employees, maintaining the family feel and nimble responsiveness of a smaller company, while providing outstanding support to our customers and their missions for over seven years.Where we are going? Information Systems, Computer Science, Database Administration, Data Science, Engineering, IT Management, Mathematics, or Statistics (or another quantitative field).Îà Minimum five (5) years of
