Title: Data Analytics/Digital Marketing Analyst
Description: Data Analytics/Digital Marketing AnalystAbout Our CompanyExceptional Lives is a not-for-profit organization that helps parents and caregivers get the information they need to help family members with disabilities. Figuring out how to find services or navigate complicated processes when youÈre stressed, new to the situation, or entering a new phase of your childÈs life can be overwhelming. We write our online guides, blogs, and resource directory in language that parents can understand and organize the information so they can find what applies to their situations. WeÈre based out of Boston, Massachusetts, and create content for families throughout the United States. Our team is passionate about helping families; you can learn more about us https://exceptionallives.org.Exceptional Lives is seeking a full-time Digital Marketing and Analytics Analyst to support all aspects of our business with a focus on increasing user engagement and improving the user experience. This role will report to the Chief Operating Officer and will work collaboratively with all team members to drive insights for core business metrics, including marketing campaign effectiveness, conversion, and engagement.Core Capabilities:Proven track record of turning raw data into meaningful analysisProven track record as a power user of Google Analytics platform, Google Tag Manager, Google Ad Words, Google Search Console, Advanced ExcelExperience with data tools such as Screaming Frog and Crazy Egg,Strong experience using data and analytics to measure attribution across marketing campaigns, optimize digital media, optimize conversion funnels, and increase online user engagement.Must have RequirementsCritical thinking: You are a strategic thinker and enjoy the challenge of finding solutions for complex data issues. Problems are obstacles to be conquered versus a reason to become discouraged.Self-Learner: You are naturally curious and eager to stay abreast of developments in the field of data analytics. You stay on top of changes to Google Analytics and other data tools.Cultural fit: You identify with the problem that Exceptional Lives is trying to solve, which is to provide families and professionals caring for a child with disabilities with the information they need to get the resources and benefits that the child and family need to thrive.Citizenship: You must be a US Citizen or have an active green card.Location: Must be located in the greater Boston area with the ability to work in Exceptional LivesÈ downtown Boston office at least 3 days a week.Interview Process: The Interview process will involve a test of your knowledge of Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and other tools as well as your overall problem-solving capabilities.You must be willing to undergo a background check.Responsibilities:Use data to drive continuous improvement and decision making, with an emphasis on:Increasing the number of meaningful users to siteOptimizing the user experience on web and mobile appsSupporting marketing initiatives across online channelsData-driven strategic business decision makingUsing GTM and GA to optimize conversion and engagement.Design and implement A/B tests and analyze findings to drive actionable insightsCreate dashboards/reports for both internal as well as funder reporting.Build reports, manage custom dimensions, segments in Google AnalyticsPreferred Requirements:BA/BS degree with a quantitative emphasis (Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics, Data Science or similar).5 years of experience of supporting digital organizations with all analytics needs,5 years of experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.Experience in designing and reporting of A/B testingStrong MS-Excel and PowerPoint skillsPersonal and/or professional experience with children and adults with disabilitiesDuties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Benefits and Anything Else Worth MentioningExceptional Lives values the contributions of its team members and reflects such in its culture.Exceptional Lives offers health insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, as well as three weeks of paid vacation.Exceptional Lives is committed to providing equal opportunities and to non-discrimination. It is our policy to ensure that all individuals with whom we are in contact are treated without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, expression, gender identity, ancestry, marital status, citizenship status, or veteran status.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Google Analytics: 3 years (Required)Google Tag Manager: 3 years (Required)Location:Boston, MA (Required)Application Question:Are you a US citizen or do you have a permanent authorization to work in the US?Benefits:Health insurancePaid time offOther

They will leverage data and advanced techniques to develop, implement, and analyze predictive models that enable data-driven, strategic decision-making. This role requires the ability to learn and understand a broad range of predictive analytics techniques and their application to business opportunities. They will have the right mix of analytical, technical, and communication skills to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Grade level will depend on education and experience.Benefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. Title: Data Engineer/Senior Data Engineer - Data & Analytics Engine...
Description: Data Engineer/Senior Data EngineerAt Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Title: DATA TOOLS ENGINEER
Description: About LightkeeperLightkeeper is a rapidly growing and innovative software company looking to add talented people to its team. Our firm is committed to providing financial services firms with the tools necessary to intuitively access and analyze all relevant portfolio information through a unified platform.About This OpportunityLightkeeperÈs core functionalities are data management, analytics, insights, and reporting. Therefore, data is the cornerstone of what we do. We want someone who loves rolling up their sleeves and getting into the details of the entire data pipeline. You will see the data flow through to the presentation layer where it is shown in an easy to digest manner.Your core responsibility will be to build scalable, robust tools for the entire data pipeline  from receiving the data to transforming it, storing it efficiently and allowing easy access. There are new and interesting challenges every day: youÈll get data from various sources, find new and interesting quirks to the data and be wrangling different formats that need to be normalized.A good fit for our team is someone who can adapt and contribute to different areas of the system depending on the need. Getting your hands dirty and being willing to dig into a new problem is both critical to do the job well and what keeps it interesting. Lightkeeper is developed using both static and dynamic languages, combining the best of the open source world with custom developed solutions for domain specific problems.Responsibilities:Design, build and document (or find and use) scalable, robust tools to manage and store dataInteract with outside data vendors to create file formats that contain the data we needMigrate and optimize existing data processing to updated formatsProvide transparency on the state of the data processing workflowImplement automated testing on existing and new componentsTrack down differences between data sets that should tie out and create tooling to automate itQualifications:BA / BS degree in CS / Math preferred3 to 5 years of experienceSelf-motivated, strong work ethic and interest in working in a small business environmentPython expertise is strongly preferred, however expertise in other scripting languages may be consideredExperience with Pandas is a plusStrong desire to automate, and dislike of doing things manuallyPositive attitudeStrong communication skills necessary to interact both internally and externally with clientsKnowledge of financial data such as Bloomberg, Morningstar, or FactSet is a plusBonus points: experience in C# or javascriptFor more information about Lightkeeper, please visit www.lightkeeper.comJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $90,000.00 to $130,000.00 /yearExperience:Software Engineering: 2 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Additional Compensation:BonusesWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceRetirement planPaid time offOtherSchedule:Monday to FridayOn callCompany's website:LIGHTKEEPER.COMBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:No

Title: Director II, Data Science - GRM Actuarial
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!Job Summary:GRM Actuarial  Predictive Modeling team is searching for a highly motivated Director II, Data Science who is eager to make an impact on the very complex and evolving insurance industry. As the manager of the US Long-Tailed Lines Predictive Modeling team, you will provide analytical direction for a team of actuarial and data science professionals.You and your team will leverage primary data, advanced quantitative modeling and financial analysis to develop predictive models and tools that enable data-driven strategic decision-making. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive modeling techniques, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. You will provide highly technical analytical assessments of business issues to management and a mixture of technical and non-technical audiences so good communication skills are essential. This is a highly visible role that will connect often with senior management and other groups across Liberty Mutual.Responsibilities:Manage, coach and develop a team of up to six highly-skilled actuarial and data science staff.Collaborate with other business partners to develop appropriate statistical approaches and tools that will drive strategic decision making related to reserving, trends and other challenging problems central to our business.Understand the competitive marketplace, business issues, and data challenges in order to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and business processes.Research, recommend, and implement new and/or alternative statistical and mathematical methodologies appropriate for the given model or analysis.Supervise and perform highly complex, technical and creative predictive modeling projects.Effectively communicate results, insights and recommendations in written, oral and presentation formats to technical and non-technical audiences.Regularly engage with data science and actuarial communities and lead cross-functional working groups.Qualifications:Master's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or any other quantitative field plus a minimum 7 years of applied business/non-academic experience preferred; OR Ph.D. plus a minimum of 4 years of experience preferred; OR Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation required plus a minimum of 5 years of experience, or comparable actuarial education/designation combined with relevant experience.Proficient in predictive analytics including experience in model development, validation, and testing.Experienced in the following: generalized linear models, survival models, random forests, clustering, and Bayesian approaches to data analysis.Proficient with at least one language for data analysis, such as R, Python or SAS.Proven ability to lead and drive projects and assignments to completion through others, and effectively engage talent.Knowledge of insurance principles, underwriting and the various functions of an insurance organization, including Finance, Underwriting, Sales and Claims desirable.Exceptional planning, analytical, decision-making, communication and project management skills.Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.Ability to give effective presentations to and influence senior leaders and other groups.Management experience is preferred.Overview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.WeÈre dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description: Job DescriptionSeeking a Lead Data Scientist to join our team. This position will be responsible for deriving new tools and theories to improve our data analysis platform. You will participate in cutting-edge research in AI/ML applications for neurotechnology.The ideal candidate should be comfortable with creative problem solving in a startup environment. If you like tinkering, are curious by nature, consider yourself a technologist or someone who thinks several steps ahead then you will fit in well with our team.This is a unique opportunity for a passionate individual about innovation in neuroscience, machine learning, and AI. This is a fast-paced, collaborative, and iterative environment requiring quick learning, agility, and flexibility. Your work will directly contribute to an evolutionary milestone in the field of brain-computer interfaces (BCIs).Key DutiesParticipate in cutting edge research in AI/ML applications for neurotechnologyManage science backlog and roadmapCommunicate with internal teams and external stakeholdersDefine experiments, provide scientific guidance, and help the engineering team throughout R&D and Product life cyclesBuild prototypes and algorithms in Matlab or PythonReview prototypes and algorithms written by other engineersManage and contribute to grant applications, studies, and projectsRequirementsPhD/MD in Cognitive or Computational Neuroscience, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Electrical and/or Biomedical Engineering with experience in brain-computer interfaces or neuroengineering5-10+ years designing experiments to investigate the neural correlates of perception, action, or cognition using human or animal modelsExperience in designing cognitive/behavioral tasks and conducting lab-oriented researchExpertise in statistical and signal processing, linear algebra, time-frequency analysis, machine learning, and their application to multivariate biometric and neuroimaging datasetsFluent in numerical computing and proficient in various programming languages (e.g., C, Python, Matlab, ML and deep learning toolboxes)Prior experience and continued interest in mentorship and technical development of junior data scientistsAbility to solve problems that have not been solved, in other words, a willingness to explore the unknown and ability to make progressAbility to embrace uncertainty when working on challenging research questionsKnowledge of perceptual/behavioral evaluations and physiological measurement is desiredHardware and software experience with multimodal data acquisition, instrumentation, and human-machine interfaces is a plusCompensation and BenefitsCompetitive Salary and Equity PackageHigh Quality Health Insurance (Full Company Sponsorship)401(k) with Employer Matching ContributionsGenerous PTOConvenient Location in Downtown BostonFun Office, Team Events, and Pets Welcome!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Senior Machine Learning EngineerOne of our prestigious clients is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their team which is driving innovation in labor market. As a member of our team, youÈll drive delivery of innovations which powers the sophisticated labor market data and solutions and transform the ways people plan for careers, colleges, and universities to develop talent, and institutions envision their workforce needs.Reporting directly to the Head of Data Science, the Senior Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for leading innovation to scale-up of machine learning models, delivering them to production environments for customers and development teams. As an individual contributor in data science organization, the Senior Machine Learning Engineer collaborates with other members of the team to execute and deliver against data science vision and roadmap.Responsibilities:Transition POC machine learning workflows into high-performance APIs live in productionImplement best practices for retraining models as well as monitoring the performance of models in productionPromote best practice software development principlesCollaborate with machine learning, engineering, and product development teams to create requirements for the deployment of new machine learning modelsMake financial and strategic cost/benefit decisions when choosing among various engineering approachesRequirements:Minimum of five years of experience in professional software developmentProven expertise in deploying high performance APIs that rely on deep learning models (Docker, FastAPI, Kubernetes, PyTorch/TensorFlow, etc.)Fluent with software development best practices, including version control, documentation, testing, and CI/CD (Airflow, etc.)Experience with AWS (EC2, EMR, etc.)Experience with SparkStrong proficiency in PythonBeneficial Experience:Familiarity with machine learning approaches and an understanding of the analysis and testing processes of machine learning algorithmsFamiliarity with Natural Language Processing approachesExperience with Amazon SagemakerBasic background in economics and how labor markets functionJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $110,000.00 to $130,000.00 /yearWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to Friday8 hour shiftBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Analytics/Digital Marketing Analyst
Description: Data Analytics/Digital Marketing AnalystAbout Our CompanyExceptional Lives is a not-for-profit organization that helps parents and caregivers get the information they need to help family members with disabilities. Figuring out how to find services or navigate complicated processes when youÈre stressed, new to the situation, or entering a new phase of your childÈs life can be overwhelming. We write our online guides, blogs, and resource directory in language that parents can understand and organize the information so they can find what applies to their situations. WeÈre based out of Boston, Massachusetts, and create content for families throughout the United States. Our team is passionate about helping families; you can learn more about us https://exceptionallives.org.Exceptional Lives is seeking a full-time Digital Marketing and Analytics Analyst to support all aspects of our business with a focus on increasing user engagement and improving the user experience. This role will report to the Chief Operating Officer and will work collaboratively with all team members to drive insights for core business metrics, including marketing campaign effectiveness, conversion, and engagement.Core Capabilities:Proven track record of turning raw data into meaningful analysisProven track record as a power user of Google Analytics platform, Google Tag Manager, Google Ad Words, Google Search Console, Advanced ExcelExperience with data tools such as Screaming Frog and Crazy Egg,Strong experience using data and analytics to measure attribution across marketing campaigns, optimize digital media, optimize conversion funnels, and increase online user engagement.Must have RequirementsCritical thinking: You are a strategic thinker and enjoy the challenge of finding solutions for complex data issues. Problems are obstacles to be conquered versus a reason to become discouraged.Self-Learner: You are naturally curious and eager to stay abreast of developments in the field of data analytics. You stay on top of changes to Google Analytics and other data tools.Cultural fit: You identify with the problem that Exceptional Lives is trying to solve, which is to provide families and professionals caring for a child with disabilities with the information they need to get the resources and benefits that the child and family need to thrive.Citizenship: You must be a US Citizen or have an active green card.Location: Must be located in the greater Boston area with the ability to work in Exceptional LivesÈ downtown Boston office at least 3 days a week.Interview Process: The Interview process will involve a test of your knowledge of Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and other tools as well as your overall problem-solving capabilities.You must be willing to undergo a background check.Responsibilities:Use data to drive continuous improvement and decision making, with an emphasis on:Increasing the number of meaningful users to siteOptimizing the user experience on web and mobile appsSupporting marketing initiatives across online channelsData-driven strategic business decision makingUsing GTM and GA to optimize conversion and engagement.Design and implement A/B tests and analyze findings to drive actionable insightsCreate dashboards/reports for both internal as well as funder reporting.Build reports, manage custom dimensions, segments in Google AnalyticsPreferred Requirements:BA/BS degree with a quantitative emphasis (Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics, Data Science or similar).5 years of experience of supporting digital organizations with all analytics needs,5 years of experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.Experience in designing and reporting of A/B testingStrong MS-Excel and PowerPoint skillsPersonal and/or professional experience with children and adults with disabilitiesDuties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Benefits and Anything Else Worth MentioningExceptional Lives values the contributions of its team members and reflects such in its culture.Exceptional Lives offers health insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, as well as three weeks of paid vacation.Exceptional Lives is committed to providing equal opportunities and to non-discrimination. It is our policy to ensure that all individuals with whom we are in contact are treated without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, expression, gender identity, ancestry, marital status, citizenship status, or veteran status.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Google Analytics: 3 years (Required)Google Tag Manager: 3 years (Required)Location:Boston, MA (Required)Application Question:Are you a US citizen or do you have a permanent authorization to work in the US?Benefits:Health insurancePaid time offOther

Title: Director II, Data Science - GRM Actuarial
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!Job Summary:GRM Actuarial  Predictive Modeling team is searching for a highly motivated Director II, Data Science who is eager to make an impact on the very complex and evolving insurance industry. As the manager of the US Long-Tailed Lines Predictive Modeling team, you will provide analytical direction for a team of actuarial and data science professionals.You and your team will leverage primary data, advanced quantitative modeling and financial analysis to develop predictive models and tools that enable data-driven strategic decision-making. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive modeling techniques, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. You will provide highly technical analytical assessments of business issues to management and a mixture of technical and non-technical audiences so good communication skills are essential. This is a highly visible role that will connect often with senior management and other groups across Liberty Mutual.Responsibilities:Manage, coach and develop a team of up to six highly-skilled actuarial and data science staff.Collaborate with other business partners to develop appropriate statistical approaches and tools that will drive strategic decision making related to reserving, trends and other challenging problems central to our business.Understand the competitive marketplace, business issues, and data challenges in order to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and business processes.Research, recommend, and implement new and/or alternative statistical and mathematical methodologies appropriate for the given model or analysis.Supervise and perform highly complex, technical and creative predictive modeling projects.Effectively communicate results, insights and recommendations in written, oral and presentation formats to technical and non-technical audiences.Regularly engage with data science and actuarial communities and lead cross-functional working groups.Qualifications:Master's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or any other quantitative field plus a minimum 7 years of applied business/non-academic experience preferred; OR Ph.D. plus a minimum of 4 years of experience preferred; OR Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation required plus a minimum of 5 years of experience, or comparable actuarial education/designation combined with relevant experience.Proficient in predictive analytics including experience in model development, validation, and testing.Experienced in the following: generalized linear models, survival models, random forests, clustering, and Bayesian approaches to data analysis.Proficient with at least one language for data analysis, such as R, Python or SAS.Proven ability to lead and drive projects and assignments to completion through others, and effectively engage talent.Knowledge of insurance principles, underwriting and the various functions of an insurance organization, including Finance, Underwriting, Sales and Claims desirable.Exceptional planning, analytical, decision-making, communication and project management skills.Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.Ability to give effective presentations to and influence senior leaders and other groups.Management experience is preferred.Overview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.WeÈre dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: ABOUT YOUYou are eager to learn and quick on your feet.You are extremely organized and highly motivated.You are very detail-oriented yet is also able to think strategically.You can take directions quickly and get things done.You are flexible, driven, creative and an achiever.You can lead when asked; you can follow when asked.You are driven to make a difference and serve.You are customer-focused.You never quit because youÈre a winner.You are technologically and digitally ahead of your peers.You are a creative technologist - creative yet have an affinity towards science.You live and breathe data and innovations.You roll up your sleeves quickly and quick to pivot at momentÈs notice.ABOUT USWe are a very unique agency serving citizens of Commonwealth of MA. With your passion to serve, your attention to detail, your very forward attitude towards technology and digital innovations, your customer-focused drive and your love for data and innovation, you'll enable Operational Services Division (OSD) to continuously improve serving its constituents more effectively and efficiently.OUTCOME: THE CHALLENGECreate data and innovation products to enable OSD to continuously improve serving its constituents more effectively and efficientlyJOB DESCRIPTIONUnder direction from your supervisor/manager focus areas are:Utilizing statistical techniques, acquire data, analyze results and formulate recommendationsDevelop application and data products (business process design and continuous improvement, workflow and customer-focused applications and analytic solutions: acquisition, extraction, translation, visualization, data story, and analytic applications) and other strategies and tactics that optimize data/innovation practice and decision-makingAcquire data from multiple and complex data sources: open data, OSD and Commonwealth of MAÈs applications/data sources, public and proprietary data and develop repeatable collection systems, translation and insight productsQuickly roll up sleeves to clean/filter data in a repeatable, incremental (agile) and big-picture mannerProactively identify opportunities for improvementCommunicate results and recommendations with management/leadership effectivelyIn a positive collaborative manner, actively prioritize commitments with management, stakeholders and customersPerform other duties as directed by supervisor/managerTECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIREDConcentration: Computer Science, Data Science and/or Analytics (Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Media Arts Technology, Interaction Design, Machine Learning and AI courses strongly preferred OR equivalent 2 years experience in analytics/data scienceMicrosoft Office Knowledge: Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint, VisioAgile certification or experience in agile environment preferredLanguages/Tools Preferred: Python, R, Julia, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS3 including Animations, Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure, AWS, JIRA, Qlik, Tableau, Power BI, JIRA, Adobe Creative Suite, OmnniGraffle, Axure, Invision, Google Analytics, Sugar CRM, CVentQualificationsFirst consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.Minimum Entrance Requirements:Applicants must have at least (A) three years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in electronic data processing, of which (B) at least one year must have been in work in which the major duties included computer systems analysis, or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.SUBSTITUTIONS:I. An Associate's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*II. A Bachelor's or higher degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*III. A diploma for completion of a two year full-time, or equivalent part-time, program in a recognized non-degree granting business or vocational/technical school above the high school level with a major in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*IV. An official transcript from a recognized business or vocational/ technical school as evidence of completion of a program consisting of at least 650 hours of instruction in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.V. Graduation from the data processing course of a recognized vocational/technical high school may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.Education toward such a degree or diploma will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for the one year of the required (B) experience.Special Requirements: NoneAn Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.Official Title: Edp Systems Analyst IIPrimary Location: United States-Massachusetts-Boston-1 Ashburton PlaceJob: Information Systems and TechnologyAgency: Operational Services DivisionSchedule: Full-timeShift: DayJob Posting: Mar 25, 2020, 4:33:29 PMNumber of Openings: 1Salary: 58,390.54 - 83,591.56 YearlyIf you have Diversity, Affirmative Action or Equal Employment Opportunity questions or need a Reasonable Accommodation, please contact Diversity Officer / ADA Coordinator: Jacqueline Brownell - 617-720-3300Bargaining Unit: 06-NAGE - Professional Admin.Confidential: No

Title: Assistant Director/Director, Office of Data Science
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company!As a technical member of the Office of Data Science (ODS), Enablement & Collaboration unit, you will work with a team of data science (DS) and machine learning (ML) experts to solve LibertyÈs most challenging data science problems.The ODS was created to provide additional centralized support and expertise to DS teams across the global organization. Our projects focus on key areas of interest to multiple teams, bleeding edge research and experimentation, common tool development, and establishing best practices to ensure the scientific community at Liberty is well-positioned to rapidly meet the challenges of modern industry.If you are interested in making an impact on an entire culture at a Fortune 100 company, the ODS is the place for you!As a centralized group, our project scope is vast. Possible projects include:Design new language models (NLP/NLU) to understand and build predictions or summaries from customer calls, claim notes, web chats, medical records, and beyondDetect property hazards from aerial imagery, customer photos, geospatial data, etc. using computer vision (CV)Explore the advantages and limitations of privacy-preserving ML, to accelerate experimentation and better protect our customersÈ dataPush the boundaries in fundamental experimentation to boost and augment small-sample or rare-event data, transfer learning, and similar techniquesEngage in theoretical research in collaboration with MIT, via LibertyÈs investment in the MIT Quest for Intelligence, to shape the future of AIThe actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidateÈs overall experience and skill level.Qualifications:Solid knowledge of predictive analytics techniques and statistical diagnostics of models. Advance knowledge of predictive toolset; expert resource for tool development.Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely. Has a value-driven perspective with regard to understanding of work context and impact.Competencies typically acquired through a Ph.D. degree (in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Actuarial Science or other scientific field of study) with 2+ years professional experience, a MasterÈs degree (scientific field of study) and 4+ years of relevant experience or may be acquired through a BachelorÈs degree(scientific field of study) and 5+ years of relevant experience.Benefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, itÈs our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.WeÈre dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Data Engineer/Senior Data Engineer - Data & Analytics Engine...
Description: Data Engineer/Senior Data EngineerAt Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as an Agile team within a Fortune 100 company, we are on the front edge of an IT transformation for how people work and deliver solutions.GRM Data & Analytics Engineering actively searching for a highly productive member of a distributed, dynamic agile team to serve as a technical expert in analysis, design, coding, and testing innovative data warehouse reporting solutions and analytics. You will analyze complex technical system problems and create innovative solutions that exceed customer expectations.This is a fast-paced environment providing rapid delivery for our business partners. You will have the opportunity to help lead this change with us as we grow this culture, mindset and capability.In this role you will:Work in a dynamic and exciting agile environment with Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and team members to develop creative data-driven solutions with our ETL pipeline that meet business and technical initiativesImprove speed to market by focusing on current Agency & Strategic Partners data needs as well as building out the long-term strategic data solutions using AWS, SQL, Unix, Informatica, as well as other modern data technologiesDesign and develop programs and tools to support ingestion, curation and provisioning of complex enterprise data to achieve analytics, reporting, and data scienceDemonstrate open minded and collaborative approach to creating innovative technical solutionsAnalyze data and technical system problems to design and implement effective, flexible solutionsHandle end-to-end development, including coding, testing, and debugging during each cycleDevelop automated tests for multiple scopes (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)Mentor new and junior developersIdentify and recommend appropriate continuous improvement opportunitiesQualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferredExperience developing back end, data warehouse technology solutionsKnowledge of a variety of data platforms including Teradata, DB2 (Cloud based DB a plus)Experience with AWS (such as S3, Snowflake, Athena, snapLogic), Unix, Informatica & SQLExtensive knowledge of IT concepts, strategies, methodologies.Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Test Engineers)Versed in diverse technologies and new technical architecture principles and conceptsDemonstrates leadership and active pursuit of optimizing CI/CD process and tools, testing frameworks and practicesMust be proactive, demonstrate initiative, and be a logical thinkerMust be team oriented with strong collaboration, prioritization, and adaptability skills requiredAdditional Qualifications:Java, Ruby, NoSQL, Python development experienceUnderstanding of Cloud / Hybrid data architecture conceptsUnderstanding of insurance industry and productsExcited by trying new technology and learning new toolsBenefits & Culture:In GRM Data & Analytics Engineering, we embrace all of the values of our Fortune 100 company and push our practices and technology skill sets to the next level. In this organization, we are an agile set of teams dedicated to helping impact the lives of thousands of customers every day. We embrace a modern co-working style with exceptional work/life balance, ergonomic work areas, substantial benefits, and best-in-class amenities.Liberty Mutual is one of America's Best Employers for Diversity and one of the Best Employers for Women http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacesToWorkforWomen one of the Best Employers for New Grads http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacesforNewGrads and one of the Best Places to Work http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacestoWork . We offer excellent benefits for our employees including generous parental leave, retirement plans including 401k and pension, education reimbursement, commuter benefits, college savings plans, and much more.To learn more about our benefit offerings and culture please visit:https://LMI.co/Benefitshttp://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-CultureEOE Statement:Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn More:

Title: UI BENEFITS CALL CENTER REPRESENTATIVE - CDE
Description: This is an ongoing position to fill multiple Time-Limited positions for up to 1 year for UI Benefits Claims Representative - Charlotte CC. Qualified applicants will be screened and referred to hiring manager on an rolling basis for hiring decisions.This position is based in the Customer Call Center within the Division of Employment Security. It will provide administrative assistance to customers who are initiating Unemployment Insurance Claims through telephone and/or internet. Speaking with and interviewing clients filing claims, entering personal and work history information into the computer systems. Provides basic information regarding requirements for filing a claim, penalties for fraudulent claims, reemployment services, eligibility status, and appeal procedures. Verifies citizenship status, lawful alien registration and document issues related to barriers to employment. Processes and/or troubleshoot internet and/or telephone claims and responds to e-mails using Microsoft Outlook about unemployment insurance services. Creates and composes documents in Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel. The work schedule for this position is Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. This position is physically located in Charlotte, North Carolina, Mecklenburg County.This posting include multiple positions:65010129, 65010130, 65010131, 65010132, 65010133, 65010134, 65010135, 65010137, 65010138, and 65010139Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / CompetenciesQualified applicants must submit an application that clearly reflects work experience that demonstrates the following:Demonstrated experience in a high call volume call center environment handling a continuous flow of inbound and/or outbound calls (approximately 60-80 a day).Demonstrated experience explaining company, government benefits, eligibility, products, programs and/or services to the public.Demonstrated experience obtaining information using interviewing and/or investigative techniques to process claims or payments.Demonstrated experience communicating verbally and in writing to document call center transactions while entering data accurately using basic programs as Windows, Word, Excel, Internet, etc.~Applicant must meet both the minimum education and experience requirements and all posted Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies requirements to be considered Qualified for the position.Minimum Education and Experience RequirementsBachelor's degree from an appropriately accredited institution accompanied by at least one (1) year of experience.Associate's degree from an appropriately accredited institution accompanied by at least three (3) years of experience.High School or General Educational Development (GED) diploma and five (5) years of experience.Reviewing, evaluating, or processing requests for program participation or eligibility; Title: Program Director
Description: As a result of the COVID-19 hiring slow down, please note that this position will have a July 1st or later start date.The OpportunityWe're seeking a results-oriented and social justice-minded leader with program, performance, and team management experience to lead our Charlotte office - our newest office across the country - and implement CEO_Ñés proven program model there. The Program Director will provide the leadership needed to start and grow the Charlotte program, ensure its sustainability, and support CEO program participants in successfully transitioning from incarceration to stable and productive lives.Who We AreThe Center for Employment Opportunities (CEO) provides employment services to people with recent criminal convictions. Across the United States, over 6,000 people participate in CEO each year, transitioning to employment that supports themselves, their families, and their communities.What began as a demonstration project of the Vera Institute of Justice in the 1970s to address employment barriers facing the formerly incarcerated following release in New York City has grown into the leading reentry employment organization in the country, where over 25,000 formerly incarcerated individuals have secured full-time employment since 1996. In 2016, CEO embarked on a 5-year strategic plan to grow to serve 9,000 participants annually.Who You AreYou are deeply dedicated to and engaged in social justice and perhaps are already working in the re-entry fieldYou come to CEO with 5+ years of leadership and program management experience in a fast-growing and results-oriented nonprofit environmentYou have a working knowledge of the local Charlotte or general criminal justice and workforce development systemsYou have people management experience and can build, manage, and develop a diverse team and are able to bounce seamlessly between high level strategy and getting into the weeds when needed to ensure your team_Ñés successYou understand the importance of performance based goals and have experience catalyzing a team to reach theseYour attention to detail allows you to juggle multiple projects at one timeYou thrive in ambiguity and want to play a key role in the growth of an organizationYou understand the importance of regularly collecting, analyzing, and applying data to drive program strategy and decision makingYou have experience engaging and persuading a diverse array of stakeholdersYou are comfortable with technology, including Google Suite and SalesforceYou have the highest level of personal integrity and are personally and professionally committed to excellence and having deep impact on our participants_Ñé livesWhat You_Ñéll Be Responsible ForHiring, supervising, and supporting a diverse, high-performing local team to serve participants and achieve our program outcomes (including life skills graduation, successful placement of participants in transitional employment, full-time job placement, and long term job retention) through disciplined data analysis, coaching, and training and development;Collaboratively developing and executing CEO's fund development strategy in Charlotte, identifying philanthropic, government, and private funding prospects;Growing CEO's presence in the workforce development and criminal justice communities within Charlotte, cultivating relationships with local parole and probation bureaus, district attorney offices, and other program referral sources;Developing strong partnerships with local organizations that offer support for our participants including benefits access, financial literacy, housing counseling, substance abuse, and career advancement;Increasing the number of paying social enterprise customers that allow our participants to gain income and work experience while working to secure stable employment;Handling or delegating invoicing, program reporting, record keeping and other operational duties;Ensuring the smooth operation of the office_Ñés administrative functions, supported by our central team headquartered in New York CityCompensation and BenefitsThe salary range for this position is $65,000 - $70,000. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package, including medical and dental coverage, paid parental leave, participation in a retirement plan, sick and vacation leave, paid holidays and more. Title: Program Director
Description: As a result of the COVID-19 hiring slow down, please note that this position will have a July 1st or later start date.The OpportunityWe're seeking a results-oriented and social justice-minded leader with program, performance, and team management experience to lead our Charlotte office - our newest office across the country - and implement CEO_Ñés proven program model there. The Program Director will provide the leadership needed to start and grow the Charlotte program, ensure its sustainability, and support CEO program participants in successfully transitioning from incarceration to stable and productive lives.Who We AreThe Center for Employment Opportunities (CEO) provides employment services to people with recent criminal convictions. Across the United States, over 6,000 people participate in CEO each year, transitioning to employment that supports themselves, their families, and their communities.What began as a demonstration project of the Vera Institute of Justice in the 1970s to address employment barriers facing the formerly incarcerated following release in New York City has grown into the leading reentry employment organization in the country, where over 25,000 formerly incarcerated individuals have secured full-time employment since 1996. In 2016, CEO embarked on a 5-year strategic plan to grow to serve 9,000 participants annually.Who You AreYou are deeply dedicated to and engaged in social justice and perhaps are already working in the re-entry fieldYou come to CEO with 5+ years of leadership and program management experience in a fast-growing and results-oriented nonprofit environmentYou have a working knowledge of the local Charlotte or general criminal justice and workforce development systemsYou have people management experience and can build, manage, and develop a diverse team and are able to bounce seamlessly between high level strategy and getting into the weeds when needed to ensure your team_Ñés successYou understand the importance of performance based goals and have experience catalyzing a team to reach theseYour attention to detail allows you to juggle multiple projects at one timeYou thrive in ambiguity and want to play a key role in the growth of an organizationYou understand the importance of regularly collecting, analyzing, and applying data to drive program strategy and decision makingYou have experience engaging and persuading a diverse array of stakeholdersYou are comfortable with technology, including Google Suite and SalesforceYou have the highest level of personal integrity and are personally and professionally committed to excellence and having deep impact on our participants_Ñé livesWhat You_Ñéll Be Responsible ForHiring, supervising, and supporting a diverse, high-performing local team to serve participants and achieve our program outcomes (including life skills graduation, successful placement of participants in transitional employment, full-time job placement, and long term job retention) through disciplined data analysis, coaching, and training and development;Collaboratively developing and executing CEO's fund development strategy in Charlotte, identifying philanthropic, government, and private funding prospects;Growing CEO's presence in the workforce development and criminal justice communities within Charlotte, cultivating relationships with local parole and probation bureaus, district attorney offices, and other program referral sources;Developing strong partnerships with local organizations that offer support for our participants including benefits access, financial literacy, housing counseling, substance abuse, and career advancement;Increasing the number of paying social enterprise customers that allow our participants to gain income and work experience while working to secure stable employment;Handling or delegating invoicing, program reporting, record keeping and other operational duties;Ensuring the smooth operation of the office_Ñés administrative functions, supported by our central team headquartered in New York CityCompensation and BenefitsThe salary range for this position is $65,000 - $70,000. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package, including medical and dental coverage, paid parental leave, participation in a retirement plan, sick and vacation leave, paid holidays and more. We're a workplace that promotes continual learning and teamwork, offering lunch and learns, team outings, holiday gatherings and more for our staff.More About UsWe welcome diversity and highly encourage applications from people of color and people with convictions. We are an equal employment opportunity for all regardless of race, color, citizenship, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran or reservist status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.IND 3

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
Description: Who are you? You_Ñére ready to join an organization that is helping clients win. You_Ñéve been looking for the right opportunity to work hard, learn and make a difference. You_Ñére a digital marketer. You_Ñére confident on the phone, friendly, reliable and a great listener. You feel energized by both positive client interactions and collaboration_Ñ_ because well, you genuinely like helping people and love finding unique solutions to challenges. Opportunities for growth with a passionate team excite you. You_Ñére super-positive and have that undeniably awesome personality people can_Ñét help but gravitate toward. You_Ñére self-motivated, driven and possess a strong work ethic. And_Ñ_ you are a digital marketer.------------------------------------------Who is Klik Marketing? We_Ñére a Global Digital Marketing Agency based in Charlotte. We are on the edge of uptown in the fast-developing West Charlotte corridor (but currently working remotely). We handle all facets of digital marketing, including SEO, PPC, social media marketing, and Facebook Ads. Our roots are in Charlotte, but we serve the world.Position OverviewWe are hiring a Digital Marketer for Klik Marketing. You will be responsible for the growth of our client_Ñés online businesses by leading their digital marketing efforts with our staff of experts.Primary ResponsibilitiesThis candidate will report to the CEO of Klik Marketing as part of the Digital Marketing team and will oversee and execute the daily deployment of comprehensive digital media plans, including SEO, SEM, display advertising, online video and social media efforts that will effectively and efficiently drive traffic and sales growth across our client's brands.Work closely with Klik team members to digitally support promotions, analysis, and vendor management; align all campaign creative/materials with overall master brand architecture and marketing strategy.Oversee our external partners and internal staff to execute web design/development, paid media, content strategies, and analysis initiatives.Manage client_Ñés dashboards and oversee analytics and reporting.Work with our marketing coordinators and social media specialists to support our social media and content development strategies.Understand weekly/monthly sales data and build reports to inform digital performance plans for executive-level consumption.Measurement and AnalyticsProvide regular reporting to brand owners on digital performance.Work closely with analytics and staff to maintain a comprehensive digital dashboardPropose various A/B testing programs to identify new opportunities for clients.Interpret and utilize sales/product/ticket data to identify opportunities and trends and provide actionable recommendations integrated into digital marketing plansSkill RequirementsBachelor's degree in marketing or advertising3-5 years of digital marketing or related experienceDetail-oriented with strong organizational & communication skillsAnalytical skill set to use data to drive directionIntermediate/Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPointProject management experience preferredGoogle Analytics and Google AdWords certifications a plusExperience owning, managing or directing marketing agencies a plusJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Charlotte, NC 28208 (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Preferred)Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $38,000.00 to $42,000.00 /yearExperience:Marketing: 3 years (Required)

Title: Supply Chain Planning Analyst
Description: Imagine ...working for a company that knows that its people are the key to its success in the marketplace. A company in which achieving extraordinary results and having a stimulating work experience are part of the same process.We cultivate and embrace a diverse employee population. We recognize that people with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives fuel our growth and enrich our global culture.We are looking for an individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced, team oriented environment, likes to be challenged, and values the opportunity to make a difference.The Supply Chain Planning Analyst researches and analyzes operational data. This position supports business processes through planning improvements and reporting system enhancements. This position works with the entire Supply Chain Planning Department to assist in data mining and analytics to solve business problems and provide justification to implement planning and operational improvementsEssential Job DutiesWorks with Supply Chain Planning leaders to analyze current operational procedures, problems and input/output requirements.Acts as a productive team member on internal and cross-functional multi-departmental projects as required.Exercises and maintains an understanding of commonly used Supply Chain concepts, practices, and procedures for conducting data analysis.Consults with department team members to obtain all required information during the investigation and analysis process. Evaluates all possible alternative methods to gather the necessary data.Assists in the improvements of operational and system processes that define user needs, functionality and steps required to enhance planning systems, processes and procedures.Tracks and documents changes to business process and or procedures.Assists in post-implementation analysis, validation and revision requests.Provides regular weekly, monthly and annual analytical reports regarding Supply Chain Planning performance including but limited to capacity, production output, scheduling efficiency, inventory performance, obsolescence and service.Contributes to validating, maintaining and creating Supply Chain Planning master data including modifiers, six segment, routings and BOM_Ñés in cooperation with Finance, Engineering, Marketing, Commercialization and Operations.May perform other Supply Chain duties as required.Scope of ResponsibilityThis role works under the direction of the Director of Supply Chain Optimization with limited independent decision-making; expected to determine how to accomplish the work assignments using available resources. Project budgets can reach up to and include $100,000 annually, and decision making within the scope of these projects will affect the company_Ñés data and planning management operations.Knowledge and Skill RequirementsAbility to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, synthesizing complex or diverse information.Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints, varying writing style to meet needs and or speaking clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.Possess good verbal communication / listening skills.Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.Ability to exercise discretion while managing confidential information.Ability to develop and coordinate projects, project plans, and completing projects on time and within budget.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products. In-depth knowledge and experience within relevant Oracle EBS modules. Base understanding of available development platforms.Capability to observe and understand plant floor operations.Education and ExperienceBachelor_Ñés degree Required with analytical process experience preferred.Professional Licenses or Certifications (List professional licenses or certificates required for the job) N/APhysical DemandsThe employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear.The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.Work EnvironmentCorporate office settingThe noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Travel RequiredProgram related travel < 25% of time.To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.CSC1The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, disability, age, religion or any other classification protected by law.In that regard, U.S. applicants and employees are protected from discrimination based on certain categories protected by Federal law.

Title: Applied Behavior Analysis Therapist / Registered Behavior Te...
Description: A Bridge To Achievement is seeking energetic and career-minded professionals to join our team! We are currently hiring for a part-time position with the potential to become full-time. The applicant must be willing to work between the hours of 9 AM and 7 PM, though scheduled times may vary.We are looking for professionals who want to make a positive difference in the lives of those with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and their families. A Bridge to Achievement (ABtA) will provide all necessary training for new behavior technicians and offer a unique guided career path for those looking to grow in the ABA field.Who is ABtA?A Bridge to Achievement is a rapidly growing agency that provides family-centered Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services, emphasizing the future of children with ASD and their families. Our expert team of Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) and highly trained behavior technicians use evidence-based ABA methods to teach children social, communication, play, cognitive, and self-care skills, while reducing problem behaviors in a variety of settings based on the family needs.At ABtA, we understand that ASD has a dramatic and lifelong impact on individuals with this diagnosis and their families. We partner with parents to understand their children by identifying their strengths, interests, and learning styles. Using ABA and other evidence-based techniques, our highly-trained clinicians focus on therapies and interventions that use positive reinforcement to teach the children we support to reach their full potential. We then integrate our services in a variety of settings striving to create the most effective learning experience and promote positive change across all aspects of the lives of the children we serve and their families.Why should you choose a career with ABtA?Our unique organizational approach allows new and seasoned behavior technicians alike the opportunity to explore and implement ABA techniques to help guide their desired career path. ABtA provides comprehensive training in a variety of ABA strategies such as Discrete Trial Training, Verbal Behavior, Natural Environment Teaching, and Behavior Modification programming.Benefits for All ABtA Employees:ë Exceptional and Competitive Wagesë Paid Time Off (PTO)ë Flexible Holiday and Time Off Schedulesë 401(k) with Company Matchë Mileage Reimbursementë Healthcare Insurance Optionsë Initial and Ongoing Paid Training and Supervisionë RBT Certification Program for New Behavior Technicians in the Fieldë Tuition Discounts, Supervision and Mentorship for Employees Seeking Their BCBA Certificationë Opportunities for Rapid Career Advancement for both RBTs and BCBA Traineesë Performance and Promotion RaisesRoles and Responsibilitiesë Provide consistent and reliable 1:1 ABA therapy for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder based upon evidence-based strategiesë Under close supervision of a BCBA, behavior technicians will implement training plans that target maladaptive behaviors, functional living skills, social skills, and verbal behaviorë Maintain open communication between families and clinicians/supervisors.ë Attend and contribute to all team meetings and workshops provided by ABtAë Collect, record and maintain clinical data for all clients in CentralReach practice management systemë Follow all company policies and procedures, as well as the BACB Ethical Compliance, while promoting a positive company moraleë With our unique RBT career path model, behavior technicians will have the opportunity for additional roles and responsibilities including, but not limited to:ë Serving as a local liaison between community and ABtAë Planning company events and activitiesë Administrative duties as requested and seen fit by BCBAë Assisting in the development of materials for sessionsPhysical Requirements:ë Be able to perform the following activities easily:ë Climbing (e.g. upon playground equipment)ë Squatting (e.g. to assist child putting on shoes)ë Bending over (e.g. to assist child with writing)ë Running (e.g. running through a sprinkler with a child)ë Carrying (e.g. teaching materials, toys, art supplies) * Be able to work in a variety of work settings (both indoor and outdoor)ë Be able to safely lift up to 50lbsë Be able to sit and move to standing quicklyë Be able to sit on the floor or ground for extended periods of timeë Be comfortable with teaching and assisting with toilet trainingMinimum Qualifications Requirementsë High School Diplomaë Valid driver_Ñés license and reliable transportationë Ability to pass a background and Healthcare Registry checkë Ability to pass all drug screenings during the time of employmentMinimum Experience Preferredë Experience working with individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder or individuals with ID/DDë Experience providing ABA servicesë Individuals seeking their Masters Degree in ABA are highly encouraged to apply!ë Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certificationë Bachelor's degree in a human service fieldABtA provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment
