Description: Title: QC Analyst: Data Integrity SMEWork Location: NebraskaDuration: 3+ MonthsExperience Level: 9+ yearsHourly Rate: NegotiableWho are we?Laboratory Validation Specialists, Inc. is a single source provider of cGMP regulatory compliance in the United States, Europe, and Asia for pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device companies.Job DescriptionThe QC Analyst: Data Integrity SME is a role in which you would be expected to be responsible for ensuring compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices in all work performed. Title: VP of Sales - Health Plan Experience - Remote Role
Description: Take us to new heights _ÑÐ bring on new logos and clients because of your connections. the VP of Sales will:Build and maintain healthy sales pipeline for new businessProactively develop strategic deals by leveraging personal and professional networksDefine market segments, implementing marketing strategies and developing sales plans utilizing available resources to effectively penetrate the payor marketWork with marketing to develop proper messaging to reach our desired audienceConduct, create and coordinate client presentations over webinars, in person and at eventsAttend events that drive new businessForecast and report regularlyREQUIREMENTSBachelor's degreePrior sales experience calling on national and regional managed care organizations with success in closing sales in these organizationsAdvanced understanding of the strategic sale and what is strategies within managed care organizationsDemonstrated experience building and implementing strategy to network and gain C-level contacts within health plansStrong sense of urgency, with the drive and knowledge to navigate mutli-level relationships with complex and fluid managed care customers.Deep understanding of needs based selling strategies and ability to uncover underlying customer objections and concernsAbility to think strategically and create plans unique to a prospect given their situation in the marketplace and business issuesStrong analytical thinker with the ability to clearly articulate a value proposition that resonates with a prospect organization and its buyersThorough understanding of the consultative, customer-focused approach to the sales processExperienced in the use of CRM applications such as SalesforceConfidence in Microsoft Office: PowerPoint, Word and ExcelPREFERREDMaster's degreeFamiliarity with behavioral healthAll work from home opportunities require:A quiet, private, distraction-free home office work environmentA reliable high-speed internet connection (cable, DSL or fiber) with speeds of at least 10Mbps download and 5Mbps uploadWillingness to do constant sedentary workDiscipline to work from home while following a set scheduleBackground check clearanceABOUT USCatasys is making a positive impact on people_Ñés lives every day. We use predictive analytics to identify health plan members with unaddressed behavioral health conditions that worsen chronic disease, then engage, support and guide these members to better health with a personalized, human-centered approach. This has led us to where we are today: growing fast and saving lives as we do.To support our explosive growth, we_Ñére looking for compassionate, hard-working people-lovers to join our team. If innovating in the field of patient care is something you_Ñére passionate about, we encourage you to join our mission to improve the health and save the lives of as many people as possible.Impact lives in so many waysYou'll be an integral part in supporting people coping with their unique life challenges. Every member of the Catasys team contributes to accomplishing our goals and upholding our people-centric values.The new face of mental healthOur model is research-based, and we are invested in staying on the leading edge of treatment. You'll help us break down barriers and stigmas associated with mental health.Career optionsOur ongoing strong growth and evolution, we are looking for people who want to do their best at work. Join our team and take your career to the next level with Catasys. We are committed to promoting from within.Excellent compensationIn addition to a competitive wage, we offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid holiday, vacation and sick time; flexible spending accounts; Basic Life/AD&D, Employee Assistance Program and Travel Assistance Program and more.Catasys is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran statusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $99,357.00 to $226,108.00 /yearExperience:national or regional managed care organization sales: 2 years (Required)needs based selling: 3 years (Required)Selling INTO HEALTH PLANS: 3 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Additional Compensation:CommissionWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Data Analyst/Statistician Position #1119
Description: Department InformationAbout the Colorado Department of EducationThrough setting a clear vision for increasing student performance, CDE continually supports the advancement and improvement of the state's education system to prepare all learners for success in a rapidly changing global workplace.VisionAll students in Colorado will become educated and productive citizens capable of succeeding in society, the workforce, and life.MissionThe mission of the Colorado Department of Education is to ensure that all students are prepared for success in society, work, and life by providing excellent leadership, service, and support to schools, districts, and communities across the state.Why work for Colorado Department of Education?We offer great location and great benefits which include:Medical and dental plansStrong, secure, yet flexible retirement plans including PERA Defined Benefit Plan or PERA Defined Contribution Plan plus 401K and 457 plansEmployee wellness programsPaid life insuranceShort and long-term disability coverageNo Cost ECO Pass10 paid holidays per year plus vacation and sick leaveFlexible work schedule options, training opportunities, and more."ADAAA Accommodations: Any person with a disability as defined by the ADA Amendments Act of 2008 (ADAAA) may be provided a reasonable accommodation upon request to enable the person to complete an employment assessment. To request an accommodation, please contact by phone or email at least five business days before the assessment date to allow us to evaluate your request and prepare for the accommodation. You may be asked to provide additional information, including medical documentation, regarding functional limitations and type of accommodation needed. Please ensure that you have this information available well in advance of the assessment date."Description of JobThis Data Analyst/Statistician Data position is responsible for managing the Student End of Year collection as collected from Colorado's local education agencies including districts and BOCES. This position must collaborate with various units across the department to determine collection changes necessitated by legislation or regulation and to provide data needed to fulfill reporting, technical assistance, monitoring and analysis obligations.Key Duties and ResponsibilitiesFacilitate and coordinate the Student End of Year collection including documentation, business rules, testing procedures, instructions, training materials, and training. Collect data from Colorado's districts and BOCES and provide technical assistance to ensure the field meets collection deadlines.Serve as the primary backup for the Student October collection.Collaborate effectively and cooperate with members of other CDE units as collection business analyst to determine data changes necessitated by legislation or regulation and to provide data needed to fulfill reporting, technical assistance, monitoring and analysis obligations. Ensure Data Dictionary is up to date with determined collection changes.Provide technical assistance and training to district and BOCES field personnel regarding the submission of all data.Work with the CDE's Information Management Services (IMS) staff to verify the accuracy and integrity of data.Prepare specific information and reports, as requested, in response to inquiries from federal, state, local education and private agencies, and from the general public. Respond to data analysis requests and prepare technical and/or statistical reports regarding Data Services data. Extract data from the CDE data warehouse for statistical analyses and to fill data requests and use statistical analysis software to perform data analyses, as appropriate.Act as a major data steward within CDE's Data Governance structure.Assist in case management of State Assigned Student Identification numbers (SASIDs) in the Record Integration Transfer System (RITS).Act as advisor and provide technical assistance to CDE staff in areas associated with data collection, education research, statistics, evaluation and programs.Other duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal RightsCompetency and Qualification RequirementsExperience with analysis programs, querying tools and or database applications (i.e., Excel, TOAD).Knowledge and experience with applied statistics.Detail-oriented (i.e., proofing work, spelling, grammar, formatting, etc.).Proven communication and project management skills.Effective and constructive interpersonal skills.Evidence of strong logical thinking skills and technical writing skills.Interest in working with file layouts, editing data, and basic data analysis.Ability to effectively balance quality of work and productivity expectations.Ability to collaborate with internal and external customers (i.e., school districts, BOCES, other CDE units, etc.).Takes initiative and exhibits a proactive approach to work.Identifies problems and recommends solutions prior to the standard being jeopardized.Ability to work independently as well as on a team.Exhibits CDE's mission, vision and values by the consistent expression of professional, respectful, and customer service oriented behaviors.Minimum Education RequirementsBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in data management, statistics, computer programming or a closely related field OR six years of professional experience in data management, statistics or computer programming.Supplemental InformationHow to Apply:Applicants MUST submit a resume and letter of interest detailing how their experience and background address the stated minimum and preferred qualifications/competencies of the job and attach to the online application. Applications left blank or marked "See Resume" will not be accepted.Complete Applications must include the following documents:A complete online application.A cover letter (attach to your online application).A resume (attach to your online application).Only complete applications submitted by the closing date for this announcement will be given consideration.***Please DO NOT attach transcripts, certificates or reference letters***The State of Colorado believes that equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and we encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply. The State of Colorado is an equal opportunity employer committed to building inclusive, innovative work environments with employees who reflect our communities and enthusiastically serve them. Therefore, in all aspects of the employment process, we provide employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, medical condition related to pregnancy, creed, ancestry, national origin, marital status, genetic information, or military status (with preference given to military veterans), or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.The Colorado Department of Education is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, our agency will assist individuals who have a disability with any reasonable accommodation requests related to employment, including completing the application process, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, participating in the employee selection process, and/or to perform essential job functions where the requested accommodation does not impose an undue hardship. If you have a disability and require reasonable accommodation to ensure you have a positive experience applying or interviewing for this position, please direct your inquiries to our DAAA Coordinator, Susan Jiron-Garcia at Human_Resources@cde.state.co.us or call ?303-866-6600.

Title: DORA/Public Utilities Commission: Analyst VI
Description: Department InformationThe Department of Regulatory Agencies (DORA) is dedicated to preserving the integrity of the marketplace and is committed to promoting a fair and competitive business environment in Colorado.Consumer protection is our mission.DORA values and promotes diversity, supporting a workforce that is inclusive of people from different backgrounds and experiences; creating an environment that is reflective of our communities; promoting positive relationships; and putting forth unique perspectives to fulfill our mission.Description of JobDORA's Public Utilities Commission (PUC) serves the public interest by effectively regulating utilities and facilities so that the people of Colorado receive safe, reliable and reasonably-priced services consistent with the economic, environmental and social values of our state.The work unit generally exists to provide professional analysis, technical and policy testimony, and/or advice and recommendations on engineering, economic, financial, and operational matters. The unit functions as a team to challenge, develop, present and recommend complex engineering, financial and legal approaches in utility regulation. The team functions both in formal legal proceedings and informal negotiations and contacts with regulated companies. In performing these functions, the work unit must balance the need for financially healthy utilities with the needs of the consumers to receive safe, reliable utility service at reasonable rates. An increasingly important function of the work unit is to assist in the evolution of new regulatory structures in the face of the new business environment brought about by: increased focus on consumer protection; emerging technologies and increasing competition in many areas of utility operations; changing environmental regulations and goals; and related costs of traditional utility services.Position: SGA 5068The purpose of this position is to review, investigate, prepare advisory memorandum for uncontested proceedings; and review, investigate, issue audit and discovery, prepare written testimony, and defend staff recommendations in hearing in formal litigated proceedings. This position focuses primarily on proceedings where wholesale electric cooperative integrated or electric resource planning activities are at issue. The proceedings may include electric power distribution plan proceedings, municipalization applications, requests for certificates of public convenience and necessity, and electric/integrated resource plans.Duties include, but are not limited to:Performing engineering and cost analysis using spreadsheets or complex electric resource planning and security-constrained economic dispatch computer simulations or models that provide insight into the costs and effectiveness of future electric generation acquisitions and retirements;Preparing written and/or oral recommendations concerning advice letters, applications, and other filings;Drafting orders for the Commissioners that are accurate, unbiased, complete, and representative of the Commissioners' findings and decisions;Drafting rules that are comprehensive, concise and understandable for consideration by the Commission and other interested parties;Determining which audit should be propounded, and whether any inspections should be completed in order to adequately analyze utility proposals for electric resource planning;Participating as Commission trial staff in litigated proceedings where wholesale electric cooperative integrated or electric resource planning activities are at issue;Participating as a member of cross-organizational task forces assigned specific responsibilities to investigate and report on federal and state legislation, alternative regulatory treatment in other jurisdictions, and new and emerging electric resource planning practices, with a goal of increasing Commission and staff knowledge;Conducting inspections and monitoring activities, including, but not limited to, a review of utility methods, practices and procedures; collecting and analyzing data samples; completing necessary reports and documentation; and communicating findings to utilities, the Commission and other parties as appropriate.Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal RightsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (MQs):Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in economics, public policy, business administration, statistics, mathematics, finance, engineering, applied physics, accounting, or in a field of study closely related to the work assignment; andFive (5) years of progressively responsible, professional* experience in the utility industry performing analytic work.Document this experience in your application IN DETAIL, as your experience will not be inferred or assumed. Part time experience will be prorated.SUBSTITUTIONS:A combination of professional* work experience as described above, which provided the same kind, amount and level of knowledge acquired in the required education, may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year-for-year basis;A master's or doctorate degree from an accredited college or university in a field of study related to the work assignment may be substituted for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.Professional work involves exercising discretion, analytical skill, judgment and personal accountability and responsibility for creating, developing, integrating, applying, and sharing an organized body of knowledge that characteristically is: uniquely acquired through an intense education or training regimen at a recognized college or university; equivalent to the curriculum requirements for a bachelor's or higher degree with major study in or pertinent to the specialized field; and continuously studied to explore, extend, and use additional discoveries, interpretations, and application and to improve data, materials, equipment, applications and methods.Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:Advanced degree in engineering, applied physics, economics, public policy, statistics or mathematics;Electric or integrated resource planning experience;Electrical utility industry experience;Public Policy Experience;Experience working on energy policy;Experience explaining and breaking down complex, technical engineering concepts into layman's terms.Required Competencies: The following knowledge, skills, abilities, and personal characteristics are required competencies and may be considered during the selection process (including examination and/or interview):Demonstrated written and oral communication skills (which includes being cognizant that not all recipients of such communications are professional engineers);Professional demeanor;Demonstrated ability to conduct research and gather pertinent information;Attention to detail;Comfortable demonstrating expertise in front of authorities;Demonstrated interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively as part of a collaborative team;Strong judgment and confidence in decision-making skills;Creativity and flexibility, with an ability to adapt to new changes;Strategic thinking, including the ability to identify emerging issues, anticipate trends, and provide recommendations on strategies to minimize risk impacts;Time management, including the ability to manage numerous, competing priorities;Ability to read and analyze laws, rules, regulations and policies and interpret them in order to explain them to various stakeholders;Flexibility and adaptability with regard to change management, including the ability to adhere to changes in work processes, adapt to changing priorities, and maintain a willingness to comply with and support organizational change(s);Demonstrated ability to understand and abide by workplace principles, practices and behaviors as internally identified and defined by the division;Ability to represent the department and the PUC in a positive, professional and objective manner, and support a positive workplace environment;Ability to handle sensitive and/or highly confidential information in a professional and ethical manner, and in accordance with state and federal laws;Proficiency in the use of various PC software applications, including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.), Google Docs, etc., as well as in the use of databases.Conditions of Employment: Candidates who fail to meet the conditions of employment will be removed from consideration.The successful passing of a reference check and/or, if required, a background check.A reference check may include but is not limited to: contacting previous and current supervisors to verify employment and discuss performance, a review of the personnel file, a review of the performance record, etc.The type of background check depends on the job duties of the position, and can include a review of any criminal record, credit report, and/or driving record.Supplemental InformationPLEASE READ - Required Application MaterialsInterested individuals must submit the following online:1. A completed State of Colorado Application (log-in to your current NeoGov account or create a NeoGov account to complete the online application). Note: Incomplete applications, including incomplete work history sections or "see rÕ©sumÕ©," "see attachment," or "see addendum" statements, will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application form.2. A current email address on your application, as all communication pertaining to this position will be conducted via email. Please set up your email to accept messages from info@governmentjobs.com and '@state.co.us' addresses, and check your email often. Note: The department cannot guarantee the successful delivery of email, including incorrect filtering into junk mail folders.3. A detailed cover letter, explaining how you meet the required competencies and how your accomplishments, qualifications, skills, areas of expertise, personal characteristics, etc. make you a good fit for this position; you may also attach additional documents that demonstrate this.Comparative Analysis Process: Structured Application ReviewPart of, if not the entire, comparative analysis process for this position will involve a review of the information you submit in your application materials; Therefore, it is paramount that in the experience portion of your application and cover letter, you describe the extent to which you possess the education, experience, and competencies outlined in the job announcement as well as the required and/or preferred qualifications/competencies. You are also encouraged to attach additional documents to that effect. Failure to include adequate information or follow instructions may affect your score and prevent you from competing in subsequent measures used to arrive at a top group of applicants.Veterans' Preference: Candidates who wish to assert Veterans' Preference should attach a copy of their DD-214 to their application. Failure to do so will result in being denied Veterans Preference.PLEASE NOTE: Former State Personnel System employees who were disciplinarily terminated or resigned in lieu of termination must disclose this information on the application. Colorado Revised Statutes require that all state employees be hired and promoted through competitive examination of merit and fitness. Failure to include the required information, failure to follow instructions, and/or failure to submit materials by the application deadline may result in your application not being considered for the position and may affect your score or inclusion in the final pool of qualified candidates.The State of Colorado believes that equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and we encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply. The State of Colorado is an equal opportunity employer committed to building inclusive, innovative work environments with employees who reflect our communities and enthusiastically serve them. Therefore, in all aspects of the employment process, we provide employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, medical condition related to pregnancy, creed, ancestry, national origin, marital status, genetic information, or military status (with preference given to military veterans), or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.ADAAA Accommodations: DORA is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, our agency will assist individuals who have a disability with any reasonable accommodation requests related to employment, including completing the application process, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, participating in the employee selection process, and/or to perform essential job functions where the requested accommodation does not impose an undue hardship. Title: Director of Operations
Description: Director of Operations Job DescriptionPosition Title: Director of OperationsReports To: CEOGeneral Description:The Director of Operations manages and optimizes all tactical and operational functions of the business, including but not limited to financials, inventory control, and compliance.The primary responsibilities of the Director of Operations include:Purchasing and Run RatesManage purchasing driven by run rates on two-week cycles.Maintain relationships with existing vendors.Negotiate pricing to deliver a product balance with a strong GPM.Software, Security, and ComplianceAll IT; from managing and updating Metrc and Flowhub to oversite of the DVR systems.Install and manage all POS software.Remain current on State and City rules and regulations.BookkeepingReconcile cash & debit positions and input daily sales receipts in QuickBooks.Generate financial reports as needed for compliance and planning purposes.Reconcile monthly bank statements to reflect the current AP/AR position.Inventory ControlOversee all inventory cycle counts during the week.Adjust Flowhub and Metrc to match physical inventory.Facilitate product transfers to, from, and in-between stores.PersonnelDesign and communicate product selling points to sales associates.Tutor sales associates on features and benefits of products.Provide product guidance to the store manager.Monitor efficacy of selling points and restructure as needed.New Business DevelopmentIdentify new vendors/partners.Take lead on operational inputs of strategic initiatives.A successful candidate will have:A minimum of a BA in economics, analytics, or business. An MBA or Advanced Degree that highlights applied math is preferred.Mastery of the Microsoft Suite, Google Docs, and the ability to build complex formulas in Excel/Google Sheets is mandatory.Must be available minimum 40 hours/week, or as long as necessary to complete schedule-driven initiatives.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $65,000.00 /yearExperience:supervisory: 5 years (Required)strong leadership skills: 5 years (Required)budgeting: 3 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Location:Boulder, CO 80301 (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Additional Compensation:BonusesBenefits:Health insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:No

Title: Digital Communications Manager
Description: Title: Digital Communications ManagerPurpose: Combines communications, public relations, digital marketing, and social media management skills to architect and enhance the potato industry_Ñés mission to strengthen the demand for U.S. potatoes via media relations, digital and online marketing, and social media presence. Includes interacting with users, promoting nutrition and usage-focused content, and expanding opportunities to build and enhance the positive image and the reputation of U.S. potatoes and the U.S. potato industry. Works effectively and responsively with leadership, marketing, marketing agencies, and consultants to create innovative campaigns, education, and engagement in key online conversations to promote the nutritional profile of the potato, stimulate usage, and protect the reputation of U.S. potatoes and the potato industry.Essential job duties and responsibilities:ë Creates public relations, digital marketing, and social media campaign and strategies, including budget planning, content ideation, and implementation schedules.ë Ensures brand consistency in PR, marketing, and social media messages.ë Ensures all content is factual, accurate, and meets USDA guidelines.ë Supports the development, implementation and effectiveness of the annual social media plan that meets and is approved by USDA.ë Creates, curates, and manages all published content (images, video, written and audio/podcast, etc.).ë Establishes and maintains relationships with consumers, the community, and public interest groups by writing press releases and other communications.ë Responds to requests for information.ë Updates and maintains web content.ë Provides training and guidance on social media implementation best practices and strategies to staff and agency partners as needed.ë Collects data on social media and website interactions and visits while consistently monitoring online conversations/topics. Turns data into comprehensive reports with supporting recommendations to improve future marketing and engagement strategies and campaigns. Reports progress to management regularly.ë Grows and expands company social media presence into new social media platforms as appropriate, plus increases presence on existing platforms.ë Researches and monitors the activity of industry members, as well as other commodity groups.ë Creates and distributes engaging written or graphic content in the form of e-newsletters, web pages, blog content, and social media messages.Job Requirements- Degree in journalism, public relations, marketing, communications, or a related field- Minimum of seven years of experience with public relations, marketing and/or social media management- Extensive experience creating content, copywriting, graphic design, web design and management- Experience collecting and analyzing user data on social media and web properties to provide actionable insights to leadership and program managers- Strong creative thinking skills- Exceptional interpersonal, verbal, and written communications skills- Professional knowledge of, and experience with, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Pinterest- Ability to engage followers on social media and use different engagement strategies including search engine optimization, and demonstrated ability to adjust when needed to align with strategic program and algorithm changes- Demonstrated experience using keywords and hashtags effectively to increase engagement- Experience creating professional videos and graphics and using editing tools _ÑÐ video production and software needs to design and develop creative assets to be determined in collaboration with manager- Experience with media reporting and analysis tools available within the social media platforms, as well as Google analytics and/or third-party measurement software- Ability to work collaboratively and cooperatively with diverse constituency throughout the organization- Detail oriented- Strong organizational skills- Self-motivated and directed- Ability to use creative problem-solving skills- Flexible schedule to accommodate the 24/7/365 nature of social mediaNOTE: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with the job.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $85,000.00 to $110,000.00 /yearExperience:digital communications: 3 years (Preferred)marketing: 3 years (Preferred)Benefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceRetirement planPaid time offFlexible scheduleParental leaveSchedule:OtherBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time Title: CBD/Hemp National Sales Account Executive
Description: National Account ExecutiveElixinol is a Colorado based CBD company seeking the best and the brightest employees in the industry; with deep roots in the hemp industry, Elixinol has been manufacturing and providing the highest-quality CBD hemp extracts in the world for over three decades. We are currently growing and seeking high quality, highly motivated individuals to join our team.Are you an entrepreneurial sales leader who likes to be pointed in the right direction then let loose to conquer a market? Are you passionate about plant-based wellness solutions and excited about the potential for the Cannabis/Hemp plant? Are you connected to buyers, decision-makers or business leaders in national retail markets from grocery stores to convenience stores and everything in between? If this is you, they you may be our next Regional Sales Manager for National Accounts!Elixinol is seeking sales hunters with account management skills in charge of all sales activities for Retail customers for multiple regions of the United State! This position will be responsible for achieving defined top-line sales and managing promotional spending within annual budgets. The goals will be challenging but the landscape is wide open for the taking _ÑÐ only go-getters with a strong work ethic and unparalleled drive for success need apply!Elixinol is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.RESPONSIBILITIES:Meet or exceed monthly/quarterly/annual sales goals.Manage development and execution of the Region's sales objectivesIdentify and build a pipeline of potential new customers, initiate and manage prospects through the sales pipeline, and then close these opportunitiesSeek new opportunities to increase brand exposure and volume/shareMonitor competition by gathering current information on products, pricing and positioning.Identify new distribution opportunities and build partnerships that maximize profitable share and volume through distribution, visibility and serviceMonitor competition by gathering current information on pricing and productsDevelop and execute upon sales forecastUnderstands the competitive landscape and Elixinol's unique value propositionProvide leadership in the day-to-day operations of the Region and brokers, while maintaining focus on the company's strategic goalsWork with accounts to ensure all visual guidelines are held and negotiate for better space and location wherever possible.Develop and maintain business relationships within the region _ÑÐ to include customers and internal cross functional team membersEXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:8+ years of experience in, supplements, CPG, conventional & natural grocery or HBA sales requiredExperience in start-ups, launching new and challenging brands requiredExperience selling CBD and related products preferredDemonstrated success managing existing relationships and developing new partnerships with Retail customers and distributors in an assigned regionProficiency in business planning and all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account management and developmentDemonstrated success in sales goal attainment within a defined regionBachelor's degree or equivalent experience requiredESSENTIAL SKILLS:Networking and relationship buildingData analytics, critical thinking and strategic decision makingForecasting, goal setting and action planningConsultative selling and new business developmentDetail orientation and exceptional organizational skillsExceptional written and oral communication/presentation skillsSelf-motivation, "can do" attitude, sense of urgency for delivering resultsStrong negotiating skillsVersatility, flexibility and the ability to adapt quickly to changeMicrosoft Office 365 expertise; Dynamics Business Central experience preferredJob Type: Full-timePrimary Location: Westminster, COTravel: Up to 50%; in assigned region _ÑÐ Valid driver's license and clean driving record requiredSalary: $45,000 - $65,000 Base DOE + commissionBenefits: Our employees receive medical, dental, and leave benefits at highly competitive rates, 10 paid holidays and 3 weeks of PTO as part of our robust benefits package. We have a fun, engaged and brilliant team of leaders, and we are looking for someone who complements our culture and brings passion and a positive attitude to our dynamic team!

Title: PURCHASING AGENT I
Description: Department InformationWelcome to the Auraria Higher Education Center (AHEC) located in the Platte River Valley in downtown Denver. AHEC is the service provider for 43,000 students and approximately 5000 faculty and staff working at and attending the Community College of Denver, Metropolitan State University of Denver and the University of Colorado Denver. Learn more about us through this link: Auraria Higher Education CenterAuraria employees enjoy an excellent benefits package which includes paid vacation, holidays and sick leave, discounted RTD Eco-Pass, BenefitHub (medical, dental, disability, life), and outstanding retirement plan. Learn more through this link: Benefits Package.So, if you're interested in a great job working alongside great people, this may be the opportunity for which you've been waiting.Description of JobThis job announcement will close after receiving 50 applications, or on the scheduled closing date, whichever occurs first.This work unit exists to procure goods and services for the Auraria Higher Education Center (AHEC) using applicable laws, rules, regulations, policies and professional practices.The purchasing agent I is part of the central procurement office of AHEC and is a member of a procurement team, and is responsible for reviewing requisitions for either preparation of purchase orders, bids and/or price agreements. Under direct supervision and detailed instruction by Director (or other higher level staff) is responsible for:analyzing requests for materials, supplies, equipment and servicesrecommending alternate specifications and advise on matters of availabilityreviewing for items covered by State price agreements, campus agreements, or other cooperative agreementsanalyzing to determine which bid methods can be used to spend resources more efficiently and effectivelydetermining the method of procurement, i.e., documented quote, sealed bid, or whether sole source, emergency, or special circumstances exist.Helping to execute audit programs for small dollar purchasesreviewing vendors insurance certificates following State insurance requirementslearning the development, solicitation, analytics, evaluation, and award of small dollar documented quotes (DQs), which includes developing, revising, and/or reviewing the proper specifications, appropriate terms and conditions, vendor solicitation and award (via internet bids systems) to obtain maximum competition.learning award process of DQs which will be in accordance with criteria set forth in solicitation to the appropriate winning bidder/s.attending pre-solicitation meetings between users and bidders, pre-bid conferences, and quote openings.Position operates independently and determines which purchasing agent to assign purchase requisitions (PRs) to by reviewing old requests, workloads, etc. Position also independently reviews the PRs for missing information and may contact sender for additional information, or additional approvals.Position maintains Procurement workflows within Microix procurement tracking software by adding accounting codes, employees, approval levels, troubleshooting, etc. Reviews W-9s and vendor documentation for input into Abila MIP. Creates spreadsheets and electronic files, filing, mailing/courier, emailing, copying, etc.Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal RightsThis job announcement will close after receiving 50 applications, or on the scheduled closing date, whichever occurs first.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in Purchasing, Procurement/acquisition, Contracts Management, Business Administration, or a similar directly related field of study.Substitution:Professional work experience in a position where your primary work responsibilities were as a functioning contributor to a purchasing/procurement department in a direct purchasing/procurement, or purchasing/procurement support role, will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: (candidates demonstrating the following will be given preference)Proficiency with MS Word and MS ExcelExperience with State price agreements, campus agreements, or other cooperative agreementsExperience reviewing PRs for proper information and approvalsExperience in auditing purchasing programsExperience with Microix purchasing softwareExperience with Abila MIP accounting softwareSupplemental InformationNotice of Appeal RightsIf you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.Applicant Checklist & Minimum QualificationsE-mail AddressAll correspondence regarding your status in the selection/examination process will be conducted by email.Applicant ChecklistWe request that you include the following in your application:Cover Letter detailing how your experience & education meet minimum and preferred qualificationsCollege Transcripts when requested, or when using education to meet minimum qualificationsOnly applications submitted by the closing date for this announcement will be given consideration.Minimum QualificationsYour application as submitted is used to determine if you meet Minimum Qualifications. Please read the Minimum Qualifications and ensure that information in your application "draws correlations" to the Minimum Qualifications. Human Resources Analysts will not infer that you meet the Minimum Qualifications if information isn't detailed in your application.*Years of experience will be expressed in terms of full-time equivalent service with full-time workload equal to one (1) Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) year. No more than 1.00 FTE year may be credited in any twelve (12) month period. Positions working 40 hours or less per week will be pro-rated (30 hrs/wk=0.75 FTE=9 mos credit; 20 hrs/wk=0.5 FTE=6 mos credit; 10 hrs/wk=0.25 FTE=3 mos credit.)*Commitment to Equity, Diversity and InclusionThe State of Colorado believes that equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and we encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply. The State of Colorado is an equal opportunity employer committed to building inclusive, innovative work environments with employees who reflect our communities and enthusiastically serve them. Therefore, in all aspects of the employment process, we provide employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, medical condition related to pregnancy, creed, ancestry, national origin, marital status, genetic information, or military status (with preference given to military veterans), or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.Auraria Higher Education Center (AHEC) is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, our agency will assist individuals who have a disability with any reasonable accommodation requests related to employment, including completing the application process, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, participating in the employee selection process, and/or to perform essential job functions where the requested accommodation does not impose an undue hardship. If you have a disability and require reasonable accommodation to ensure you have a positive experience applying or interviewing for this position, please direct your inquiries to Jim Gamelin, ADAAA Staffing Coordinator for the Auraria Higher Education Center, at jim.gamelin@ahec.edu or call 303-556-6465.

Title: Sales Engineer - Workforce Management
Description: Company Overview:Guided by a mission to help, ABILITY, an Inovalon company, is a leading information technology company helping healthcare providers and payers simplify administrative and clinical complexity by enabling data-driven improvements in healthcare. Through specialized, easy-to-use applications and data analytics that work together, customers of all types and sizes across the continuum of care _ÑÐ rely on ABILITY to help optimize reimbursement, care quality and staffing. To learn more please visit www.abilitynetwork.com or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube and Facebook.Job Purpose:The Sales Engineer II will function as the primary technical resource and trainer for the sales force. They are the key technical advisor and product advocate for ABILITY platforms and services. Must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. Function as the SME (Subject Matter Expert) to support sales productivity and opportunity flow. The SME collaborates with sales, engineering, and product management to ensure proposed opportunities include technical capabilities that accurately address customer needs. This position will also provide Sales Engineering support for a set of core products and services, but may have responsibility for getting cross-trained on other designated ABILITY products and will act as the point person for all new hire, release and refresher training content, delivery and storage/access.Responsibilities:Work in collaboration with the sales person, proactively scopes the technical solution required to address customer requirements, assesses customers_Ñé met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and present the greatest strengths of ABILITY.Coordinate closely with internal sales, sales support, and service resources to align solution design customers_Ñé business requirementsAct as the point person for all new hire, release and refresher Sales training. Develops training materials. Provides training, coaching and professional development, aligned with student_Ñés relational style, to sales team(s) in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.Participate on sales calls to guide clients and advise prospects on how to best deploy ABILITY products and services in their organizationsBe able to assist in the troubleshooting of integration issues and implementation issues.Be knowledgeable about ABILITY products and services and best practices to help guide customers on how ABILITY services can address their business needs in their workflowParticipate and help drive the appropriate product, sales, and procedural training and certification to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position including intermediate products such as SECUREPAY and others.As needed, works directly with Marketing on all designated product Webinars and related sales campaigns, tradeshows and large group presentationsCollaborates with Product Management and other key stakeholders on product launch and all product releases to insure sales readiness with minimal supervisionTest all product releases in the sales demo system using engineering scripts as well as investigating logical ancillary product capabilities prior to release and alert Sales and Product Management of any potential risksFor assigned products, develop and deliver sales messaging including vision prompters, ideal customer profile, buying committee map, cost versus benefit analysis and other sales tools independently.Train sales team on assigned products and other designated products on product and sales messaging, product features, and product functionality independently.Develop certification checklists, scenarios and processes to implement and track all designated product demo certificationsIn partnership with sales leadership, inspect calls and determine needed refresher courses, mini workshops, or other training formats (i.e. computer based training modules for Discover LMS) independently.Partner with the Customer Operations trainer to ensure that all Sales, Support, Implementation, Account Management, and Success staff are appropriately trained to support the designated products. Provide improvement proposals to Customer Operations training.Respond effectively to RFPs/ RFIs. Develop processes, document/archive responses etc. to more efficiently respond.Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by managementAdditional duties and responsibilities as requiredMust comply with all company policies and proceduresMinimum Requirements:Bachelor_Ñés Degree (or commensurate experience of four or more years in a Workforce Management sales engineer, subject matter expert or user role)Three or more years of experience as an in-Patient Acute/Post-Acute/Behavioral HealthWorkforce Management systems user, sales, sales enablement or support personThree or more years in a customer facing sales or support role.Preferred Capabilities:Working knowledge of SPIN sales methodology, ability to develop financial and analytical tools such as Cost Benefit Analysis calculator.Familiar with typical Healthcare Workforce Management customer functions, workflows, terminology and challenges.Previous experience in sales enablement for a SaaS Healthcare Workforce Management companyOther:Self-motivated with strong organizational/prioritization skills and ability to multi-task with close attention to detail. Takes initiative to find improvement opportunities and develops better ways to complete tasks.Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Presents self effectively and professionally in a variety of environments including C-level customer or partner onsite meetings.Ability to work as part of a team to diagnose business problems in complex selling environmentsExcellent customer service and communication skills, including the ability to assess problems and communicate solutions.Ability to work in a fast-paced environmentAn analytical mind that can dig into client requirementsCultivates relationships with a broad range of functional stakeholders, understanding their perspectives and agendas. Able to work with and influence other departments, at all levels, to complete team projects taking into consideration the work styles of other team members.Regularly works with enterprise customers and or significant partners.Employs a mix of tactical and strategic approaches depending on the issue and circumstance.Able to discern and adjust approach to match customer or other audience learning and business style.ABILITY is headquartered in Minneapolis with principal offices in Tampa and Boston.We are committed to make ABILITY a great place to do great work, growing to benefit customers and employees alike.In the spirit of this commitment, we live by the following values:Help others: We are here to help - our customers and each other.Make it better: We continually improve and innovate to offer practical solutions.Do the right thing, always: We set and meet high standards in all that we do.Deliver extraordinary results together: We accelerate growth and achieve extraordinary results as a team.Travel: 20-40%Ability to travel nationally for tradeshows and/or customer site visitsJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $85,000.00 /yearExperience:Customer facing sales/support: 3 years (Preferred)Healthcare: 3 years (Preferred)Workforce Management: 3 years (Preferred)Sales Engineer: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Additional Compensation:TipsCommissionWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementPaid Training:YesSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: DevOps Developer
Description: Our Federal Civilian Government client is responsible for critical Federal wide data and IT platform with a portfolio of existing cloud hosted software applications (Custom, CMS, Metadata Registries, LAMP and MEAN Apps, NoSQL Registry, Open Source Geospatial, ArcGIS Online) and services (MicroServices, Web Services, OGC Web Services) on AWS cloud environment (ELB, EC2, CodeDeploy, Docker) to help in discovery, mapping, analytics, and metadata management. Updating Software Stack for WordPress, NodeJS, Unix images; AWS Configuration Management; Experience with building CI/CD pipelines for CodeBuild; RDS Management of MongoDB Backup/Restore; Design for Data Pipeline and Graph Database ConceptsMaintain AWS environment including RDS Management of ElasticSearch Backup/Restore; Experience in AWS DocumentDB; Management of WordPress; NodeJS Experience; Understanding of OAuthJob Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field min. educationReal world experience, not project Bootcamp experience;Expert in DevOps in the following technologies: AWS (DevOps, Lambdas, DynamoDB, EC2, IAM, Elastic Beanstalk, SES, S3), REST (preferred Express REST Server), MicroServices (NodeJS 10.x), NoSQL (preferred MongoDB), ID integration (Oauth), and Web MC JS Frameworks (MEAN, Angular 1.x & 8.x, LAMP),Support Web App Developers in ES6 Coding Style, Typescript, Angular, Developing using Docker Images (Not creating Docker Images); Able to write Unit Tests for backend, Developing in MongoDB, and CSS DevelopmentBonus - Understands Semantic Web or RDF, Elastic Search Query Syntax, WordPress Experience, S3Git Experience, Experience in Leaflet, Geospatial FormatsTeam experience using Agile, GIT, JIRAJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $120,000.00 to $140,000.00 /yearExperience:aws: 1 year (Preferred)strong: 1 year (Preferred)software development: 1 year (Preferred)devops, system admin: 1 year (Preferred)devops: 1 year (Preferred)Benefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekends requiredHolidays requiredDay shiftNight shiftOvernight shiftWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Inside Sales & Customer Service (Hemp/CBD)
Description: Inside Sales & Customer Service RepresentativeElixinol is a Colorado based CBD company seeking the best and the brightest employees in the industry; with deep roots in the hemp industry, Elixinol has been manufacturing and providing the highest-quality CBD hemp extracts in the world for over three decades. We are currently growing and seeking high quality, highly motivated individuals to join our team.Are you passionate about plant-based wellness solutions and excited about the potential for the Cannabis/Hemp plant? Are you an outgoing customer advocate with a penchant for problem solving and a knack for consultative selling? Do you enjoy interacting with customers and helping guide them to a product that will benefit their unique needs? If so, then you may be a perfect fit for this Inside Sales & Customer Service Representative role at Elixinol!Elixinol is seeking a solution minded, customer-focused sales professional who will support customers in both resolving product or ordering issues as well as help them find new CBD products to meet their needs. The Inside Sales & Customer Service Representative will balance their time between supporting customers and selling products; responding to in-bound customer service calls and leveraging their sales skills to upsell existing customers as well.Elixinol is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.RESPONSIBILITIESEstablish Subject Matter Expertise on all Elixinol productsRespond to inbound customer calls spanning general product questions to issues regarding the ordering, fulfillment or use of Elixinol productsTroubleshoot customer issues and provide one-call resolution; tracking and escalating recurring issues and common solutions to team leadershipConsistently deliver world class customer serviceDrive top line revenue through nurturing and upselling existing small business clients, overcoming objections and closing salesConduct regular business meetings via phone with active accountsAchieve a series of core metrics, including outbound call volume, inbound call handle time and call qualityAchieve & surpass monthly quotaREQUIREMENTS3-5 years in customer service and/or inside sales2+ years of experience in Cannabis, Health and Wellness, Nutraceuticals or other consumable product sales or customer serviceExperience with consumer packaged goods (CPG) preferredHigh School Diploma requiredBachelor's Degree or relevant work experience preferredDemonstrated ability to meet and exceed assigned sales objectivesESSENTIAL SKILLSNetworking, relationship building and creative problem solvingData analytics and critical thinkingDetail orientation and exceptional organizational skillsAbility to track common issues, document proven solutions and provide recommendations to senior leadersExceptional written and oral communication abilitySelf-motivation, "can do" attitude, sense of urgency for delivering resultsStrong negotiating skillsVersatility, flexibility and the ability to adapt quickly to changeProficiency with CRM ToolsMicrosoft Office 365 expertise; Dynamics Business Central experience preferredJob Type: Full-timePrimary Location: Westminster, COTravel: Minimal travel required, less than 10%Salary: DOE _ÑÐ Base plus variable incentiveBenefits: Our employees receive medical, dental, and leave benefits at highly competitive rates, 10 paid holidays and 3 weeks of PTO as part of our robust benefits package. We have a fun, engaged and brilliant team of leaders, and we are looking for someone who complements our culture and brings passion and a positive attitude to our dynamic team!
