Title: Director Advanced Analytics
Description: Director, Advanced AnalyticsInsuranceHartford, CT$155,000 - $175,000Do you want to join one of the biggest and most highly regarded Insurance companies in the US? A rapidly growing analytics center of excellence who are disrupting the way they approach the market, having partnerships with some of the biggest companies worldwide are looking for Advanced Analytics/Data Science Managers with strong backgrounds in predictive modelling in R/Python, as well as clinical or health care to join their team in CT. If you are statistically savvy in SQL, Python and R, with the ability to build advanced predictive models such as survival, neural networks and decision tress, as well have team management capabilities, then this could be the next step in your career.THE ROLE:As a Director, Advanced Analytics you will be a core part of the analytics center of excellence, proactively involved in managing a wide variety of customer focused projects for this $billion brand, performing highly statistical analysis in Python, R and SQL to understand how effective each product is for the business to optimize marketing spend, demographic coverage, product offering and health issues, related to lifestyle and spend. You will manage/mentor a team of data scientists, but be both coach and player, being hands on in building the advanced predictive models, as well as training and developing their statistical capabilities. Your main responsibilities will include:Understanding all of the company's current product offerings, building advanced models, such as neural networks, decision trees, regressions in R and Python to automate the health product offering across different demographics and predict the impacts on health to the provider.Making recommendations on how to reduce claims, risk strategies and new product offerings to meet market demand, as well as areas of further exploration, providing thought leadership and solutionsWorking with teams across the business including Marketing, Product Sales and BI teams, as well as the wider Data Science and Engineering teams to ensure that the quality of the data and models are of the highest standardDelivering insights and recommendations to diverse Title: Business Development Representative
Description: Job Title: Business Development Representative (BDR)Department: SalesReports to: Account ExecutiveCompany SummarySigga is a SAP certified global software company providing scalable, out-of-the box Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) solutions across industry sectors. Our EAM solutions enable our clientsäó» digital transformation initiatives to improve processes, including analytics, mobility and IIoT. For almost 20 years, we have been helping SAP customers achieve better results in their plant maintenance workflows by increasing profitability, productivity (nearly 20%), maximizing efficiency, and reducing costs. One of the ways we do this is by eliminating paper-intensive processes for submitting work orders and simplifying the planning and scheduling of maintenance work. This significantly improves the accuracy of data input from the field and seamlessly syncs with SAP PM. As part of an end-to-end EAM solution-set, Siggaäó»s Mobile EAM solution integrates with SAP Plant Maintenance, providing a better, more productive and intuitive user experience for maintenance users. This enables users to conveniently and more effectively do their work from a smartphone or tablet.Job SummaryThe BDR is responsible for identifying and convert leads to qualified opportunities. That includes cold calling, handling of inbound leads, nurturing, establishing relationships with prospective customers, hosting discovery calls and demo, among other activities, like supporting the Account Executive throughout the entire sales cycle. BDR will also present monthly results to the head of sales and be part of regular internal meetings.Essential Functions:Create opportunities and manage leads effectively based on existing sales process instructions.Be able to determine pain points of prospects and effectively present the value proposition via voice, email, during a demonstration of our solution over the web, or in person.Keep efficient tracking of all leads and opportunities as well as follow-up calls to ensure that priority items are touched quickly and regularly, and all accounts are kept up-to-date.Effectively partner with the company's Account Executives to target high-value prospects and transition leads into new opportunities.Provide effective feedback to management regarding both successful and unsuccessful leads, calls, and potential clients industries.Use HubSpot CRM to track activity, send emails, and manage opportunities.Desired Qualifications:Excellent verbal and written communication skills (i.e., comfortable and confident interacting with contacts at all levels of the organization).Excellent and enthusiastic telephone manner.Technically proficient (i.e., working knowledge of standard office applications).Highly organized (i.e., ability to work through a list and document results in a spreadsheet or database).Self-motivated person, being able to handle ups and downs of the regular BDR routineEducation:Bacheloräó»s DegreeExperience1 year of experience in a similar role in the software industryCustomer-focused, results-driven with excellent interpersonal skillsPast experience in working with a company that sells to SAP companies is a plus.Ambition to grow and build a career in sales

Title: Telephone Sales
Description: Company descriptionMillions of people are willing to anonymously share information about their health in order to advance medical research. Millions of people are eager to participate in a clinical trial in order to access cutting edge drugs, treatments, surgeries, and therapies. World Health Survey matches every-day people with health researchers and with clinical trials as well as doing its own surveys and analytics with the data. This company is a startup founded by a guy who has successfully founded, built, and sold 4 internet companies.Job descriptionContract is to contact clinical trial recruitment companies and secure contracts on a pay per success basis for participants to clinical trials. Applicant must be very experienced and knowledgeable about clinical trial recruitment. Monthly fee plus good commission.Industry: PharmaceuticalsBenefits:Flexible working hoursWork from home opportunitiesReference ID: 105Contract length: 12 monthsPart-time hours: 20 per weekJob Types: Part-time, Contract, CommissionSalary: $20.00 /hourWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Remote Sales Representative
Description: We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Executive to bring on new clients through a consultative sales approach. This is a role for a proven sales leader that has strong presentation, relationship building and closing skills. You will be required to impress potential clients through a detailed analysis of their current digital presence and articulate the key value points of the firm including guarantees and proven results.Dot Com Media is an established digital marketing and consulting firm. We provide SEO, Paid media, Reputation Management, Social media, Mobile and Video marketing services nationally. We value innovation and collaboration that will continue to provide outstanding results and service to new and existing clients looking to increase their own client acquisition.Responsibilities:- Prospecting and follow-ups to nurture relationships and move opportunities through the sales stages.- Articulate service specifics, value points and results while analyzing current challenges.- Negotiate contract specifics and pricing- Manage client relationships- Review of reporting and analytics, making sure your client understands the value and is receiving desired results.- Maintain detailed lead and client records within CRM.- Meet target KPI's monthly and quarterly.- Collaborate with other departments and provide status updates to management.Desired Experience & Skills:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent- Prior experience in a technical consultative and strategic sales in marketing or interactive media a plus.- Familiarity with marketing, SEO, SEM or Paid media.- Excellent relationship building skills.- Superb interpersonal communication skills, especially where complex technical information must be conveyed.- Ability to communicate with Executives and Professionals in a polished and profession demeanor.- Well organized with a knack for time management.- Motivated and ambitiousCommission based compensation structureGenerous BonusesResidualsPerksPlease submit your resume for consideration.Job Types: Contract, CommissionSalary: $65,000.00 to $110,000.00 /yearExperience:Sales: 3 years (Preferred)B2B Sales: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Associate (Preferred)Application Question:Are you familiar with digital marketing?Additional Compensation:CommissionWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:NoneWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Sr. Pricing Analyst [SQL or Tableau Req'd] for a Nationwide...
Description: SENIOR PRICING ANALYST JOB DESCRIPTIONOur client is a reputable nationwide Real Estate company, a member of the SP 500 and FT Global 500. They are stable and continuing to hire despite the impact of COVID19; however, will be a lot more selective so PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE REQUIREMENTSPRIOR TO APPLYING.They are looking for a Senior Pricing Analyst to work out of our Corporate Office in Glendale, CA. The Senior Analyst will primarily support our Revenue Management and Marketing teams by using their analytical skills to gather, validate, and implement pricing strategies based on performance data. In addition will provide managerial reporting and trends for revenue performance. The position works closely with our team of internal analysts, external business partners, and our information technology group. The primary goal is to help us improve the revenue generating effectiveness of our consumer by translating complex and massive data sets into actionable insights and recommendations for senior management.Scope of Responsibilities:The primary duty is assessing data from a variety of sources and using it to derive insights into pricing strategies and market trends. Uses a number of quantitative and qualitative methods to analyze competitor pricing, assess market trends, and track customer engagement in order to gain a complete picture of effective pricing strategies for the company.Forecast Revenue and develop models to determine market and customer trends.Use a variety of statistical modeling methods to prepare reports that show the potential impact of various pricing strategies.Work with sales and marketing personnel to develop and enact competitive pricing strategies.Monitor and test market trends within the industry for potential improvement in sales and profitability.Develop pricing tools that allows for quick responses to changing market needs and trends.Present findings to senior management on various pricing strategies and recommendation for actionable strategies and techniques to drive sales and enhance marketing efforts.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors Degree in Business, Business Analytics or Computer Science is required.3+ years prior business analytics and data analysis experienceAbility to generate ad-hoc data extracts from various databases using Structured Query Language (SQL)Ability to work efficiently under pressure, accurately meet deadlines, present a professional demeanor and work well independently is essentialExperience with one or more of the following tools/programs/languages:SQL and Excel proficientTableau, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Google BigQueryScheduling/Query tools such as SQL Server Management StudioSuperior understanding of SQL and Database ModelingAdvanced skills in Microsoft ExcelDetailed oriented and organizedSelf-starter with strong multi-tasking skills

Title: Temporary Assembly Team Member (AM Shift)
Description: As the impacts of Covid-19 rapidly evolve, we want to keep you up to date on how Revolution Foods is continuing to support our communities and families in this time of need operating as an _ÑÒessential business_Ñ. Every day brings new partnerships and collaborations to ensure no one goes hungry during this pandemic.Call to Action!We are looking for reliable, hardworking team members who provide excellent customer service in all they do. Working as part of a team, our Production Associates primarily assists with the preparation, assembly, and packaging of thousands of meals per day. Responsibilities also include loading, labeling, stacking, sorting, and preparing products for shipping.If this is you, apply with us today!Qualifications:Entry-level position. Previous experience in a fast-paced fresh food handling environment is preferred.Experience working in a time-sensitive environment.Ability to routinely work in a chilled, damp, factory environment of around 38 degrees Fahrenheit.Ability to physically perform requirements of the job includes, but is not limited to, standing for extended periods of time, bending, twisting, hand and arm motions, and lifting up to 50 pounds unassisted.Works well with others and participates as part of a team to achieve results.Committed to the Revolution Foods mission that all children and our community at large will have access to nutritious, tasty food to support the development and maintenance of healthy minds and bodies.Role Specifics:This is a temporary role. The assignment could last up to 90 days, with the potential to be shortened or extended, dependent on business needs.This is an hourly, entry-level role starting at $13/hr.Hours worked per week are 40 hours, with potential for overtimeThe shift days for this role would fall between Sunday through Thursday.The shift hours for this role would fall between 8am to 5pm.There might be potential openings for swing shifts.Notice At Collection.For Applicants Residing In California:Revolution Foods, Inc. Our team is made up of talented, entrepreneurial spirited individuals who are driven by a shared mission. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and creating social impact while delivering kid-inspired, chef-crafted food across the nation. Revolution Foods supports a work environment that is challenging and invigorating. In return, we provide a competitive compensation and benefits package, encouraging talent development, empowerment and diversity.

Title: Director of Marketing ($110,000-$125,000)
Description: JOB TITLE:Director, MarketingDEPARTMENT:MarketingFLSA:ExemptLOCATION:HollywoodGRADE:15First Entertainment is looking for a seasoned and skilled Director of Marketing to oversee the daily operational needs of the Marketing Department at the direction of the CMO. This includes working with: Lending, Digital, Business Banking, Real Estate, Accounting, Operations/Payments, and other departments as needed. This person serves as the business lead (number 2) of the marketing department. This requires the candidate to take meetings on CMO's behalf and serve as a leader to various departments on Marketing needs.He/she is a behind the scenes operational savant. This person knows how to work collaboratively between multiple departments on tasks that vary from product promotion, analytics, keeper of the marketing calendar, and responsible for all budget, website trafficking, Marketo, and performance tracking. This role requires a detail oriented candidate. This right fit will be a master multi-tasker.The Director of Marketing is tasked with optimizing the Chief Marketing Officer's vision for First Entertainment's Marketing organization. This candidate will help streamline key activities, provide tactical and operational support, and carryout the CMO's agenda throughout the company. This role reports directly to the CMO and interfaces with various business units and leaders to ensure effective communication and delivery.The successful candidate will have a minimum of five to eight years of professional experience in operational and support roles for senior executives including the proven ability to interact with and influence senior leaders in the organization.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES% Time30%30%20%20%The sole operational leader of Marketing Department. Responsible for the core First Entertainment operational needs that come through the Marketing Department. Title: Marketing Manager ($77,000 - $97,000)
Description: JOB TITLE:Marketing ManagerDEPARTMENT:MarketingFLSA:ExemptLOCATION:HollywoodGRADE:13BASIC FUNCTIONUnder limited supervision and in support of the Credit Union's Brand, Key Results, Strategic Initiatives, and Cultural Beliefs, this role is responsible for overseeing the public promotion of Credit Union content, membership, and products. This role is responsible for managing the daily operations of the Marketing Department and sustaining the continuity, proliferation, and well-being of the First Entertainment Brand.The Marketing Manager has an entrepreneurial spirit, and produces a broad range of communication materials and performs projects as assigned by the Director of Marketing. This role provides support to all Marketing Department activities, and assists in all facets of executing the marketing plan.Oversees the responsibilities of the Graphic Designer and Marketing Coordinator, as well as various freelancers and vendors.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES (% Time)25%Collaborates with stakeholders and vendor partners to develop, produce, and implement concepts across web, email, social media (paid & organic), video, digital advertising, print, signage, and emerging platforms (e.g. campaigns, product launches, etc.). Manages yearly content calendar to keep track of all major concepts and projects. Provides departmental guidance, keeps track of goal-setting, and leads appropriate team members on projects and goals.15%Manages email and direct mail marketing campaigns, including template design, A/B testing and scheduling, proofing, calls-to-action, and provides accurate tracking metrics. Oversees database segmentation to target audiences accurately.15%Manages web design and content including regulatory & ADA compliance, SEO optimization, quality control, and provides accurate tracking metrics.10%Collaborates with team members to leverage metrics and best practices to design media buying and targeting strategies that are optimized for efficiency and conversions. Also responsible for monitoring and maintaining media buy budget.10%Graphic design, videography & post production, event photography, copy writing, and social media management (paid & organic) as needed.10%Manages assigned vendor relationships, communications, quality control, and deliveries. Performs vendor evaluation and due diligence reviews.5%Explores new marketing channels and techniques and recommends professional development tracks for self and supervised staff. Makes recommendations on Marketing plans, budgets, staffing, Brand, and strategies.5%Keeps manager updated and informed of goal progress, prioritization, significant issues, and resource availability. Makes recommendations to manager or assists in development of improved processes. Ensures department is equipped to function in a smooth, professional, and self-sufficient manner.5%Assists in organizing special events, such as the annual meeting, and other related events as needed.REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS AND CONTACTSSupervisor:Director of MarketingSupervision Received:Limited supervisionSupervisory Authority:Supervises Graphic Designer and Marketing Coordinator, as well as various freelancers and vendors.Contacts:Members, potential members, Credit Union employees, various vendors, and freelancers through in-person, telephone and electronic communication.SPECIAL ACCOUNTABILITY1. Facilitate, attend, and participate in meetings and assigned training sessions.4. Meet and/or exceed individual goals and objectives as established by the Credit Union.5. Support the pursuit of Key Results and Strategic Initiatives as established by the Credit Union.6. Support the Brand and Cultural Beliefs of the Credit Union.7. Adheres to policies, procedures, compliance, safety, and security as they relate to the job and work assignments.8. Has the authority to make independent choices, free from immediate direction or supervision and with respect to matters of significance.9. Regularly and directly assists an employee in an executive capacity.QUALIFICATIONSEducation:College graduate or equivalent work experience. Degree in marketing or related field desirable.Experience:Minimum five (5) years of experience in marketing or related field preferred.Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Smartsheet, SiteImprove, Microsoft Office, Constant Contact, WordPress, Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook (Blueprint Certified preferred), Twitter, Yelp, and others as required.Ability to handle numerous projects simultaneously.Advanced understanding of marketing concepts and delivery channels including web, direct mail, email, search and display, and social media.Previous art direction / media producer experience preferred.Excellent copy writing, graphic design, video production and photography skills required.General knowledge of financial services industry.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Certifications:N/AWORKING ENVIRONMENTStandard indoor, environmentally controlled office work area including desk space and adjustable chair with little discomfort from noise, dust or other causes. Title: Category Buyer (Chinese Speaking)
Description: Description:Weee!, headquartered in Fremont, California, is the largest and fastest-growing Asian e-grocer in the United States with nearly 2M deliveries fulfilled to date. Weee! is currently available in the SF Bay Area, Sacramento, Seattle, and Los Angeles. Weee! was founded in 2015 as a social e-commerce company to enable affordable access to hard-to-find and fresh Asian ingredients directly from the source. By partnering with local suppliers and leveraging proprietary demand forecasting technology, Weee! is reshaping the grocery supply chain entirely. Weee! has received $40M in funding to date from Goodwater Capital, iFly.vc, Silicon Valley Bank, Amino Capital, VMG, XVC, and Welight Capital. For more information, please visit www.sayweee.com, follow us at @isayweee on Twitter, or check out our apps on iOS and Android.As a Category Buyer, you are responsible for managing the buying of compelling assortments for our customers at Weee!. It_Ñés your job to oversee a team to effectively develop suites of products _ÑÐ determining competitive pricing and analyzing marketplace trends to identify new opportunities for the future and which assortments to transition if they are past their prime _ÑÐ ensuring business plans are a _ÑÒwin-win_Ñ for our customers and Weee!. Creativity and agility will be paramount as you identify retail trends and synthesize information and partnerships across multiple cross-functional touchpoints _ÑÐ providing forecasts and business solutions in a fast-paced, multi-dimensional environment. Your job is to bring the _ÑÒart_Ñ to the _ÑÒscience_Ñ _ÑÐ using your intuition and expertise fueled by data, analytics and, above all, a passion for helping our customers get high-quality products and live better.Responsibilities:Owns sales and gross profit margin.Develops and implements strategic direction for multiple categories.Drives sales and gross profit through the optimization of the product assortment in multiple categories.Promotes and supports company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity.Provides supervision and development opportunities for junior buyers.Supports cross-channel and company initiatives to achieve global strategic multi-channel plans.Requirements:3+ years of proven experience in merchandise, forecasting and product selection - Seafood and Meat preferred.Industry background required.In addition, must have experience developing strong business relationships with vendors and industry leaders.Have experience managing and creating new categories of business in an extremely competitive environment.Have experience managing margin to meet category objectives.Bachelor_Ñés degree or higher.Bilingual (English and Chinese).Benefits:Comprehensive health insurance package, including medical, dental, and vision.Free lunch daily, catered by local restaurants.Annual bonus opportunities.Company stock options.Vacation and holiday time off.Monthly mobile stipend.Monthly Weee! Points credit.Valuable opportunity to grow into your dream role by contributing to a venture-backed startup in a high-growth stage.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Apply for this job.

Description: Enterprise Software Product ManagerRiparian has an amazing opportunity for an intellectually-curious professional who is a natural leader, has the ability to listen to various stakeholders and quickly distill their concerns down to the key issues, and enjoys coming up with creative solutions to complex problems, getting buy-off on those solutions, and driving them to completion. roadmap.Creativity: He/she must be someone who thinks critically and creatively about the big picture, while also being methodical in their thought process and highly detail-oriented in their (be it internal or external, current or prospective).Develop and maintain domain area expertise, including best practices to provide value to customers.Contribute to the growth of Riparian by being a brand ambassador and assist in the hiring of great talent.Basic Qualifications:Team Player: Enjoys working hard, exhibits professionalism, is dedicated to meeting and exceeding expectations.Communicator: Superior communication skills (presentation, written, and verbal), listening skills, and demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical ideas and plans effectively to non-technical audiences.Problem Solver: Highly skilled at problem-solving, decision making, and ability to navigate challenging situations in a professional manner.Analytical: Strong analytical skills. Title: Director Paid Digital Advertising [Virtual/Job Share]
Description: Director Paid Digital Advertising Position Description [Virtual/Job Share]Position OverviewThe Director Paid Digital Advertising holds a key position that oversees our service delivery as it relates to paid advertising, including insourced and outsourced services. Varying levels of knowledge of several disciplines is a must, including Search Engine Marketing, Paid Digital Advertising, Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Website and Landing Page Development, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO).This role is for a seasoned business leader who understands how agencies work, in addition to having a broad understanding of various B2B and B2C business models employed by our clients, including revenue/cost structures. This is a doer/management position that includes both executing development and management of paid digital advertising programs, as well as overseeing day-to-day activities of employees and contractors, so a proven ability to deliver results through others is a must. In addition to managing a handful of clients yourself, you would hire, train, coach and monitor day-to-day activities and prepare employees for their next opportunities. As a manager and a leader of our organization, you are expected to demonstrate a continual growth in your knowledge and skills so as to enlarge DirectiveGroup_Ñés position as a thought leader. Additionally, you would help lead all DirectiveGroup employees to grow our company by writing articles for internal and external blogs, making content updates to our corporate website, writing proposals and preparing presentations, speaking at conferences and seminars, networking and referring new clients, etc.To do well in this role, you will require:Expert knowledge in paid digital advertising, including all aspects of attaining strong performance, as well as sufficient knowledge about other digital marketing tactics.Strong capabilities in people management, from identification of appropriate resources, to hiring, coaching and managing, so as to attain strong performance and a high retention rate.Strong client relationship management and outstanding representation of company and industry in small settings and large venues, including fostering an industry-leading POV.Strong organizational leadership and culture-building capabilities that facilitate a high performing team built on the principles of excellence and mutual support to attain outstanding, industry-leading performance.Strong capabilities in project management, process management and all internal administrative processes that underlie a consistently strong performance.A significant plus would be very deep hands-on digital experience, previous agency ownership experience, a broad and well-seasoned business background and top tier consulting background. For such a candidate, there is a medium-term partnership opportunity with an earned equity share.You would be setting the cultural tone with this role. We are a virtual company, so you_Ñéd be joining a team self-starters that are very disciplined and organized. Our positions are fast-paced, so the ability to multi-task and self-manage is of crucial importance. We ask for a lot from our team, but for these hardy souls, we offer some degree of flexibility in hours, dependent primarily on the needs of assigned clients. In addition, we seek to build an environment of learning that includes _ÑÉfast failing_Ñé to get to the top faster and a mutually supportive space for trying new things with a proper risk-mitigation mindset that fosters application of thoughtful solutions vs reckless behavior.After one year of service, all employees are encouraged to dedicate up to five percent of their time to assist non-profits that meet our company criteria. All employees are required to possess a computer with the latest version of MS Windows OS & MS Office Productivity Suite, as well as sufficient internet capacity for a VoIP phone.Compensation: $75K - $90K annually FT (50-60 hrs), including performance bonus, based on skills and experience. This position starts as a PT role and if desired may expand to FT once performance goals are attained within 3-6 months.Outcomes: First Six MonthsSuccessfully gains understanding of all clients under management (by self or others on your team) and is meeting the performance goals of at least 20% growth YoY in measures of individual client performance, within two months of start.Expertly oversees the development of DirectiveGroup strategies, including development of tactics within domains of expertise, and subsequent authoritative presentation and implementation of these strategies that achieves targeted performance goals, within two months of start.Conducts Paid Advertising Audits that uncovers opportunities and problems, and presents to existing and prospective clients in an authoritative and persuasive way to achieve goals of winning ongoing business.Manages employees and contractors to attain performance while achieving meaningful professional goals that contribute to their professional development and wellbeing, within three months of start.Follows project and process management best practices to deliver all in-scope requirements within given timeframe and within given hours, for self and all managed resources, within four months of start.Leads thought leadership internally and externally to build the DirectiveGroup brand and to generate interest in our services, including assisting sales in attaining at least one new client each month, within six months of start.Skills Required to Achieve SuccessDigital Marketing & AdvertisingConsistently demonstrates deep expertise in paid digital and social advertising methods, is well-versed in trends and historical knowledge and has thought-leadership insights that can be communicated clearly internally & externally.Deep capabilities to complete or direct analysis of budgets, bid management, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Deep capabilities to complete or direct the completion of strategy-based documentation and associated tactics plans that include well-thought out, phased approaches, resources and costs to deliver.Is well versed in new opportunities within domain of expertise and is able to identify, develop and implement high-value productized offerings.Understands conversion optimization theory, including how to effectively lay out landing pages and websites, as well as how to develop strong direct marketing content.Has substantial level of knowledge of website development process, from a functional and usability standpoint, and can communicate ideas effectively with programmers.Understands how to measure performance and has expertise with Google Analytics and other Web Analytics and data visualization tools and programs.Has broad general industry and market skills that are applied to understand what each client must achieve to consider program a success.Has an informed level understanding of various programming languages and what they are used for, servers and web hosting, and internet security issues.People Management, Leadership & Executive Management SkillsHas maturity and demonstrated managerial knowhow to oversee day-to-day activities of direct report employees, even in a virtual environment, so as to deliver superior results.Provides excellent training and coaching that measurably improves results of peers, colleagues and direct report employees.Assures client programs are executed in an expert, timely and professional manner and that results are always above market average.Can train and coach direct reports to expertly manage multiple client projects, including developing and executing on strong plans with goals, milestones and priorities to finish projects on time, at budget and with high quality.Delegates and co-manages effectively to internal and outsourced resources.Provides thought leadership within DirectiveGroup and within industry.Participates in the development of company strategy and tactics.Proven effectiveness at achieving company goals through individual efforts and by leading and orchestrating the efforts of others.Achieves client attainment, retention and loyalty goals.Demonstrates strong capabilities of resource management for cost/efficiencies goals.Brings good judgment and broader perspective to highly charged and active environments.Assures process and automation compliance within DirectiveGroup team.Rallies the team around becoming individually certified in various programs, continually developing deepening expertise and enthusiastically growing new domains of expertise.Client Leadership & Management SkillsMonitors attainment of performance goals of all client programs on an ongoing basis.Can complete analysis of budgets, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Is able to communicate to each client at his or her level of knowledge, and sufficient such that it is clearly understood what we are doing and why, including management of client expectations.Can lead client and our team through the planning, set-up, initiation and ongoing programs.Manages well through conflict and is able to diplomatically tell the client what s/he needs to know and not just what s/he wants to hear.Understands the importance of _ÑÉvalue perception_Ñé to achieve client loyalty and can effectively help our clients understand the value of what we do for them.Understands the online advertising and marketing opportunity for client_Ñés business and can lead general business discussions or interviews to identify specific opportunities for the client.Is able to sell upgrades and program improvements, either independently or in concert with a sales executive (for larger recommendations).Takes ownership, has strong initiative and is self-directed and can deal effectively with ambiguity, change and complexity.Qualifications6+ years SEM & Paid Digital Advertising complex program set-up and management across companies of multiple sizes and industries, in local, regional and national markets.5+ years_Ñé experience managing and leading employees, preferably virtually.2+ years Paid Social Advertising experience with both B2B and B2C companies.Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding credentials.Post graduate degree and/or professional designation an asset.Strong business acumen and experience in communicating with Executives at larger companies and Owners/CEOs and smaller companies.[Preferred] Experience within a digital marketing agency as an owner or working with larger brands as a _ÑÉSolutions Architect/Director_Ñé or _ÑÉBusiness Strategist._Ñé[Preferred] Published author or renowned conference speaker on areas of expertise.Personal CharacteristicsLeads co-creation of a culture that supports our vision, built on two pillars: 1) accountability and ability to debate ideas and 2) creation of a trust-based _ÑÒsafe_Ñ environment that supports all team members.Strong organization skills and project management skills.Superior written and verbal communication skills.Excellent meeting facilitation skills.Demonstrates superior leadership skills, confidence and a high level of maturity.Loves working with people and facilitating personal growth.Demonstrates extremely effective managerial and oversight skills.About DirectiveGroupWhy we exist: To help growing companies become industry leaders such that they are the first and only option in the mind of their customers. We provide the surety of a big digital marketing agency, yet deliver results with the mastery, commitment, and passion of an in-house team.DirectiveGroup is a digital marketing agency that creates a unique and powerful online presence for each of our clients so as to deliver extraordinarily high results. We specialize in developing or revitalizing high-converting websites, strategies, marketing artificial intelligence, search engine marketing and optimization, content & social media marketing and email marketing.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $75,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Management: 5 years (Required)Paid Digital Advertising: 6 years (Required)Education:Master's (Preferred)Application Question:Please provide information about published works or conference presentations in last 3 years.Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleThis Job Is:A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applySchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.directivegroup.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Controller

Working with this company, you will receive competitive and comprehensive compensation and benefits package, as well as strong career growth. We want to hear from you if you can motivate others with your positive detail oriented attitude; are honest, reliable and a leader; and can provide outstanding client services by managing self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability. Additionally, you will handle key decisions and challenge, negotiate and influence the team. As a leader, you will encourage innovative ideas that are sound and progressive, challenge the status quo, and support creativity in your area of responsibility. Based in the Vernon, California area, this opening for a Controller is a full-time position.Major responsibilitiesWork closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful Title: Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager), G...
Description: DutiesSummaryThe purpose of this position is to assist and support in the administration of field data collection phases of the various current or special census surveys while troubleshooting any field operational problems.The incumbent will apply statistical theories, techniques and methods to manage and coordinate the census activities.This vacancy is for a Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager) position located in the Los Angeles Regional Office in Burbank, CA.ResponsibilitiesManage data collection to ensure training and observation programs are utilized to foster quality data collection techniques.Manage surveys to ensure data collection remains on track and within targeted budget.Collect and tabulate data using a variety of methods or developing new procedures for statistical projects.Communicate progress of data collection operations to management and staff.Ensure work schedules, assignments, and communication strategies are utilized to ensure team performance and cost efficiencies.Travel RequiredOccasional travel - Some travelSupervisory statusYesPromotion Potential12Job family (Series)1530 StatisticsRequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentU.S. citizen.Suitable for Federal employment.Registered for Selective Service if applicable. (www.sss.gov)You may be required to complete a financial disclosure (OGE-450).Applicants must meet all qualification requirements by the closing date of this announcement.This announcement will close at 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time on the date the first (50) applicants are received or on May 20, 2020, whichever comes first.This vacancy is advertised under 2 different announcements. Read the 'Who May Apply' section carefully to determine your eligibility. If you are not eligible under this announcement, please see LA RO-2020-0024, Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager), GG-1530-7/9/11/12, Census-DOC-LJG.This is a Temporary Appointment, initial appointment is not to exceed (NTE) 10/30/2021. This appointment may be extended at management_Ñés discretion.A trial period may be required.A supervisory probationary period may be required.Relocation will not be paidThe work schedule for this position is Mixed Tour. With a Mixed Tour work schedule, an employee may be changed between full-time, part-time and intermittent work schedules to accommodate fluctuating workloads and is subject to a signed agreement.QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Basic Entry Requirements for All Grade Levels:A. Degree: that included 15 semester hours in statistics (or in mathematics and statistics, provided at least 6 semester hours were in statistics), and 9 additional semester hours in one or more of the following: physical or biological sciences, medicine, education, or engineering; or in the social sciences including demography, history, economics, social welfare, geography, international relations, social or cultural anthropology, health sociology, political science, public administration, psychology, etc.NOTE: As indicated in A above credit toward meeting statistical course requirements will be granted for courses in which 50 percent of the course content appears to be statistical methods, e.g., courses that included studies in research methods in psychology or economics such as tests and measurements or business cycles, or courses in methods of processing mass statistical data such as tabulating methods or electronic data processing. Additionally, to receive credit for course work that is not catalogued on the transcript as Statistics or contain 'statistics' in the course title, applicants must attach an official course description for the course that clarifies that the course has statistical content, or written documentation (documentation must be on official school letterhead) from a professor or a school official verifying that the content of a course has either met the 50% statistics course requirements or was a statistical course if the course name in your transcript is not entitled as statistics.If you do not submit sufficient academic documentation necessary to demonstrate that you meet the eligibility and minimum qualification requirements described in this announcement, your application will be deemed incomplete and you will be ineligible for further consideration for this vacancy.ORB. Combination of education and experience - courses shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. The experience should have included a full range of professional statistical work such as (a) sampling, b) collection, computing and analyzing data, and c) applying statistical techniques such as measurements of central tendency, dispersion, skewness, sampling error, simple and multiple correlation, analysis of variance, and tests of significance. The quality of the combination of education and experience must be sufficient to demonstrate that the applicant possesses the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to perform work in the occupation, and is comparable to that normally acquired through the successful completion of a full 4-year course of study with a major in the appropriate field.GRADE LEVEL REQUIREMENTS:In addition to meeting the Basic Entry Requirements above, applicants must have the specialized experience listed below.Specialized Experience:For GG-07, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-05 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position includes applying standard statistical methods and analyses such as measures of central tendency and dispersion; and collecting data for surveys or studies, as a team member.ORYou have one full year of progressively higher-level graduate education.ORYou have superior academic achievement, which is defined as one (or more) of the following: Membership in a national honor society; graduating in the upper 1/3 of the class; earning an undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.95 (on a 4.0 scale) in the final 2 undergraduate years completed; earning a cumulative undergraduate GPA of at least 2.95; earning an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.45 in the major field of study during the final 2 undergraduate years completed; or earning a cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.45 in the major field of study.For GG-09, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-07 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position includes assisting in the design and development of specifications for data collection and data processing requirements for statistical studies and surveys, applying advanced statistical analytical tools such as regression analysis and measures of variance to socio/economic and demographic data, and assisting in the development of professional papers or reports on such data.ORYou have completed two years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a master's degree or you have a master's degree or equivalent graduate degree.For GG-11, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-09 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position include designing and developing specifications for data collection and data processing requirements, operating procedures, training materials, and operational schedules for statistical studies and surveys; applying advanced statistical analytical tools such as regression analysis and measures of variance to socioeconomic and demographic data, and assisting in the development of professional papers or reports; and coordinating field data collection activities for large scale statistical surveys.ORYou have 3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a doctoral degree or you have a Ph.D. degree or equivalent doctoral degree.For GG-12, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position include leading a team to plan a statistical survey or study; developing survey and data collection specifications and establishing time schedules for various phases of survey operations; establishing analytical methodology, design sampling and estimation procedures for surveys, and documenting work results and findings; and planning the analysis of the socioeconomic or demographic data developed by the survey or study.Education cannot be substituted for experience at this grade level.NOTE: Education and experience may be combined for all grade levels for which both education and experience are acceptable.Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.EducationAdditional informationThe Department of Commerce provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify the Human Resources Office. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be on a case-by-case basis. TTY users can contact the Human Resources Office via the Federal Relay Service, 1-800-877-8339.How You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.Your resume, optional cover letter and supporting documentation will be reviewed to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications for the position. If you meet the minimum qualifications stated in the job opportunity announcement, we will compare your resume, optional cover letter and supporting documentation to your responses on the scored occupational questionnaire (True/False, Yes/No, Multiple Choice questions) and place you in one of three pre-defined categories. These categories are "gold," "silver," and "bronze." Your resume and/or optional cover letter must support your responses to the scored occupational questionnaire, or your score may be lowered. Candidates placed in the "gold" category will be identified for referral to the hiring manager and may be invited for an interview.How you will be evaluated for preference eligibility: Within each category, those entitled to veterans' preference will be listed at the top of the pre-defined category for which they are placed.The scored occupational questionnaire will evaluate you on the following competencies; please do not provide a separate written response:Ability to lead, and motivate a team to complete a project under tight deadlines.Ability to use survey methods such as survey research, sampling, questionnaires, and data collection in order to design, conduct, interpret and analyze surveys.Skill in interviewing applicants, making selections and proposing performance and conducting related actions.Knowledge of data collection or analysis to write tabular, graphic or test reports outlining progress or results of surveys.Ability to communicate technical and non-technical information to a variety of audiences.For more information on category rating, please go to: http://www.hr.commerce.gov/s/groups/public/@doc/@cfoasa/@ohrm/documents/content/prod01_009474.pdf.We recommend that you preview the online questions for this announcement before you start the application process.To preview questions please click here.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceNot RequiredDrug test requiredNoRequired DocumentsRequired DocumentsA complete application consists of the following:Resume showing relevant experience; cover letter optional. Your resume should list your educational and work experience including the dates (mm/dd/yy) of each employment along with the number of hours worked per week. Your resume may be used to validate your responses to the scored occupational questionnaire. Your resume should also indicate your citizenship and if you are registered with the Selective Service System if you are a male born after 12/31/59.Veterans' Preference Documentation: Please indicate on your resume the type of veterans' preference you are claiming and provide the appropriate supporting documentation (DD-214 stating disposition of discharge or character of service, VA letter, SF-15, etc.) to validate your claim. For more information regarding eligibility requirements, please go to: http://www.fedshirevets.gov/job/vetpref/index.aspx.Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) and Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) documentation, if applicable (see other information).Education Documentation: If this position requires proof of higher education, or you are substituting education for experience, you must submit an unofficial transcript or a list of courses that includes the following information: name of accredited institution, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned. This also applies to Census Bureau employees. Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. Please refer to http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/policy/ApplicationOfStds-04.asp for more information.You are not required to submit official documents at this time; copies are sufficient.Special Instructions for Foreign Education: Qualifying education from colleges and universities in foreign countries must be evaluated in terms of equivalency to that acquired in U.S. colleges and universities. Applicants educated in whole or in part in foreign countries must submit sufficient evidence, including transcripts, to an accredited private organization for an equivalency evaluation of course work and degree. A listing of these accredited organizations can be found on the Department of Education's website - http://www.ed.gov/international/usnei/us/workrecog.doc You must provide a copy of the letter containing the results of the equivalency evaluation with a course by course listing along with your application. Failure to provide such documentation when requested will result in lost consideration.CTAP and ICTAP EligiblesCTAP and ICTAP candidates will be eligible for selection priority if it is determined that they have exceeded the minimum qualifications for the position by attaining at least a rating of 85 out of 100. Information about CTAP and ICTAP eligibility is on the Office of Personnel Management's Career Transition Resources website at: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/ctap_guideline.pdf.CTAP applicants MUST submit the following documents:A copy of your RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a directed geographic relocation outside of the local commuting area; a Certificate of Expected Separation (CES); or certification that you are in a surplus organization or occupation (this could be a position abolishment letter, a notice of eligibility for discontinued service retirement, or similar notice);A copy of your SF-50 "Notification of Personnel Action", noting current position, grade/band level, and duty location;A copy of your latest performance appraisal including your rating; andAny documentation from your bureau/operating unit that shows your current promotion potential.ICTAP applicants MUST submit the following documents:A copy of your RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a directed geographic relocation outside of the local commuting area, notice of disability annuity termination, certification from your former agency that it cannot place you after your recovery from a work-related compensable injury; Title: Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager), G...
Description: DutiesSummaryThe purpose of this position is to assist and support in the administration of field data collection phases of the various current or special census surveys while troubleshooting any field operational problems.The incumbent will apply statistical theories, techniques and methods to manage and coordinate the census activities.This vacancy is for a Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager) position located in the Los Angeles Regional Office in Burbank, CA.ResponsibilitiesManage data collection to ensure training and observation programs are utilized to foster quality data collection techniques.Manage surveys to ensure data collection remains on track and within targeted budget.Collect and tabulate data using a variety of methods or developing new procedures for statistical projects.Communicate progress of data collection operations to management and staff.Ensure work schedules, assignments, and communication strategies are utilized to ensure team performance and cost efficiencies.Travel RequiredOccasional travel - Occasional TravelSupervisory statusYesPromotion Potential12Job family (Series)1530 StatisticsRequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentU.S. citizen.Suitable for Federal employment.Time-in-grade requirements must be met by the announcement closing date.Registered for Selective Service, if applicable. (www.sss.gov)You may be required to complete a financial disclosure (OGE-450).Applicants must meet all qualification requirements by the closing date of this announcement.This vacancy is advertised under 2 different announcements. Read the 'Who May Apply' section carefully to determine your eligibility. If you are not eligible under this announcement, please see LA RO-2020-0025 Supervisory Survey Statistician (Regional Survey Manager), GG-1530-7/9/11/12, Census-DE-LJG.This is a competitive temporary promotion opportunity not to exceed (NTE) 10/30/2021. This temporary promotion may be extended, terminated earlier, at management's discretion. At the conclusion of the temporary promotion, the employee will return to their position of record.A probationary period may be required.A supervisory probation period may be required.Relocation Will not be paid.The work schedule for this position is Mixed Tour. With a Mixed Tour work schedule, an employee may be changed between full-time, part-time and intermittent work schedules to accommodate fluctuating workloads and is subject to a signed agreement.QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Basic Entry Requirements for All Grade Levels:A. Degree: that included 15 semester hours in statistics (or in mathematics and statistics, provided at least 6 semester hours were in statistics), and 9 additional semester hours in one or more of the following: physical or biological sciences, medicine, education, or engineering; or in the social sciences including demography, history, economics, social welfare, geography, international relations, social or cultural anthropology, health sociology, political science, public administration, psychology, etc.NOTE: As indicated in A above credit toward meeting statistical course requirements will be granted for courses in which 50 percent of the course content appears to be statistical methods, e.g., courses that included studies in research methods in psychology or economics such as tests and measurements or business cycles, or courses in methods of processing mass statistical data such as tabulating methods or electronic data processing. Additionally, to receive credit for course work that is not catalogued on the transcript as Statistics or contain 'statistics' in the course title, applicants must attach an official course description for the course that clarifies that the course has statistical content, or written documentation (documentation must be on official school letterhead) from a professor or a school official verifying that the content of a course has either met the 50% statistics course requirements or was a statistical course if the course name in your transcript is not entitled as statistics.If you do not submit sufficient academic documentation necessary to demonstrate that you meet the eligibility and minimum qualification requirements described in this announcement, your application will be deemed incomplete and you will be ineligible for further consideration for this vacancy.ORB. Combination of education and experience - courses shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. The experience should have included a full range of professional statistical work such as (a) sampling, b) collection, computing and analyzing data, and c) applying statistical techniques such as measurements of central tendency, dispersion, skewness, sampling error, simple and multiple correlation, analysis of variance, and tests of significance. The quality of the combination of education and experience must be sufficient to demonstrate that the applicant possesses the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to perform work in the occupation, and is comparable to that normally acquired through the successful completion of a full 4-year course of study with a major in the appropriate field.GRADE LEVEL REQUIREMENTS:In addition to meeting the Basic Entry Requirements above, applicants must have the specialized experience listed below.Specialized Experience:For GG-07, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-05 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position includes applying standard statistical methods and analyses such as measures of central tendency and dispersion; and collecting data for surveys or studies, as a team member.ORYou have one full year of progressively higher-level graduate education.ORYou have superior academic achievement, which is defined as one (or more) of the following: Membership in a national honor society; graduating in the upper 1/3 of the class; earning an undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.95 (on a 4.0 scale) in the final 2 undergraduate years completed; earning a cumulative undergraduate GPA of at least 2.95; earning an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.45 in the major field of study during the final 2 undergraduate years completed; or earning a cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.45 in the major field of study.For GG-09, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-07 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position includes assisting in the design and development of specifications for data collection and data processing requirements for statistical studies and surveys, applying advanced statistical analytical tools such as regression analysis and measures of variance to socio/economic and demographic data, and assisting in the development of professional papers or reports on such data.ORYou have completed two years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a master's degree or you have a master's degree or equivalent graduate degree.For GG-11, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-09 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position include designing and developing specifications for data collection and data processing requirements, operating procedures, training materials, and operational schedules for statistical studies and surveys; applying advanced statistical analytical tools such as regression analysis and measures of variance to socioeconomic and demographic data, and assisting in the development of professional papers or reports; and coordinating field data collection activities for large scale statistical surveys.ORYou have 3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a doctoral degree or you have a Ph.D. degree or equivalent doctoral degree.For GG-12, you must have one year of experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service.Experience for this position include leading a team to plan a statistical survey or study; developing survey and data collection specifications and establishing time schedules for various phases of survey operations; establishing analytical methodology, design sampling and estimation procedures for surveys, and documenting work results and findings; and planning the analysis of the socioeconomic or demographic data developed by the survey or study.Education cannot be substituted for experience at this grade level.NOTE: Education and experience may be combined for all grade levels for which both education and experience are acceptable.Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.EducationAdditional informationThe following links provide information on various hiring authorities that may enable you to apply through merit assignment procedures, or be eligible for a non-competitive appointment.CTAPThe Department of Commerce provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify the Human Resources Office. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be on a case-by-case basis. TTY users can contact the Human Resources Office via the Federal Relay Service, 1-800-877-8339.How You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.Your resume, optional cover letter and supporting documentation will be reviewed to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications for the position. If you meet the minimum qualifications stated in the job opportunity announcement, we will compare your resume, optional cover letter and supporting documentation to your responses on the scored occupational questionnaire (True/False, Yes/No, Multiple Choice questions). Your resume and/or optional cover letter must support your responses to the scored occupational questionnaire, or your score may be lowered. The best-qualified candidates will be identified for referral to the hiring manager and may be invited for an interview.Due weight shall be given to performance appraisals and awards in accordance with 5 CFR ë_ 335.103(b)(3), during the interview/selection process conducted by the hiring manager.The scored occupational questionnaire will evaluate you on the following competencies; please do not provide a separate written response:Ability to lead, and motivate a team to complete a project under tight deadlines.Ability to use survey methods such as survey research, sampling, questionnaires, and data collection in order to design, conduct, interpret and analyze surveys.Skill in interviewing applicants, making selections and proposing performance and conducting related actions.Knowledge of data collection or analysis to write tabular, graphic or test reports outlining progress or results of surveys.Ability to communicate technical and non-technical information to a variety of audiences.We recommend that you preview the online questions for this announcement before you start the application process.To preview questions please click here.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceNot RequiredDrug test requiredNoRequired DocumentsRequired DocumentsA complete application consists of the following:Resume showing relevant experience; cover letter optional. Your resume should list your educational and work experience including the dates (mm/dd/yy) of each employment along with the number of hours worked per week. For work in the Federal service, please include the grade level for the position(s). Your resume may be used to validate your responses to the scored occupational questionnaire. Your resume should also indicate your citizenship and if you are registered with the Selective Service System if you are a male born after 12/31/59.SF-50, "Notification of Personnel Action," supporting your eligibility, with the exception of current Census Bureau employees.Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) documentation, if applicable (see other information).Education Documentation: If this position requires proof of higher education, or you are substituting education for experience, you must submit an unofficial transcript or a list of courses that includes the following information: name of accredited institution, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned. This also applies to Census Bureau employees. Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. Please refer to http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/policy/ApplicationOfStds-04.asp for more information.You are not required to submit official documents at this time; copies are sufficient.Special Instructions for Foreign Education: Qualifying education from colleges and universities in foreign countries must be evaluated in terms of equivalency to that acquired in U.S. colleges and universities. Applicants educated in whole or in part in foreign countries must submit sufficient evidence, including transcripts, to an accredited private organization for an equivalency evaluation of course work and degree. A listing of these accredited organizations can be found on the Department of Education's website - http://www.ed.gov/international/usnei/us/workrecog.doc You must provide a copy of the letter containing the results of the equivalency evaluation with a course by course listing along with your application. Failure to provide such documentation when requested will result in lost consideration.CTAP EligiblesCTAP candidates will be eligible for selection priority if it is determined that they have exceeded the minimum qualifications for the position by attaining at least a rating of 85 out of 100. Information about CTAP eligibility is on the Office of Personnel Management's Career Transition Resources website at: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/ctap_guideline.pdf.CTAP applicants MUST submit the following documents:A copy of your RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a directed geographic relocation outside of the local commuting area; a Certificate of Expected Separation (CES); or certification that you are in a surplus organization or occupation (this could be a position abolishment letter, a notice of eligibility for discontinued service retirement, or similar notice);A copy of your SF-50 "Notification of Personnel Action", noting current position, grade/band level, and duty location;A copy of your latest performance appraisal including your rating; andAny documentation from your bureau/operating unit that shows your current promotion potential.NOTE: You will not be considered if you fail to provide all required documents.If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.BenefitsBenefitsA career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.U.S. Census Bureau offers a comprehensive benefits package. Explore the benefits offered to most Federal employees at https://www.usa.gov/benefits-for-federal-employees.Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.HelpThis job is open toIndividuals with disabilitiesFederal employees - Competitive serviceCurrent or former competitive service federal employees.Internal to an agencyCurrent federal employees of this agency.Career transition (CTAP, ICTAP, RPL)Federal employees who meet the definition of a "surplus" or "displaced" employee.VeteransClarification from the agencyCurrent Department of Commerce employees (includes any Bureau under Commerce) on a permanent competitive appointment; Current Department of Commerce employee (includes any Bureau under Commerce) on a term, temporary or excepted service appointment with reinstatement eligibility; and Surplus and displaced Commerce employee (CTAP).

Title: Cost Accountant
Description: Los Angeles-based Milani is one of the fastest growing indie brands in the masstige category known for creating high quality products typically found in prestige brands for value price points. Milani is affordable luxury appealing to all women of all colors and skin tones, a true multi-cultural and multigenerational brand.Milani Cosmetics is seeking a proactive, self-motivated candidate who thrives in a dynamic environment to join the Milani accounting team as a Cost Accountant.What We_Ñére Looking For:This position is accountable for the ongoing analysis of process constraints, target costing projects, margin analysis and for tracing costs back to underlying activities. The Cost Accountant constructs and monitors cost-effective data accumulation systems to provide an appropriate level of costing information to management. Develop and distribute reports updating management with the cost analysis associated with projects. This position requires an analytical mindset, critical thinking skills, adaptability with a high aptitude for learning and highly-developed organizational and task management skills. This position reports to the Controller.What You_Ñéll Do:Create, review and maintain controls for data accumulation and reporting systemsAnalyze, monitor, and coordinate physical inventory counts and cycle counts; Investigate cycle counting variances and resolve issuesConduct inventory reserve analysis on a quarterly basis and generate reports for senior managementReview standard and actual costs for inaccuraciesAccumulate and apply overhead costs using U.S. GAAPPerform cost accumulation tasks in collaboration with target costing groupConduct ongoing process constraint analysesReport on break even points by products, work centers and factoriesReport on margins by product and divisionReport on periodic variances and their causes, focusing in particular on spending variancesPerform activities covering materials and production costs, costs of sales, product development, overhead, etc.Analyze actual manufacturing costs and prepare periodic reports comparing budget costs to actual production costs, including product margin reporting and analytics, and identify cost improvement opportunitiesAnalyze capital budgeting requestsPost transactions to journals, ledgers and other recordsGenerate Purchase Price Variance (PPV) reports and analyze findingsQualifications:Bachelor_Ñés degree in Accounting, Finance or related fieldCertified Public Accountant (CPA) is preferred4+ years of progressive experience in cost accounting, cost analysis, or accountingAdvance knowledge of finance, accounting (GAAP) and internal controls (SOX)Excellent analytical, organizational, prioritization and written communication skills with great attention to detailExcellent customer service and communication skills, with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization and to excel in an environment that emphasizes teamwork and collaborationExperience generating reports from our ERP System (Sage 100)High proficiency with Microsoft Office including intermediate knowledge of Excel (VLOOKUP_Ñés, and building spreadsheets)EOE/M/F/Vet/DisabilityNOTE: Applications without resumes will not be considered.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 to
