Title: Regional Operations Analyst
Description: Regional Operations Analyst - LA Metro.Los Angeles, CA.Founded in 1997, Think Together partners with schools to change the odds for kids by providing award-winning programs during and outside the school day. We_Ñére one of California_Ñés largest nonprofits working in school districts from San Diego to San Francisco. Whether you_Ñére interested in early learning, elementary, middle, or high school, you can invest in your community by working at a local school or working within our home office providing support!JOB DESCRIPTION:As an Operations Analyst, based in our LA Metro location, you will ensure that all the data that supports our regional operations is complete and accurate. You will be responsible for overseeing the collection, management and reporting of business data supporting THINK Together programs; including but not limited to, participant information, program evaluation, program (grant) compliance, student achievement, learning management and operating support. This position will require extensive use of our student information systems, web-based survey collection and reporting systems, and learning management systems, in addition to reporting and analytics tools. The Regional Operations Analyst (ROA) will use these systems to develop and execute business and evaluation reports to help field staff and management manage their operations, identify issues, and analyze business trends. Also, note that requirements may evolve and change according to business demands.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Regularly evaluate data quality and enforce data quality standards; identify and resolve data quality issues (integrity, timeliness, accuracy, and completion).Identify opportunities to share and reuse data, assisting field staff, management teams, and district partners to analyze program and business trends, identify issues, and manage operations.Provide coaching and training (written and verbal) in formal and informal settings to supervisors and field staff regarding the collection, management, reporting, and application of business and program data.Establish and maintain relationships with external and internal district partners in order to develop strong data-sharing partnerships; support partner contractual agreements including reporting and auditing processes.Maintain awareness and compliance with program requirements in addition to communicate changes to data collection, calculation, and reporting to stakeholders as required.Organize own work daily, weekly, and monthly to ensure key deadlines are met and to ensure work is completed on time and according to instructions, with frequent unplanned requests and or delays.Other duties as assigned.EDUCATION and /or EXPERIENCE:Bachelor_Ñés Degree or 4 years equivalent experience.Knowledge of and experience with data management and various reporting and analytic tools, advanced-level systems experience preferred.Experience relating data to business and operations metrics.Strong ability to identify areas of concern, business trends, and escalate to appropriate levels.Strong project management experience.Advanced level trainer with experience training in both individual and group environments, including classroom and online training.OTHER SKILLS:Ability to establish trust and successfully manage non-direct reports.Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with staff to accomplish work in a timely fashion.Strong communication skills and team orientation; ability to communicate effectively and demonstrate sensitivity to others.Strong organizational skills and ability to perform multiple, concurrent tasks with frequent unplanned requests and/or delays.Superior analytical and detail orientation skills.Systems thinker; incorporates _ÑÒdata-driven_Ñ decision-making.Math skills sufficient to compute percentages, manipulate decimals and fractions, check standard numeric data.Ability to create presentation-ready reports utilizing graphical analysis, etc.Expert in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), EXPERT at EXCEL.Expert user of YouthServices.net and Survey Monkey preferred.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:Must be willing to work some evenings and weekends.Must be willing to travel to off-site meetings, training, and events.Background Checks/Testing:Must pass Live Scan (criminal background check via fingerprinting).Provide a clear TB test.Think Together is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, religious creed, physical disability, mental disability, the age for individuals age 40 and over, medical condition (as defined by state law (for example, cancer or genetic characteristics or HIV/AIDS), marital status, military, and veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Title: Senior Director of Post-Secondary Pathways
Description: CompanyThe Wonderful Company LLCThe RoleWonderful Education's mission is to enable a lifetime of career opportunities by significantly increasing the number of college graduates in the Central Valley. Funded by Lynda and Stewart Resnick, owners of The Wonderful Company, Wonderful Education partners with education leaders, colleges, and teachers across the nation to improve educational opportunities and enhance the quality of life for children throughout California's Central Valley.In addition to launching Wonderful Education, the Resnicks also founded the Wonderful College Prep Academy (WCPA) charter schools, tuition-free public charter schools. The first site opened in Delano, California, in 2009, and a second campus opened in Lost Hills, California in 2017. Today, the Delano campus serves approximately 1800 students in grades K-12 and the campus in Lost Hills serves approximately 350 students in grades K-8. The Lost Hills campus will grow to serve students through Grade 12 over the next four years.In 2014, Wonderful Education launched Ag Prep, which is our flagship early college career pathway work in agriculture. This program is currently offered in seven Central Valley high schools (including WCPA). Ag Prep students can graduate from high school with a free two-year college degree and can go on to earn a three-year renewable college scholarship up to $18,000 or opt to fast track their career through a $35,000 per year guaranteed work fellowship. Building on the success of the Ag Prep model, Wonderful Education is expanding our college and career pathways to add additional pathway work in education, health science, and other domains.Wonderful Education is seeking a Senior Director of Post-Secondary Pathways to enhance our existing work, launch new early college pathways with multiple partner high schools, and ultimately design a satellite School of Education in Delano.Here's what you'll do:Expand and implement early college and career pathways which are designed to prepare students in Grade 9 to Grade 14 to become teachers, and community and business leaders in the Central Valley.Build strong partnerships between Wonderful Education and Wonderful College Prep Academy, partner pathway program high schools, community colleges, and universities.Develop strong, replicable systems and structures that ensure at least 75% of entering Grade 9 students graduate from high school with a two-year college degree and successfully transition to four-year universities or work fellowship.Establish partnerships to expand and build work-based learning experiences and internships that give student career exposures.Collaborate with industry partners to understand and build talent pipeline through a variety of innovate pathway program options including associates and bachelors degrees, career and technical certifications, apprenticeship.Work closely with a four-year university partner to design and launch a School of Education in Delano by 2024, where students can earn their bachelor's degree and teaching credential, while working part-time in the field of education.Manage pathway program budgets for Wonderful Education and with partner schools.Actively source and collaborate with schools to apply for public and private grants and other philanthropic funding opportunities to support dual enrollment, early college and career pathway work.Collaborate with local, state and national pathway leaders, including Jobs for the Future.Here's what you'll bring to the table:EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's degree required.Graduate degree preferred.Experience working at multiple levels in the US public education system.Five years of quantifiably successful education management experience.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:A clear pattern of establishing a compelling vision, leading a team toward ambitious outcomes, and building support among stakeholders.A history of achieving outstanding results and coaching, mentoring, and managing others in a collaborative, fast-paced, and high-performing environment.Experience leading a startup or a significant change effort, including experience with finance and budget management.Multi-faceted teaching experiences with a strong track record for student achievement.Able to self-manage, take initiative, pay attention to detail and work tirelessly on behalf of students in the Central Valley.Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; superior analytic skills.Familiarity with the Central Valley of California or, at a minimum, similar rural, agricultural, immigrant communities.Willingness to travel regularly to the Central Valley or Los Angeles (depending on location)LocationLos Angeles, CAPerksHere's what we'll bring to the table:Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental, and 401k with match eligibility.Subsidized gym membership.On-site subsidized high end cafe offering farm to table meals and snacks.Free on-site yoga classes and other wellness-focused activities.Wonderful Giving (wonderfulgiving.com) - allowing you to donate company money to a cause of your choice.Free tobacco cessation programs.Work-Life integration.All the FIJI Water and Wonderful snacks you may want in the office.Discounted tickets to various LA attractions.We are bicycle-friendly, with newly installed bicycle racks available to all LA-based employees.Wonderful Education's mission is to enable a lifetime of career opportunities by significantly increasing the number of college graduates in the Central Valley. Funded by Lynda and Stewart Resnick, owners of The Wonderful Company, Wonderful Education_¢ serves 55,000 students and partners with educational leaders, colleges, and teachers across 24 school districts to improve educational opportunities and enhance the quality of life for children throughout California's Central Valley. Initiatives include agricultural career training, college scholarships, school grants, summer camps, arts education, early childhood programs and preschools, teacher development and parent engagement programs. The Resnicks also founded the Wonderful College Prep Academy charter schools in Delano and Lost Hills, California.For more information, visit: www.wonderfuleducation.org.Click here to view our Privacy Notice.

Description: Director Paid Digital Advertising Position Description [Virtual/Job Share]Position OverviewThe Director Paid Digital Advertising holds a key position that oversees our service delivery as it relates to paid advertising, including insourced and outsourced services. Varying levels of knowledge of several disciplines is a must, including Search Engine Marketing, Paid Digital Advertising, Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Website and Landing Page Development, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO).This role is for a seasoned business leader who understands how agencies work, in addition to having a broad understanding of various B2B and B2C business models employed by our clients, including revenue/cost structures. This is a doer/management position that includes both executing development and management of paid digital advertising programs, as well as overseeing day-to-day activities of employees and contractors, so a proven ability to deliver results through others is a must. In addition to managing a handful of clients yourself, you would hire, train, coach and monitor day-to-day activities and prepare employees for their next opportunities. As a manager and a leader of our organization, you are expected to demonstrate a continual growth in your knowledge and skills so as to enlarge DirectiveGroup_Ñés position as a thought leader. Additionally, you would help lead all DirectiveGroup employees to grow our company by writing articles for internal and external blogs, making content updates to our corporate website, writing proposals and preparing presentations, speaking at conferences and seminars, networking and referring new clients, etc.To do well in this role, you will require:Expert knowledge in paid digital advertising, including all aspects of attaining strong performance, as well as sufficient knowledge about other digital marketing tactics.Strong capabilities in people management, from identification of appropriate resources, to hiring, coaching and managing, so as to attain strong performance and a high retention rate.Strong client relationship management and outstanding representation of company and industry in small settings and large venues, including fostering an industry-leading POV.Strong organizational leadership and culture-building capabilities that facilitate a high performing team built on the principles of excellence and mutual support to attain outstanding, industry-leading performance.Strong capabilities in project management, process management and all internal administrative processes that underlie a consistently strong performance.A significant plus would be very deep hands-on digital experience, previous agency ownership experience, a broad and well-seasoned business background and top tier consulting background. For such a candidate, there is a medium-term partnership opportunity with an earned equity share.You would be setting the cultural tone with this role. We are a virtual company, so you_Ñéd be joining a team self-starters that are very disciplined and organized. Our positions are fast-paced, so the ability to multi-task and self-manage is of crucial importance. We ask for a lot from our team, but for these hardy souls, we offer some degree of flexibility in hours, dependent primarily on the needs of assigned clients. In addition, we seek to build an environment of learning that includes _ÑÉfast failing_Ñé to get to the top faster and a mutually supportive space for trying new things with a proper risk-mitigation mindset that fosters application of thoughtful solutions vs reckless behavior.After one year of service, all employees are encouraged to dedicate up to five percent of their time to assist non-profits that meet our company criteria. All employees are required to possess a computer with the latest version of MS Windows OS & MS Office Productivity Suite, as well as sufficient internet capacity for a VoIP phone.Compensation: $75K - $90K annually FT (50-60 hrs), including performance bonus, based on skills and experience. This position starts as a PT role and if desired may expand to FT once performance goals are attained within 3-6 months.Outcomes: First Six MonthsSuccessfully gains understanding of all clients under management (by self or others on your team) and is meeting the performance goals of at least 20% growth YoY in measures of individual client performance, within two months of start.Expertly oversees the development of DirectiveGroup strategies, including development of tactics within domains of expertise, and subsequent authoritative presentation and implementation of these strategies that achieves targeted performance goals, within two months of start.Conducts Paid Advertising Audits that uncovers opportunities and problems, and presents to existing and prospective clients in an authoritative and persuasive way to achieve goals of winning ongoing business.Manages employees and contractors to attain performance while achieving meaningful professional goals that contribute to their professional development and wellbeing, within three months of start.Follows project and process management best practices to deliver all in-scope requirements within given timeframe and within given hours, for self and all managed resources, within four months of start.Leads thought leadership internally and externally to build the DirectiveGroup brand and to generate interest in our services, including assisting sales in attaining at least one new client each month, within six months of start.Skills Required to Achieve SuccessDigital Marketing & AdvertisingConsistently demonstrates deep expertise in paid digital and social advertising methods, is well-versed in trends and historical knowledge and has thought-leadership insights that can be communicated clearly internally & externally.Deep capabilities to complete or direct analysis of budgets, bid management, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Deep capabilities to complete or direct the completion of strategy-based documentation and associated tactics plans that include well-thought out, phased approaches, resources and costs to deliver.Is well versed in new opportunities within domain of expertise and is able to identify, develop and implement high-value productized offerings.Understands conversion optimization theory, including how to effectively lay out landing pages and websites, as well as how to develop strong direct marketing content.Has substantial level of knowledge of website development process, from a functional and usability standpoint, and can communicate ideas effectively with programmers.Understands how to measure performance and has expertise with Google Analytics and other Web Analytics and data visualization tools and programs.Has broad general industry and market skills that are applied to understand what each client must achieve to consider program a success.Has an informed level understanding of various programming languages and what they are used for, servers and web hosting, and internet security issues.People Management, Leadership & Executive Management SkillsHas maturity and demonstrated managerial knowhow to oversee day-to-day activities of direct report employees, even in a virtual environment, so as to deliver superior results.Provides excellent training and coaching that measurably improves results of peers, colleagues and direct report employees.Assures client programs are executed in an expert, timely and professional manner and that results are always above market average.Can train and coach direct reports to expertly manage multiple client projects, including developing and executing on strong plans with goals, milestones and priorities to finish projects on time, at budget and with high quality.Delegates and co-manages effectively to internal and outsourced resources.Provides thought leadership within DirectiveGroup and within industry.Participates in the development of company strategy and tactics.Proven effectiveness at achieving company goals through individual efforts and by leading and orchestrating the efforts of others.Achieves client attainment, retention and loyalty goals.Demonstrates strong capabilities of resource management for cost/efficiencies goals.Brings good judgment and broader perspective to highly charged and active environments.Assures process and automation compliance within DirectiveGroup team.Rallies the team around becoming individually certified in various programs, continually developing deepening expertise and enthusiastically growing new domains of expertise.Client Leadership & Management SkillsMonitors attainment of performance goals of all client programs on an ongoing basis.Can complete analysis of budgets, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Is able to communicate to each client at his or her level of knowledge, and sufficient such that it is clearly understood what we are doing and why, including management of client expectations.Can lead client and our team through the planning, set-up, initiation and ongoing programs.Manages well through conflict and is able to diplomatically tell the client what s/he needs to know and not just what s/he wants to hear.Understands the importance of _ÑÉvalue perception_Ñé to achieve client loyalty and can effectively help our clients understand the value of what we do for them.Understands the online advertising and marketing opportunity for client_Ñés business and can lead general business discussions or interviews to identify specific opportunities for the client.Is able to sell upgrades and program improvements, either independently or in concert with a sales executive (for larger recommendations).Takes ownership, has strong initiative and is self-directed and can deal effectively with ambiguity, change and complexity.Qualifications6+ years SEM & Paid Digital Advertising complex program set-up and management across companies of multiple sizes and industries, in local, regional and national markets.5+ years_Ñé experience managing and leading employees, preferably virtually.2+ years Paid Social Advertising experience with both B2B and B2C companies.Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding credentials.Post graduate degree and/or professional designation an asset.Strong business acumen and experience in communicating with Executives at larger companies and Owners/CEOs and smaller companies.[Preferred] Experience within a digital marketing agency as an owner or working with larger brands as a _ÑÉSolutions Architect/Director_Ñé or _ÑÉBusiness Strategist._Ñé[Preferred] Published author or renowned conference speaker on areas of expertise.Personal CharacteristicsLeads co-creation of a culture that supports our vision, built on two pillars: 1) accountability and ability to debate ideas and 2) creation of a trust-based _ÑÒsafe_Ñ environment that supports all team members.Strong organization skills and project management skills.Superior written and verbal communication skills.Excellent meeting facilitation skills.Demonstrates superior leadership skills, confidence and a high level of maturity.Loves working with people and facilitating personal growth.Demonstrates extremely effective managerial and oversight skills.About DirectiveGroupWhy we exist: To help growing companies become industry leaders such that they are the first and only option in the mind of their customers. We provide the surety of a big digital marketing agency, yet deliver results with the mastery, commitment, and passion of an in-house team.DirectiveGroup is a digital marketing agency that creates a unique and powerful online presence for each of our clients so as to deliver extraordinarily high results. We specialize in developing or revitalizing high-converting websites, strategies, marketing artificial intelligence, search engine marketing and optimization, content & social media marketing and email marketing.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $75,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Management: 5 years (Required)Paid Digital Advertising: 6 years (Required)Education:Master's (Preferred)Application Question:Please provide information about published works or conference presentations in last 3 years.Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleThis Job Is:A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applySchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.directivegroup.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Yes

Title: FULL-STACK Blockchain Engineer (JS, C++, Node.js, React, Blo...
Description: ABOUT YOU:Interested in helping revolutionize manufacturing? Are you passionate about the intersection of cloud computing, blockchain and distributed ledgers? Do you have the ability to put together unique cutting-edge solutions that bring together various technologies for breakthrough business outcomes? Do you have a unique combination of deep technical knowledge, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills? Are you a thought leader with a mix of strong product experience, software development and technical blockchain expertise. You need to be passionate about leveraging blockchain and software technology solutions to help solve the problems of manufacturers Large , Medium and Small from C-Suite executives to the Shop Floor assembly line. This role combines high-level strategic thinking, strong communication with stakeholders, and going hands-on to code up proofs of concept to full fledged feature development and existing system maintenance.As a Full Stack Blockchain Lead Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and developing on Blockchain projects across a range of different technologies. You will develop and design integration architecture for integrating applications with Blockchain specific to Manufacturing and, also, participant organizations and their member nodes to Blockchain network. Must be able to look at the wider picture and consider adding new technologies such as AI, IoT, and robotic processing (RPA) and apply these to solving real business problems and creating new Blockchain operating models.We are looking for a Lead Full-Stack Blockchain Software Architect and Developer fluent in Javascript, C++, Node.js, react.js, angluar, Ethereum, Hyperledger engineers in Los Angeles. Ideal candidates will have some exposure to Manufacturing ERP environments and be comfortable working across the front and backend of the platform with JavaScript, Node.JS, ReactJS, Redux, Angluar, MongoDB and AWS EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon API Gateway, AWS CloudHSM. While ideally seeking engineers experienced in all of these technologies, we are open to agnostic, dynamic developers who_Ñéve developed consumer-facing applications with other modern, web-based, object-oriented technologies. Successful candidates will have phenomenal communication skills and have worked successfully as part of an established engineering team.The successful candidate will become a trusted adviser both to our Product Engineering Team as well as our Customers and will work with Enterprise Sales to drive adoption and revenue. This will include showcasing working with SyncFab Manufacturing Blockchain templates (Hyperledger Fabric, Ethereum).Preferred location: Los Angeles, but open to remote during COVID19Responsibilities IncludeArchitect end-to-end solutions for our customers using blockchain and other SyncFab services.Help develop an overall blockchain ecosystem engagement strategy.In partnership with the business development, solution architects and sales team, formulate and execute a strategy to drive adoption of distributed ledgers on SyncFab.Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using SyncFab.Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the SyncFab community.Author and contribute to SyncFab customer-facing publications such as blogs, whitepapers.Engage directly with the customers_Ñé development team, understand their specific business and technology challenges in the area of distributed ledgers integration in new products and services.Experience developing Hyperledger or Ethereum based solutions and passion for getting hands dirty with code.Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams and support.Basic QualificationsComputer Science degree with 7+ years of experience in software development, including design, implementation, debugging, and supportExperience working with blockchain frameworks such as Ethereum and Hyperledger in projects2+ years experience developing smart contracts and decentralized applications.5+ years professional experience in software development in languages like Java, Go, and Node.js. Experience working with RESTful API and general service oriented architectures.Delivering high quality software solutions on timePreferred QualificationsExperience in writing smart contracts for blockchain frameworks such as Hyperledger Fabric, Hyperledger Sawtooth, Ethereum, and CordaExperience designing and building highly-scaled distributed systems and web servicesVery strong computer science fundamentals in algorithm design, data structures, problem solving, and complexity analysisPossesses strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities in the face of ambiguityThorough understanding of parallel algorithms, concurrency, asynchronous architecturesExperience working in an agile software development organizationProven ability to effectively drive cross-team solutions that may have complex dependenciesExperience in enterprise software or cloud servicesAbility to work effectively, efficiently and independently with minimal oversightExcellent organizational skills and attention to detailStrong communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills.BS/MS in Computer Science or a related fieldExperience in modern test techniques such as Test and Behavior Driven Development (TDD and BDD)Familiarity with Agile / ScrumMust Have:5+ years of professional engineering experienceTech: C++, JavaScript, React, Redux, Node.JS, RUST, GoLang, Ethereum, Hyperledger and MongoDBFull Stack ExperienceB.S in Computer Science or relatedPlus:Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)M.S. in Computer Science or relatedIdeally you have worked in an ERP environment and are thoroughly familiar with manufacturing ERP. You will collaborate closely with product and vendors and customers to improve the end product and assist the Team to increase revenue based on user feedback, as well as soliciting and managing product enhancement requests from Sales, Business Development and Operations. Our platform will be securely pooling and collateralizing data for analytics optimization and MLAI for Smart Manufacturing across industry and product.5+ years of progressive software development/architecture experience is desired5+ years of Java / J2EE architecture experience2+ years of hands-on blockchain experienceStrong knowledge of Blockchain fundamentals, smart contracts, consensus algorithmsHands-on experience with any one Blockchain platforms (Hyperledger, Ethereum, R3 Corda)Proven understanding of architecture best practicesKnowledge and experience with full SDLC lifecycleExperience with Lean / Agile development methodologiesPreferred Blockchain Senior Technical Lead Qualifications:Experience with 3 or more blockchain implementations is a plusStrong understanding of different types of Blockchain such as public, private/permissioned, public permissioned, etc.Sound understanding of Blockchain framework such as Hyperledger Fabric, R3 Corda, Ethereum (Solidity), Ripple, MultichainGood understanding of various different consensus algorithms used in Bitcoin Blockchain, Ethereum, Byzantine fault-tolerant algorithms including Hyperledger Fabric PBFT algorithm etc.Knowledge of cryptography, including asymmetric (pub/priv key), symmetric, hash functions, encryption/signatures.Experience using cryptography material such as certificates for identity management in order to authenticate members, transactions etc.Able to create security architecture for managing the security of Blockchain and related applicationsExperience creating best practices/guidelines for blockchain teamsSkilled in performance metrics for measuring Blockchain performanceExcellent verbal and written communications skills, able to resolve business issuesExperience and desire to work in a Global Delivery environmentWhat_Ñés in it for you:Be part of building the engineering department within an innovative company. Build a product from the ground up. Work with a highly motivated and passionate team to build the future of the Manufacturing and Aerospace industry. Awesome work environment! We are proudly incubated at the Los Angeles Cleantech Incubator, located at the heart of the Arts District (https://laincubator.org).OUR MISSION:Our team is passionate about using technology to advance local sustainable manufacturing supply chains increasing accessibility and transparency working to solve a variety of new and unique challenges, creating new products. We move quickly, use data to drive our decisions, and deliver products and analytics to manufacturing professionals around the world.Job Type: ContractSalary: $2,500.00 to $5,000.00 /monthExperience:Node.js: 5 years (Preferred)ReactJS: 5 years (Preferred)Software Development: 3 years (Required)React: 5 years (Preferred)C++: 5 years (Preferred)JavaScript: 5 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Contract Renewal:PossibleAdditional Compensation:Other formsWork Location:One locationFully RemoteBenefits:Work from homeThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://syncfab.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/syncfabBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply On Company Site" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $95,000 - $115,000A bit about us:---------Apply today to join one of the top mortgage services company in the area.The ideal candidate will have a background in the mortgage industry and will bring experience in SQL business intelligence analytics, SSRS reports development related to loans, data analysis, data integration and 7 years of experience.Why join us?---------Comprehensive health care plans for your entire familyA generous employee referral programAccess to several discounts for fitness, restaurants, retailUp to 2 weeks of paid vacationAnd 11 company paid holidays annuallyJob Details---------RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for providing superior reporting, Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis on a variety of assignments related to loan servicing. Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description: DirecTech Labs is hiring a Senior Data Scientist to join its team! This role will play an integral part in the building, growing and nurturing of our maturing predictive analytics start-up. You'll have a chance to drive the behavioral intelligence that powers our actionable analytics and global messaging platform with over a million users and 20 million lifecycles in our database. You will be a key member of the data science team working to improve current behavioral models, develop new ones, and prove the efficacy and business impact of our global messaging and alerts. You_Ñéll also support the product team in the creation and validation of new analytics for our dashboard.We are looking for a mixture between a statistician, machine learning expert and engineer with an interest in predictive analytics and an ability to communicate their ideas and findings in a comprehensive and digestible way to business persons and IT alike: someone who has a passion for building data products and services, especially ones that seek to understand, segment and predict human behavior. The ideal candidate has experience with creating insights and predictions around human behavior, understands the principles of behavioral science and knows what to look for in the data to generate meaningful insight.If you're a scrappy builder backed by deep data analytics experience and looking to play a pivotal role within a maturing startup, this one is for you.What You'll Do:Gather, evaluate and document business requirements, translate to data science solution definitions, and implement solutions using such tools and languages as SageMaker, Jupyter Notebooks, Spark, Tensor Flow and Python.Analyze all data from all available sources (e.g. behavioral, sales, performance, social) to identify and inform Product and Customer Experience teams areas of opportunity for product performance insights, optimization and future features.Leverage your statistical and computational knowledge along with a passion for human behavior to design and build algorithms to solve challenging problems.Ability to design and build an end-to-end prototype data science solution to a business problemBuild a behavioral profile and segmentation model aggregating personal attributes, psychologic attributes, past and predicted future behaviors to create customer genomes.About You:You have a MS in Statistics, Machine Learning, or Predictive Analytics from a well known UniversityYou have 6+ years creating predictive models using advance machine learning techniquesYou have proven work examples of turning significant amounts of data into informative/insightful actions through various statistical techniques that turn into explosive and accurately measured business resultsYou have an expert command of statistical analysis, algorithm development, and state-of-the-art tools and methodologies for data scienceYou have previous experience building advanced ML algorithms for prediction of churn, predicting the future lifetime value of a person, predicting future customer behavior and predicting upsell/cross sell opportunitiesProficiency in methods in analytics and data science algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networks.You have an expert command of SQL and Python as applied to data science with experienceYou have excellent communication and presentation skills to be able to manage expectations both up, down and outside the organizationYou don't shy away from a challenge, are curious and looking to make a big impactYou are comfortable wearing multiple hats and want to get your hands dirtyYou know how to spot an issue (technical or interpersonal) and can tactfully and effectively resolve it before pressure starts to buildYou are a critical thinker, not afraid to question and be questionedYou take your own initiative to identify and solve problems without needing a hierarchical structure to tell you what to doYou love to explain your work and are great at helping people understand and believe in your resultsBonus Points if:You already have experience in the direct sales industry, gig economy company or another account based industry (insurance, real estate, etc_Ñ_)You know that game theory is more than just _ÑÒPoints_Ñ and loyalty programs.What You'll Get:An amazing company culture that encourages creativity, personal growth, work/life balance, fun and teamwork.The chance to work for a _ÑÒdata_Ñ company building _ÑÒdata_Ñ products.Working with "A Players" across the organization.Huge opportunity to build something in an industry that is hungry for solutions.Competitive salary, fully paid health benefits and paid vacation in the business you help create!Employment Type: Full-Time _ÑÐ REMOTE-WORK FROM HOMEJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $60,000.00 to $120,000.00 /yearExperience:Data Science: 6 years (Required)Machine Learning: 3 years (Required)Language:English (Required)Application Question:Have you ever worked in a Software Product CompanyAdditional Compensation:Other formsWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.directechlabs.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

Title: Part Manufacturing Estimator and Fulfillment Coordinator
Description: Who We Are:SyncFab is an OEM Parts Manufacturing Procurement Service Platform focused on the mission of bringing more manufacturing work to local small and medium sized machine shops in the USA.About You:The Fulfillment Coordinator reports directly to Company Sales and will conduct daily outreach to CNC Machine Shop Parts Manufacturing suppliers based on variable manufacturing machining orders received from customers. The Coordinator will work closely with Suppliers to Quote and Track status of production RFQs and POs maintaining an accurate log of Supplier, RFQ and PO activity status updates in company database while maintaining clear and timely communication with company sales.The Coordinator must be a responsible self-starter and team player willing to be held accountable to the Team for their individual performance. The Coordinator must have strong attention to detail with strong knowledge of Excel spreadsheets and ideally Powerpoint or GoogleDocs as well. The Coordinator is responsive to emails and call requests with a quick turnaround time and Fluent in the English language. These are absolute and definite prerequisite skills for this role. This role calls for strong organization skills and strong ability to multitask effectively.Ideal candidate will have some familiarity with CRM software like salesforce or hubspot. The Ideal Candidate is able to read machining drawings and specifications familiar with CNC and related manufacturing processes ideally with knowledge of machine hour cost time, materials and industry certifications such as ISO with a background in Mechanical Engineering but not required - All that is required is a passionate interest in Manufacturing technologies, willing to be held accountable for customer orders and put in the time necessary to get the job done.The Coordinator will participate in weekly work group updates reporting directly to company staff. Responsible Self starter with an interest in manufacturing and product development, avid reader, thoughtful and creative! Recent Graduates with attention to detail are especially welcome to apply Individuals with background accounting are very detail oriented and also encouraged to apply. This position has room for growth.Responsibilities include:QualityDiscover and partner with trustworthy vendors and suppliers focused on zero defect qualityWork with Supplier Quality Engineers (SQE) and cross-functional vendor and customer teams to develop strategies for obtaining first time quality throughout the supply chainEvaluate suitability and stability of current and potential suppliers with regard to financial health, staffing, quality, throughput, technical capability, and reputationWork closely with SQE teams to analyze issue ticket trends and identify correct actions for strategic vendorsWork closely with Supplier Development Engineer (SDE) teams and suppliers to develop and implement quality improvement action plans to proactively drive continuous quality improvementDeliveryExercise sound business judgment in leveraging and implementing sourcing and procurement activities, including recommendations for alternative solutions that meet business prioritiesCollaboratively work with Supply Chain team on sourcing strategy, market analysis and conducting trade-off analysis reviews and supplier roadmaps with engineersDrive development of supplier and industry certification profiles, market trends and strategiesCommunicate and prepare value propositions associated with proposals to SyncFab executives, i.e. award preparation, cost reviews, reduction strategies and all critical supply issuesBuild cross functional teams and champion continuous improvement initiatives for cost, quality, and deliveryEnsure compliance with all company policies and procedures and government regulationsFoster, manage, and maintain supplier partnerships, and monitor status of work being performedProvide sourcing tools for day-to-day purchasing activities to vertical commodity teamsVisit supplier_Ñés facilities and accurately assess technical capability, equipment, and capacity for rapid deployment of new product development and long term productionConduct Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) with primary vendor baseBasic Qualifications:Bachelor_Ñés degree in business, engineering or technical disciplinestechnical procurement and/or supplier management experiencePreferred Skills and Experience:Experience reading datasheets, drawings, and blueprintsStrong influencing and customer service skills who are comfortable navigating ambiguityCollaborating with multiple teams and building strong relationships with stakeholdersIdentify opportunities for increased competitive bidding, smarter supplier relationships and more efficient processes. Collaborate with commodity teams to speed up innovationProven track record of taking ownership, successfully negotiating preferred pricing and driving resultsMust be a person of passion and integrity who has the drive to excel and deliver exceptional results including conducting all activities with the highest of integrityTrack record of issuing Vendor Pricing Agreements and Long Term Agreements (LTAs)Ability to read engineering drawing or blueprintsExceptional analytical, problem solving, and organizational skillsEffective written, verbal and presentation communication skillsAbility to learn quickly and prioritize appropriately to meet customer and company needsMust be detail-oriented, self-motivated and able to respond quickly to a fast-moving and ever-changing environmentAdditional Requirements:Must be willing to work extended hours as needed. If you are looking for a standard 9-5 to build your resume and collect a paycheck than this is not the position for you. If you are a proactive self-aware team player with integrity and ambition to build a successful thriving business while making something of yourself than this is the place for you.Our Mission:Our team is passionate about using technology to advance local sustainable manufacturing supply chains increasing accessibility and transparency working to solve a variety of new and unique challenges, creating new products. We move quickly, use data to drive our decisions, and deliver products and analytics to manufacturing professionals around the world.If you join our team, you will work on projects that really matter to real people, while developing your own potential, and having a lot of fun.Job Type: ContractSalary: $1,500.00 to $3,000.00 /monthContract Renewal:PossibleAdditional Compensation:Other formsWork Location:One locationFully RemoteBenefits:Work from homeThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applySchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://syncfab.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/syncfabBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Nurse Supervisor Case Management RN
Description: A rewarding opportunity has now become available with an acute care hospital in Southern California for a Nurse Supervisor Utilization Review RN.The Nurse Supervisor Utilization Review RN will be responsible for implementing and developing all case management functions. The Nurse Supervisor will act as a liaison between healthcare professionals including physicians, nurses and hospitalists to ensure that effective communication is achieved throughout. The Nurse Supervisor will assist the Nurse Manager in performing duties such as budget and fiscal planning, employee personnel functions, and utilize data analytics to improve performance within the case management department. Furthermore, the Nurse Supervisor Case Management will be responsible for overseeing social service functions such as patient admissions and patient discharging.The Nurse Supervisor Utilization Review will support many different departments throughout this 100+ bed facility including but not limited to Women_Ñés Services, Surgical Services, and the Cardiovascular Center. The Case Management Nurse Manager will in turn be supported by Nurse Case Managers and will report directly to the Director Case Management and CNO Chief Nursing Officer.This reputable facility is well known for providing high quality care to the friendly community that surrounds them. They offer a number of services including but not limited to: Laboratory Services, Surgical Services, Maternal Child Health, Therapy and Rehab Services, Diagnostic Imaging Services.This region of Southern California is absolutely gorgeous offering a handful of different activities to partake in from surfing on the weekends to cultural dining options throughout the week. The greater Los Angeles area is home to Championship sports teams, cultural dining options as well as world-renown theme parks. This is the perfect area to grow both personally and professionally. Southern California will not disappoint! It also doesn_Ñét hurt that there is near perfect weather nearly all year round!The acute care facility is looking to add a dedicated leader to their compassionate multidisciplinary team. The hospital is ready to offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package to the Nurse Supervisor Utilization Review RN.

Title: Marketing Manager
Description: About DocuPetDocuPet is a social enterprise and the foremost provider of outsourced pet licensing services in North America. Our mission is to provide a safe and happy home for every pet and we need the help of amazing people to achieve this goal. We are now seeking the services of an experienced marketer to expand the reach of our designer pet tag product and lost pet service both within the communities we serve and across North America.*We have developed the most comprehensive pet licensing program in the market as we aim to solve what our industry calls _ÑÒthe licensing gap_Ñ - the fact that just 13% of pet owners comply with mandatory registration laws even though licensing provides real value to pet owners and is a key funding source for local animal care and control.DocuPet has offices in Syracuse, NY and Kingston, ON. This role may be conducted from either of those offices or from a home office if necessary or preferred.Learn about our mission and services in this brief video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AiZnw_b5i5w&feature=emb_logo*About the RolePart marketing manager, part brand manager this proven professional will propel the growth of our designer pet tag line of products and related lost pet service. Focusing solely on our pet tag offering, this role will act as the chief marketing strategist, planner and implementer, devising products, programs and campaigns that drive brand adoption and real sales lift.Only DocuPet allows pet licensees to choose from over 100 designer tag options and to know that each tag is supported with our free 24/7 HomeSafe_¢ Lost Pet Service. We donate a significant portion of the sale of each tag to our charitable animal shelter partners in each community. Now, more than ever, we need to grow this product line and use it to drive increased funding for our shelter partners, and propel our services into the hands of more communities in need of our help.We are expanding very rapidly expecting to nearly double the number of customers on our system in 2020. The selected candidate will begin the role conducting nearly all of the marketing functions related to our designer tag product line, but over time be able to add supporting specialists and other team members to increase the capacity of the department.What will our Designer Pet Tag Marketing Manager do? From planning to execution, analysis to relationship growth, this senior role will be responsible for:Maintaining brand integrity across all company marketing initiatives and communicationsGuiding product development and pricingConducting competitor and customer insights analysisPlanning marketing efforts to increase the value and performance of our design tag brandManaging the budget for advertising and promotional programs and campaignsDeploying successful marketing campaigns and owning their implementation from ideation to executionLeveraging a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels such as social media, online advertising, retail experiences, contest deployment, event management, publicity, and email campaignsProducing valuable and engaging video, graphic and written material that attracts and converts our target groups, with the support of our full-time videographerAnalyzing consumer behavior and adjusting email, event, retail, and social media, advertising campaigns accordinglyBuilding and leveraging strategic relationships with key partners (shelters) and vendors (veterinary clinics)Guiding and executing designer tag retail experiences each seasonMeasuring and reporting on the performance of marketing campaigns, gaining insight and assessing against goalsAnalyzing sales forecasts and relevant financials and reporting on product salesAttracting, training and managing skilled new team members with proven organizational and empathic leadership acumen*Role RequirementsTo be successful in this role, the candidate must possess the following attributes and skills:Attributes:*Keen brand awareness - a clear understanding of how brands are grown and the importance of a balanced marketing mixExcellent relationship management skillsExcellent communication skills - verbal and written, formal and casualA strong focus on results over ideasA high degree of business acumenA hands on attitude - being both analytical and hard-workingDemonstrable experience in marketing together with the potential and attitude required to learnProven experience in identifying target audiences and in creatively devising and leading across channels marketing campaigns that engage, educate and motivateAbility to think creatively and innovativelySkills:BSc/MSc degree in Marketing or related fieldProven marketing experience with at least five years in a similar roleIntimate understanding of traditional and emerging marketing channelsUp-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurementA sense of aesthetics and a love for great copy and witty communicationSolid knowledge of modern marketing tools including:Google AnalyticsGoogle AdwordsSocial Media Platforms (organic and advertising)Email marketing platformsGraphic editing toolsOffice productivity toolsExperience in setting up and optimizing online campaignsNumerically literate, comfortable working with numbers, making sense of metrics and processing figures with spreadsheetsExcellent references who can attest to the aboveYou are ideal for this role if:You enjoy people and animalsYou enjoy working in a team environmentYou aren_Ñét afraid to share your opinion and have _ÑÒtough conversations_Ñ that lead to clarity and a better future for you and othersYou are motivated by a start-up environmentYou enjoy coaching and supporting othersYou enjoy implementing and honing processes and proceduresYou find personal success in the success of those you supportYou think big and can execute at a national levelOur Mission and ValuesEach of us at DocuPet come to work each day to move our organization closer to its ultimate mission: to provide a safe and happy home for every pet. We take our core values very seriously knowing that we only work well with those who see the working world as we do.Go Big - We aim to do big things. We don_Ñét aim to impress ourselves, or those around us, we aim to be the very best anywhere. We accept all challengers and we intend to win.Whatever It Takes - We finish whatever we start. No excuses. It often means a lot of work, but it_Ñés worth it because we are the types who don_Ñét rest until the job is done.Inspire - Our people and our business inspire those around us. Each employee has a job to do, and they do it with excellence and grace. They bring joy to everyone they meet.Believe - Each of us is responsible for selling ourselves, our projects, our outcomes and our efforts. We must be individually and collectively convicted in our actions. We sell our ideas, our services and our products at every opportunity.Respect - We work as a team. We treat each other the way we expect to be treated. We listen to all opinions and voices taking time for those with quieter personalities and those who take time to collect and share their ideas are heard. We accept differing viewpoints and are an inclusive company.Know Your StuffCandidates are asked to submit their resumes along with a well-crafted cover letter outlining their relevant experience. To support applications, candidates may wish to review the following:DocuPet.com (https://www.docupet.com/) - Our consumer-facing websiteLearn.DocuPet.com (https://learn.docupet.com/) - Our municipality-facing websiteStanislaus.DocuPet.com (https://stanislaus.docupet.com/en_US/) - An example of a DocuPet Licensing Portal for Stanislaus County, CABenefits:Work from home opportunitiesReference ID: MM-1-FJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year

Title: Program Analyst
Company: Research Foundation of The City University of New...
Description: Job DescriptionGeneral DescriptionThe CUNY School of Professional Studies (CUNY SPS) provides online and on campus degree and certificate programs that meet the needs of adults who are looking to finish or transition into a bachelor_Ñés degree, earn a master_Ñés degree or certificate in a specialized field, advance in the workplace, or change careers.Home to the first fully online degree programs at the City University of New York, CUNY SPS offers fully accredited degree and certificate programs for students who want the flexibility and convenience of online education. CUNY SPS was ranked in the top 5% in the Nation in U.S. News & World Report_Ñés list of the 2020 Best Online Bachelor_Ñés Degree Programs.Drawing on CUNY's nationally and internationally renowned faculty and practitioners, as well as industry and education partners, the School's programs provide opportunities for personal growth, job mobility, greater civic participation, and new ways to advance knowledge.Within CUNY SPS, the Office of Professional Education and Workplace Learning (PEWL) designs custom workplace learning programs to help organizations achieve their goals. To our partnerships, we bring knowledge of research-based learning practices as well as experience in developing innovative programs.Description:Reporting to the Program Evaluator, the Program Analyst will develop a comprehensive training evaluation strategy and provide ongoing evaluation support for CUNY_Ñés project with the Department of Correction (DOC). The goal of this position is to assess training effectiveness in order to contribute to ongoing development and delivery of high-quality training products. To a lesser extent (30% of time), the Program Analyst will provide analytical support, as needed, on other CUNY training projects.Other DutiesDuties and Responsibilities:Assess current evaluation practices within the DOC Training Academy:Collaborate with DOC staff to conduct a survey of current evaluation methodologies, instruments and reports; assess for effectiveness based on principles of ISD, adult learning, and training evaluation theoryAssess evaluation capabilities of the LMS (Cornerstone)Synthesize findings and present recommendationsCreate a comprehensive evaluation strategy for the DOC Training AcademyConduct research to learn the organizational culture and context for trainingDevelop and formalize an overall approach to evaluation that is rooted in industry best practices and connected to DOC_Ñés key organizational goalsDevelop and systematize an evaluation process that includes standardized methodologies & tools, a data management system, a formal reporting structure, and a formal structure for process managementIdentify KPIs and create a system for tracking and collecting dataIdentity ancillary data, such as enrollment, and create a system for tracking and collectingCreate templates for standardized evaluation instruments (such as surveys)Create reporting templatesBuild collaborative relationships with key stakeholders at DOC such as upper management, Learning Team, IT & Systems, etc.Manage ongoing evaluation activities for the DOC Training AcademyDesign custom evaluation plans for different types of training coursesDesign custom evaluation instruments such as surveys, pre/post tests, focus group moderator questions, interview questions, checklists, and othersImplement evaluation plans, i.e., administer surveys, moderate focus groups, etc.Collect, analyze, and manage dataWrite reports and presentationsManage the evaluation process from start to finishRespond to ad hoc requests for data and analysis related to training and evaluationCoordinate strategy meetingsCreate professional development for DOC training staffDesign and deliver ë_ day evaluation workshop(s) introducing the Learning Team to the importance and value of evaluation, the relationship between evaluation and organizational goals, evaluation tools and methodologies, and reportingDesign and deliver ongoing professional development training, as neededOther duties:Support the PEWL Program Evaluator on evaluation needs and special projects across the PEWL unitManage and prioritize data and reporting requests from multiple disparate sourcesServe as a resource for data analysis and reportingStay current on training evaluation methodologiesOther duties as assignedQualificationsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor_Ñés degree required and at least four (4) years of full-time relevant experience in training evaluation, program evaluation, or training management/administration.Demonstrated experience in the management, manipulation, analysis and reporting of qualitative and quantitative data as well as interpretation of findings.Expert-level proficiency using MS Excel including the ability to merge, transform, and analyze data using formulas; and display data using charts and pivot tables.Demonstrated ability to generate descriptive statistics; identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in both qualitative and quantitative data; make recommendations based on findings.Experience in survey design, sample selection, and use of survey design software such as Qualtrics.Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to thoughtfully translate findings, both verbally and in written form, to colleagues and stakeholders.Demonstrated ability to provide exceptional client service by understanding the needs of internal and external stakeholders and responding with high-quality deliverables in a timely and efficient manner.Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and complex work environment.Demonstrated success in time and project management skills with the ability to prioritize competing demands requiring varied solutions.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge in the disciplines of program or training evaluation, monitoring and evaluation systems development, impact assessment and evaluation researchKnowledge of government operations, and/or human services programsExperience writing macros using Excel VBAExperience managing and querying databasesAbility to run and interpret inferential statistics such as statistical tests and correlations

Title: Senior Data Analyst M/WBE, Enterprise Data Services
Company: New York City MAYORS OFFICE OF CONTRACT SVCS
Description: The Mayor_Ñés Office of Contract Services (MOCS) oversees and supports the procurement activities of City agencies, with a goal to ensure fairness, transparency, efficiency and cost effectiveness. The Director is the City Chief Procurement Officer. Annually, agencies procure billions in products and services from a diverse pool of vendors that represent various industries. MOCS partners with industry groups to implement policies and tools that streamline and modernize procurement, resulting in the delivery of quality services to New Yorkers. Team members operate in a fast-paced, collaborative, service-oriented environment, where flexibility and ability to achieve results are valued.The incumbent will report to the Senior Data Lead of the Data Analytic Services (DAS) unit at MOCS. With wide latitude for independent judgment, the Senior Data Analyst will perform the following job responsibilities, which include and are not limited to:Managing data-related projects focused on the City_Ñés Minority and Women Business Enterprise (M/WBE) program and policy directives related to the City_Ñés M/WBE program.Manipulating and analyzing contracting data from city agencies in order interpret M/WBE utilization rates.Managing data-related projects which may include the Procurement and Sourcing Solutions Portal (PASSPort _ÑÐ one of the largest technology projects in the City of New York) and the Annual Procurement Indicators report, including agency Minority and Women Business Enterprise (M/WBE) utilization, local food purchasing, environmentally preferable procurement, requisitions, procurement cycle time, and compliance with other laws, executive orders, and policy directives.Collaborating with representatives from business, change management and integrations teams to develop and represent the capabilities of SaaS tools and provide input around solutions.Be willing to learn the business of MOCS _ÑÐ procurement and contracting _ÑÐ and regularly provide SQL-based ad hoc analysis as requested.Develop and maintain documentation around releases (both project and maintenance).Assisting in the documentation and standardization of current database environments and technical analysis.Minimum Qual Requirements1. Graduation from an accredited college with a baccalaureate degree; or2. Graduation from an accredited community college plus two years of experience with administrative, analytic, coordinative, supervisory or liaison responsibilities; or3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent plus four years of experience as described in _ÑÒ2_Ñ above; or4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and experience.Preferred SkillsA master's degree from an accredited college in economics, business or public administration, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, sociology, political science, mathematics, public policy, computer science or a closely related field; with at least one (1) years of related work experience, orA baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and demonstrated equivalent expertise in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization, with at least three (3) years of related work experience.Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL, R, Python or other programming languages with associated documentation.Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills; experience with empirical methods and data analytics including working with large, complex micro - data sets, building applied statistics or econometrics models, and/or conducting research.Familiarity with data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques desired.Ability to interface with all supervisory and frontline staff, including senior management and other respective stakeholders both in and outside government. Communicates effectively to non-technical teams.Ability to take initiative, prioritize duties, problem solve, work independently and within a team environment, pay close attention to detail, meet deadlines, do appropriate follow-up, work well under pressure and maintain an enthusiastic work ethic. This includes maintaining a positive and helpful attitude and a proven capacity in project management skills, including organizing and strategic planning.Proficiency in SQL Server, MS Excel (Pivot, Advanced functions: INDEX/MATCH, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, etc.), MS Access, MS Project, Visio and other products in MS Suite.Demonstrated experience with IBM Cognos strongly preferred; familiarity with other BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau valuable.Critical and proactive thinker willing to work in a dynamic environment strongly considered.Interest in New York City policy and operations, a plus.Additional InformationMayor_Ñés Office of Contract Services is an equal opportunity employer.Special accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities. To request an accommodation, please contact MOCS Disability Service Facilitator at disabilityaffairs@mocs.nyc.gov or 646-872-0231.Mayor_Ñés Office of Contract Services recognizes the unique skills and strengths gained through military service. Title: Data Analyst
Description: Empower Every New Yorker _ÑÓ Without Exception _ÑÓ to Live the Healthiest Life PossibleCome join the largest public hospital system in the nation! Every day, we work together to make an extraordinary difference in the health and well-being of each individual we serve without exception. Join our team and help us create a positive patient experience.NYC Health + Hospitals provides essential inpatient, outpatient, and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year in more than 70 locations across the city_Ñés five boroughs.Job DescriptionThe Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting patient health, demographics, and financial data from multiple data warehouses and converting them into an easily processed report that can be used by supervisors and workers in order to make decisions. He/she will be proficient in developing databases from the data acquired to generating performance reports. Using statistical methods and software, the data analyst is capable of performing research, conducting analysis, solving problems and improving the quality and accuracy of information.Duties and Responsibilities:Acquire, manage and manipulate data related to the health care industry.Identify trends and patterns in the performance of departments.Accuracy and duplication of cost figures can be identified.Improvise the administrative service effectiveness.Develop and generate reports and projections from the data that is captured.Explain technologies to the members of the health care unit so that they can use the technologies.Educate staff members about accessing databases to find health information.Required Skills:Excellent proficiency in generating crystal reports.Sound knowledge in excel, power-point and other MS office applications.Knowledge in Structured Query Language.Excellent skills in information set measurement.Ability to analyze and to prioritize tasks.Good at strategic planning and problem solving methodologies.Good oral and written communication skills along with ability to work in a team are required.Ability to work independently along with strong organizational and mathematical skills is required.Possess critical thinking and a can-do attitudeDepartment PreferencesA Bachelor's of Arts in Computer Science required. Master's degree in Health informatics or Health information Management preferred.Certification can be obtained from The American Health Information Management preferred.Knowledge of MS Access, SQL Server, Visual Studio and business objects are necessary. Possess knowledge in Medicaid and Medicare procedures along with NDC and ICD-10 coding procedures preferred.Experience with report writing and data analysis for a minimum of 3 years.Responsibilities1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $59,509.00 to $85,000.00 /yearBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planSchedule:Other

Title: Data Collector and Service Analyst
Description: ATC Healthcare is a medical staffing company that has been providing qualified personnel to clients for the past 35 years. We have an opportunity for an data collector/service analyst to work with the NYC Transit System on a 6 month project. The goals of the project is to work as the transit representative on a team comprised of police and social services to move the homeless population out of the subway system and into appropriate housing. The data collector's responsibility is to enter information into a dashboard and to act as the coordinator of information about the population numbers and their changes.Staff in these assignments will not themselves be required to directly canvas, engage with, or offer services to any homeless individuals; these roles are strictly observing, assisting and reporting support functions.This is a 12 month project that offers 8 to 10 hour shifts Monday through Saturday. This will involved working on subway cars throughout 4 boroughs of New York City (does not involve Staten Island). Metro cards will be provided.Job Responsibilities include:Documenting findings, recommending improvements, and identifying areas of weakness;Maintaining a quality environment for MTA customers and employees;Managing and responding to e-mail correspondences regarding assignments, locations, etc., as requested by Department of Homeless Services (DHS) administrators;Reviewing the day-to-day operations and administration of the field program, comprised of Social Service Outreach staff and MTAPD;Maintaining communication between MTAHQ field workers, OTDA, MTAPD and the transportation service companyMaintaining a weekly schedule of stations for observationBachelors preferred; Associates requiredATC Healthcare Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status or any other category protected by Federal, State or local law. Title: Business Analyst- Risk Management experience
Description: Our client is a growing banking association and payments company.The ERM Business Analyst supports the Enterprise Risk Management team in all aspects of the enterprise-wide risk management program. Responsibilities include executing the organization_Ñés ERM Framework, as well as facilitate interfacing with functional units to establish and communicate risk management methodology, processes, risk appetite and risk culture.This role will support leadership during a period of rapid organizational change and industry advancement, as well as technical efforts such increasing use of the Cloud. The role will ensure that the company appropriately prioritizes, manages and monitors risk by collaborating with several departments and defining risk ownership. A successful candidate will contribute to the Risk Management program by bringing experience and first-hand knowledge to the enhancement and ongoing execution of the ERM program.Essential Functions and Responsibilities:Contribute towards the design, development, implementation and execution of the ERM Framework in order to establish an effective risk-based system to identify, measure, monitor, report and control enterprise-wide risksBuild, maintain and enhance business relations with department and business stakeholders for the smooth implementation of risk management activities across the organizationSupporting the execution and ongoing enhancement of the company_Ñés RCSA program. Work as an educator and partner by facilitating FLOD execution and performing SLOD challengeChampion timely remediation of self-identified issuesIdentify, understand and assess Information Technology and other enterprise risks associated with the operational processesApply sound judgment in evaluating risks and controls; effectively challenge first line of defense on the identification and disposition of risks, and the adequacy of controlsPerform risk assessments to identify current and emerging key risks (operational, technology, etc.)Qualifications Required:Bachelor_Ñés degree in risk management, business administration, management information system, mathematics, finance, economics or a related area2-3 years_Ñé experience in a first or second line operational risk management program (preferably within Operations or Technology at a bank)Experienced in performing risk assessments, e.g. RCSADemonstrated success supporting enterprise-wide functions and projects, and multi-tasking on projects with competing prioritiesAbility and eagerness to understand (at a high level) existing and emerging technologies, and to work with technical teams in a liaison-like capacityAbility to understand management objectives, risk appetite, tolerances and impact of changes to risk profilesUnderstanding of the financial regulatory environment for the banking industry and payment systems spaceMaintain current knowledge of new regulations and emerging industry risks and report potential and/or actual enterprise impact to managementAbility to work independently and proactively; innovative, resourceful, results oriented, with appropriate judgmentQualifications Desired:Experience with internal and external loss data analysis and reporting, scenario analysis, emerging events, and post-mortem/deep divesWell versed in risk taxonomyFamiliarity with IT governance and controls, including governance and control frameworks, such as COBIT, ITIL, FFIEC, COSO or equivalent is a plus, but not requiredRSA Archer or other GRC experienceJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:business analysis: 1 year (Preferred)Operational Risk Management: 1 year (Preferred)Banking: 1 year (Preferred)Benefits:NoneSchedule:Monday to Friday
