Title: Sales Representative - Anti-Corrosive Protective Coatings
Description: SUMMARY: Heresite Protective Coatings is looking for a Sales Representative to sell protective coating application services to customers primarily in the HVAC industry. This person will develop a solid sales funnel of opportunities with new and existing customers and market segments through a multi-faceted sales approach. Target sales contacts are OEM's, manufacturers_Ñé representatives, dealers, and other direct manufacturers.We work within an EOS (Entrepreneurial Operating System) environment, so this person should be accepting of the model and understand the value of collaboration, accountability, and a well-defined strategy. This person must have the drive and discipline to make daily outbound calls to customers and clients, strong analytic ability, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. This position requires someone who has an inherent ability to listen to customer needs and problem-solve. A confident individual, with the ability to work both independently and collaborate with sales, research and development, and manufacturing staff, will be successful in this position.RESPONSIBILITIES:Connect with new and existing customers to build sales volume, assess market trends, and sell using Heresite_Ñés portfolio of solutions to fulfill customer needs.Research and identify new markets, customers, and industry uses for Heresite_Ñés products and services.Communicate effectively with customers on specific attributes of Heresite coatings and services.Perform client presentations and webinars articulating the value proposition of product, solution and service offerings.Identify, contact, and use multiple selling strategies such as internet research, CRM databases, cold calling, and appointment-driven sales to capture market data and project leads.Maintain files and records in a CRM on key contacts, competitors, and customers.Explore new business opportunities with leads generated from shows, incoming contacts, and researched items.Attend various trade shows and read publications to keep abreast of current market conditions and develop new customer relationships in the HVAC market.Generate quotes, troubleshoot application questions, and process sales for Application customers.Communicate in a timely manner with customers and internal personnel regarding standing (and future) customer needs and orders.Work effectively with company personnel to provide superior customer service by researching and troubleshooting customer issues and complaints.Support other functions and areas of the business as needed.QUALIFICATIONS:4+ years of demonstrated success selling industrial B2B products or services to OEM's, manufacturers_Ñé representatives, dealers, and other direct manufacturers.Experience in the manufactured goods, metal / surface preparation industry experience is highly desired.Experience selling projects over $10,000 to major accounts with a sales cycle of 2+ months.Bachelor_Ñés Degree in relevant discipline is preferred but not required.Ability to work on-site or remotely with 10-20% travel regionally and nationally (overnight travel 3-4 nights a month). If remote, must travel to Manitowoc, WI HQ office for training and on a quarterly basis.Strong hunting / business development background. Excellent follow-up, communication, and relationship management skills. Proven ability to manage and grow existing accounts.Desire to work within a structured, high accountability Traction EOS environment with defined mission, vision, purpose, values, and quarterly objectives.Willingness and ability to gain in-depth knowledge and understanding of Heresite_Ñés products and application process.Strong experience working within a CRM sales tool and defined sales process. Prior experience using Telenos and/or ACT is desired, but not required.Dynamic personality with strong work ethic. Keeps honesty and integrity in sight at all times. Driven, conscientious, energetic, and media-savvy.High level of computer proficiency _ÑÐ especially Microsoft Excel, Power Point, and web navigation.ABOUT HERESITE:Heresite Protective Coatings, located in Manitowoc, WI, is a privately-owned company with about 30 employees that operates on the cutting edge of the coatings industry. Title: RN Care Manager
Description: Duration: 9/22/2020Pay Rate: $40/hrResponsibilities and Duties:This job owns and conducts oversight over a specified panel of members that range in health status/severity and clinical needs. The incumbent assesses health management needs of the assigned member panel and utilizes data/analytics, in conjunction with professional clinical judgement, to identify the right clinical intervention for each member. The incumbent is supported by a multi-disciplinary team and uses clinical judgment to refer members to appropriate multi-disciplinary resources. In addition to identifying the appropriate clinical interventions and referrals, the incumbent manages an active case load of members in their panel that are enrolled in case management. The incumbent conducts outreach to members enrolled in case management including but not limited to: developing a care plan, encouraging behavior changes, identifying and addressing barriers, helping members to coordinate care, and identifying various resources to assist members in achieving their personal health goals. The incumbent monitors, improves and maintains quality outcomes (clinical, financial and functional) for the specified panel of members.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIESë Maintain oversight over specified panel of members by performing ongoing assessment of members_Ñé health management needs, identifying the right clinical interventions to address member needs and/or triaging members to appropriate resources for additional support.ë For assigned case load, create care plans to address members_Ñé identified needs, remove barriers to care, identify resources, and conduct a number of other activities to help improve the health outcomes of members; care plans include both long and short term goals and plan of regular contacts for re-assessment.ë Ensure targeted percentage of patient goal achievement (i.e., realization of member care plan), and other patient outcomes, as applicable, are achieved.ë Ensure all activities are documented and conducted in compliance with applicable business process requirements, regulatory requirements and accreditation standards.ë Maintain current knowledge and adheres to applicable CMS, state, local, and regulatory agency requirements and applicable standards of practice for case management including those published by CMSA and/or ACMA, as required by the organization.ë Other duties as assigned or requested.Required Qualifications:Educational requirements: Associates in NursingProfessional experience, skills and qualifications:7 years of any combination of clinical, case management and/or disease/condition management experience, provider operations and / or health insurance experienceRN license in DE.Written and verbal presentation skills, negotiation skills, and skills in positively influencing others with respect and compassionBroad knowledge of disease processesUnderstanding of healthcare costs and the broader healthcare service delivery systemProficiency in MS Excel and computer skills.Strong analytic skills with ability to interpret, evaluate and act on clinical and financial data, including analysis of statistical dataExcellent interpersonal/ consensus building skills as well as the ability to work with a variety of internal and external colleagues from all levels of an organizationAbility to work in a high performing team environment that requires flexibilityDemonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast paced environment. Excellent organizational, time management, problem solving, and project management skillsSelf-directed; self-starter, ability to work successfully with indirect supervision and moderate autonomyPreferred Qualifications:Educational requirements: Bachelor_Ñés Degree in NursingProfessional experience, skills and qualifications:Advanced training and experience in cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT), motivational interviewing or dialectical behavior therapy (DBT)Experience working with the healthcare needs of diverse populationsUnderstanding of the importance of cultural competency in addressing targeted populationsExperience working at either Quantum or AccoladeCertification in Case ManagementJob Types: Full-time, Temporary, ContractSalary: $40.00 /hourExperience:registered nurse: 4 years (Required)Case Management: 1 year (Required)License:Registered Nurse (RN) (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Nursing Degree:Associates Degree in Nursing (Required)Application Question:Do you reside and are Licensed in the State of Delaware?Schedule:Day shift

Title: Sales Engineer - Workforce Management
Description: Company Overview:Guided by a mission to help, ABILITY, an Inovalon company, is a leading information technology company helping healthcare providers and payers simplify administrative and clinical complexity by enabling data-driven improvements in healthcare. Through specialized, easy-to-use applications and data analytics that work together, customers of all types and sizes across the continuum of care _ÑÐ rely on ABILITY to help optimize reimbursement, care quality and staffing. To learn more please visit www.abilitynetwork.com or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube and Facebook.Job Purpose:The Sales Engineer II will function as the primary technical resource and trainer for the sales force. They are the key technical advisor and product advocate for ABILITY platforms and services. Must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. Function as the SME (Subject Matter Expert) to support sales productivity and opportunity flow. The SME collaborates with sales, engineering, and product management to ensure proposed opportunities include technical capabilities that accurately address customer needs. This position will also provide Sales Engineering support for a set of core products and services, but may have responsibility for getting cross-trained on other designated ABILITY products and will act as the point person for all new hire, release and refresher training content, delivery and storage/access.Responsibilities:Work in collaboration with the sales person, proactively scopes the technical solution required to address customer requirements, assesses customers_Ñé met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and present the greatest strengths of ABILITY.Coordinate closely with internal sales, sales support, and service resources to align solution design customers_Ñé business requirementsAct as the point person for all new hire, release and refresher Sales training. Develops training materials. Provides training, coaching and professional development, aligned with student_Ñés relational style, to sales team(s) in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills.Participate on sales calls to guide clients and advise prospects on how to best deploy ABILITY products and services in their organizationsBe able to assist in the troubleshooting of integration issues and implementation issues.Be knowledgeable about ABILITY products and services and best practices to help guide customers on how ABILITY services can address their business needs in their workflowParticipate and help drive the appropriate product, sales, and procedural training and certification to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position including intermediate products such as SECUREPAY and others.As needed, works directly with Marketing on all designated product Webinars and related sales campaigns, tradeshows and large group presentationsCollaborates with Product Management and other key stakeholders on product launch and all product releases to insure sales readiness with minimal supervisionTest all product releases in the sales demo system using engineering scripts as well as investigating logical ancillary product capabilities prior to release and alert Sales and Product Management of any potential risksFor assigned products, develop and deliver sales messaging including vision prompters, ideal customer profile, buying committee map, cost versus benefit analysis and other sales tools independently.Train sales team on assigned products and other designated products on product and sales messaging, product features, and product functionality independently.Develop certification checklists, scenarios and processes to implement and track all designated product demo certificationsIn partnership with sales leadership, inspect calls and determine needed refresher courses, mini workshops, or other training formats (i.e. computer based training modules for Discover LMS) independently.Partner with the Customer Operations trainer to ensure that all Sales, Support, Implementation, Account Management, and Success staff are appropriately trained to support the designated products. Provide improvement proposals to Customer Operations training.Respond effectively to RFPs/ RFIs. Develop processes, document/archive responses etc. to more efficiently respond.Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by managementAdditional duties and responsibilities as requiredMust comply with all company policies and proceduresMinimum Requirements:Bachelor_Ñés Degree (or commensurate experience of four or more years in a Workforce Management sales engineer, subject matter expert or user role)Three or more years of experience as an in-Patient Acute/Post-Acute/Behavioral HealthWorkforce Management systems user, sales, sales enablement or support personThree or more years in a customer facing sales or support role.Preferred Capabilities:Working knowledge of SPIN sales methodology, ability to develop financial and analytical tools such as Cost Benefit Analysis calculator.Familiar with typical Healthcare Workforce Management customer functions, workflows, terminology and challenges.Previous experience in sales enablement for a SaaS Healthcare Workforce Management companyOther:Self-motivated with strong organizational/prioritization skills and ability to multi-task with close attention to detail. Takes initiative to find improvement opportunities and develops better ways to complete tasks.Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Presents self effectively and professionally in a variety of environments including C-level customer or partner onsite meetings.Ability to work as part of a team to diagnose business problems in complex selling environmentsExcellent customer service and communication skills, including the ability to assess problems and communicate solutions.Ability to work in a fast-paced environmentAn analytical mind that can dig into client requirementsCultivates relationships with a broad range of functional stakeholders, understanding their perspectives and agendas. Able to work with and influence other departments, at all levels, to complete team projects taking into consideration the work styles of other team members.Regularly works with enterprise customers and or significant partners.Employs a mix of tactical and strategic approaches depending on the issue and circumstance.Able to discern and adjust approach to match customer or other audience learning and business style.ABILITY is headquartered in Minneapolis with principal offices in Tampa and Boston.We are committed to make ABILITY a great place to do great work, growing to benefit customers and employees alike.In the spirit of this commitment, we live by the following values:Help others: We are here to help - our customers and each other.Make it better: We continually improve and innovate to offer practical solutions.Do the right thing, always: We set and meet high standards in all that we do.Deliver extraordinary results together: We accelerate growth and achieve extraordinary results as a team.Travel: 20-40%Ability to travel nationally for tradeshows and/or customer site visitsJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $85,000.00 /yearExperience:Customer facing sales/support: 3 years (Preferred)Healthcare: 3 years (Preferred)Workforce Management: 3 years (Preferred)Sales Engineer: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Additional Compensation:TipsCommissionWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementPaid Training:YesSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Mortgage Quality Control Specialist
Description: Our client is a full-service mortgage banking company with over 15 years of experience inMortgage origination, processing and servicing. Their experienced mortgage professionals demonstrate exemplary service levels and operate under the credit union philosophy of _ÑÒpeople helping people_Ñ.Our client is seeking an experienced Mortgage Quality Control Specialist ( Contract-To-Hire). This position will ensure the compliance with Federal/State/Local/Investor regulations pertaining to all functions related to Quality Control. This position will ensure all approved loans comply which includes Federal, State, Local and Investor compliance forms also for reviewing the underwriters decisions for approving & denying loan applications and ensuring all documentation and conditions were cleared.Responsibilities Include:Review all loans to ensure compliance of Federal, State, Local requirements and Investor overlaysReview all Appraisals on Conventional and Government loans; including the preparation of the FHA Analysis of Appraisal Document, notating any comments, changes, corrections, and final value of property to be used for underwriting purposes and issuance of FHA conditional commitment. If not completed by the appraisal management company, the appraisal report will be required to be uploaded to the UCDP Portal. Complete the appraisal logging for all FHA reports in FHA Connection.Review a pre-determined percentage of the loan closings on a monthly basis for LQI Pre-Funding; which consists of a random and discretionary sampling.Review all loans for compliance, which includes Federal, State, Local, and Investor compliance forms. (Ex: Loan Estimate and Closing Disclosure, APR tolerance, company compliance forms)Analyze the Underwriter_Ñés final loan approval to ensure the proper decision was rendered. Title: Cyber Security Engineer
Description: THE COMPANYThe Tactile Group is an award-winning software development company that is designed to give a damn. We love civic-focused work and are committed to developing products that improve the lives of others. We are a purposely diverse team of talented professionals who continuously evolve by seeking inspiration in the world around us. We work collaboratively with our clients to achieve the objectives of each project through a system of constant communication, efficient project management, extensive research, expert deployment, and continuous improvement.*THE JOBThe Cyber Security Engineer position requires an individual with a broad skillset who is responsible for the creation, delivery, and management of security services across multiple projects. The Cybersecurity Engineer is responsible for the architecture, implementation and optimization of cyber security solutions. This position is expected to take ownership of managing all project lifecycle phases to plan, coordinate, document, and implement security for systems, applications, and technologies. This is a new position for a growing company; the successful candidate is expected to work independently to analyze existing and design new systems_Ñé security. This position reports directly to the Vice President/Chief Operations Officer.This position requires U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residence with current Public Trust 6C Federal security clearance or eligibility to obtain it.RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and implement information security plans and policiesDevelop and implement incident response plans and policiesInstallation and maintenance of firewalls, VPNs, data encryption, as well as other security products and/or proceduresConfigure, analyze, and coordinate responses to regular vulnerability scansImplement IT security standards and best practice policies and procedures using the NIST Risk Management FrameworkOversee continuous monitoring, annual security self-assessment, and third-party security assessmentsDevelop and implement risk mitigation strategiesManage standard security documentation including system description, technical description, system security plan, contingency plan, incident response plan, and other plans as required for security audits and obtaining an Authority to Operate (ATO)Oversee resolution of POA&Ms and update security documentationContribute to workforce training on security standards, policies, and best practicesMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSDegree in Computer Science, Cyber Security, or a related fieldDemonstrated knowledge and 3-5 years hands-on experience in information securityFamiliarity with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) security requirements, including FISMA, FIPS and SP-800 seriesStrong documentation, presentation, analytics and technical writing experienceKnowledge of tools used for vulnerability scanning such as NessusKnowledge of tools used for penetration testingKnowledge of tools used for IT forensics analysisAbility to identify critical risk factors that may impact a projectFamiliarity with cloud service providers and security practices: AWS required, Azure preferredExcellent organizational abilities, analytical skills, and communication skills; project management skills a plusHold or be able to obtain one or more of the following certifications:Certified Information Systems Professional (CISSP)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)Info Systems Security Architecture Professional (ISSAP)Info Systems Security Engineering Professional (ISSEP)ITIL Foundation certificationAbility to travel, less than 10% of timeAbility to be nice, even if they_Ñére having a crappy dayELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTSU.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident, with current Public Trust 6C Federal security clearance or eligibility to obtain itWorking at The Tactile GroupThe Tactile Group is an AA/EOE committed to the development of an inclusive, multicultural community. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, ancestry, national origin, or age.Tactile is a professional, creative, and highly collaborative group of self-motivated colleagues. Tactile offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including paid time off, health insurance, flex spending, 401K, and professional development opportunities.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $95,000.00 to $105,000.00 /yearExperience:cyber security: 3 years (Required)cyber security governance, policy, a&a / c&a: 3 years (Preferred)federal cyber security environment or it: 3 years (Preferred)cyber security specialist: 3 years (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Application Question:Are you a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident, with current Public Trust 6C Federal security clearance or eligibility to obtain it?Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleParental leaveProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to FridayNo weekendsCompany's website:www.thetactilegroup.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/TheTactileGroupBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Drafter II
Description: Summary: The McKee Group, a property management, home building, and real estate investment company, is seeking a talented and energetic individual who desires diversity in assignments and an opportunity for growth. The Drafter II plays a vital role in supporting the New Homes department and the Company as a whole.Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include:Provide routine drafting support.Prepare various drawings and schematics derived from a variety of specifications, layouts, blueprints, and sketches.Utilize established techniques, standards and tools like computer-aided drafting software to prepare technical drawings.Coordinate and consult with engineers, architects or designers to complete projectsEstimate and cost all plans. Title: Financial Analyst
Description: If you want to work for a fast-growing company, Accountemps is hiring dedicated candidates for a Financial Analyst position. You will manage financial modeling on a range of financial products as well as measure, analyze, and forecast performance in conjunction with operating plans in this position. You will be charged with being responsible for advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. You will be a part of a dynamic team being a key business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. This Financial Analyst role is based in the Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, area and is a long-term temporary-to-full-time employment opportunity. We seek someone who has internal drive and strong potential for professional growth and development.Key responsibilitiesReview annual performance by comparing actual results to their expectationsFacilitate effective Business Intelligence (BI) to provide forward-looking insight and decision supportDrive monthly reporting to business partners on financial results and actions requiredWork next to cross-functional partners in Accounting and Operations to execute against plansMaintain weekly, quarterly and annual Area/Segment-level Bookings and P&L forecastingAnalyze on topics such as: Retention forecasts, Campaign Planning & Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, event tracking and execution, strategic resource allocation, and prioritizationUnderstand and explain internal and external drivers impacting performance and trendingFlexible individual comfortable with large amounts of information and adept at managing expectationsWork with Accounting on the monthly and quarterly financial close processSpreadsheet and ERP system experience recommendedAble to build and deliver effective presentations to audiences analytics or in a similarly demanding and analytical role)Active problem-solver who listens for customer cues and actively resolves problems with grace and integrityKnowledge of SAPFinancial analysis experience preferredBudgeting experienceProficiency in general ledgerSolid understanding of Microsoft ExcelExcellent verbal, written, and social communication skillsExperience with financial data management processes & systems, e.g. Oracle/Hyperion/SAP Business Objects/SFDC/Tableau- Financial analysis & planning (go-to-market experience preferable)Bachelors degree in finance or a related field

Title: Cisco Data Engineer
Description: The Cisco Data Contractor is responsible for the installation, maintenance, and support of the data communications equipment and systems within our client and affiliated business units for connectivity requests and/or reported problems. The Cisco Data Contractor reviews, organizes, communicates, and records all requests for data services. Additional responsibilities and accountabilities include configuration of Cisco 9300 and 3850 switches, other data communications devices, design and implementation of local and wide area networking platforms, and problem determination knowledge in these areas. The Cisco Data Contractor is expected to review, organize, communicate, and record requests for service additions, deletions, and/or changes within our client. The Cisco Data Contractor also will provide technical assistance to departmental personnel, clients, vendors, and other parties as assigned to meet business requirements or provide continued network services.The Cisco Data Contractor works closely with all of our client's departments and business units, ISD departments and/or groups, as required, to meet business objectives, resolve problems, provide technical assistance in accordance with assigned responsibilities, and when necessary, coordinates with other telecommunications resources in carrying out the assigned responsibilities. This position also interacts with vendors and suppliers.Minimum RequirementsEducational/Knowledge Requirements:Acquisition of Core IT skills and knowledge via 3 years of Cisco communications infrastructure (Switching) design and support experience.Mastery of the essential basic knowledge base for an IT professional.Demonstrate thorough understanding of the fundamental tools and concepts of data network engineering and apply that understanding to make independent practical contributions to Network data infrastructure installation, support, and maintenance.Preferred Certification:Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA Route/Switch)Responsibilities- Provide service to ISD client community, patients, families and visitors, while protecting the integrity and confidentiality of all data and information through physical and electronic measures.- Perform site surveys with ISD and client representatives to insure complete and accurate record-keeping and project documentation for requested services, including wiring requirements in support of the client request, specialized power requirements in support of data and/or voice communications hardware. Provide technical assistance pertaining to guidelines and/or rules/regulations covering wiring systems and network infrastructure connectivity.- Maintain electronic documentation, as defined by the Manager outlining wiring and interconnection for all of our client's facilities, as approved by the Manager and/or the Director, ISD, including master and intermediate wiring closet configurations, cross-connection to data communications hardware (switches, routers, hubs, etc.), and other hardware as part of all projects and/or initiatives assigned.- Coordinate with other ISD departments or assigned group/person, on all requests for addition, relocation, and/or removal of required wiring to meet network client requirement(s).- Review all assigned network client specialized service requests, received through request notification systems and respond to client requests, within service level, providing information as to service(s) and lead-time to meet objective. Coordinate with client in service delivery activities and all requirements to meet the request, keeping the client current on the status of the service request (i.e. phone call, email, etc.).- Coordinate and support installation of data communications network hardware including, but not limited to routers, switches, hubs, servers, terminals, printers, personal computers, controllers, wireless access points, etc. as outlined and documented in assigned project(s) and/or initiative(s).- Plan, publish, maintain, and distribute technical documentation pertaining to the Data Communications network including pictures, procedures, practices, and problem determination guidelines as requested or assigned by the Manager, Data Communications, and/or the Director, ISD Technical Services Department.- Provide ISD Level II support services for problem calls escalated by the NOC and coordinate with personnel and vendors to resolve issues. Report back to the NOC on problem status until resolved.- Understand and explain network topologies, network hardware and protocols.- Troubleshoot network problems and knowledge of network troubleshooting tools (Wireshark/NetScout).- Assist with network sizing and network troubleshooting.- Assist with installation and support of networks, including LAN/WAN/WLAN systems.- Assist in the implementation and maintenance of data or voice and data communication networks.- Familiarity with Cisco network management toolset (Prime Infrastructure, APIC-EM, DNA Center is preferred)- Apprise project manager of status, schedule variances, and outstanding issues.- Control project costs and communicate any project-related expenses to project manager.Impact Consulting Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/V/DJob Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $70,000.00 to $85,000.00 /yearExperience:relevant: 3 years (Preferred)Contract Length:More than 1 yearWork Location:One locationMultiple locationsBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offVisa Sponsorship Potentially Available:No: Not providing sponsorship for this jobSchedule::Monday to Friday

Title: Supervisory Economist or Supervisory Statistician (Economics...
Description: DutiesSummaryThis position is located in the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Office of Field Operations, Regional Office, Division of Compensation Programs (DCP), Branch of National Compensation Surveys (BLS).This position is outside the bargaining unit.ResponsibilitiesThe incumbent manages a Branch of National Compensation Surveys (NCS). Incumbent has responsibility to direct and provide technical guidance and leadership to professional subordinate employees in the following areas:Improving survey non-response; assisting branch Field Economists in developing strategies for obtaining participation from respondents critical to the NCS indexes, multiple BLS programs or which have complex pricing practices or initiation procedures; leading, training and mentoring others; explaining survey findings and data uses; providing guidance on CIPSEA and the BLS confidentiality policy; exchanging information on developments; making presentation to interested groups regarding survey results.Researches/directs research and contacts with companies that have complex structures, maintain highly sensitive/confidential records, and usually require highly placed corporate officers; approval before preparation.Ensures the quality of the data collected by all staff through a comprehensive data quality program consisting of observational interviews, re-interviews, and scheduled reviews for multiple surveys.Ensures that changes in survey techniques or design are well understood and properly and promptly implemented by staff.Participates in NCS and Occupational Requirements Survey (ORS) developmental activities to better operationalize economic measures in the field as well as improve collection methodology for planning and directing the collection and processing of data from primary sources for the NCS and ORS. The person in this position provides technical oversight of the survey, conducts analysis of survey data, and prepares technical reports.The position is also responsible for:Directly supervising professional employees with a career ladder of GS-12, to achieve maximum efficiency while optimizing utilization of resources.Providing direction on all technical aspects of the survey to regional professional and support staff both in the collection and processing of data.Planning, developing, and conducting program specific training for professional and support staff.Evaluating staff performance and giving advice and instruction to individual employees on both operational and administrative matters.Travel Required25% or less - To attend training, meetings and work with staff employees in the field.Supervisory statusYesPromotion Potential13 - This position is at the full performance level.Job family (Series)0110 Economist1530 StatisticsRequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentAppointment to this position may require a background investigation.Requires supervisory probationary period if requirement has not been met.Must be at least 16 years old and an U.S. Citizenship.Requires a valid drivers license.Applicants must meet time-in-grade, time-after-competitive-appointment and qualifications requirements within 30 calendar days after the closing date of the vacancy to be eligible for consideration for selection.Federal Employees Please Note: Your SF-50 must include enough information to be able to determine that time-in-grade requirements have been met and reflects your position title, pay plan/series/grade, tenure and the type of appointment (i.e. competitive/excepted). In some cases you may need to submit more than one SF-50.Reference the "Required Documents" section for additional requirements.You may not be aware, but in the regulations for agency ethics programs, there are requirements for supervisors. Section 2638.103 of Title 5 of the CFR states:Every supervisor in the executive branch has a heightened personal responsibility for advancing government ethics. It is imperative that supervisors serve as models of ethical behavior for subordinates. Supervisors have a responsibility to help ensure that subordinates are aware of their ethical obligations under the Standards of Conduct and that subordinates know how to contact agency ethics officials. Supervisors are also responsible for working with agency ethics officials to help resolve conflicts of interests and enforce government ethics laws and regulations, including those requiring certain employees to file financial disclosure reports. In addition, supervisors are responsible, when requested, for assisting agency ethics officials in evaluating potential conflicts of interest and identifying positions subject to financial disclosure requirements.QualificationsBasic Requirements:Economist, GS-0110: A) Degree in economics, that included at least 21 semester hours in economics and 3 semester hours in statistics, accounting or calculus.ORB) A combination of education and experience - courses equivalent to a major in economics, as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education.Statistician (Economics), GS-1530: A) Degree that included 15 semester hours in statistics (or in mathematics and statistics, provided at least 6 semester hours were in statistics), and 9 additional semester hours in one or more of the following: physical or biological sciences, medicine, education, or engineering; or in the social sciences including demography, history, economics, social welfare, geography, international relations, social or cultural anthropology, health sociology, political science, public administration, psychology, etc. Credit toward meeting statistical course requirements should be given for courses in which 50 percent of the course content appears to be statistical methods, e.g., courses that included studies in research methods in psychology or economics such as tests and measurements or business cycles, or courses in methods of processing mass statistical data such as tabulating methods or electronic data processing.ORB) A combination of education and experience - courses as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. The experience should have included a full range of professional statistical work such as (a) sampling, (b) collecting, computing, and analyzing statistical data, and (c) applying statistical techniques such as measurement of central tendency, dispersion, skewness, sampling error, simple and multiple correlation, analysis of variance, and tests of significance.IN ADDITION TO MEETING THE BASIC REQUIREMENTS LISTED ABOVE:Applicants must have 52 weeks of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level, GS-12, in the Federal Service.Specialized Experience: Specialized experience is experience in, or directly related to economics or one of the specialized fields of economics. Specialized experience includes: (a) individual economic research assignments requiring planning, information assembly, analysis and evaluation, conclusions and report preparation; (b) supervisory or project coordination assignments involving a staff of professional economists, and requiring the evaluation and interpretation of economic information; or (c) teaching assignments in a college or university that included both class instruction in economics subjects and one of the following (1) personal research that produced evidence of results, (2) direction of graduate theses in economics, or (3) service as a consultant or adviser on technical economics problems. Experience in related fields that did not involve the use and understanding of economic principles and theories may not be used as qualifying experience for this position.EducationAny applicant falsely claiming an academic degree from an accredited school will be subject to actions ranging from disqualification from federal employment to removal from federal service.If your education was completed at a foreign college or university, you must show comparability to education received in accredited educational institutions in the United States and comparability to applicable minimum course work requirements for this position. Click Evaluation of Foreign Education for more information.Additional informationExplanation of Evaluation Factors (Competencies)All qualified applicants will be evaluated on the following key competencies:Team Building - Manages group processes; encourages and facilitates cooperation, pride, trust, and group identity; fosters commitment and team spirit; works with others to achieve goals.Conflict Management - Manages and resolves conflicts, confrontations, and disagreements in a positive and constructive manner to minimize negative personal impact.Accountability - Assures that effective controls are developed and maintained to ensure the integrity of the organization. Holds self and others accountable for rules and responsibilities. Can be relied upon to ensure that projects within areas of specific responsibility are completed in a timely manner and within budget. Monitors and evaluates plans, focuses on results and measuring attainment of outcomes.Customer Service - Balancing interests of a variety of clients; readily readjusts priorities to respond to pressing and changing client demands. Anticipates and meets the need of clients; achieves quality end-products; is committed to continuous improvement of services.Decisiveness - Exercises good judgment by making sound and well-informed decisions; perceives the impact and implications of decisions; makes effective and timely decisions, even when data are limited or solutions produce unpleasant consequences; is proactive and achievement oriented.Human Resources Management- Assesses current and future staffing needs based on organizational goals and budget realities. Using merit principles, ensures staff is appropriately selected, developed, utilized, appraised and rewarded; takes connective action.Influencing/Negotiating- Persuades others to accept recommendations, cooperate, or change their behavior; works with others towards an agreement; negotiates to find mutually acceptable solutions.Interpersonal Skills- Shows understanding, professionalism, courtesy, tact, empathy, concern, & politeness, even with individuals who are difficult, hostile, or distressed;Planning & Evaluation- Organizes work, sets priorities, and determines resource requirements; determines short- or long-term goals & strategies to achieve them;Product Oversight & Improvement- Knowledge of methods for researching/analyzing external products to determine their potential for meeting organizational standards & business needs.DOL seeks to attract and retain a high performing and diverse workforce in which employees_Ñé differences are respected and valued to better meet the varying needs of the diverse customers we serve. DOL fosters a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes collaboration, flexibility and fairness so that all individuals are able to participate and contribute to their full potential.Federal Employees Please Note: Your SF-50 must include enough information to be able to determine that time-in-grade requirements have been met and reflects your position title, pay plan/series/grade, tenure and the type of appointment (i.e. competitive/excepted). In some cases you may need to submit more than one SF-50.This is an interdisciplinary position and may be filled either as an Economist or Statistician (Economics).Refer to these links for more information: GENERAL INFORMATION, ADDITIONAL DOCUMENTATION, FORMER FEDERAL EMPLOYEESHow You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.Click here for Evaluation details. For Displaced Employees ONLY: if you meet the eligibility requirements for special priority selection under ICTAP/CTAP, you must be well-qualified for the position to receive consideration for special priority selection. ICTAP/CTAP eligibles will be considered "well-qualified" if they attain at least a rating score of 85.0 in a numerical rating scheme. Be sure to review DOL Account Eligibility Questions #24 and 27 to reflect that you are applying as an ICTAP/CTAP eligible and submit supporting documentation.Evaluation Factors (Competencies) - All qualified applicants will be evaluated on the following key competencies:Please see the other information section for explanation of competencies.The information you provide may be verified by a review of your work experience and/or education, by checking references and through other means (ex. interview). Your evaluation may also include a review by an HR Specialist or panel and may include other assessment tools (ex. interview, structured interview, written test, work sample, etc). The examining Human Resources Office (HRO) makes the final determination concerning applicant ratings. Your resume MUST provide sufficient information to substantiate your vacancy question responses. If not, the HRO may amend your responses to more accurately reflect the level of competency indicated by the content of your resume.To preview questions please click here.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceOtherDrug test requiredNoRequired DocumentsRequired DocumentsThe following documents must be submitted by 11:59 p.m. (ET) on the vacancy closing date. Warning: If you submit a document using the same document title, the 2nd submission will OVERWRITE the 1st submission. Also, do not upload password protected documents.The following documents are required from all applicants (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY):ARE YOU A CURRENT OR FORMER FEDERAL EMPLOYEE? If applying as a status candidate with current or former Federal Service, please provide a copy of your last or most recent SF-50, "Notification of Personnel Action_Ñ which shows your appointment eligibility for the position for which you are applying. Your SF-50 must identify the highest grade you held on a permanent basis, Pay Plan/Pay Schedule, Series, and Grade/Pay Band, and career status. Multiple SF-50 may be submitted to demonstrate your highest previous rate and eligibility.WARNING: An award SF-50 (ex. cash or time off award) may not indicate grade, step and competitive status. For current DOL employees, an award SF-50 DOES NOT indicate grade and step.Most recent performance appraisal/evaluation signed and dated within 18 months is requested by the agency, but will not disqualify candidates if not submitted. If not submitted during the application process, one may/will be requested at the time of the interview if the opportunity is extended. Applies to current and former Federal employees.Land Management Eligibles: a copy of your most recent Notification of Personnel Action (SF-50 or equivalent) proving your eligibility for appointment under the Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act. This service must have been performed in the competitive service, under a time limited appointment in a Land Management Agency, as defined by P.L. 114-328. For more information, click here.The following documents are required if applicable:- Displaced Employee Placement Documents - Only required if requesting priority consideration under ICTAP/CTAP Eligibility.- DD-214 - verifying military service, eligibility for consideration under the Veterans Employment Opportunity Act (VEOA) and showing character of discharge (ex. Member Copy 4 and 2 are acceptable vs. Copy 1 which is not acceptable to adjudicate veteran's preference)- Special/Non-Competitive Appointing Authority Documents - Applicants who are eligible for consideration, and wish to be considered, under one of the following non-competitive hiring authorities must submit appropriate documentation (click on the links below to see the documentation requirements):(a) Military Spouses (MISP)Cover Letters are not mandatory and will not be used to verify experience, but may be submittedApplicants selected for employment who are not current DOL employees will be required to provide proof of citizenship, and the E-Verify system will be used to confirm the employment eligibility of all new hires._ÑÐ Unofficial Transcript(s) (in English) - submit if using education as a basis for qualifying for this position. If so, you must submit all applicable academic transcripts demonstrating that you meet the qualifying educational requirements (ex. BA/BS, MA, JD, PHD, etc). If over 3 MB, please submit via fax feature.OFFICIAL Transcripts MUST BE RECEIVED prior to selection and report date. Reference the _ÑÒEducation Section_Ñ for College Transcript and Evaluation of Foreign Education.If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.BenefitsBenefitsA career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. We currently have a team on-site supporting multiple groups with their drive to deploy NextGen platforms and applications capable of powering real time analytics. The BSA will be part of a new squad focused primarily on delivering new functionality associated with Finance analytics. We_Ñére looking for candidates with excellent communication, interpersonal and documentation skills in addition to proven success collaborating effectively with both key business stakeholders and highly technical development teams.Ideal candidates will have solid SQL experience with end-to-end data experience including discovery, extraction, manipulation, blending, QA/validation and visualization. We_Ñére looking for smart, analytical people with a unique blend of technical aptitude and the polish required to partner with the business and deliver accurate and meaningful insights. SAP or Cognos knowledge is nice to have. The key quality we_Ñére looking for is adaptability _ÑÐ in other words candidates whom have a desire and passion for learning new technologies and the acumen to ramp up on new tools quickly. We_Ñére looking to hire self-starters that can thrive in a highly Agile environment and willing to perform any task that will help _ÑÉmove the ball down court_Ñé. Addition key skills can be found below.Qualifications:Minimum 2 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on building data products.Strong Finance knowledgeExperience in data wrangling and strong SQL skills.Proven ability to sift through data, perform analysis, identify critical information, and develop solution options is essential.Commitment to and hands-on experience in performing technical code reviews and data issue triage.Working knowledge of Scrum and agile principles.Demonstrated ability to think critically and seamlessly collaborate with data science and engineering partners.Strong presentation skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills.Familiarity with Tableau, or other data analysis/visualization packagesBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Stats, Business, or other relevant subject area.Nice to Have:Profitability and/or Margin Analytics knowledgePrior SAP or Cognos experienceCloud deployment or NextGen platform familiarityAbout BICPBICP is a leading-edge consulting firm focused on delivering innovative and transformative BI&A, Advanced Analytics and Big Data solutions to our customers. With deep experience across a diverse ecosystem of NextGen platforms, Analytics and Data Science applications we have the required product ambiguity and expertise to deliver truly best in breed solutions customized to our client_Ñés specific business needs.Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $120,000.00 to $130,000.00 /yearExperience:Business Analysis: 2 years (Required)SQL: 1 year (Required)Finance: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Benefits:Health insuranceThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureSchedule:Monday to FridayDay shiftCompany's website:www.bicp.comWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Operations and Policy Analyst
Description: Initial Posting Date:05/13/2020Application Deadline:05/27/2020Agency:Department of Human ServicesSalary Range:$4,312 - $6,294Position Type:EmployeePosition Title:Operations and Policy Analyst 2 - Foster Family Retention and Recruitment Champion (Washington County)Job Description:We want you to join our team!Do you want the opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of children in need of support? Do you want to be part of a diverse workforce that collaborates and learns from each other to improve services that support children, families and communities? T hen, we want to hear from you!A champion can be defined as someone who supports or defends a cause. They advocate, promote, uphold, support, back, and stand up for others. That_Ñés just what our Foster Families and their supporting Communities need! We are excited to announce that our Foster Care and Youth Transitions Unit is hiring 1 (one) permanent Foster Family Retention and Recruitment Champion (Operations and Policy Analyst 2) to serve Washington County. This position will be supervised from the Central Office Child Welfare Program in Salem; however, the position will work from the official workstation in the local DHS office in Hillsboro.The main purpose of this position is to primarily serve as the lead role to improve retention and recruitment outcomes for foster families in their local communities. We are looking for highly motivated people who are energized at the thought of engaging a diverse community, finding creative ways to build infrastructures of support for foster families and leading local teams around a shared vision; a vision where someday we will have an abundance of safe, affirming, well-trained, supported, diverse and thriving quality foster families that reflect the characteristics of children in care and are equipped to meet their unique needs.We stand at the edge of the beginning of something great for our Foster Families, children in foster care and our Communities. Are you the right one to take that next step with us? If so, we_Ñéd love for you to apply.Our Mission"To help Oregonians in their own communities achieve well-being and independence through opportunities that protect, empower, respect choice and preserve dignity."ABOUT THE PROGRAMFor more information on Child Welfare programs pleaseFoster Family Retention/Recruitment Champion Program VideoWHAT YOU WILL BE DOINGThe purpose of this position is to primarily serve as the lead role to improve retention and recruitment outcomes for foster families in local communities. They will be responsible for managing, planning organizing and leading assigned projects, programs and activities to enhance the retention, recruitment, support and engagement of resource families and community partnerships. This position will also actively participate as a member of the District Management and the Central Office Foster Care Programs' leadership teams and local committees. This position will also lead efforts to research, develop, train and establish a customer service approach which fosters and promotes all elements of RiSE, DHS_Ñé organizational culture, to include: Safety and Well-Being, Caring and Supportive Relationships, High Expectations and Accountability, Meaningful Participation and Community Engagement. Efforts should also align with DHS_Ñé service equity framework and uphold the core values and overall mission of the agency.This position is responsible to serve as liaison and leader between DHS and Foster Families as well as various public, private and non-profit organizations locally and statewide. This includes collaborating, coordinating and communicating with Foster Families and District Management leadership teams to assure necessary information, data and program policies and rules are being shared, as well as participating in group efforts and committees with community partners and other key stakeholders.The Foster Family Retention and Recruitment Champion is responsible for monitoring performance, evaluating findings and data, and preparing comprehensive reports and recommendations for the Central Office Foster Care Program and District Management teams. The Foster Family Retention and Recruitment Champion will be responsible for facilitating and coordinating the development of local Oregon Foster Family Retention Recruitment and Support Diligent Recruitment plans which are a driven by data with a customer service approach to the retention, recruitment and support of resource families. The reports created, managed and tracked through this model will go to inform DHS Child Welfare Annual reports.This position is responsible for the creation, facilitation, and leadership of local Action Teams to ensure certain projects progress on schedule and within prescribed budget and timelines. This position will interpret complex regulations and adapt or design new policies and procedures. The work requires communication and coordination with the field and state office staff and analysis of information and data from a variety of sources and geographic locations. This position is responsible for maintaining effective working relationships with DHS Child Welfare line staff, DHS management, Central Office staff and community groups. They monitor the program outcomes, evaluate results, recommend and implement program improvements.The Foster Family Retention and Recruitment Champion provides leadership to staff and partners through communicating DHS values, developing a positive, constructive organizational culture and stimulating creativity, innovation, diversity and teamwork. The individual in this position also actively seeks to achieve the DHS goals of integrity, stewardship, responsibility, respect and professionalism.WORKING CONDITIONSThe employee in this position is managed from the Central Office Child Welfare Program in Salem; however, will work from the official workstation in the local DHS office in Hillsboro. Time spent outside the office will be significant as the employee participates in community meetings and planning sessions, seeking resources and services for resource families and providing presentations. Some local travel is required for meetings, training, or consultation, including meetings outside the assigned counties, including monthly travel to Salem. The employee must have a valid driver_Ñés license or an acceptable method of transportation. The person in this position must be able to operate a personal computer and must be able to work in a normal office environment associated with noise from surrounding area. Regular attendance is critical to the performance of the job. The employee may be exposed to and need to deal with a range of emotionally charged issues/situations. This may require conflict resolution skills and facilitation skills.WHATS IN IT FOR YOUWhen you join the Department of Human Services, you join a community of nearly 10,000 employees dedicated to Oregon_Ñés most vulnerable population. Career growth and development is encouraged through ample training and committee participation opportunities. The State of Oregon offers excellent benefits, including low-cost, high-coverage health insurance , generous time-off, and a competitive retirement plan .THIS IS WHAT YOU NEED TO QUALIFY:To be considered for an interview, you must submit all required documents and your application material must reflect that you meet the requirements.A Bachelor's Degree in Business or Public Administration, Behavioral or Social Sciences, Finance, Political Science or any degree demonstrating the capacity for the knowledge and skills; and two years professional-level evaluative, analytical and planning work.OR;Any combination of experience and education equivalent to five years of experience that typically supports the knowledge and skills for the classification.***Resume is Required***Requested Skills/Desired Attributes:The most qualified candidates will possess the following attributes, skills, and areas of experience as they relate to the position:Excellent Organization, Prioritization and Multi-tasking Skills.Ability to work without constant supervision.Ability to mobilize and engage community partners/people.A fair understanding of data analytics, evaluation and reporting.Ability to think creatively and outside the box, Ability to make data informed decisions and problem solving.Experience working in diverse, multicultural and inclusive settings.Additional Requirement:Finalists will be subject to a computerized criminal history and abuse check. Adverse background data may be grounds for immediate disqualification. Successful candidates for this position must pass a Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) fingerprint-based background check and maintain CJIS eligibility. Due to CJIS requirements related to system access, the following convictions are likely to result in being disqualified for this position: Felony Convictions, Computer theft, identify theft and fraud. CJIS Clearance is done at the conditional job offer.Requires valid driver_Ñés license.HOW TO APPLYExternal Applicants: Click on the _ÑÒApply_Ñ button and submit your application. View this video for help.Internal Applicants (this includes Current State of Oregon employees): Apply via your employee Workday account. View this job aid for help.GET NOTICEDYour candidate profile, cover letter, and resume are the perfect opportunity to highlight your interest in the position and showcase the amazing skills and experience, making you the best candidate for the position. The work experience and/or education section of your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet all the minimum and special qualifications listed above. We do not accept a resume in place of the completed application. For additional tips, please visit the Oregon Job Opportunities page, Resources for Job Seekers .HELPFUL INFORMATION:To receive Veterans' Preference, you must complete the required Task that will be sent to you through Workday and will be located under your account profile. This Task will prompt you to provide the appropriate documentation for your Veterans_Ñé Preference point selection.For questions about documentation, please visit: Veterans Resources or call the Oregon department of Veterans_Ñé Affairs at: 1-800-692-9666.Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. Applicants who require VISA sponsorship will not be considered at this time.This position is represented by the Service Employees International Union (SEIU). Note: this recruitment may be used to fill future vacancies.For questions about the job duties or application process, please contact theresa.souza@dhsoha.state.or.us . Please be sure to include the job requisition number.If you need an accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) to participate in the application or selection process, please contact our office at DHS.RECRUITMENT@dhsoha.state.or.us .Have questions about Workday, and want some tips on understanding the state application process? Check out this link: https://www.oregon.gov/jobs/Pages/support.aspx .DHS commits to inclusive excellence by advancing equity and diversity in all that we do. We are an affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer and encourage applications from members of historically underrepresented racial/ethnic groups, women, individuals with disabilities, veterans, LGBTQ community members, and others to help us achieve our vision of a diverse and inclusive community.

Title: Medical Records Technician- Multnomah County,OR
Description: Job SummaryAbout Advantmed:Founded in 2005 and based in Santa Ana, California, Advantmed, LLC is a healthcare information management company that helps health plans and managed care organizations optimize revenue and improve quality outcomes.Advantmed partners with managed care organizations to deliver the optimal combination of capabilities unique to each organization needed to achieve the objectives, including risk analytics, software containing NCQA-certified HEDIS ëå measures, medical record retrieval, medical record abstraction, risk adjustment coding and provider education.For immediate response, please apply on the link below :https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=995&company=advantmedi&username=Responsibilities and DutiesJob Role & Responsibilities: Medical Record TechnicianTravel to various medical facilities and hospitals assigned by the company's MRT logistics team to scan patient records. This position is seasonal and part to full time, with the possibility of extension based on project needs. Technicians will use a company laptop and portable scanner to retrieve sections of medical records which will be uploaded into a database.This is a great "foot-in-the-door" position for those looking to be involved in the emerging Healthcare & Technology industry.Qualifications:* Must have a current State Driver_Ñés License* Must have a personal vehicle and current insurance under your name* Clean Motor Vehicle Record* Must have internet access at home* Must be willing to drive at least 80 miles* Must have excellent PC skills and familiarity with office equipment usage such as scanners and flash drives. Knowledge of file copying, sharing and transfer is required. You will be working with various EMR systems and will need to be comfortable navigating software that is unfamiliar to you.*Must have intermediate knowledge of medical chart structure, content and medical terminology.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* Compliance with maintaining confidentiality of patient health information* Strong professional presentation skills* Excellent organizational skills* Excellent written and oral communication skills* Ability to lift and carry up to 25 pounds* Ability to work independently and under some pressure to meet deadlines* Ability to identify elements of a medical record's structure and content* Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills* Having a smartphone with a GPS is a huge help for navigating and job-related communicationsFor immediate response, please apply on the link below :https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=995&company=advantmedi&username=Pay Rate:$11.25 hourly OR $1.75 per chart depending on performance. We also provide mileage-based reimbursementsJob Types: Temporary, ContractSalary: $11.25 /hourExperience:senior caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)caregiver: 1 year (Preferred)med tech: 1 year (Preferred)caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)cna: 1 year (Preferred)

Title: Business Analyst 3
Description: Business AnalystOur client, a leading Pacific Northwest utility provider, is looking for a Business Analyst for their Portland, Oregon location. This position will provide analysis and development of capital projects management processes procedures, and policy recommendations. Utilizing analytical, modeling, process, and data management expertise, this position will support the improvement portfolio execution and delivery. This role primarily supports capital project proposal function and processes and will be expected to gather and analyze data as needed to inform capital decisions. In addition, the work will include analyzing process performance and gaps, gathering requirements, documenting processes and procedures, and assisting with implementation of the new capabilities.This position is a one-year contract with the opportunity to renew on an annual basis. It also includes employee benefits! If you think you_Ñéd be a good fit, we want to hear from you!Responsibilities of Business Systems Analyst:Support the development of project proposals.Analyze and develop budget reports for management using existing capital, expense, and operational data.Draft and present high-level strategic planning documents and supporting analysis to management, stakeholders, and executive level leadership for review and approval.Draft and recommend project management, change management and project plans supporting security and continuity proposals and business cases, addressing stakeholder sponsorship, communication, training, budget needs/constraints, and resistance management.Conduct cost analysis and provide supporting documentation for a wide variety of projects.Provide support to Program Management staff in developing Balanced Scorecards and Integrated Program Review to include analysis of performance objectives and metrics.Provide expertise with business process modeling techniques to recommend incorporation of new business drivers and roles and responsibilities within a project or program.Requirements of Business Systems Analyst:Bachelor_Ñés degree in Business Administration, Management, Accounting, Computer Science, Engineering or a closely-related field is preferred.With an applicable Bachelor_Ñés degree 6+ years of experience is required.With an applicable Associate_Ñés degree: 8+ years of experience is required.Without a degree, 12+ years of experience is required.Experience should be consistent with the specific requirements of business analysis and progressively more technical in nature.Experience providing budget tracking, analysis and execution principles.Direct work experience and knowledge of program support/project coordination experience, demonstrating strong ability to interpret requirements and apply judgment to ensure policies are compliant with regulations.Strong technical writing skills _ÑÐ Position requires executive level written documentation including requirements, business cases, agency decision framework, process diagrams, systems design, and production support guides.Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude.Intermediate proficiency in Visio (flowcharts), MS Project, Access, Power BI and SharePoint.** We are unable to accommodate corp to corp candidates **All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status.(AH8176)Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $64,866.00 to $68,889.00 /yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) MatchingDental InsuranceHealth InsurancePaid Time OffVision InsuranceExperience:business analysis: 8 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Schedule:Monday to Friday
