Title: Director Paid Digital Advertising [Virtual/Job Share]
Description: Director Paid Digital Advertising Position Description [Virtual/Job Share]Position OverviewThe Director Paid Digital Advertising holds a key position in our service delivery group as it relates to paid advertising. Strong or expert knowledge of several disciplines is a must, including Search Engine Marketing, Paid Digital Advertising, Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Website and Landing Page Development, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO). Demonstrated thought leadership within the industry is essential.This role is for a seasoned business leader who understands how agencies work, in addition to having a broad understanding of various B2B and B2C business models employed by our clients, including revenue/cost structures. This is a doer/management position that includes both executing development and management of paid digital advertising programs, as well as overseeing day-to-day activities of employees and contractors, so a proven ability to deliver results through others is a must. In addition to managing a handful of clients yourself, you would hire, train, coach and monitor day-to-day activities and prepare employees for their next opportunities. As a manager and a leader of our organization, you are expected to demonstrate a continual growth in your knowledge and skills so as to enlarge DirectiveGroup_Ñés industry authority position. Demonstrated thought leadership in digital marketing would be a plus, as you would help lead all DirectiveGroup employees to grow our company by writing articles for internal and external blogs, speaking at conferences and seminars, making content updates to our corporate website, writing proposals and preparing presentations, networking and referring new clients, etc.To do well in this role, you will require:Expert knowledge in paid digital advertising, including all aspects of attaining strong performance, as well as sufficient knowledge about other digital marketing tactics.Strong capabilities in people management, from identification of appropriate resources, to hiring, coaching and managing, so as to attain strong performance and a high retention rate.Strong client relationship management and outstanding representation of company and industry in small settings and large venues, including fostering an industry-leading POV.Strong organizational leadership and culture-building capabilities that facilitate a high performing team built on the principles of excellence and mutual support to attain outstanding, industry-leading performance.Strong capabilities in project management, process management and all internal administrative processes that underlie a consistently strong performance.A significant plus would be very deep hands-on digital experience, previous agency ownership experience, a broad and well-seasoned business background and top tier consulting background. For such a candidate, there is a medium-term partnership opportunity with an earned equity share.You would be setting the cultural tone with this role. We are a virtual company, so you_Ñéd be joining a team self-starters that are very disciplined and organized. Our positions are fast-paced, so the ability to multi-task and self-manage is of crucial importance. We ask for a lot from our team, but for these hardy souls, we offer some degree of flexibility in hours, dependent primarily on the needs of assigned clients. In addition, we seek to build an environment of learning that includes _ÑÉfast failing_Ñé to get to the top faster and a mutually supportive space for trying new things with a proper risk-mitigation mindset that fosters application of thoughtful solutions vs reckless behavior.After one year of service, all employees are encouraged to dedicate up to five percent of their time to assist non-profits that meet our company criteria. All employees are required to possess a computer with the latest version of MS Windows OS & MS Office Productivity Suite, as well as sufficient internet capacity for a VoIP phone.Compensation: $75K - $90K annually FT (50-60 hrs), including performance bonus, based on skills and experience. This position starts as a PT role and if desired may expand to FT once performance goals are attained within 3-6 months.Outcomes: First Six MonthsSuccessfully develops and executes growth plans for clients under management (by self or others on your team) to meet performance goals of at least 20% growth YoY in measures of individual client performance across all (integrated) program tactics, within two months of start.Expertly oversees the development of DirectiveGroup strategies, including development of tactics within domains of expertise, and subsequent authoritative presentation and implementation of these strategies that achieves targeted performance goals, within two months of start.Conducts Paid Advertising Audits that uncovers opportunities and problems, and presents to existing and prospective clients in an authoritative and persuasive way to achieve goals of winning ongoing business.Manages employees and contractors to attain performance while achieving meaningful professional goals that contribute to their professional development and wellbeing, within three months of start.Follows project and process management best practices to deliver all in-scope requirements within given timeframe and within given hours, for self and all managed resources, within four months of start.Leads thought leadership internally and externally to build the DirectiveGroup brand and to generate interest in our services, including assisting sales in attaining at least one new client each month, within six months of start.Skills Required to Achieve SuccessDigital Marketing & AdvertisingThinks strategically about business, has strong business model understanding across multiple industries, but can connect business growth strategies to specific digital marketing programs.Consistently demonstrates deep expertise in paid digital and social advertising methods, is well-versed in trends and historical knowledge and has thought-leadership insights that can be communicated clearly internally & externally.Deep capabilities to complete or direct analysis of budgets, bid management, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Deep capabilities to complete or direct the completion of strategy-based documentation and associated tactics plans that include well-thought out, phased approaches, resources and costs to deliver.Is well versed in new opportunities within domain of expertise and is able to identify, develop and implement high-value productized offerings.Understands conversion optimization theory, including how to effectively lay out landing pages and websites, as well as how to develop strong direct marketing content.Has substantial level of knowledge of website development process, from a functional and usability standpoint, and can communicate ideas effectively with programmers.Understands how to measure performance and has expertise with Google Analytics and other Web Analytics and data visualization tools and programs.Has broad general industry and market skills that are applied to understand what each client must achieve to consider program a success.Has an informed level understanding of various programming languages and what they are used for, servers and web hosting, and internet security issues.People Management, Leadership & Executive Management SkillsHas maturity and demonstrated managerial knowhow to oversee day-to-day activities of direct report employees, even in a virtual environment, so as to deliver superior results.Provides excellent training and coaching that measurably improves results of peers, colleagues and direct report employees.Assures client programs are executed in an expert, timely and professional manner and that results are always above market average.Can train and coach direct reports to expertly manage multiple client projects, including developing and executing on strong plans with goals, milestones and priorities to finish projects on time, at budget and with high quality.Delegates and co-manages effectively to internal and outsourced resources.Provides thought leadership within DirectiveGroup and within industry.Participates in the development of company strategy and tactics.Proven effectiveness at achieving company goals through individual efforts and by leading and orchestrating the efforts of others.Achieves client attainment, retention and loyalty goals.Demonstrates strong capabilities of resource management for cost/efficiencies goals.Brings good judgment and broader perspective to highly charged and active environments.Assures process and automation compliance within DirectiveGroup team.Rallies the team around becoming individually certified in various programs, continually developing deepening expertise and enthusiastically growing new domains of expertise.Client Leadership & Management SkillsMonitors attainment of performance goals of all client programs on an ongoing basis.Can complete analysis of budgets, ROI, cost per lead and more, as needed to evaluate client advertising and marketing programs.Is able to communicate to each client at his or her level of knowledge, and sufficient such that it is clearly understood what we are doing and why, including management of client expectations.Can lead client and our team through the planning, set-up, initiation and ongoing programs.Manages well through conflict and is able to diplomatically tell the client what s/he needs to know and not just what s/he wants to hear.Understands the importance of _ÑÉvalue perception_Ñé to achieve client loyalty and can effectively help our clients understand the value of what we do for them.Understands the online advertising and marketing opportunity for client_Ñés business and can lead general business discussions or interviews to identify specific opportunities for the client.Is able to sell upgrades and program improvements, either independently or in concert with a sales executive (for larger recommendations).Takes ownership, has strong initiative and is self-directed and can deal effectively with ambiguity, change and complexity.Qualifications6+ years SEM & Paid Digital Advertising complex program set-up and management across companies of multiple sizes and industries, in local, regional and national markets.5+ years_Ñé experience managing and leading employees, preferably virtually.2+ years Paid Social Advertising experience with both B2B and B2C companies.Completed undergraduate degree with outstanding credentials.Post graduate degree and/or professional designation an asset.Strong business acumen and experience in communicating with Executives at larger companies and Owners/CEOs and smaller companies.[Preferred] Experience within a digital marketing agency as an owner or working with larger brands as a _ÑÉSolutions Architect/Director_Ñé or _ÑÉBusiness Strategist._Ñé[Preferred] Published author or renowned conference speaker on areas of expertise.Personal CharacteristicsLeads co-creation of a culture that supports our vision, built on two pillars: 1) accountability and ability to debate ideas and 2) creation of a trust-based _ÑÒsafe_Ñ environment that supports all team members.Strong organization skills and project management skills.Superior written and verbal communication skills.Excellent meeting facilitation skills.Demonstrates superior leadership skills, confidence and a high level of maturity.Loves working with people and facilitating personal growth.Demonstrates extremely effective managerial and oversight skills.About DirectiveGroupWhy we exist: To help growing companies become industry leaders such that they are the first and only option in the mind of their customers. We provide the surety of a big digital marketing agency, yet deliver results with the mastery, commitment, and passion of an in-house team.DirectiveGroup is a digital marketing agency that creates a unique and powerful online presence for each of our clients so as to deliver extraordinarily high results. We specialize in developing or revitalizing high-converting websites, strategies, marketing artificial intelligence, search engine marketing and optimization, content & social media marketing and email marketing.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $75,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Management : 5 years (Required)Paid Digital Advertising Program Management: 6 years (Required)Education:Master's (Preferred)License:Google Ads and Bing (Required)Application Question:Please provide information about digital marketing industry published works or conference presentations in last 3 years.Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homeFlexible scheduleThis Job Is:A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applySchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.directivegroup.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Yes

Title: Senior Internal Auditor
Description: The Avangrid Lead Internal Auditor is a self-motivated, adaptive, quick learner who can manage and prioritize an evolving workload in a fast-paced environment. This person will be an individual contributor who must be able to develop relationships throughout the company to facilitate the audit programs that he/she will execute and accomplish the mission set forth by the Audit & Compliance Committee of the Board of Directors. Excellent communication skills are a must in this position. The Lead Internal Auditor is responsible for performing audits from the annual Internal Audit Plan, which includes operational, financial, regulatory, and compliance audits. This role will report to the Manager of Avangrid Renewables Internal Audit.Employee has access to Avangrid and operating company records, properties, and personnel; freedom to appraise policies, plans, procedures and records relevant to the subjects under audit and review; make recommendations to strengthen controls, improve operating effectiveness, and increase efficiency.MAJOR ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Performs audits, using data analytics where applicable, to verify accuracy and ensure compliance with plans, policies, and procedures proscribed by management, develops the audit scope, evaluates risks, develops an effective audit program, and performs the audit testing.Adequately explains and documents all audit testing, findings and recommendations.Drafts the audit report summarizing the audit findings, exceptions, and recommendations for oral and written audit reports to management. Summarizes audit findings and preliminary recommendations, with appropriate indication of risk, for review with the Manager of Internal Audit for clarification of facts.Performs testing to evaluate design and operational effectiveness of SOX internal controls.Evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of controls and identify internal control weaknesses and participate in developing the recommendations for cost-effective solutions in an effort to ensure that Avangrid and operating company assets are safeguarded, accounting records are accurate and in accordance with GAAP, Company policies, procedures, and legal and regulatory obligations are adhered to.Provides assistance to external auditors, when applicable, related to SOX internal control testing reliance.Conducts follow-up reviews on audit finding recommendations and management actions. Participates in ongoing reviews that track and appraise the implementation of the audit recommendations.Gathers and reports data for measurements of audit benchmarking capabilities and improvement effort priorities.Periodically works with a diverse global team on specific multi-national audits.Skills and RequirementsAbility to plan, organize, and communicate effectivelyAbility to collect and analyze dataGood problem-solving skills and sound independent judgmentDemonstrated effectiveness in collaboration and working with othersAbility to work independently with limited direction and guidanceExperience as an auditor in a public accounting or industrial firm is preferred. Knowledge of audit standards, procedures, techniques, and internal controls. Proficient in accounting and management principlesKnowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) internal controls testing and documentation requirementsEducation & Experience Required:Bachelor_Ñés Degree required5-10 years of experience in an auditing, accounting or related field preferredKnowledge of engineering and relevant utility experience preferredExperience with auditing public company SOX internal controls is preferredExperience with Data Analytics tools is preferredCertifications:CPA, CIA and/or CFE certification is strongly desired but not requiredCompetenciesDevelop Self & OthersEmpower to growCollaborate and ShareBe a role modelFocus to achieve resultsBe agile#INDMLJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $65,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:internal audit: 5 years (Preferred)utility/renewables: 5 years (Preferred)Additional Compensation:BonusesBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failSchedule:Monday to FridayOtherCompany's website:www.avangrid.comWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Social Media / Marketing Manager
Description: We are looking for a talented and versatile Social Media/Marketing Manager to join our team to promote our Chrome Extension, App and website. Please download FatCoupon extension at Chrome store before you apply to understand our business ( https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/fatcoupon/cakejefemdjbmhdjkjhibjhmhgjefidm ).FatCoupon Extension, App and website provides a one-stop shopping solution for customers, allowing customers to automatically scan and apply millions of coupon codes in our database at checkout. Our website provides daily hot deals and coupons to customers. This person will be responsible for the overall goal of promoting our brands, increasing App and extension downloads, and retaining customers.This person will ensure content posted on social media platforms is engaging and cohesive and goes live on a regular and timely basis across all key platforms. The candidate will use performance data to iterate and evolve social media content for higher levels of engagement both in real time and testing for future initiatives. The candidate must be highly creative with exceptional editing and writing skills and have experience with video and photo editing software and tools such as Photoshop, InDesign, Adobe Illustrator, OBS and Streamlabs.Job Responsibilities:Under general direction, plan and execute the social media content and branding strategy in support of our general goalsAnalyze performance data on a regular basis to make improvements to content creation and communicate findings and best practices in a daily, bi-weekly and/or monthly report.Develop and execute a content strategy for all social media accountsContinuously develop fresh ideas for content, campaigns, and contestsResponsible for analytics and reportingActively monitor social media trends and best practices, delivering insights to Title: Security Solutions Architect
Description: Non-Union PositionIS Security & Analytics; Portland , Oregon (US-OR)Regular FTPosting # 144The Role:You will be accountable for proactively and holistically leading or supporting security and EA activities that create deliverables that guide the direction and development for technological responses to disruptive forces and driving targeted business outcomes. Technologies will include business applications, cloud security solutions, severs, security technologies, and industrial controls systems.In this role, you would provide the leadership, facilitation, analysis and design tasks required for the development of an enterprise's security architecture. They create deliverables that help develop target-state guidance (reusable standards, guidelines, individual parts and configurations) for evolving information security across the enterprise, in order to enable business strategy and manage risk. They facilitate and orchestrate the delivery of targeted business outcomes through technical decisions and within alignment of the security and EA practices to ensure a cohesive solution is provided. Day to Day:Work with EA, security peers, and other stakeholders to analyze the enterprise business context (business strategy and trends), as well as change requirements in other enterprise architecture viewpoints (such as business, information and solution) to derive the security architecture future state. This includes defining the requirements, principles and models that guide technology decisions for the enterprise.Understand security trends and the practical application of existing, new, and emerging technologies to enable new and evolving business and operating models.Demonstrated experience in assessing risks and defining security strategy enterprises based on those risks.Demonstrated experience in architecting, designing, implementing, and managing security for highly available, resilient systems (physical, virtual, cloud).Drive digital innovation by leveraging innovative new technologies and approaches to renovate, extend, and transform the existing core technology base and IT estate.Define high-level plans to address the gaps between the current and future state, typically in sync with the IT budgeting or other capital planning processes.Lead the analysis of the current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement. In addition, lead the analysis of technology industry and market trends to determine their potential impact on the enterprise as well as on the enterprise technology architecture.Coach, mentor and collaborate with technical subject matter experts and EA peers to develop a security architecture that enables and drives new business capabilities and operating models.Assist with designing the governance, assurance and standards activities associated with ensuring enterprise security architecture compliance.Oversee, or consult on, technology implementation and modification activities (for example, projects), particularly for new or shared security solutions.Oversee and facilitate the research, evaluation, and selection of hardware and software technology and product standards in the security area, as well as the design of standard configurations.Identify the organizational impact (for example, on skills, processes, structures and culture) and financial impact of the enterprise technology architecture.Document necessary enterprise security architecture design and analysis work, possibly including project postmortem documentation and metric collection.Understand, advocate, and augment the business and IT strategies. Be prepared to "sell" the enterprise information security process its outcome and ongoing results.Reports straight-line to the Senior Manager for Information Security and IT Compliance with a dotted-line to the Director of Enterprise Architecture.Collaborate with business constituents, other EA team members, project teams and staff in various IT functional areas as needed to fulfill the responsibilities described above. Come on your first day with:Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experienceMinimum of 10+ years of design and implementation experience in IT, with a deep knowledge in of the following technical disciplines: security architecture and design supporting enterprise level application environments, middleware, servers and storage, database management, and IT operations.3 + years of experience with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS)Working knowledge of security solutions and Active Directory at the enterprise level.Working knowledge of current threatsExposure to multiple, diverse technical configurations, technologies and processing environmentsSkillsExcellent interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiationStrong leadership skillsExcellent analytical and technical skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent planning and organizational skillsKnowledge of many, if not most, aspects of an enterprise security architectureKnowledge of information principles and processesKnowledge of financial models and budgetingUnderstanding of infrastructure and application architectureUnderstanding and knowledge of system development life cycle methodologies (such as waterfall, spiral, agile software development, rapid prototyping, incremental, synchronize and stabilize, and DevOps)Understanding and knowledge of IT Service Management (ITSM) and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL Foundations Certification is required within 90 days of hiring) (TOGAF and CISSP certification are encouraged, but not required)Knowledge and understanding of different modeling languagesUnderstanding and knowledge of IT standards and controlsCompetenciesAbility to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations and how they relate to achieving targeted business outcomesAbility to estimate the financial impact of technology alternativesAbility to apply multiple technical solutions to enable future-state business capabilities that, in turn, drive targeted business outcomesAbility to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of existing, new and emerging technologies that enable and drive new business designs and modelsDemonstrated ability to work well with others and be respected as a leaderOrganizationally savvy, with understanding of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate obstacles and politics.Ability to balance the long-term (big picture) and short-term implications of individual decisionsMotivated and driven by achieving long-term business outcomesTeam player and collaborativeWhat we offer:Arguably the most competitive healthcare and wellness benefits in the Pacific NorthwestMeaningful Annual Incentive Bonus Opportunity in addition to base salary401(k) with generous match and additional 5% employer contributionCompany provided Trimet or C-Tran passes/Bike storage for cyclistsGreen Team / Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council / Safety Team / Women_Ñés NetworkNumerous volunteer and community engagement opportunitiesEmployee Stock Purchase Plan with a 15% discount20% Employee discount on Natural Gas7 Paid Holidays and up to 3 floating holidays to add an extra paid day off to Holidays Observed by NW NaturalFlexible work schedule opportunitiesBase salary range: $105,650.00 - $146,300.00 per year, depending on qualificationsDeadline: May 29, 2020All applications must be submitted through NW Natural_Ñés Electronic Application System. Resumes submitted via email, fax or mail will not be accepted in lieu of an electronic application.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any federal, state or locally protected class.We are a drug free workplace and we comply with Federal Drug Free Workplace Act and Department of Transportation regulations. Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
Description: Date: May 2020Position Title: Digital Marketing Specialist Based: Portland, OregonTimeline: NowApplicants: We are only interviewing candidates within 25 miles of Portland, Oregon. At Applied, we provide design-analysis-manufacturing software, training and consulting services that adds value to our clients_Ñé business. We are looking for someone that can be our digital voice and communicate our vision to a diverse and technical client base.Position Description: Digital Marketing SpecialistOur engineering services and software company is looking for an entrepreneurial-type creative design and marketing professional. Your job will be to help us develop brand identity and design cutting-edge graphics for our web sites. Most importantly, you will be our innovative, go-to person for helping us take our engineering graphics and technical prose and turn it into eye-catching landing pages, presentations or one-page pdfs for our clients. We want effective graphics that will generate business. We expect you to move quickly and be part of our team in developing leads from your artistic creations, whether for engineering services or software sales. If one were to divide up the tasks, the percentage might be 50% creative design and 50% marketing. The marketing part assumes that you enjoy light web page work along with an understanding of SEO, Google AdWords and web metrics. Besides your heavy hitting with Adobe Illustrator, you will be putting together email campaigns, mocking up trade booths and developing presentations with our engineering team.The candidate should have reference work in:ë Working with technical sales and engineers, take their content (tip/trick videos, webinars, learning sessions) and clean it up, brand it, and post to websitesë Coordinate, create, author, and send quarterly newsletterë Manage and Develop content and text for website updates/posts/news/announcementsë Post and keep social media (LinkedIn, Instagram) sites up to dateë Graphic design for web sites, presentations, brochures (pdf) and other business graphic mediaë Marketing experience with email blasts and managing databases (e.g., constant contact)ë Understanding that message delivery requires many touches and a disciplined approachë Web page design, layout and modification for the technical community with demonstrated ability to quickly modify existing web pagesë Experience with Google AdWords, SEO, web analytics, mailing lists, CRM (e.g., salesforce) and creating a targeted mailing listë Being part of a team that must hit schedulesCritical Competencies and RequirementsBA/BS degree5+ years creative design work with portfolio2+ years of marketing work with examplesDedicated and enthusiastic toward helping us be the best in our fieldWork Environment and BenefitsWe offer a relaxed work environment within a beautiful office in SE Portland. You will have state-of-art tools and you will be an integral part of our engineering team. The compensation package for this position is a base salary with the expectation that 20% or more of your compensation will come from assisting the sales team hit their metrics. This latter component means that you should enjoy advocating your digital work via search engine optimization and ensuring that your newsletter is getting traction via kick-ass leads coming in for the sales team. Very simply, you should be excited that part of your compensation is due to your initiative, hard-work and cleverness. It is simple; as we do better, you will directly share in this success. We also offer medical benefits, 401k plan, a bike-to-work program with a cash incentive of $500/year for those that ride to work more than 50% of the time and we encourage healthy lifestyles with stand-up desks (up or down _ÑÐ your choice) and free gym / boot-camp passes. We also provide paid vacation and sick leave.Who We AreWe represent three companies: Applied CAx, Predictive Engineering and Sherpa Design. Applied and Sherpa won awards last year for being among the 100 fasting growing companies in Oregon. Applied also won VAR of the year award from Siemens PLM Software. Our companies believe in a holistic approach of life, family and business. Description: Software ArchitectBased in Portland, OR, we are a well-funded, innovative business process automation company that specializes in SaaS accounts payable automation. We have exceptional leadership that prioritizes providing a great working environment for its employees.Due to growth and demand for our services, we are in need of hiring a Software Architect with extensive experience with C#/.NET, TypeScript, MySQL, AWS, and React or Vue.The right candidate will help design and build our next generation AP automation system, as well as leveling up our unit test coverage. You will also be mentoring and providing the vision to our development team.Additionally, experience with the following is a HUGE plus, but not required: Node or GolangIf you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high profile position.Top Reasons to Work with UsCompensation:$120,000 to 175,000 Base + 401K, Benefits, Bonus, Flex Times/PTOPTO:Flex Time/ 3 weeks PTOGrowth:Huge opportunity for career and personal growthOpportunity:Opportunity to make SaaS application architecture decisionsWhat You Will Be DoingProvide technical leadership, vision, direction, and mentoring for the development teamCollaborate effectively with engineers, analysts, product managers, senior management and other internal groupsCreate the technical architecture for multiple SaaS products, and help with the implementation of those designsParticipate in the development of data analytic methods and tools, to help drive insights into customer data.What You Need for this Position10+ years of software development experience in multi-tiered, enterprise application systems5+ years of C#/.NET experience5+ years of JavaScript/Typescript3+ years of leadership experienceExperience configuring and scripting infrastructure on AWSExperience with modern JS frameworks such as React, Vue.js, Angular, etc.Experience with modern SQL databases like MSSQL or Postgres.Experience with Golang or Node.js a plusSo, if you are a Software Architect with experience, please apply today!Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Your Right to Work _ÑÐ In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Title: VP Sales & Marketing
Description: The Director of Marketing is responsible for creating strong digital marketing strategies, execution, and driving sales results. This position grows Marketing180's revenue, presence, and conversion on both Shopify and channel partner websites by defining goals, setting best-in-class digital strategy, and leading a team to develop integrated customer experiences and generate sell-out velocity.Duties and ResponsibilitiesE-Commerce Strategy Development & LeadershipCreate and lead a team to craft the overall eCommerce Channel strategy for the organization, driving direct online sales growth across the businessIdentify & implement opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell buyers within the customer journeyLead and own the development of all online merchandising strategies and execution to drive engagement and commerce on Shopify, Amazon and Channel Partner websitesImplement a plan to create, manage, and optimize product listings so that Brother stands ahead of the competitionDrive focus for our U.S. eCommerce Channel Partner business, integrating multiple teams/functions, and mobilizing resources within Brother (sales and product teams, customer experience center, etc.) to support business objectivesLead the direction of Amazon AMS/AMG campaigns, marketing programs and A+ content development through strategy, implementation, and success metricsBuild the capabilities for the eCom and Amazon content team to drive innovation on various Brother Channel Partner websitesEnsure that all Brother communications are compliant from an IP, legal & product team perspectiveFind and vet agencies to help Brother with our endeavorsE-Commerce Operations, Analytics, & Continuous ImprovementDevelop appropriate analytical framework, reporting, and tools to measure ROI and track effectiveness of all merchandising, marketing, and operational effortsBuild processes and calendars to communicate merchandising plans to various teams across the organizationManage all content publishing, ensuring quality and accuracyDevelop and execute testing roadmapBuild a culture for continuous learning through on-going testing, measurement, and optimization on marketplaceSet KPIs to measure effectivenessPartner with managers to report on performance, insights and optimizations on a periodic basis to all levels of the organizationManagementOverall management of staff, ensuring assignments and duties are completed as requiredCompose and conduct performance reviewsProvide guidance, training, mentoring, coaching and developmentMake recommendations regarding hiring, promoting and terminatingQualificationsEducationA Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent experience) in Business, Marketing, Communications, or related field is requiredExperienceA minimum 10 years' experience is required in the following areas:Leading or directing a marketing & E-Commerce function for a mid-sized organizationExtensive experience working directly with Amazon as well as with retailers_Ñé ECommerce platformsExperience leading and managing teamsExperience with AMS/AMG campaigns with a proven track record of strategy, implementation, and success metricsSoftware/Technical SkillsIntermediate level knowledge and proficiency is required in :Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)Proven Analytical skills (web analytics & reporting tools)Other Required Skills/Knowledge/Abilities*Extensive knowledge of eCommerce marketing platforms, best practices, and industry standardsExtensive knowledge of Amazon Media Group (AMG) and Amazon MarketingServices (AMS) campaigns, with a proven track record of strategy, implementation, and success metricsAbility to lead cross-functional eCommerce business initiatives from concept through implementation, with quantifiable resultsDeep knowledge of category management/merchandising functionsStrong digital project management skillsStrong communication & presentation skills (verbal & written)Ability to build strong relationships across the organization and externallyAbility to coach/manage multiple employees, teams, and outside agenciesJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $85,000.00 to $200,000.00 /yearExperience:Phone sales: 1 year (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Benefits:None

Title: Social Media Marketing Manager
Description: We are looking for a talented and versatile Social Media/Marketing Manager to join our team to build entertainment live-streaming content for the the future.Artslandia Happy Hour Live was created to explore new types of entertainment and bring the best of performing arts together in a virtual community. To build on our momentum, we want to add to our team a passionate and experienced candidate with developing a unified branding scheme, providing timely social media content plans, calendars and editorial while understanding the priorities of holistic promotional campaigns.This person will work to ensure content is engaging and cohesive and goes live on a regular and timely basis across all key platforms. Unafraid of numbers and analytics, the candidate will use performance data to iterate and evolve social media content for higher levels of engagement both in real time and testing for future initiatives. The candidate must be highly creative with exceptional editing and writing skills and have experience with video and photo editing software and tools such as Photoshop, InDesign, Adobe Illustrator, OBS and Streamlabs. The applicant must have extensive technical knowledge of both software and hardware related to live- streaming.Successful applicants will also produce live video streams on platforms likeFacebook Live and YouTube Live. They will collaborate with the team to plan their activities, messaging, and discussion for content creation. This position also involves constructively and positively engaging with the audience, and evaluating the performance of episodes and initiatives using analytical social tools.Job Responsibilities:Under general direction, plan and execute the social media content and branding strategy in support of the Partnerships and Social Media goals.Develop and nurture relationships with Artslandia partners/ambassadors stimulating enthusiasm and cooperation in social engagement to support and promote AllSocial campaigns and events and other activities.Implement an engagement strategy that focuses on initiating conversations, building a rapport and influencing follower and partner behavior.Analyze performance data on a regular basis to make improvements to content creation and communicate findings and best practices in a daily, bi-weekly and/or monthly report.Manage social media video [e.g., live streaming, IG Live, FB Live, Twitter,Live, etc.] including set-up, filming and editing.Coordinate department-wide campaigns and event-based promotions.Work with Publisher to establish and maintain an authentic social voice that enhances Artslandia_Ñés brand, increases the effectives of social media strategies and improves the partner and follower experience.Develop and execute a content strategy for all social media accountsCreate a comprehensive social editorial calendar - to promote and optimize content that resonates with our various customer segmentsContinuously develop fresh ideas for content, campaigns, and contestsResponsible for analytics and reportingActively monitor social media trends and best practices, delivering insights to drive continuous improvement and reinvestment strategiesDaily management of social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, which includes creating, editing and publishing content to platformsRespond and engage with comments and messages on social media channels, ratings, and reviews, etc. in a timely manner and monitor public conversations via a listening platform to identify opportunities to amplify our brandFlag potential issues and alert stakeholders and/or develop action plans and responses as appropriate, including partnering with customer service to escalate and resolve issues/inquiresDevelop and execute a comprehensive influencer marketing strategyIdentify and pitch influencers and media partners to participate in regional campaigns.Create a clear plan for every influencer campaign to ensure optimum service + maximum leverage . Plan and execute experiential events for influencers and partners to showcase our brands/productsIdeate and develop unique contentDevelop a strategy for paid social advertising needs (content creation, photo edits, copy review, etc.)Create the marketing strategy and go-to-market plans for key channels with data based insights on the most effective marketing channelsDetermine how viewers interact with our programming and use this to inform marketing plansCreate customer lifecycle marketing plans that target marketing to customers at various phasesInnovate with new marketing tactics and channels to ensure we are on the cutting edge for how customers discover our programsPartner with cross-functional teams and external agencies to ensure execution of marketing and project management excellenceDemonstrated ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize marketing and activation initiatives.Demonstrated ability to think both strategically and tactically.Exceptional interpersonal, communication (spoken and written; including experience of reviewing results with senior management and working in a global team setting) and influencing skills and an ability to navigate a complex and unstructured cross-functional environment.Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, excellent attention to detail and good business judgmentRequired Qualifications:Minimum of 3 years of experience in social media branding.A minimum of 3 years of live video production and post-production experience in a professional environmentMinimum of 1 year experience in production / video editing experience.Minimum of 1 year of experience with performance data analytics.Bachelor_Ñés Degree in Social Media, Marketing, or Communications or equivalent experience.Strong communication skills, both written and verbalProficiency with OBSExperience with multi-camera live switchingExcellent work ethicMeticulous attention to detailPositive attitudeJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 /yearExperience:social media: 1 year (Required)search engine optimization: 1 year (Required)social media marketing: 1 year (Required)marketing: 1 year (Required)video editing: 1 year (Required)Additional Compensation:CommissionWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offSchedule:Monday to Friday8 hour shiftCompany's website:https://artslandia.comWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Vice President of Operations _ÑÐ High-Growth, Global, SaaS/Tel...
Description: Vice President of Operations _ÑÐ High-Growth, Global, SaaS/Telecom/Cloud Startup Portland, ORSince 2007, Acumen is proud to be a leading boutique, woman-owned Executive Search and Leadership Solutions Partner in the Pacific Northwest with global reach. We deliver high-impact results and higher than national average retention rates while nurturing genuine, long-term relationships. Acumen works shoulder to shoulder with our clients to deliver customized, meaningful, and proven leadership solutions empowering organizational success.Our client is a team of telecom and network software professionals that help keep businesses connected to the Cloud. They are a well-funded, mature startup and are experiencing rapid growth both domestically and internationally. They are seeking a Vice President (VP) of Operations with both IT and business operations capabilities and of course, experience managing rapid growth, preferably within an entrepreneurial environment. The Vice President (VP) of Operations reports directly to the CEO. Compensation package to also include competitive bonus, stock, and a full suite of benefits.From their cutting-edge technology with extraordinary relevance in current day Pandemic times (and beyond), to their 3X growth in just a few years, to sales throughout Europe and Asia, to their Microsoft accelerator invitation, to their down-to-earth, collaborative culture of heartfelt service, this company is well-positioned for their next huge leap of growth.The Vice President (VP) of Operations will act as the _ÑÒConductor_Ñ between IT Ops and Development (DevOps). They will also straddle more strategic Business Operations focused on strategic planning, implementing efficiencies, and new ERP systems - and the day-to-day management of IT (internal and public-facing), supply chain/fulfillment, and network engineering and network support teams.This is a great opportunity to have major impact on the success of the organization; the culture is entrepreneurial and open to ideas, strategies, and general best-practices. The Vice President (VP) of Operations is a critical member of the leadership team within the organization, so solid executive-level communication skills as well as a high degree of emotional intelligence are required.If you:Have experience scaling a high-growth, startup.Are experienced in leading network operations/engineering and technical support teams in a public-facing IT services environment and want to also influence Business Operations.Have Telecom/VOIP, CDN, Networking Software, SaaS, Cloud, datacenter, IoT and/or other Internet-facing industry experience.Are a hands-on business strategist who possesses solid engineering expertise in networking and Internet routing (understanding of how specific network issues affect application performance)Have an understanding of supply chain, vendor management, and managing physical inventory.Embrace working in an always-changing, entrepreneurial environment with attractive upside potential.Are comfortable with both owning and implementing ERP systems.Are process and analytics-driven.Are skilled in implementing the day-to-day nuts and bolts of network operations, engineering, and support functions.This opportunity may be for you.As the Vice President (VP) of Operations, you will be responsible for:Partnering with the Executive Team on all operational and strategic issues as they arise; providing strategic recommendations to the team based on today_Ñés operations and to plan for future changes. Participating in the ongoing strategic planning process as an integral member of the executive team. Providing relevant and appropriate business analytics to the leadership team so they may effectively manage their areas of responsibility and be aligned with the financial management of the company.Position SummaryTeam and OperationsAct as a strategist while hands-on contributing on key projects for this small but growing team.Train, develop, challenge, mentor, encourage, correct, and reward team members to ensure the health and success of each person on the team.Leverage your strong knowledge of business and IT DevOps practices to implement and maintain processes across the organizational chart _ÑÐ in some cases, directly lead efforts and/or collaborate with other team leaders.From Quote to CashUltimately responsible for the rapid processing/provisioning of equipment and services once the sale is complete.Drives the process of quickly and efficiently turning sales into billing services through internal and customer-facing project management working collaboratively with the customer, provisioning teams, and sales teams.Sets up on-prem network equipment accurately and ensures timely shipment to customers, exceeding customer and sales partner expectations.IT Systems and ProcessesOwn Internal IT systems and processes.Oversee and provide support - from laptops to ERP systems, including key security considerations such as IS policies and network security.Ensure IT system and process have solid strategy behind them and needs are met.Work in collaboration with other teams such as finance and sales for ERP needs.Develop and network teams for security.Supply Chain and FulfillmentWork with ODM Vendor from design, sourcing, and fulfillment of network equipment.Maintain strong relationship with key vendors and providers.Supply responsibilities include receiving, inventory, and shipping.Strategic and growth plans on equipment, processes, and team members.Network and Support Leadership (Strongly preferred)Leadership of network development, operations, and tech support.Providing and overseeing customer success and support teams.Troubleshooting all bottlenecks to support customers.Strategically guiding technical and engineering teams.DevOps oversight for scalability.Support Sales and Marketing teams on delivery promises.Minimum QualificationsAt least 10 years of experience leading and scaling tech business operations, with some of that as part of a high-growth venture-backed startup.At least 2 years of experience leading physical IT operations in a public-facing IT environment, such as a datacenter, internet carrier, CDN, or other service provider.Experience implementing and managing internal-facing IT tools, including ERP systems, CRM systems, and data analytics systems.Experience managing physical inventory, shipping, and receiving.Knowledge of and experience implementing IT Service Management practices such as ITIL.A passion for serving customers and team members in a humble and consultative manner.Demonstrated care for and experience in the professional and personal development of team members.Strong ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical people in written and spoken English.Self-starter approach to identifying and accomplishing goals.Basic understanding of networking and internet fundamentals.Basic understanding of information security.Ability to be on-call for escalation matters.Ability to travel occasionally (a few times per year).Bonus QualificationsExperience sourcing and managing relationships with ODM network device vendors.Experience managing information security (Infosec) teams, policies and/or systems.Project management experience.ITIL or other IT Service Management certification (a plus).KeywordsNetwork, Network Systems, Network Engineering, Operations, IT Operations, Business Operations, Vice President, VP, VP of Ops, Director of Ops, Leadership, DevOps, Development Operations, Cloud, Telecom, VOIP, Datacenter, SaaS, CDN, DNS, IoT, Supply Chain, Logistics, Physical Goods, Fulfillment, Warehouse, Shipping, Provisioning, ERP, Netsuite, ODOO, IT Support, Technical Support, IT Support. Enterprise Systems, ERP, CRM, Customer Service, Customer Success, Project Management, Project Manager, Engineering, Strategy, ODM, OEM, Vendor Management, ITIL, IT Service Management, entrepreneurial, venture-backed, information security, security, Infosec, startup, scalingProcedure for ApplyingTo apply or see our other positions available, please go to:https://www.acumenexecutivesearch.com/job-posts/ to submit a resume and brief cover letter indicating your interest in the opportunity.If our current open positions aren_Ñét the right fit for you and you_Ñéd like us to share relevant opportunities, please send your resume and a brief cover to info@AcumenESearch.com.

Title: Now Seeking Account Resolution Specialists
Description: Now seeking Account Resolution Specialists (Customer Service Reps) to join one of the largest bank in the industry! This is a full time opportunity with advancement + benefits!Pay: $14.25 to start, $20+ once you're a permanent employeeLocation: Hillsboro, ORJob Description:Assisting 70-100 calls daily regarding deposit accounts (checking, savings, business)Responsible for providing a quality customer experience while working to collect and negotiate terms of repayment on outstanding account balancesProvide exceptional service while being empathetic when evaluating customers situation to provide relevant solutionsQualifications:General customer service experience (call center, retail, restaurant, fast-food, etc)Good analytic skills with high attention to detail and accuracyStrong telephone etiquette skillsAbout Aerotek:We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing ëå Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions.

Title: Supervisory IT Specialist
Description: DutiesSummaryThis position is located in Software Development & Operations (JLS), Enterprise Shared Services (JL), Information Technology (J), Bonneville Power Administration (BPA).The purpose of the position is to serve as the Manager of Software Development & Operations and a key member of the IT management team.ResponsibilitiesAs a Supervisory IT Specialist, you will:Serve as manager overseeing the Software Development & Operations organization that provides the technical support for implementations, upgrades, and maintenance for over 200 applications, supporting human capital management, customer relationship management, supply chain, personal property, asset management, financial management, analytics & reporting and commercial systems.Through management of subordinate supervisors, direct and oversee a workforce performing IT work in Agency Commercial Systems, Business Applications, Enterprise Applications, Data Integration & Reporting, and Asset Management & Engineering Applications. Make decisions on work problems presented by subordinate supervisors.Provide leadership in developing, evaluating and implementing technology programs and operation plans to achieve compliance with IT objectives. Prioritize and determine project and program initiatives within established resources and ensure alignment with overall BPA goals and commitments.Establish overall goals and objectives for assigned staff and program functions while creating and maintaining an organizational culture that is customer-driven and quality-focused. Monitor the performance of JLS programs, and evaluate the requirements established for personnel regarding knowledge and skills in information resources management and the adequacy of such requirements for facilitating the achievement of the performance goals established for information resources management. Establish and implement organizational efforts to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the sub organizations. Ensure that subordinate work units meet performance goals and operate within established budgets.Evaluate subordinate supervisors and serve as the second-level reviewing official for non-supervisory performance ratings. Ensure reasonable equity among work units of performance standards and rating techniques. Recommend selections for subordinate supervisory positions and approve selections for non-supervisory positions. Hear and resolve grievances or serious employee complaints, review and approve serious disciplinary actions (e.g., suspensions) involving nonsupervisory subordinates, recommend changes in position classification or organization structures, and recommend or approve awards for subordinate supervisors and staff. Approve training needs and requests and approve expenses comparable to within-grade increases, extensive overtime, and employee travel. Provide leadership and support in administering the Bonneville EEO program for applicants and employees. Provide and ensure fair and equitable treatment for all employees in implementing HR policies and practices including recruitment, selection, placement counseling, training, career development, promotion and adverse action, and communicate support of these policies to subordinate supervisors and staff membersTravel RequiredOccasional travel - Occasional travel may be requiredSupervisory statusYesPromotion Potential14Job family (Series)2210 Information Technology ManagementRequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentYou must be a United States Citizen.This employer participates in the e-Verify program.See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.This announcement is also being advertised under Merit Promotion as announcement DOE-BPA-20-14011-MP. If you are a status candidate or intend to apply under a Special Hiring Authority (e.g. Schedule A, VEOA, etc.), please apply under the Merit Promotion announcement as well.***Relocation (PCS) is not authorized for this vacancy; however, relocation/recruitment incentive may be paid in accordance with federal regulations and in consideration of budget availability for a highly qualified candidate; determined upon selection***OTHER REQUIREMENTS:All males born after December 31st 1959 must abide by laws regarding Selective Service registration. To learn more about this law, visit the Selective Service web page, Who Must Register. If you are not registered and don't have an approved exemption, you will not be eligible for employment with the Federal government.When you apply you will be asked a series of questions to determine your eligibility for employment and your qualification for this position specifically. You must answer all of these questions completely and truthfully.A preliminary background check must be completed before a new employee can begin work. Current Federal employees or other individuals with an existing completed background investigation may not be required to undergo another background check.Selectee may be subject to a 1 year probationary period.Occasional after hours on-call availability will be required.First time supervisors will be required to serve a 1 year probationary period.QualificationsBASIC REQUIREMENTYou must have IT_Ñrelated experience demonstrating each of the four (4) competencies listed below. The experience must be IT related and may be demonstrated by paid or unpaid experience and/or completion of specific, intensive training (for example, IT certification) as appropriate.To meet this requirement you must demonstrate proficiency in each of the four competencies listed above as follows:Attention to Detail _Ñ Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.Customer Service _Ñ Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services.Oral Communication _Ñ Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately.Problem Solving _Ñ Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations.Advanced _Ñ You can perform the actions associated with each of these competencies without assistance. You are recognized within your immediate organization as "a person to ask" when difficult questions arise regarding each of these competencies. Focus is on broad organizational/professional issues; You have consistently provided practical/relevant ideas and perspectives on process or practice improvements which may easily be implemented; You are capable of coaching others in the application of each of these competencies by translating complex nuances relating to each competency into easy to understand terms; You participate in senior level discussions regarding these competencies; You assist in the development of reference and resource materials in these competencies.SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT:A qualified candidate's resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level (GS-13) in the Federal service.Specialized experience for this position is defined as: Experience in software development and operations providing technical support in planning, designing, implementation, coordination, configuration, installation, integration, updates and maintenance of an organization's application portfolio in support of various business software applications such as human capital management, customer relationship management, supply chain, personal property, asset management, financial management, analytics & reporting and commercial systems; and experience applying software design principles, methods, and approaches ensuring applications meet infrastructure standards and requirements.There is no substitution of education for experience at the GS-14 level.Your resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills, abilities and competencies (KSACs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your resume how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSACs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position.Interpersonal Skills: Shows understanding, friendliness, courtesy, tact, empathy, concern, and politeness to others; develops and maintains effective relationships with others; may include effectively dealing with individuals who are difficult, hostile, or distressed; relates well to people from varied backgrounds and different situations; is sensitive to cultural diversity, race, gender, disabilities, and other individual differences.Leadership: Influences, motivates, and challenges others; adapts leadership styles to a variety of situations.Managing Human Resources: Plans, distributes, coordinates, and monitors work assignments of others; evaluates work performance and provides feedback to others on their performance; ensures that staff are appropriately selected, utilized, and developed, and that they are treated in a fair and equitable manner.Oral Communication: Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, an responds appropriately.Partnering: Develops networks and builds alliances; collaborates across boundaries to build strategic relationships and achieve common goals.Planning and Evaluating: Organizes work, sets priorities, and determines resource requirements; determines short or long-term goals and strategies to achieve them; coordinates with other organizations or parts of the organization to accomplish goals; monitors progress and evaluates outcomes.Problem Solving: Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgement to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations."Experience" refers to paid and unpaid experience. Examples of qualifying unpaid experience may include: volunteer work done through National Service programs (such as Peace Corps and AmeriCorps); as well as work for other community-based philanthropic and social organizations. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills; and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.EducationThere are no specific education requirements or substitution of education for experience for this position.Additional informationThe U.S. Department of Energy fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. For more information, please visit the links at the bottom of this page or visit the FedsHireVets website.More than one selection may be made from this vacancy announcement.Some positions may require completion of a probationary period of up to 1 (one) year.Many positions require successful completion of a background investigation.All males born after December 31st 1959 must abide by laws regarding Selective Service registration. To learn more about this law, visit the Selective Service web page, Who Must Register. If you are not registered and don't have an approved exemption, you will not be eligible for employment with the Federal government.EEO Policy: http://www.usajobs.gov/eeoReasonable Accommodation Policy: http://www.usajobs.gov/rapsVeterans Information: http://www.usajobs.gov/viTelework: www.telework.govSelective Service Registration: http://www.sss.gov/BPA strives to ensure a safe, positive, inclusive work environment, supported by Leadership Behaviors. For more information on Leadership Behaviors visit: www.bpa.gov/goto/LeadershipBehaviorsWe also understand the importance of work/life balance and offer a variety of programs and policies designed to create more flexible, responsive work environments supportive of commitments to community, home and family members. BPA also supports employees_Ñé overall wellness through its Be Well program, which helps employees adopt healthier lifestyles and feel better about their work/life balance. The program supports five key areas of life: career, community, financial, physical and social.How You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.The Department of Energy uses an application tracking system to evaluate the responses you provide in the applicant assessment questionnaire to place you into an initial quality category via OPM's Category Rating procedures. These categories are "Best Qualified", "Well Qualified", and "Qualified. Then, the HR Office and/or Subject Matter Expert (SME) will conduct a quality review of your application and supporting documentation to ensure you have been placed into the appropriate quality category.Your application is rated based on the extent and quality of your experience, education (when applicable), and training as described in your resume and applicant assessment. Your credentials are measured against the established duties of the position at the grade level(s) being advertised.If you are eligible for career transition assistance plans such as ICTAP or CTAP, you must meet the definition of "well qualified" which is defined as scoring in the Well Qualified category (or higher).If you are a Veteran Preference eligible candidate, you will be listed at the top of whichever quality category your rating places you in. CP/CPS veterans are placed at the top of the highest category for all positions except professional and scientific positions at GS-9 and higher.If your resume is incomplete or does not support the responses you provided in your online questionnaire, or if you fail to submit all required documentation before the vacancy closes, you may be rated 'ineligible', 'not qualified', or your score may be adjusted accordinglyTo preview questions please click here.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceNot RequiredDrug test requiredNoPosition sensitivity and riskNon-sensitive (NS)/Low RiskTrust determination processSuitability/FitnessRequired DocumentsRequired DocumentsPlease carefully review the following list to determine what documentation you need to submit. Some documents may not apply to all applicants.If you are unsure, click the link for each document type to read more.ALL APPLICANTS: You must submit a resume supporting your specialized experience and responses to the online questionnaire.Your resume should list all work experience (paid and unpaid); you must list the full name and address of the each employer.For all types of work experience, you should indicate the start and end dates (include month, day, and year); you must also list the average number of hours per week that you worked.For paid work experience, please indicate your starting salary for each position and the highest salary you earned (if different).Your resume should also include any education and training you have completed (list the program title, subject area, number of hours completed, and completion date).For more information about what to include in your resume, please view this USAJOBS Resume Tutorial video on YouTube.Most DOE offices will allow you to submit a resume in the format of your choice (as an attached document or as a USAJOBS Resume Builder format). Title: Senior Technical Recruiter
Description: Scion Technical, an award-winning recruiting firm is seeking an experienced Information Technology Recruiter to add to its incredible team in downtown Portland, Oregon. This position is part of the Tech/IT Division at Scion Staffing.We recruit for amazing technology companies, corporations, and startups! From cloud, analytics, products, universities, emerging tech, to expanding corporations we recruit for the best!Recently awarded to the 2019/2018 list of Best Executive Recruiting Firms in the world by Forbes; Scion Technical is an award-winning full-service executive search firm, direct-hire, and temporary staffing agency who provides clients with extraordinary talent for hire. Our firm was started in 2006.We are growing and we're ready to add an Information Technology Recruiter to our growing Portland, Oregon office!If you are an energetic, agency-experienced IT recruiter who is self-directed, successful, and ready to make a significant impact- we want to talk to you!We have amazing jobs that we are recruiting for.In this exciting role the Information Technology Recruiter interfaces directly with clients, and has a real say in the ability to influence tools, processes and strategy, and truly part of helping to further expand and amazing company. We have tons of room for professional growth, clients and jobs that need to be filled ongoing, an amazing web marketing in place, a top ATS, job board subscriptions, corporate site job posting, a social networking presence, and more to support your recruiting efforts.Internal and client-facing ethics are a must as is passion for your work. We like people who are driven, professional and fun to work.In this role, you'll:Jump into immediate needs placing awesome talent.Manage multiple job openings effectively and efficiently.Apply existing applicant tracking system experience (Bullhorn experience a plus but not required) and build a steady recruiting pipeline.Interface confidently and professionally with clients.Instill confidence "speaking tech" to potential and existing clients.Write up personalized and effective job descriptions, sanitized for agency posting without client exposure.Effectively search via job boards and search agents.HUNT off the job boards via networking events, LinkedIn, social media, career fairs, university recruiting, etc.Collaborate well with teammates, and add to overall growth and expertise of the team.Keep up with new technologies and have no fear of new acronyms.Pick up the phone frequently and CALL clients, candidates, and co-workers.Evaluate skill level, manage offer process, conduct reference checks, and make salary recommendations.Have a proven track record of successful permanent placements.Work with an amazing and fun team!Salary & Benefits:Competitive starting base salary plus exceptional commissions and bonus structure offering exceptional earning potential plus a full package of benefits. $100k+ on target earnings.No "draws" or artificial monthly timers on placements; you'll be fairly paid on your commissions at all times. (We have an awesome commission structure with attainable goals)Amazing culture and ever-evolving agency at the top of their game.Business casual environment and remote/onsite flexibility.Comprehensive fully paid individual health, dental, and other benefits.Generous paid vacation, significant sick time, 10 paid annual holidays, 3 paid volunteer days each year paid, and your birthday off.Awesome downtown office, location, close to MAX, major bus lines.Free gym access.A job and team that will inspire you daily!About Our Search Firm:Scion Technical is a division of Scion Staffing Inc., an award-winning, full service, national staffing firm. Our track record and recruitment prowess has made us one of the top recruitment firms on the West Coast. Additional information about our firm and success can be found online at www.scionstaffing.com, www.sciontechnical.com, or in the 2019/2018 Business Times and Forbes list of top staffing firms.
