Title: Creative Director
Description: sMover is seeking a uniquely skilled and multi-faceted rockstar to partner with us.Are you a UX/UI designer who has a passion for building brands and user experiences?Do you want to work remotely or at our HQ in Washington, D.C.?The ideal candidate will join our international, distributed workforce (2 in Washington, D.C., 1 in Ukraine, 1 in Estonia) and is highly capable of helping us build a dynamic customer experience with our global, real estate marketplace.sMover is an early stage technology company making positive changes to global real estate. You will work directly with the executive leadership team and be an integral part of our exciting future.The goal for this role will be to create emotion, bringing a human element to our online marketplace. You will help us creatively establish, build, and grow relationships with customers and real estate agents, globally. We seek to leave a lasting impact, providing a memorable experience with the services we provide. The priority in this role will be the design, and we will shift the responsibilities between marketing and design with each product release phase.This is not an entry level position. 5+ years of UX/UI experience required with additional marketing track record.To succeed in this position, you will:- Define a clear vision and strategy for design + marketing plans- 5 years+ of experience as an UI-UX Designer- Exceptional design experience in both UI (interaction, visual) and UX (user research, analysis, information architecture, wire-framing)- Highly proficient in all aspects of the creative process: including sketches, user flows, mood boards, prototypes, wireframes, and developing web pages that drive results- Work directly with our software engineers to ensure designs are successfully implemented- Employ data analytics, user experience research, competitive and market analysis, and business goals to refine and iterate ensuring positive growth- Create branding guidelines and design standards- Incorporate customer feedback, technical constraints, and usability findings into design- Provide an online portfolio demonstrating samples of previous work- Research and implement solutions to improve the user experience- Implement A/B testing and other growth experiments to drive continual iteration- Develop strategy and roadmap for bringing products to market- Grow in this role and help us recruit, hire, and develop a successful teamAt sMover, real estate is gamified and exciting!sMover connects local and global markets with our blue ocean strategy of transparency, efficiency, and simplicity. To do this, sMover leverages big data, partnerships, and machine learning to empower and connect global consumers of real estate. By providing consumers and agents/ brokers access to transparent real estate data, sMover empowers consumers to control their real estate journey beginning with finding the best agent and negotiating the best deal, while also empowering agents to secure highly motivated clients and providing them the unique data to complete deals quicker and with higher success.sMover is currently raising funds for its pre-seed financing round. This position will be an equity hire until funds are raised or revenue is generated (likely up to 3 months after hire). We are currently under consideration for 2 of the top 5 global, tech accelerators.sMover benefits:Company stock optionsFlexibility in work location and hoursCompetitive salary and a full suite of benefits (pending secured investment or revenue, likely up to 3 months after hire)sMover stack:slack, figma, notion, telegram, AWS, sketch, invision, and gsuitechange the way you move, move sMover! (pronounced: smoov-er)Extra:sMover is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not accept unsolicited resumes from outside recruiters/placement agencies. sMover will not pay fees associated with resumes presented through unsolicited means.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $0.00 to $100,000.00 /yearExperience:UX-UI Design: 5 years (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Application Question:Please provide links to your linkedin and online portfolio:Additional Compensation:BonusesOther formsWork Location:Multiple locationsFully RemoteSchedule:Monday to FridayOtherCompany's website:www.smover.coCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/smovercoBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may apply

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description: Job Description _ÑÐ QA Engineer _ÑÐ IT Data & AnalyticsPosition Summary:We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer for the Data & Analytics Team to bring a quality mindset to product development. This includes reviewing acceptance criteria for a quality focus, pairing with developers to build in quality, and setting up automated test systems to ensure quality. This role will bring an end-to-end testing and integration testing focus to the team.The successful candidate will join the Asset Data Foundationproduct delivery team, following best-practice agile techniques to deliver impactful data products for internal partners. You will actively participate and practice in an open, highly collaborative Agile environment, joining an existing team.Position Responsibilities:Collaborate on a daily basis with the product team to integrate the test plan into the development process.Oversee quality and stability of our data products and the production models that are fed by the data in Asset Data Foundation and orchestrated in Data & Analytics cloud-native foundational platform. Ensure end-to-end and integration tests are executed to deliver needed product quality.Develop, write and review test plans and test cases based on end to end test strategy, risk analysis, functional specifications, and use of system within existing infrastructure. Test plans confirm products meet and department technical standards, as well as user and stakeholder needs.Automate testing to the full extent possible. This includes identifying automation opportunities and implementing test automation.Attend design meetings to understand system architecture and review test plans and cases with key stakeholders. Provide test coverage assurance.Actively participate in planning, estimation, and prioritization processes to ensure successful execution of testing activities. Work with developers and business analysts to execute test strategies, test plans, manual test cases, and document results to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects.Research defects and open test cases. Communicate any and all defects to key stakeholders with defect resolution suggestions and participate in defect retesting.Anticipate potential problems by creating test scenarios and updates test cases for system when appropriate to reflect changes in product functionality or requirements.Participate in the disaster recovery testing efforts by preparing test cases.Troubleshoot hardware or software issues. Logs system failures, reports bugs to developers, and proactively work with support teams for quick resolution.Keep abreast of current methodologies, technologies, and tools, and proactively seek ways to incorporate them into testing efforts.Works with management and Information Technology to define user acceptance testing within the business unit.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or job-related discipline or equivalent experience5-years experience with software delivery, or other relevant experienceExperience developing test plans and implementing quality processes into Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelinesExperience with Test Driven DevelopmentExperience scoping and performing integration and end-to-end testingExperience delivering product with Agile / Scrum methodologiesExperience with test automation and building frameworksExperience in:*Jenkins*Python*PytestJob Type: ContractSalary: $50.00 to $80.00 /hourExperience:Pytest: 1 year (Required)Automation: 5 years (Required)Jenkins: 3 years (Required)Python: 3 years (Required)Benefits:NoneSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Software Engineer (Microservices)
Description: Omnicell is the world leader in pharmacy robotics, and we_Ñére expanding beyond inventory management into inventory analytics. The Performance Center tech-enabled service helps hospitals and health systems understand how meds flow through their business, from the loading dock to the nurse_Ñés glove, and then apply clinical expertise and advanced machine learning to uncover opportunities to adjust that flow to improve safety, cost, efficiency, and patient outcomes. And the next step for us is to help busy clinicians act on those opportunities by building efficient, industry-leading workflows.To do that, we take terabytes of data from thousands of devices and translate it to simple, actionable steps our clients can take to improve their overall performance. Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Our innovative technology has helped us grow to become the nation_Ñés fastest growing outplacement provider. Our expert coaching and professional branding teams have successful track records of empowering careers. And, ultimately our results speak for themselves: we have received enormous industry recognition, including Gartner_Ñés _ÑÒMost Innovative Company,_Ñ the _ÑÒNation_Ñés Best and Brightest Companies to Work For,_Ñ Fortune_Ñés _ÑÒ100 Best Companies for Women,_Ñ and Deloitte _ÑÒFast 500_Ñ _ÑÐ recognized as one of North America_Ñés fastest growing technology companies. Title: Retail Buyer/Category Buyer
Description: Weee!, headquartered in Fremont, California, is the largest and fastest-growing Asian e-grocer in the United States with nearly 2M deliveries fulfilled to date. Weee! is currently available in the SF Bay Area, Sacramento, Seattle, and Los Angeles. Weee! was founded in 2015 as a social e-commerce company to enable affordable access to hard-to-find and fresh Asian ingredients directly from the source. By partnering with local suppliers and leveraging proprietary demand forecasting technology, Weee! is reshaping the grocery supply chain entirely. Weee! has received $40M in funding to date from Goodwater Capital, iFly.vc, Silicon Valley Bank, Amino Capital, VMG, XVE, and Welight Capital. For more information, please visit www.sayweee.com, follow us at @isayweee on Twitter, or check out our apps on iOS and Android.As a Merchandiser, you are responsible for managing the buying of compelling food and beverage assortments for our customers at Weee!. It_Ñés your job to oversee a team to effectively develop suites of products _ÑÐ determining competitive pricing and analyzing marketplace trends to identify new opportunities for the future and which assortments to transition if they are past their prime _ÑÐ ensuring business plans are a _ÑÒwin-win_Ñ for our customers and Weee!. Creativity and agility will be paramount as you identify retail trends and synthesize information and partnerships across multiple cross-functional touchpoints _ÑÐ providing forecasts and business solutions in a fast-paced, multi-dimensional environment. Your job is to bring the _ÑÒart_Ñ to the _ÑÒscience_Ñ _ÑÐ using your intuition and expertise fueled by data, analytics and, above all, a passion for helping our customers get high-quality products and live better.Owns sales and gross profit margin.Develops and implements strategic direction for multiple categories.Drives sales and gross profit through the optimization of the product assortment in multiple categories.Promotes and supports company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity.Provides supervision and development opportunities for junior buyers.Supports cross-channel and company initiatives to achieve global strategic multi-channel plans.Requirements:1-3 years of proven experience in purchasing food and beverage merchandise, forecasting and product selection.Food and beverage industry background required.In addition, must have experience developing strong business relationships with vendors and industry leaders.Have experience managing and creating new categories of business in an extremely competitive environment.Have experience managing margin to meet category objectives.Bachelor_Ñés degree or higher.Benefits:Comprehensive health insurance package, including medical, dental, and vision.Free lunch daily, catered by local restaurants.Annual bonus opportunities.Company stock options.Vacation and holiday time off.Monthly mobile stipend.Monthly Weee! Points credit.Valuable opportunity to grow into your dream.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate: Operations Insights
Description: Description:The Manager in Business Insights & Analytics (BIA) is an integral business partner in Roche/Genentech_Ñés clinical operations planning, tracking and continuous improvement efforts. He/she has a broad understanding of people management and working effectively in a cross-functional environment. As an integral participant in planning and executing relevant focus area activities and deliverables, projects and initiatives, he/she is crucial in ensuring business stakeholders get the insights and decision support for their business needs. He/she engages with customers and stakeholders to determine business needs, priorities, design solutions while cultivating alignment across the broader Roche/Genentech organization. He/she leads organizational learning spanning multiple disease states and ensures functional expertise continues to flourish and develop towards future business needs. He/she oversees and leads individuals in leveraging primary and secondary data to address key business questions and support the development of insights and analytics strategies.Major ResponsibilitiesBuild and maintain a connected ecosystem of self-service dashboards across multiple different platforms (Tableau)Work with key stakeholders to transform requirements into actionable dashboardsChampion data & reporting within the business, using the highest standards of analytical rigor, data integrity and design-minded principlesPrepare KPI reports distributed daily, weekly and monthly to our Leadership TeamsPartner with the Technology to ensure reporting tables address the needs of the businessBuild and maintain a _ÑÉSource of Truth_Ñé for business-wide metricUnderstand the business objectives and provide input and recommendations based on analytical findings.Organize data structures to efficiently drive scalable workflows.Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing reports and dashboards and ad hoc analysis to drive business decisions.Lead deep data mining, statistical analyses, and creation of models such as our Selection Decision Framework.Write high quality SQL code to retrieve and analyze data, and learn and understand a broad range of Amazon_Ñés data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use.Create plan for developing of automated product backend operations, execute the plan and provide solution for troubleshootingCreate automated E2E backend solution for commercial products & update the technology with efficient technological solutionsWho You AreWe are looking for people who are nimble, able to manage and lend expertise to multi-functional teams and adapt quickly to competing priorities within their area of focus. We are also looking for people who are committed to continuing to make Roche/Genentech a great place to work, by investing in people and providing ongoing mentorship and coaching to help them advance their expertise.Understand impact of change and new activity on the wider organizationStrong interpersonal skills and a consultative mindset, with the ability to influence without direct authority, and to develop strong partnershipsAbility to adapt to evolving internal and external pressures, provide focus and direction to successfully navigate complexity and uncertaintyAbility to effectively manage change by explaining context, answering questions, and patiently listening to concernsAbility to connect with people in ways that generate enthusiasm and commitment; look for opportunities to build community and celebrateUnderstand what motivates people to perform at their best by recognizing the importance of their workEffective coach and mentor, with genuine interest in helping others develop; actively invest time to get to know people and what they doSkilled at managing and influencing peers and leadersQualificationsBachelor_Ñés or Master_Ñés in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physical Sciences or related field preferredTableau, Python & SQL certifiedData analytics, including considerable experience applying exploratory & confirmatory data analysis techniques, methodologies and tools as well as various secondary data sources (i.e.., census data, patient-level data, trial registry data, disease and treatment information etc...)Awareness of scripting, statistical & programming languages and analytical tools a plus (i.e. Python, MATLAB, R, SAS, Google/Adobe analytics, SQL)Experience with forecast modeling, including familiarity with patient-based models, trending, and uncertainty analysesPersuasive written and verbal communication skills, easily communicating complex ideas.Strong attention to detailJob Type: ContractSalary: $40.00 /hourEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Application Question:Do you have skills in Python, Tableau & SQL ?Contract Length:5 - 6 monthsContract Renewal:PossibleFull Time Opportunity:NoBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceWork from homeFlexible scheduleTypical start time:9AMTypical end time:5AMSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://www.roche.com/Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Description: DevOps EngineerThis Jobot Job is hosted by: Jasper PosnerAre you a fit? We leverage a Full Stack Cloud Platform, AI/ML, Predictive Analytics and Data Science to predict customer behavior and needs so Revenue Leaders and Sales People have the highest quality leads before the competition. We are very well funded and growing quickly in terms of both head count and revenue.If you are an experienced DevOps Engineer who has experience with Python, Linux, Docker and Kubernetes as well as an interest in the Hadoop Ecosystem and High Availability Systems , then please read on_Ñ_.Why join us?---------Competitive Base Salary, bonus and equity package!Architect, build and scale services using the latest and greatest technologiesAll the perks of well-funded A-Level start-up life (great benefits, perks, free meals, team building, etc)Job Details---------Is your background a fit? Title: UX Researcher / Designer Intern (Summer)
Description: What We DoVALUENEX is a big data predictive analytics platform and consulting services company, powered by proprietary algorithms, artificial intelligence, and teams of data scientists and expert analysts. Founded as a startup in Tokyo in 2006, the company provides solutions for Corporate/R&D strategy development, Intellectual Property(IP) monetization and evaluation, investment analyses and technology convergence mapping. Working with clients across a wide range of industries and business functions, VALUENEX_Ñés panoramic-view analytics software and expert consulting has led to breakthroughs in big data analytics and predictive modeling. VALUENEX has grown on the global stage to include 45% of Japanese Fortune Global 500 as clients, as well as major corporate partners such as Honda Motors, Panasonic and Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley. Through advanced capabilities in strategy development, white space extraction, pan-industry or technology specific trend mapping, and comprehensive M&A analyses, VALUENEX continues to hold the top position in the field.Job DescriptionThis internship position is part UX researcher and part UX designer. You will translate our users' needs by conducting original research, performing usability studies, and presenting findings to VALUENEX teams across the globe. HCP are individuals who, during the influenza season, work in VHA locations where patients receive care or who come into contact with VA patients as part of their duties. VHA locations include, but are not limited to, VA hospitals and associated clinics, community living centers (CLCs), community-based outpatient clinics (CBOCs), domiciliary units, Vet centers and VA-leased facilities. HCP include all VA licensed and unlicensed, clinical and administrative, paid and unpaid, full- and part-time employees, intermittent employees, fee basis employees, VA contractors, students, researchers, volunteers, and trainees who work at these facilities. Title: Laboratory Unit Manager - Genetic Counselor
Description: Job descriptionManages a large unit or multiple units providing ambulatory services. Ensures staff provides high quality, accessible, cost effective care, and patient focused services to members across the continuum, which comply with local, state, and federal requirements. Develops and maintains budgets and on-going staff development.Essential Responsibilities: * Manages the operations of a large unit or multiple units in an outpatient facility.Ensures Assistants and staff provide the highest quality of care and are in compliance with The Joint Commission, federal, state, and local requirements.Collaborates with physicians and other health care providers in establishing, implementing, and maintaining patient care and quality service standards to meet members and internal clients expectations.Acts as patient advocate resolving patient care issues.Designs and evaluates processes to improve systems and patient care results across the continuum of care.Develops and monitors budgets and resource allocations.Monitors financial performance and identifies and implements strategies to reduce costs and improve quality of care/service.Determines the appropriate staff mix for department and develops processes to screen, interview, hire, train, and maintain the competency of all department staff.Provides on going staff development.Develops, implements, and monitors departmental policies and procedures which support the organizations goals and business objectives and ensures they are met.Collaborates with Physician Team Leader and Department Chief in developing the level of patient services and the day-to-day operations of the department.Manages and resolves human resource, labor relations, employee and department safety, and risk management issues.Kaiser Permanente conducts compensation reviews of positions on a routine basis. At any time, Kaiser Permanente reserves the right to reevaluate and change job descriptions, or to change such positions from salaried to hourly pay status. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees.Qualifications:Basic Qualifications:Experience * Minimum three (3) years of supervisory experience OR two (2) years of supervisory experience with Master's degree.Education * Bachelor's degree required.License, Certification, Registration * N/AAdditional Requirements: * Knowledge of The Joint Commission, and other local, state, federal regulations.Demonstrated strong interpersonal communication skills.Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.Preferred Qualifications: * Minimum three (3) years of experience in an outpatient care setting.BLS certification preferred.Master's degree preferred.Master's Degree in Genetic CounselingMust have a National Provider Identifier (NPI), or obtain an NPI, prior to employment start date.Must be Board Certified by the American Board of Medical Genetics, or the American Board of Genetic Counseling.Must have a current/valid Genetic Counselor License issued by the California State Department of Public Health, or obtain license prior to employment start date.Demonstrated experience working with a laboratory and/or curation teamDemonstrated clinical expertise in area of specialty requiredDemonstrated refined analytic and diagnostic reasoning skillsDemonstrated interpersonal skillsPrior supervisory or management a plusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $120,000.00 to $138,000.00 /yearBenefits:NoneSchedule:Monday to FridayOther

Title: Senior Financial Analyst (FT)
Description: Weee is looking to hire a Senior Financial Analyst (FT).Weee!, headquartered in Fremont, California, is the largest and fastest-growing Asian e-grocer in the United States with nearly 2M deliveries fulfilled to date. Weee! is currently available in the SF Bay Area, Sacramento, Seattle, and Los Angeles. Weee! was founded in 2015 as a social e-commerce company to enable affordable access to hard-to-find and fresh Asian ingredients directly from the source. By partnering with local suppliers and leveraging proprietary demand forecasting technology, Weee! is reshaping the grocery supply chain entirely. Weee! has received $40M in funding to date from Goodwater Capital, iFly.vc, Silicon Valley Bank, Amino Capital, VMG, XVE and Welight Capital. For more information, please visit www.sayweee.com, follow us at @isayweee on Twitter, or check out our apps on iOS and Android.This Sr Financial Analyst will work closely with our company_Ñés senior management team to provide critical business and financial insights to drive significant financial and operational improvements. We are looking for someone who is highly analytical, passionate about eCommerce, sensitive with numbers, self-motivated with great business sense and excellent communication skills.Job Descriptions:Assist senior management to create quarterly and annual plans and budgets.Analyze key drivers of important expenses (e.g. discount, user acquisition cost, operating expenses), identify ways to save and work with various teams to achieve financial results.Provide financial and analytical support to functional teams.Run special projects to drive important financial results.Requirements:2+ years FP&A, management consulting or investment banking experience.BS in accounting, (MBA preferred).Excel/Google Sheets expert, SQL is a plus.Passionate about numbers, analytics and problem-solving.Benefits:Comprehensive health insurance package, including medical, dental, and vision.Free lunch daily, catered by local restaurants.Annual bonus opportunities.Company stock options.Vacation and holiday time off.Monthly mobile stipend.Monthly Weee! Points credit.Valuable opportunity to grow into your dream role by contributing to a venture-backed startup in a high-growth stage.Thoughtful, talented, and supportive coworkers and leadership team.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
Description: About GEOJANGO MAPS: We are an innovative mapping company that produces small to large scale maps for homes, schools, and businesses across the USA. https://geojango.comThis position is for work at our facility in Pleasanton, CA. This position is ideal for someone located in Pleasanton, Livermore, Walnut Creek, Dublin, or the surrounding area. No relocation is provided.Description:The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating and executing our marketing strategy. You will lead our marketing campaigns, evaluate our marketing performance metrics, and collaborate with internal teams. You will have a strong marketing background with excellent communication skills and attention to detail.The position is suited for a person that enjoys the analytical and strategic side of marketing. This includes conducting comprehensive SEO analysis, competitor analysis, and website marketplace analysis. A creative eye is also important.The candidate should have strong organizational skills. This position will include responsibilities to create written marketing material about our brand and products. The position will include outreach to media resources such as online magazines, newspapers, emails, blogs, and influencers to increase our brand awareness.In this role, the Marketing Coordinator will need to prioritize and juggle multiple projects. The position requires the continual expansion of your skills. This is ideal for someone who is self-motivated to increase their skills through reading, exploring, training, and experimenting. This role is not suited for someone who wants to be trained to do specific routine tasks.Responsibilities:Leads the marketing team in all planning and day-to-day activities.Monitor progress, identify KPI, and create marketing plans.Master the use of SEO and SEM applications to improve our positions.Work with the Amazon platform including keywords, advertising, and product pages.Work with the Shopify platform and website platform including product pages, SEO, and optimizing the site.Coordinate, plan, and execute photo shoots of our products.Document and analyze website insights and trendsPrepare and research eMail CompaignsPrepare Media Kits, Press ReleasesContribute material to our website and blogsWork with our staff to create strong social media channelsResearch and outreach to increase our brand awarenessMonitor and report on customer feedbackContributes fresh ideas and strategies to the teamQualifications:Education in Marketing. A bachelor_Ñés degree is desirable.Experience (2+ years) with website SEO, DA, keywordsExperience with SEO/SEM applicationsExperience with Google Analytics and AdWordsKnowledge of HTML for effective SEO (coding and hierarchies)Strong understanding of a variety of social media platforms and trends.Proficient with Excel / SpreadsheetsDemonstrated writing skills/articlesAbility to lift 25 pounds and help in our production area during busy times.New Marketing Graduates: Please apply if you reside in the Tri-Valley area.Helpful Skills:A good understanding of Adobe products including Photoshop, Lightroom, Premier Pro, Dreamweaver is preferred.Experience with Amazon Seller Marketplace is preferred.Experience with Shopify and eCommence is preferred.Experience with photography and image optimizations for website is preferred.Experience with videography or video advertising is preferred.Essential Traits:We are looking for an intelligent, hard working individual to join our team.Someone who commits to completing assignments efficiently and accurately.A quick learner is self-motivated to learn beyond our training and builds their skills to take on further responsibility.Positive thinker - who finds solutions and is resourceful.Reliable _ÑÐ to our agreed upon schedule and completing tasks efficiently.Honest and Responsible - displays integrity and is accountable.Works Smart - organized, efficient, and is dedicated to helping our team, customers, and company.Cares _ÑÐ thoughtful and interested in other people_Ñés point of view and their contributions.Hours/Schedule:This position is for 30-35 hours a week in our office.Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m.Or we can coordinate a 25 hour week for a working parent (Hours and schedule can be coordinated).Location: Pleasanton, CAWe offer a fantastic office and create environment for your work.No location assistance is provided.This position is NOT suited for remote work or consulting work.Applying for the PositionPlease include the following:1. Cover Letter: Please provide a brief description of yourself and let us know why the position and our company is interesting to you in a cover letter.2. Resume: Please provide resume in PDF format.3. Online Reference: Please provide a link to your LinkedIn page or other social media pages that you would like to share so we can learn more about you.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $22.00 to $30.00 /hourExperience:Marketing: 2 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Pleasanton, CA 94566 (Required)Additional Compensation:BonusesWork Location:One locationHours per week:20-2930-39Typical start time:9AMTypical end time:5PMSchedule:Monday to FridayDay shiftCompany's website:https://geojango.comWork Remotely:No

and ensures statistical sample size validity, where appropriate * Consults with customers to identify and evolve their business intelligence requirements * Creates analytical applications and reports based on detailed specifications * Develops and maintains analytical and reporting specification and process documentation; train and provide knowledge transfers to developers on the team * Maintains ongoing documentation of the appropriate business intelligence solutions for various reporting or data extract needs * Extracts and prepares data from appropriate systems; develops and deploys query parameters, visual layouts, and filters * Trains customers in business intelligence systems usage. Uses Master Data Management (MDM) definitions, and works with Data Stewards to create new definitions, for accurate output labeling * Works with teams to do needs analysis to determine business intelligence needs; gathers report data objectives, data required and specifications * Propagate BI adoption, best practices across technology and business * Provides guidance to other BI developers and helps them align to best practices * Designs, builds and deploys BI solutions within Microsoft BI stack and other best-ofbreed BI tools * Maintains and supports data analytics and visualization platforms * Leads or contributes to evaluation of BI platforms, development of BI strategies in Technology and Business Units * Develops in-depth understanding of data environment and leverages knowledge to build robust, scalable solutions * Develops subject matter expertise (data and processes) and applies to development of solutions * Performs data research / profiling and applies results to solution design * Trains / guides other BI team members * Identifies and implements appropriate continuous improvement opportunities * Collaborates with teams to integrate systems * Develops and updates technical documentation * Design and develop the following: data modeling, data warehouse, SSIS packages, SSAS cubes and reports using the tools / technology outlined in the Experience section * Document all design requirements * Document development work * Use development collaboration and change management tool to check in all changesTraining and Experience:Sufficient education, training, and experience to demonstrate the possession and direct application of the following knowledge and abilities. Title: Data Scientist
Description: *Candidates with hands on 8+ yrs experiece in Gensim , NLP, NLU, NLTK , LDA ,Text Blob, Tokenization, Lemmatization, Stop Words, sentiment analysis, Bag of Words, n-grams, Parts-of-speech (POS) Tagging will be preferred.The Data Scientist will lead the strategy, planning and development of models for Customer, Market and Industry Insights to take customer insights to the next level. We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate data scientist with strong analytical skills, business experience, relentless curiosity, and a motivation to improve the customer experience:As an expert in data science, you will formulate approaches to solve challenging problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources in context of customer, stakeholder and business needs. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities. You will also interpret the results of the analysis and new insights that influence experience improvements. You will contribute to research, identification, prototyping, and productizing of ML/AI techniques and algorithms that result in specific action plans. You will also engage in the review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the applicability of your results.Responsibilitiesë Evaluate existing AI ML models, techniques and methodologies in production today to determine alignment with current business objectivesë Proactively look for opportunities to challenge, elevate and evolve the current thinking and approaches to enable continuous improvement in our models and methodologies that brings us closer to understanding the customer experienceë Contribute as a data science subject matter expert to the development of business and technical proposals outlining continuous improvement opportunities, inclusive of the how and impact.ë Deeply understand existing ML models in production today by first acquiring an understanding of the business problem statement the models address then diving deeply into the applied logic and code.ë Serve as the subject matter expert across CSS and beyond when it comes to the application of AI and ML to foster and support and customer centric culture, engaging with peer data scientists to share, collaborate and grow impactë Identify new use cases for existing ML models production today to grow our share of customer voice by pulling in additional sources that grow our understanding of the holistic customer experience.ë Develop net new models leveraging latest technologies to address new and emerging customer listening scenarios [Linked In, Gig, Employee, Advocate]ë Partner with peer data science leads and teams across Microsoft both with peer CSS business units and extending beyond to Microsoft Engineering teams on joint development opportunities.ë Consistently discover customer listening capabilities with applied AI, ML across the organization to identify opportunities to leverage and contribute to propel our collective work forwardë Identify opportunities to leverage existing and new customer AI, ML derived capabilities to define or contribute to predictive customer experience initiativesë Serve as technical lead directly representing CMII, working in close collaboration with our managed service provider to contribute, influence and lead data science strategy and approached applied to customer experience.ë Partner closely with Voice of Customer Technical Strategy Lead to deeply contribute to and influence technical capabilities applied to Voice of Customer road map for Microsoft.ë Maintain active involvement in data science community across Microsoft as well as within the industry to both influence and benefit from collective mindshare and thought leadership.Basis Qualificationsë 3-5+ years of hands-on experience in in data science, applied statistics, machine learning, data mining, statistical modeling tools and underlying algorithmsë 3-5+ years of hands-on experience building production grade machine learning enabled solutions end to end.ë 3-5+ years of experience in statistical modeling methods, time series, text mining, optimization, information retrievalë 3-5+ years hands-on experience using R, Python or and other languages appropriate for large scale analysis of numerical and textual dataë 3-5+ years Hands-on experience using SQL and data miningë Advanced knowledge of neural networks, LDA, SVM and clustering algorithmsë Experience with experiments, machine learning, deep learning, anomaly detection, predictive analysis, exploratory data analysis, and other areas of data scienceë Experience using large data systemsë Advanced data visualization experienceë Experience in business, program and/or strategy planningPreferred Skills & Qualificationsë Strong analytical skills that enable interpretation Title: Government Relations Administrator
Description: SummaryTogether, with leadership and our employees, we are changing the way government delivers service and winning national recognition as a model of excellence.King County Metro seeks an internal candidate for Government Relations Administrator who has a passion for clear communication, a strategic mindset, and a love of working with both internal and external stakeholders to fulfill policy, legislative and intergovernmental initiatives and objectives and ensuring and optimizing delivery of County services. Decisions made by incumbents in this classification.This position reports directly to the Strategic Planning Manager II (SPM II), serving as an integral member of the Strategy and Analytics Section.In this role, you will:work closely with the SPM II in developing and analyzing Metro Transit's policies and the strategies internal to the department and County as well as with external jurisdictions and stakeholdershave a high risk and impact, and incumbents may supervise staffOur ideal candidate is:Open to valuable perspectives from multiple sources with the ability to combine the diverse perspectives from front-line organizational experience, broad functional knowledge, and creative energy.Adept at incorporating both logic and emotion into their thinking with both left brain and right brain orientation.Comfortable thinking in ways extending beyond today's reality - able to free themselves from today to consider multiple possibilities for how Metro's course may play out in the future.Constantly questioning both the familiar and the new in pursuit of strategic options.Open to not answering or resolving every strategic issue - able to focus on what is vital for business performance and growth.Commitment to Equity & Social JusticeWE BELIEVE diversity encompasses the unique perspectives, knowledge, skills, abilities and the rich dimensions of identity each member of the Metro community brings to work daily. These perspectives and human dimensions are built through life experiences and membership in socially defined groups including, but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic status, age, physical abilities and religious beliefs.The diverse experiences and perspectives of our employees help us serve King County residents in an equitable and culturally responsive way. To learn more, please visit https://www.kingcounty.gov/elected/executive/constantine/priorities/building-equity.aspx.Acting on our strong commitment to social equity, we are pioneering income-based fares to help make our services affordable for everyone. We are actively developing the systems and standards necessary to achieve better outcomes for all residents and our employees, while at the same time, changing the way government delivers service by actively engaging the people we serve in our planning processes.Through innovations like these Metro won national recognition as a model of excellence.We are looking for candidates who meet the following minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Public Administration or a related field and five (5) years of experience in developing and implementing legislative strategies and policies OR any combination of experience and education which provides the skills, knowledge, and abilities perform the key roles and responsibilities of the position.Key responsibilities include:Make independent strategic judgments and decisions to influence legislation.Negotiate intergovernmental agreements; design, develop and direct programs resulting from intergovernmental initiatives.Research and assess issues and recommend strategies to ensure needs are met.Advocate King County's position to the Legislature and to governmental agency staff.Establish and maintain administrative and political liaisons with local governments, as well as cultivating productive working relationships with inter- and intra- governmental staff.Develop, analyze and implement policies.Coordinate activities of contracted lobbyists.Implement approved contracts and agreements.Coordinate the communication and analysis of state or federal legislation that may affect the agency; ensure that legislation is responded to in a timely manner and the County's position is clearly defined.May supervise staff; administer personnel matters, such as hiring, firing, performance reviews, employee discipline and counseling.Perform other duties as assigned.In addition, the most competitive candidates will possess the following desired qualifications:Knowledge of Metro Transit's strategic goals and adopted policy frameworksKnowledge of strategic business planning techniques, principles and practicesKnowledge of project management techniques and principlesKnowledge of state and federal grant and loan procurement processFamiliarity with legal and regulatory environments affecting intergovernmental agreementsSkill in working effectively with diverse group of individualsSkill in working with Elected Officials and senior executivesSkill in leading others and reaching consensusSkill in synthesizing information, gaining buy in from key stakeholders and making sound recommendationsFor more information regarding this recruitment, please contact Talent Advisor:Deandra Stanley - destanley@kingcounty.govSupplemental InformationReady to Apply?King County Metro Transit is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and values diverse perspectives, life experiences, and differences. King County Metro encourages people of all backgrounds to apply, including people of color, immigrants, refugees, women, LGBTQ, people with disabilities, people of all ages, and veterans. We are committed to being equitable and fair in providing equal access to opportunities for all.Who May ApplyThis position is open only to qualified King County Metro Transit employees.Available VacancyThis recruitment will fill a career service position. This recruitment will create an eligibility pool to fill future career service, term-limited temporary and/or special duty vacancies which may occur in the next 6 months.Application ProcessA King County application is required. A resume and letter of interest is highly recommended (optional). Applicants should complete the online application at www.kingcounty.gov. If you are unable to apply online, follow the instructions at www.kingcounty.gov/jobs under Application Tips and FAQs.Selection ProcessApplications will be screened to determine whether candidates meet minimum qualifications, as well as for clarity, completeness and responsiveness to application instructions. The most competitive candidates presenting evidence that they meet or exceed the qualifications noted above may be invited to participate in one or more panel interviews. Formal offers may be contingent upon successful references and a record review.Union Membership This position is not represented by a union.Class Code: 2830300

Title: Impact Assistant
Company: Real Escape From the Sex Trade
Description: Impact Assistant: (Database Administrator)REST Job DescriptionREST SUMMARYREST exists to provide pathways to freedom, safety, and hope for victims of sex trafficking and people involved in the sex trade. REST offers programs that are centered on the strengths, needs and individual choices of each survivor we serve. In all of our programs, from crisis intervention through long term housing, we work with survivors to increase their safety and move toward healing, stability and economic independence. In 2019 over 700 individuals reached out to REST for services, hoping to find their path out of the sex trade. REST believes that everyone deserves to be loved and everyone deserves a life without exploitation. We are motivated and inspired by our faith as a Christian organization and dedicated to serving people of all faiths and backgrounds.IMPACT MANAGEMENT SUMMARYImpact Management is part of Programs Management at REST and is critical advancing our mission. The Impact Management team: Impact Manager and Impact Assistant, work closely with the Programs Manager and the Executive Director to set and implement the impact strategy for the organization. This team works to ensure data collection, data analysis, action research, and program evaluation is happening in cohesion with our daily service delivery, and is effective, efficient, and leads to the improvement of short-term and longterm outcomes for program participants.ROLE SUMMARYThe Impact Assistant assists the Impact Manager with building the practices related to impact management across the organization. This includes tracking, monitoring, and analyzing data related to program performance metrics. This role manages the client management software (Social Solutions: Apricot) to ensure accurate data entry and use for the purpose of collecting and analyzing data related to target outcomes; implementing program evaluation tools, and assisting with reporting on findings. Additionally, this role assists with new victim services and innovative project development rollout to ensure that impact measurement mechanisms are in place and functioning for project deployment and evaluation. This position reports to the Impact Manager but may be assigned to Executive leadership support for new project assistance.RESPONSIBILITIES Impact Evaluation (50%)*Serve as Apricot administrator, make changes and modifications to system as requested*Implement audits and cleaning processes to ensure data in Apricot is accurate and current*Ensure data collection processes (quantitative and qualitative) are conducted with cultural-and linguistic-sensitivity, survivor-centered, and in a trauma-informed approach, withexcellence and rigor and attention to data integrity and confidentiality*Train staff at on boarding and at least yearly in data collection and impact managementprocess*Oversee the systematic recording, analysis, and evaluation of outcomes across programsand over time, in order to ensure survivors are served effectively, to optimize impact and cost-effectiveness of services, and to increase credibility with stakeholders and partners*Deliver quarterly findings to management with respect to impact successes and challenges*Manage programs dashboard and on a monthly basis accurately reflect programmilestones and accomplished outcomes; provide monthly reports to Impact Manager*Collaborate with external research partners for action research in accordance with grantrequirements (e.g., OVC Specialized Services grants)*Project manage and ensure successful execution of project plans with Wrike software toolNew Projects (50%)*Work alongside Impact Manager and Executive team to assist in development and launch of new of alternative solutions.Process functional designs, system configurations, testing, development specifications and end user training.Coordinate User Acceptance Testing and manage end Title: Sales Hunter (Business Development Specialist)
Description: Please Read: (Only local candidates will be considered for this role)Do you love sales and know how to hustle?Do you have the ability to engage a client over the phone?Do you want an uncapped earning potential?Do you want to work in tech?If so, keep reading below. If you're still interested after reading below please take our culture assessment at the following link below....We ask that all perspective team members take the cultural assessment. Candidates that do not complete the assessment will not be considered.https://assessment.predictiveindex.com/64R/574ebdcb-5094-4289-b15e-7b63f5619991?type=candidatebaJob Summary:The focus of this job is making connections with people, motivating and inspiring them to achieve results. Poise and an engaging, empathetic communication style based on natural warmth and enthusiasm is the key to achieving the goals of this job. The work involves driving toward results by enrolling the commitment and buy-in of others. While the job requires strong initiative and self-direction, results are only achieved with and through people. A sincere appreciation for people and how they are each uniquely motivated is the foundation for designing and implementing interactive communication and decision-making processes. Knowledge and skill in how to successfully influence and persuade others by understanding how their individual needs and motivations link to goals is essential. The job requires a high degree of _ÑÒselling_Ñ, whether of ideas and policies within the organization, or products or services in the marketplace. The job environment is fast paced and results oriented. While there is urgency to goal achievement, responsibility for the achievement of results needs to be shared and effectively delegated when necessary. Initiating projects and processes beyond established organization practices will often require training and developing others, and enlisting their support by using a _ÑÒselling_Ñ rather _ÑÒtelling_Ñ communication style. A self-confident, extroverted style that can enliven, engage and positively impact individuals and groups is essential. The job has variety of tasks and is dynamic and changing. Because goals and desired results can quickly change, the job requires regularly meeting and pro-actively establishing relationships with new groups. The ability to understand, quickly react and motivate others to adapt to the changing organization environment is a critical key to success. In general, the core of this position requires a motivated and motivating team builder and organization developer.Startup Life Primer:Audantic was recently ranked 968 on the INC. 5000 list of fastest growing companies. That said, we are a true startup environment. This is not for everyone, and in reality, probably not for 90% of the people that will look at this post. If you_Ñére looking for security and a simple 9-5 workplace environment devoid of thinking and a good amount of stress stop reading.To be successful here, you need a high risk/reward mentality. We_Ñére looking for team members that can operate with a high level of autonomy and have the ability to develop solutions to daily business challenges. If this is you, keep reading because the upshot here is huge.JOB CHARACTERISTICS:Variety of activities Multiple projects occurring simultaneously Multi-tasking Sense of urgency for goal achievement Fast-paced environmentPeople/relationships focus Team building Inspire, motivate others, and engage their commitmentInvolve others in decision-making process Cooperative, collaborative decision-making Must assume responsibility for riskExtroverted, warm, enthusiastic, empathetic Stimulating communicator Persuasive _ÑÒselling_Ñ style Collaborative approachLeadership based on ability to motivate othersStrong commitment to resultsDelegate authority readilyWhat We_Ñére Looking For:Sales Personality: Must be engaging and love talking to people (Know how to hustle)Entrepreneur Mindset: Someone who enjoys solving problems on their ownBachelor's degree0-2 years of sales or account management experienceThis is an entry level role_Ñ_Ideal candidates will have no more than 1-2 years_Ñé experience!About Audantic:Audantic is a Washington grown start up that leverages Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning Models, to drive customer success in the real estate investment vertical. Currently, we are one of the most highly respected data and analytics services for real estate investors in the industry. Our services include data acquisition and management solutions to streamline and increase marketing ROI.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $48,500.00 to $59,000.00 /yearExperience:retail sales: 1 year (Preferred)sales: 1 year (Preferred)outside sales: 1 year (Preferred)tech sales: 1 year (Preferred)Additional Compensation:CommissionBonusesBenefits:Health insuranceRetirement planPaid time offWork from homePaid Training:YesManagement:Team LeadSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.audantic.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

Title: Android Developer
Description: Position: Software Dev Engineer IVLocation: Bellevue, WADuration: 9 monthsOverviewTekWissen Group is a workforce management provider throughout the USA and many other countries in the world. Our Client is a company operating a marketplace for consumers, sellers, and content creators. It offers merchandise and content purchased for resale from vendors and those offered by third-party sellers.Job Description:SERVICES TO BE PERFORMEDBe part of the team that is building something that empowers people to be their own boss.We are seeking a Software Development Engineer that will obsess over the safety of drivers who use the client's mobile delivery application for package delivery.The client's delivery app is the system that collaborates with crowd-sourced and third-party delivery partners to complete deliveries for many of the client's programs. Our mobile application works in concert with our advanced logistics systems and predictive analytics. These technologies allow delivery partners to onboard, schedule delivery times in advance or on-demand, and be guided through their deliveries with in-app mapping, navigation, and much more.As an engineer, you will work on cutting edge technology to build software that will keep the driver safe while on road. You will build a variety of software ranging from ones that interact with devices and sensors on vehicles to ones that do predictive analysis using machine learning algorithms.You will work with our product management team to develop the strategy, followed by the architecture and implementation of critical safety features into our mobile and back end platform. You will also own software in all phases of the software life-cycle from architecture and design through deployment and release. You will learn about the client_Ñés logistics network, interact with other teams to build optimized systems, and have the autonomy to deliver software that impacts multiple delivery provider programs.REQUIRED SKILLSFor Android: Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK and Android Developers Kit. Expert knowledge of Android Architecture, performance optimization, and Security.5+ years in Software Development with at least 3 years developing multi-threaded mobile applicationsFirm understanding of software development principles, capabilities, and limitations of mobile platforms (iOS and Android).Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies quicklyDemonstrated experience and passion for delivering exceptional User ExperienceAttested oral and written communication skills with technical and non-technical partners.BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.PREFERRED SKILLSMaster's degree in CSExperience in mobile app development in Android, iOS or bothCustomer obsessed with the ability to deal with ambiguityExperience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience building highly scalable, consumer-facing systems.Experience in utilizing Mobile design patterns, building mobile frameworks/SDKs, building custom UX widgets and optimizing apps for performance.Expert in software engineering (process, architecture, algorithms, data structures) and knowledge of Agile methodologies is a bonus.Passion for mobile development. We would love to hear about the apps you_Ñéve developed!Job Type: ContractSalary: $65.00 to $70.00 /hourExperience:android: 3 years (Preferred)java: 1 year (Preferred)Location:Bellevue, WA 98004 (Required)Contract Length:7 - 11 monthsContract Renewal:PossibleFull Time Opportunity:YesBenefits:NoneSchedule:Monday to FridayDay shift8 hour shiftWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description: Senior DevOps Engineer needed for rapidly growing engineering team.This Jobot Job is hosted by: Chris PriceAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply On Company Site" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $140,000 - $200,000A bit about us:---------We're seeking a passionate Senior DevOps Engineer to join our data platform engineering team to help build and automate systems to deploy and monitor scalable, high-availability systems critical to the success of our business.We're using data and analytics to predict the future of US residential real estate. Our goal is to help people make better decisions by offering innovative and unparalleled insights. Our platform accurately forecasts values 36 months into the future for four million residential blocks and more than 100 million properties.We have assembled the most comprehensive dataset in the residential real estate industry, drawing from over 200 individual databases. Combined with our sophisticated machine learning models, which understand the relationships between property value drivers, we can determine the current and future valuations for 100 million residential properties and deliver insights that empower our customers to make the smartest decisions about their real estate investment assets.Why join us?---------Some of the other wonderful things we offer!Competitive CompensationBonusesESOPOpen VacationHealth 100% paid on managed care platform; Title: Experienced Mental Health Clinical Referral Coordinator
Description: About UsFounded in 1976, Women_Ñés Therapy Referral Service (WTRS) is a feminist co-op of women psychotherapists, screened for professional excellence. We offer a variety of approaches to psychotherapy but share a common perspective in viewing our clients as people who come to us with a fund of personal strengths and abilities but who seek further growth and healing.Our group includes clinical psychologists, social workers, masters level counselors, and marriage and family therapists. All of us offer individual therapy, and some also offer couples and/or family therapy. Each therapist works autonomously and has full and separate legal and ethical therapeutic responsibility for her clients.Our referral coordinator is a client_Ñés first contact with the organization _ÑÐ providing information about mental healthcare, helping clients clarify therapy needs, and offering guidance on how to effectively interview a therapist to make an informed choice. The coordinator then provides referrals to three well-matched therapists and follows up with clients as needed.Job DescriptionThe Coordinator is the general office manager and primary contact person for the Women_Ñés Therapy Referral Service. The Coordinator supports the organization with both administrative and clinical skills. The Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Board and membership as well as providing clients seeking psychotherapy with appropriate referrals to therapists within the service. This part-time position requires a regular schedule of 20-25 hours per week and at least one evening per week until 8 pm.*** UPDATE *** Due to challenges presented by the Coronavirus, this position will be 10-20 hours per week while all businesses are in fluxJob ResponsibilitiesClinicalScreen new clients via email and phoneConduct in-person interviews with new clients, educate clients about mental healthcare, provide referrals to therapistsFollow-up with clients and therapists to understand fit issues, fine-tune referrals, and address client concernsConsult regularly with a clinical supervisor provided by the serviceAdministrativeMaintain email account and phone requests, track requests and screenings, follow up with clientsFacilitate communications between organization_Ñés committees as neededAssist with Board paperwork, note-taking, meeting minutes, and distribution of information to membershipManage initial contact with and keep a list of potential new therapist members, provide information and refer to Interview CommitteeTrack member availability and practice and location changesTrack operational, budgetary, and service use statistics and offer analysis as neededManage office (bills, bookkeeper, web person, supplies, and tidying)Attend and take/distribute minutes for the quarterly membership meetingMaintain referral database and community resourcesUtilize practice management software to track client progressionOrganizationalOutreachMaintain database of providers and organizations who refer to the serviceCoordinate with the Marketing committee to print and mail promotional materialsMembersAnswer or redirect member questionsHelp orient new members, visit new member officesMaintain an ongoing sense of how each therapist works and what types of clients they serveCommitteesProvide monthly and quarterly use statistics for Board and Marketing committeeParticipate in panel interview of prospective members with the Interview committeeRefer queries about membership issues on to an appropriate committeeAttend a monthly board meeting on Friday afternoon.Skills and QualificationsMeaningful experience in counseling or related field (e.g., as an educator, case management, intake, social justice work, clinical experience in paid or volunteer capacity); Minimum of five years_Ñé relevant work experience preferredBachelor_Ñés Degree in related fieldAbility to listen without judgment or preconceived _ÑÒframe_ÑAbility to maintain confidentiality and to otherwise contain sensitive information and emotional experienceExcellent clinical and organizational skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsMust have a working knowledge of Word and Excel and ability to learn practice management softwareBalance of intuitive and analytic skills/capacitiesAbility to work at least one evening per week (until 8:00 pm)Must have access to transportation and a valid Driver_Ñés License and InsurancePossess or have a capacity to develop understanding of different psychotherapeutic orientationsComply with continuing education requirements (12-15 credits per year in ethics, suicide prevention, and cultural competence)Must be comfortable with autonomy and able to ask for assistance when needed.Benefits$25-30/hour depending on experiencePaid vacation and sick leaveClinical Consultation providedPaid continuing education (12-15 credits per year)Partial benefits availableWomen_Ñés Therapy Referral Service is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
