Title: Epidemiologist II - Analytics &Informatics COVID
Description: SummaryPublic Health _ÑÐ Seattle and King County values diverse perspectives and life experiences. The Department encourages people of all backgrounds to apply, including people of color, immigrants, refugees, women, LGBTQ, people with disabilities, and veterans.Do the following interest you?Developing analysis and reports based on complex data systemsMonitoring and ensuring data integrityApproaching public health data problems with an informatics lens, leveraging innovative strategies so that resources are used effectivelyPublic Health _ÑÐ Seattle & King County is seeking an Epidemiologist II to support informatics and analytics for COVID-19. This position is part of the Communicable Disease Epidemiology and Immunization Section (CD-EPI). The Epidemiologist II is independently responsible for the design of major surveillance projects/systems and analysis of data and supervises the work of assigned staff.The duration of this opportunity is expected to last up to one year from position fulfillment.Applicants from this recruitment may be used to fill additional positions that may occur in the next 6 months.WHO MAY APPLY: This position is open to all qualified candidates.Special Duty Assignment interest, you must be a Career Service, Career Service Exempt or other regular employees in King County who have completed their initial County probation. You must have supervisor approval prior to taking a Special Duty Assignment.WORK SCHEDULE: Monday through Sunday, 40 hours per week, which may including evenings. This position is subject to the Fair Labor Standards Act and is overtime eligible where time exceeds 40 hours per week. At Seattle/King County Public Health we strive to be accessible to those we serve. This position may require flexibility to accommodate different work schedules and work locations. Overtime during evenings and weekends may be required as part of emergency response.CONTACT: If you have questions about your application or the application process, please contact Angela Brown, Human Resource Analyst, at abrown@kingcounty.gov.APPLICATION PROCESS:A complete application packet will consist of the following:NEOGOV/Government Jobs on-line or paper applicationSupplemental questionsSample Materials - as described in the supplemental questions, please submit the following materials with your application. As we would like to evaluate your coding and reporting skills to date, please do not write new programs or make modifications to existing ones. If you have concerns about sharing these examples, please send an email to abrown@kingcounty.govOne example that demonstrates your programming skills in data manipulation (e.g., SQL, text string searches, arrays, recoding data values, macros, date/time calculations, applying formats to variables, merging data sets, transposing data, creating output in HTML/PDF/Word, etc.) and data analysis skills.One example that demonstrates your skills in developing reports, including visualizations and interpretation of results.You may attach multiple documents if you wish with your application:Copy and paste one or more documents into the text resume section of the application.Attach multiple documents/files in the resume attachment section.Applications and/or Supplemental Questionnaires that state "see my resume" or "see my personnel file" are considered incomplete and will not be accepted. Cover letters and/or resumes are not accepted in lieu of a completed application. Do not copy and paste content from a CV or resume as a substitute for answering the supplemental questions. Answers to the supplemental questions will be used to identify eligible candidates for this position; please provide detailed responses to these questions.TIMELINE: Candidates who pass the initial screening (based on their responses to the supplemental questions) will be contacted approximately 1-2 weeks after the application period closes. Eligible candidates will be invited to at least one (and possibly two) interviews. Candidates will generally be notified of a final decision within 1-2 weeks of their interview date.Job DutiesApply epidemiological and statistical methodologies to conduct disease surveillance.Lead and coordinate the collection of data from settings such as laboratories, electronic medical records, long-term care facilities, correctional settings, homeless shelters, and schools by building partnerships, coordinating the exchange of data, designing databases, developing surveys, and implementing novel data collection strategies.Conduct data integration (e.g., matching/merging records across complex data sources).Lead epidemiological and statistical analysis using local, state, and federal databases to support disease investigations and determine trends, incidence and prevalence of disease, and examine data for health disparities.Supervise the conduct of data quality assurance, including data cleaning and developing data quality reports.Create reports and interpret data for internal and external audiences.Lead data analysis and data interpretation, including the development of reports and written summaries for internal and external audiences.Design and supervise the creation of data visualizations and dashboards (e.g., using Tableau) for internal and external audiences.Design or improve infrastructures, tools, and methodologies for collecting communicable disease data.Lead the design and maintenance of databases.Work with a team of database developers and epidemiologists to design and test improvements to existing databases/systems.Design and oversee development of data collection tools and methodologies.Design, implement, and supervise data integration across data systems.Provide technical supervision of assigned staff involved in data collection and management.Experience, Qualifications, Knowledge, SkillsMaster's degree in epidemiology, informatics, biostatistics, or related field OR any equivalent combination of experience and education which provides the applicant with the skills, knowledge and abilities required to perform the work.Experience leading or coordinating data collection, by facilitating data exchange with partners, designing data collection strategies, or designing databases.Experience with data management and analysis, in each of the following categories:Experience analyzing complex databases, including longitudinal data and relational datasets.Creating surveillance summaries, outbreak summaries, or annual reports for internal and external audiences.Experience conducting record linkage and data integration across databases.Expertise in analytical programming, including knowledge of SQL (for extracting or creating data sets), text string searches, coding efficiencies, arrays, recoding data values, macros, date/time calculations, applying formats to variables, merging data sets, transposing data, and conducting statistical modeling.Creating visualizations of surveillance data (using Excel, ArcGIS, R, SAS, or Tableau).Knowledge of statistical theory, including hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis, trend analysis, regression analysis, sampling techniques, and confidence-interval estimation.Experience interpreting data by summarizing assumptions, conclusions, strengths and weaknesses of the data.Supervisory experience.Proficient written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.Demonstrated ability to work well on a team.Demonstrated ability to conduct projects within timelines.Ability to work independently with minimal direction; excellent problem-solving skills.Ability to work well under pressure with multiple competing priorities and deadlines.Desired QualificationsStrong SAS coding skills.Experience analyzing data from electronic health records (EHR) or electronic laboratory reports (ELR).Experience conducting communicable disease surveillance.Experience working in a local or state public health practice setting.Supplemental InformationA complete King County application will include only the requested materials and fully answered supplemental questions that is supported in your application.The selection process may include but is not limited to: evaluation of application materials and supplemental questions, interviewing, and testing. For more information on our selection process, please refer to www.kingcounty.gov/depts/health/jobs/hiring.Regular and reliable attendance, effective communication skills, and development of effective working relationships are requirements of all Public Health positions.Staff may be required to play an active role in the event of a public health emergency, which may include changes in responsibilities, work location and working hours.Necessary Special Requirements:The selected candidate will be required to submit a background check. Records are not automatically disqualifying.Employees are required to protect the privacy and security of protected health information as defined in State and Federal Law.Employees are required to adhere to OSHA/WISHA guidelines including but not limited to completing required trainings on time.Union Affiliation:This position is represented by WSC of County & City Employees, Local 21

Title: Senior Director I, Product Research, New Mobility Products
Description: Senior Director I, Product Research, New Mobility ProductsDescription:Are you looking for a position with the ability to leverage the resources of a Fortune 100 company to battle for the future of our place in the transportation, new mobility and insurance industries? Our Product Technology Solutions group within Global Retail Markets is seeking a Senior Director I to lead the product design and development of new mobility insurance products.Consumer preferences and emerging trends in the mobility and auto insurance space are pressuring insurers to adapt. This role is the Product Design lead for GRM within Liberty Mutual_Ñés Cross-SBU New Mobility team, which exists to help us stay ahead of and capitalize on the disruption of mobility trends. Segments in focus include shared economy, ridehail, autonomous vehicles, next generation vehicle technology, peer to peer, goods delivery, micromobility & more.A key to success in this role will be the ability to understand the needs of our growing portfolio of mobility customers, and to adapt and converge the traditional capabilities of commercial lines and personal lines insurance products to address those needs.As part of the New Mobility Product team, you will be involved with a top priority initiative of the Global Retail Markets business unit _ÑÐ creating and deepening our new mobility partnerships. With a number of new mobility products already in market and the portfolio continuously expanding, this role will be responsible for working directly with our partners to align on strategic product opportunities, bringing one or more products to market, and optimizing in-flight products. This is a hands-on, high-visibility role where you would manage engagement and communication with stakeholders ranging from executives, to developers, to brokers, and to new mobility partners.Responsibilities for the person in this role include:Manage a Team: directing and developing them to execute against Mobility strategic initiatives and product objectivesMobility Pod Product Design Strategy: Collaboratively lead product design, pricing strategy, and program management for enterprise-level quotesMobility Pod New Product Development: Formulate approach and lead the ideation and building of new mobility solutions across personal, small, and large commercial to meet emerging needsMobility Pod Pricing Alignment: Drive strategy for how we prioritize competing Mobility Pod pricing efforts with dedicated reach back resources in GRM Economics, GRM Product Design & Modeling, and GRS Actuarial, e.g. prioritize backlog of enterprise quotes, shared economy flow business, new product development and pricing R&D.Cross-SBU Coverage Coordination: of large commercial, small commercial and personal policies to meet emerging mobility coverage needs arising from the convergence of mobility trends, e.g. Power-user policies for Peer-to-Peer vehicle sharingSupport New Mobility quote submissions beyond product, pricing and coverage aspects as needed. Frequently supplementing submission efforts with competitive intel, doing client analysis, fielding objections, and helping to develop sales strategyAnalytics and Reporting for New Mobility Programs: Drive insights, manage, coordinate and deliver the New Mobility Monthly Operating Report as well as driving market research and opportunity sizingNew Vehicle Technology Trends & Product Strategy: evaluating the impact on our business and developing strategic response plans to capture value and minimize risk / cost, e.g. Electric Vehicle product strategyManage New and More Detailed Vehicle Data Streams: understand the impact of new vehicle features on auto insurance and productize accordingly, e.g. Vehicle Build Sheet vendor analysis and product strategyDrive Autonomous Vehicle Strategy for GRM Product Management: The Senior Director will be responsible for identifying the needs, conducting research and defining the strategy for the next generation of products for semi and fully autonomous vehicles. They will also be responsible for managing a portfolio of initiatives and partners with multiple functions within Liberty Mutual and external companies to execute initiativesThe role will report to the VP & Manager, Countrywide Product, Product Technology Solutions.We Are Looking for a Candidate That:Can build and manage an effective teamHas a roll-up your sleeves and get things done mentality _ÑÐ shows gritServes as _ÑÒchaos pilot_Ñ who approaches the fast-pace and frequent pivots inherent in innovation with energy and openness, keeping team morale highHas an interest in learning about new emerging spaces and technologyUnderstands, or is willing to learn about how multiple insurance products, such PL & Commercial Auto, telematics, Accident and Health, can supplement each other in a world of converging mobility trendsIs self-driven, has superior organizational skills, integrity and great follow through on tasksExcels in handling ambiguity and weathering the uncertainty and pivots inherit in product innovationCan collaborate and communicate cross-functionally to develop buy-in on our product visionApproaches strategic analysis with an unbiased mindset, can empathize with customers, partners, and competitors and make thoughtful, data-driven recommendationsIs comfortable facilitating conversations with strategic partners, as well as key internal and external stakeholdersResponsibilities:Manage and develop a team of high performers that can operate in ambiguityConduct competitor, market research to understand competitor actions and product acceptance/adoption by customersDevelop strategic analysis frameworks and recommendations for GRM_Ñés Transportation and Mobility strategic imperativesDevelop comprehensive, multi-functional, multi-year plan to prepare our business for the transition to autonomous and semi-autonomous vehiclesObtain executive (e.g., COO, Chief Product Officer) buy-in on strategy and initiativesPartner across the organization to develop and execute on go-to-market strategyIdentify and mobilize internal stakeholders to execute against our product visionLead the planning and implementation of our products with IT, distribution, claims, marketing, finance, design and modeling, and state management teamsManage and deliver the ridehail & New Mobility Monthly Operating ReportEstablish processes to communicate product performance and identify optimization opportunitiesSupport new opportunity development for potential partners in collaboration with our Strategic Partnership Group and Vendor Management teamDevelop a comprehensive view of the autonomous vehicle landscape across technological changes, legal and regulatory implicationsCommunicate updates to internal and external leadership regularlyQualifications:8-10+ years of relevant and progressively more responsible experience, preferably within insurance including experience in customer and technology areasAdvanced degree (degree in an analytical discipline like Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Marketing Analytics or Data Science a plus) and/or ACAS/FCAS designation preferredMust have exceptional planning, organizational, analytical, decision-making and communication skills.Experience managing individuals or operations requiredExpert understanding of insurance concepts and financial metricsExcellent analytic, quantitative and problem solving skills with proven ability to influence other leaders across the Product organization.Expert knowledge of product offerings, business processes, product line systems, underwriting rules, pricing plans and databasesExpert organizational, project management, collaboration, and presentation skillsAbility to work on multiple priorities in a fast-paced environmentExcellent written and oral communication skills, including PowerPointPMP or Six Sigma certification a plusThe qualified individual can work in Boston or Seattle.Benefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it_Ñés our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.We_Ñére dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Account Manager - Customer Success Team
Description: AboutBarn2Door is a Seattle-based food+tech startup that helps local farms sell direct to buyers through all digital channels, including web, social and mobile. We exist to empower Farmers who care about our planet.We are looking for people passionate about the intersection of food, agriculture and technology. At Barn2Door, you_Ñéll get to learn what it takes to build a startup business and participate in ongoing training and education, while also playing a critical role in our growth.OverviewAs an Account Manager for our Farmers, you will be part of Barn2Door_Ñés Success Team. This role is crucial in our customers_Ñé journey. Once trained and onboarded, Farmers will depend on ongoing recommendations, training and insights to optimize their customer adoption through marketing best practices online. You will be responsible for keeping our existing customer base successful through effective customer engagement and platform adoption (as evidenced through transaction volume).This role includes managing Farmer Accounts and requires project management, customer service, and ongoing training of the Barn2Door platform. You will become an expert on core product functionality, and provide feedback to the Support, Marketing and Product teams.You should be a natural teacher, confident with technology, solution-oriented, and eager to become fluent in local food and agriculture. You will be accountable for platform adoption, sales volume and Farmer renewal rates.You WillManage Farmers as they leverage Barn2Door to manage their customer relationships, including but not limited to ongoing marketing tacticsTrain Farmers on platform features and capabilities to service their end customersTrain Farmers on digital marketing best practices (web, social, and email) to optimize regular online ordersTrack individual customer accounts, develop personas and match programs and tactics accordinglyMonitor, measure, and map customer engagement and activityHelp iterate on strategy and process for lifecycle marketing to FarmersProvide exceptional customer service using proactive communicationMaintain great technical knowledge of the Barn2Door platform and guide our customers through relevant features and functionalities for their specific needsCollaborate with the Support and Product teams to ensure customer satisfactionYou Are:A highly motivated, focused self-starter (this isn_Ñét a theory it_Ñés a must)Energized by human interaction, communication and building relationshipsWell organized, always looking to excel and over-deliverAble to methodically track progress, steps and resultsHungry to learn and excel at facilitating Farmers_Ñé Success across all online channelsEspecially enthusiastic about sustainable food, farms and restaurantsAn excellent communicator with ability to resolve customer issues with graceComfortable working in an entrepreneurial environmentYou Have:1-2 years experience or equivalent, as a Customer Success Manager (CSM) in SaaS (ideally with a focus on small business)A good understanding of CSM metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs)A passion for training and communicating with customers, and the drive to help them be successfulExcellent communication skills both to engage customers and deliver feedback to your peers and managementStrong technical skills, and a willingness to quickly adopt new skillsA service-oriented, can-do attitude: you are able to stay enthusiastic, positive and focus on the go-forward strategyBonus: experience in agriculture, food, restaurant industriesBonus: experience with trainingBonus: experience with online CRM, social and marketing management solutions (Facebook, Instagram, Hubspot, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, Analytics etc.)You Get:$44k-$56k annual salary DOE + generous stock options and benefits10 days PTO, 5 days Sick Leave and 11 Paid Holidays100% premium coverage for Medical, Dental, Vision and AD&D (Employee-only)Real experience in a high profile startup company just hitting its growth curveOngoing training and professional developmentOpportunity to be a rock star - great exposure and upsideHip startup office environment on Eastlake (Lake Union)Net-netWe_Ñére looking for driven, intelligent people who regularly go the extra mile. You should thrive on the urgency of a startup atmosphere and be results driven (always seeking to exceed expectations). You must be well-disciplined, self-motivated and hungry to achieve. If you_Ñéve got the drive, grit, creativity, and a passion for local food, startups and disrupting the food industry - then Barn2Door may be right for you.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $44,000.00 to $56,000.00 /yearWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offProfessional development assistanceThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culturePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:https://www.barn2door.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/barn2doorBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: HRIS Business Analyst
Description: Whether it's ensuring public health and safety; providing clean drinking water and environmentally responsible electricity services; connecting people, places and products via a high-quality transportation system; creating welcoming and safe places to play and build community; or acting upon opportunities to meet the challenges of a growing and vibrant city - City of Seattle employees make our community a better place every day. At the Seattle Department of Human Resources (SDHR) our work promotes an equitable and engaging work environment, so employees can do their best work and make a difference for the people and communities we serve.The City of Seattle believes in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and is committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. SDHR provides services for the City of Seattle's diverse workforce, using our expertise to define and direct strategic Citywide human resource policies and practices. We constantly pursue excellence to best meet the needs of our clients and ensure we are taking care of the City's greatest asset: its people. We center racial equity and inclusion of staff in decision-making, and we are looking for a teammate and partner who shares these goals of shared power and inclusion.We have an opportunity for an experienced HRIS professional to support the planning and development of the replacement of the City's legacy HR system. The HRIS Business Analyst will support a designated functional area throughout the project. The major priority for the successful candidate will be to collaborate closely with business units to ensure processes and system functionality meet the business and end-use needs. This role will support a functional area in meeting objectives, creating and maintaining deliverables, driving cross functional design issues to solution, maintaining project standards, determining system configuration requirements, analysis, understanding data, documentation, training and project support.Job Responsibilities:The HRIS Business Analyst will work with internal partners, stakeholders and sponsors to support the replacement of the City's legacy human resource system. This work involves extensive customer interaction and execution of deliverable tasks.Here's more of what you'll be doing:Examine data files, processes, forms, reports and operational needs of business units, in order to complete data mapping and system conversion requirements.Develop an understanding of, and define, business unit's products and services through information gathering sessions to determine the City requirements for HRIS replacement.Through data analysis, product mapping and interviews, gather forms and data files from business units and assess requirements for system utilization and configuration.Conduct implementation analysis and training sessions with stakeholders to facilitate solution configurations and interface set-up.Formulate recommendations, present, and support the configuration requirements of system modules.Assist in the evaluation of potential HRIS replacement systems.Your effectiveness in this role will depend on your ability to:Communicate technical concepts and processes using clear, simple language and visuals.Anticipate, draw conclusions, and adapt to changing needs as well as engage with business. stakeholders within a functional area to gather, clarify and document requirements.Identify gaps in business requirements and ask the right questions to fill in gaps.Resolve conflict in a constructive manner and work around obstacles to ensure success.You will be prepared for this role if you have the following knowledge and skills:Formal training in management information systems, computer science or a similar discipline.Proficiency in testing and functional validation.One or more certifications from the Project Management Institute (PMI).Knowledge of HCM database design, structure, functions and processes.Familiarity with general human resources processes and procedures within the employee life cycle.Strong delegation and time management skills.You will be most successful in this role if you have experience in any of these areas:Experience working with system users defining current processes and mapping those to solutions.Testing and troubleshooting system HRIS configurations.Documenting business processes and system operations.Experience with at least one HCM enterprise solution.Working with stakeholders with limited technical expertise regarding business processes and data requirements.Qualifications:A qualified candidate is a seasoned professional with experience in supporting HRIS projects and enterprise system implementation. The work of this position requires demonstrated subject matter expertise in HRIS support, business process mapping and documentation and information system implementation.The successful candidate is self-motivated and well-adapted to meet deadlines with speed, accuracy and a professional attitude. They have demonstrated their ability to be creative and strategic across a range of projects with ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines. They have an established record of leading successful projects. They have a reputation as a strong collaborative partner, exercising a high level of tact, good judgment, discretion, diplomacy and cooperative working relationships with diverse groups of people.Additional Information:This is a fully benefited two-year temporary assignment.Please note this job advertisement is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Please submit the following with your online application:A cover letter in which you clearly describe how your knowledge, skills, and abilities prepare you for the job responsibilities and qualifications outlined in the job announcement.A resume of your educational and professional work experience.Please submit your application, resume and cover letter to https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/seattle/. If you have questions, please contact Pam Inch, Senior Executive Recruiter at Pam.Inch@seattle.gov.Who May Apply: This position is open to all candidates that meet the qualifications. The Seattle Department of Human Resources values diverse perspectives and life experiences. Applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, marital status, disability, religious or political affiliation, age, sexual orientation, or gender identity. The Department encourages people of all backgrounds to apply, including people of color, immigrants, refugees, women, LGBTQ, people with disabilities, veterans and those with diverse life experiences.

Title: Business Analyst - TA0R076
Description: Consultant- Business AnalystAltaSource Group is looking for a Business Analyst for our global wealth company in Seattle! They are a leading global asset management firm providing systematic, rules-based investment strategies and customized exposure management to institutions and individual investors around the world.You are someone who is comfortable, curious, eager, willing to be collaborative and not being afraid to ask questions. This is a Business Analyst role where it doesnÈt necessarily mean that you would need to be Senior in your tenure however, be able to add value to the team. We provide 100% company paid medical, dental and vision for our employees! Additional employee benefits include a free Employee Assistance Program, available flex spending accounts, available 401K program, and local discount programs through Passport.We are proud to say we have a Glassdoor rating of 4.9!Your recruiter for this role will be: Kristen Penahttps://www.linkedin.com/in/klpena/IND123

Title: Digital Business Analyst
Description: The Digital Business Analyst will help Community Transit make travel easy by translating customer needs into user stories to create a digital experience that works well for its users. The Digital Business Analyst will determine the impact these stories will have on existing systems and processes. Will become an expert on the systems that drive our digital channels. They will compare user requirements to business system capabilities and conduct a gap analysis. This problem-solver will work cross-functionally to develop strategies to solve complex technical problems.The Digital Business Analyst will apply analytical skills to gather both functional and non-functional requirements derived from product roadmaps. They are an active member of the Digital Scrum Team who adds business value by working with the Digital Product Owner and business stakeholders to create clarity around business objectives through the development and refinement of user stories. They will document the requirements necessary to develop solutions that improve the customer experience.The ideal candidate is an expert at analyzing software systems and delivers actionable insights that guide decision making and optimization. The position is both strategic and hands-on, requiring an obsession to improve the customerÈs experienceMinimum QualificationsBachelorÈs degree in Business, Computer Science or related field Or equivalent combination of education and experience to successfully perform the essential duties of the job.Three (3) yearsÈ professional expertise analyzing software systems and business operations.At least two years of experience in applied quantitative methods of analysis and research, preferably in the transportation industry.PreferredUnderstanding of the transportation industryFamiliarity with software tools like Jira, Rally or TFSProject management experienceExposure to Agile/Scrum MethodologyFull job description, essential duties, minimum & entry level qualifications on our website.APPLICATION PROCESSApply on line on the Community Transit Jobs PageOnly complete on-line applications with job history listed, resume and cover letter will be considered.Applicants must include a resume and cover letter with their application.Applicants who meet minimum requirements may be scheduled for tests and interviews to demonstrate knowledge, skills for the position.If you have a family member, or share the same living quarters of a current Community Transit employee, please let your Human Resources Recruiter know as your eligibility for this position may be affected. Community Transit provides a tobacco-free & drug-free work environment.As a recipient of federal funds, Community Transit is an Equal Opportunity Employer & does not unlawfully discriminate on any basis prohibited by Federal, State or Local law. We value and encourage diversity in our workforce. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, protected veteran status or disability.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $78,426.00 to $82,347.00 /year

Title: Certified Business Analyst  IT Security and Industrial Cont...
Description: BackgroundTotal Systems Solutions Consulting Inc. represents an association of independent IMITS Consultants based in British Columbia. We are seeking a partner consultant for the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure in Victoria or Vancouver BC Canada.The Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure plans transportation networks, provides transportation services, develops and implements transportation policies, and administers many transportation-related acts and regulations. The Information Management serves the ministry by develop and maintaining strategic client relationships with Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure clients and directing the development of Information Management /Information Technology solutions for the Ministry.In 2013, the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (ministry) built the Regional Transportation Management Centre (RTMC) facility that now serves as a focal point for transportation management in the province. The RTMC is equipped with modern traffic control systems and provides 24/7, real-time monitoring of road and traffic conditions (of provincially managed highways) across B.C. Its goal is to keep traffic moving efficiently and safelyThe Office of the Attorney General informed the Ministry on October 20, 2016 that they were considering a performance audit of the security of industrial control systems monitored and managed by the MinistryÈs Regional Transportation Management Centre (RTMC), now renamed to Transportation Management Centre of BC (TMCBC, or TMC). Industrial control systems are designed to monitor and control the operation of critical infrastructure equipment in sectors such as transportation.The OAG notified the Ministry on March 23, 2017 that they would proceed with a shorter and more focused cybersecurity audit to determine whether the Ministry has established appropriate cybersecurity controls to protect its traffic management systems at the TMC and three Local Operations Centre (LOC) sites: Lions Gate Bridge, George Massey Tunnel, and Cassiar Tunnel.The audit was conducted from April 10-13, 2017 and included site visits and on-site interviews.The OAG chose to align their audit lines of enquiry and criteria with the Centre for Internet Security (CIS)Ès good practice guide CIS Critical Security Controls.The scope of the audit included all network-discoverable information technology (IT) and operational (industrial) technology (OT) transacting the MinistryÈs fibre network: servers, workstations, network devices, and OT devices.In June 2017, the auditors issued a draft management report to the Ministry for review and feedback and revised it to consider the feedback provided by the Ministry. The OAG delivered the final management report to the Deputy Minister the first week of August 2017; it detailed a total of 28 recommendations in all five lines of enquiry and includes the MinistryÈs Management ResponseÈ committing to action each recommendation. On October 26, 2017 the OAG released its Public Report summarizing these detailed recommendations at a high level. The report can be found at www.bcauditor.com/sites/default/files/publications/reports/FINAL_RTMC.pdfThe RTMC Remediation Project is responsible for ensuring that the OAGÈs 28 detailed recommendations are actioned and completed. One of the recommendations in the report is the remediation and/or replacement of existing supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems at 4 key locations within the lower mainland, each of which will be treated as a project; Lions Gate Bridge lane control & lighting system, George Massey Tunnel lighting and life safety system, Cassiar Tunnel lane control and lighting system, and Port Mann Bridge snow and ice removal system.A common SCADA platform, Ignition by Inductive Software, has been selected to support all four projects. The ministry is seeking a IT business analysis consultant who will work with Ministry and contracted staff, system vendors and implementors, in the provision of the services detailed in section 2.ServicesThe Consultant will provide the Services and deliverables similar in content and nature to the following list of examples. This list is not intended to be limiting or all-inclusive, however provides a good representation of the Services and deliverables the Ministry will require during the Term of the Contract. The Ministry will provide the Consultant with specific requirements, quality standards and timelines for the Services and deliverables on a case by case basis. Examples include:Assist with development of current solution architecture; development of solution abstracts; business process architecture; conceptual data models; business process diagrams; environmental scans and gap analyses;Assist with development of Privacy Impact Assessments (PIA), preliminary technical analysis; business requirements and process diagrams, RACI models;Conduct stakeholder analysis, workshops and requirements gathering sessions, liaise with the working group to determine requirements and document as required according to the Information Management Branch (IMB) SDLC or Agile deliverables or other methodology as required;Liaise with a COTS Contractor on changes to a COTS solution;Assist with the Ministry and OCIO standard privacy and security process and policies. development of Security and Threat Risk Assessments (STRA), Deployment Plan documentation;Participate in Data Migration Plan development and execution, transition and test plans, and test strategies;AvailabilityThe Ministry anticipates the duration of this engagement to be approximately one year (starting June 2020) with an estimated time commitment of 50%-100%, depending upon project requirements. These are average estimates only and not a guarantee of billable hours against the contract. The resulting contract will contain an option to renew for three additional one-year terms or any portion thereof, subject to satisfactory performance and availability of funding.Location and FacilitiesProjects may require the Consultant to attend meetings or work with IMB resources in the Greater Victoria area and /or MoTI offices in Coquitlam, subject to any public health orders in place at that time. The Consultant should be prepared to work at their own office location and must be able to be contacted by phone, email and via the MnistryÈs unified communication tools (Lync/Skype and online meetings.Consultant Competency and ExperienceProposed Consultants should have the following knowledge, skills, and abilities:Sound working knowledge of business analysis principles and methodologies (BPM, Agile, SDLC, for example);Ability to lead multi-discipline teams in business transformation initiatives to align business systems with new business processes, using application portfolio management techniques, and have provided and followed a plan to transfer the business from the as is structure to the to be structure;Knowledge of business process re-engineering;Knowledge of change management;Identify, define, model and document business needs, including the ability to model and document technical solutions,Experience in the development of testing, verification and training documentation & materials.Manage the quality of the delivered business solution to ensure it meets the quality expectations and is in compliance with applicable standards.Experience interacting with stakeholders, vendors, professionals and various levels of employees in a government setting;Promotes innovation to improve project success and performance by doing or promoting new ways of doing things.The Consultant should have experience delivering at least two IM/IT projects within the past eight years that clearly demonstrate experience in all of the below listed skill sets. It is not required that each project demonstrate all of the skills required, but that across the projects provided in the submission, the experience below is met:Three years of experience identifying, defining, modelling and documenting business needs, including modelling and documenting technical solutions;Three years of experience interacting professionally with a wide variety of people in diverse roles (e.g., executives, contractors, technical experts, naive users) to develop and implement automated business processes, and at least one of: service agreements with service consumers and suppliers, appropriate service management processes, training/education materials and application maintenance support;Three years of experience managing the quality of the delivered business solution to ensure it meets quality expectations;Two years of experience leading multi-discipline or single discipline teams in a business initiative to design and align new business systems with business processes;Two years of experience reporting to senior managers;Two years of experience managing effective communications with project stakeholders at all levels from diverse business units.The number of required years of experience is a minimum. Additional years of experience beyond the minimum will result in additional points being awarded.Experience with the following is heavily preferred and will result in additional points being awarded:Experience with Industrial Control System (ICS) technologies, including Autonomous Control and Supervisory Control and Data AcquisitionExperience with Industrial Cyber Security controls and best practicesExperience leading blended project teams comprised of IM/IT, Engineering, and Field Technician team membersExperience with leading blended project teams through deployment planning and execution activities for all ICS components including software, network, and industrial field device componentsExperience leading business areas and technical resources through ICS System Acceptance Testing, User Acceptance Testing, and Live Cut-overs.Experience facilitating and documenting testing and deployment activities.Relevant Education and Professional DesignationsPreference will be given to Consultants that have formal education (i.e. diploma or degree) in a related business or computer science field. In addition, Bonus points will be awarded for the following preferred certifications:International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA)- Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP); and/orLean Six Sigma (Green or Black Belt).Job Types: Part-time, ContractSalary: $100.00 to $105.00 /hourExperience:ICS including Autonomous Control and Supervisory Control : 3 years (Required)project teams comprised of IM/IT, Engineering, and Field : 3 years (Required)documenting business needs, and technical solutions: 3 years (Required)development service agreements : 1 year (Required)Industrial Cyber Security controls: 3 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)License:* Lean Six Sigma (Green or Black Belt). (Required)(IIBA) or (CBAP) (Required)Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analytics
Description: Hi,Hope you are doing well.**This is Nasim Shah from Tredence. We have an exciting opportunity for those who are passionate about Data Analytics. We are looking for Data Scientist in Seattle, WA. for our company (Tredence). Please find the Job Description below:About Us:Tredence is a global analytics services and solutions company. Our capabilities range from Data Visualization, Data Management to Advanced analytics, Big Data and Machine Learning. Our uniqueness is in bringing the right mix of technology and business analytics to create sustainable white-box solutions that are transitioned to our clients at the end of the engagement. We do this cost effectively using a global execution model leveraging our clients' existing technology and data assets. We also come in with strong IP and pre-built analytics solutions in data mining, business intelligence and Big Data.(Permanent Position) **Job Responsibilities:Lead and manage independently the onsite-offshore relation, at the same time adding value to the client.Engage with clients and business partners to understand their requirement, identify their challenges.Provide clear business context and deliver actionable insights and recommendations, by designing analytical solutions and frameworks, in collaboration with the off-shore team in India.Put together a solution architecture that is scalable, reusable, efficient and effectivePresent results, insights and recommendations to senior management with an emphasis on the _ÑÒnow what_Ñ, i.e. business impact.Build engaging rapport with client leadership through relevant conversations and genuine business recommendations that impact the growth and profitability of the organization.Build and grow the organization through pre-sales, operations and training enablement.**Skills and Qualifications:3 to 5 years of database experience with advanced SQL skillsStrong business skills, strong SQL, customer/marketing analytics experience.SQL - Advanced HIVE SQL (incl. window functions, advanced aggregations etc)Python Scripting (re-usable classes, functions)Statistics _ÑÐ In addition to what we current have also add - understanding of test /control analysis, confidence intervals, bootstrapAbility to research and manipulate complex and large data sets (both distributed and non-distributed)Ability to solve complex business problem through a blend of logical and creative thinking _ÑÐ mental ambidexterityStrong communication skills with excellent ability to synthesize complex informationWorking experience in retail, e-commerce, merchandising, marketing will be an added advantage bachelor_Ñés in engineering, or Masters in Statistics / Economics / Business AdministrationRegards**Nasim ShahAssociate Manager US Recruitment | TREDENCE | Connect the Dots | www.tredence.comDirect: 408-831-3758Follow us on | F* | t* | inInc.5000 for the 3rd consecutive year | Economic Times Bootstrap Champ-2018Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $100,000.00 to $130,000.00 /yearExperience:Data analytics: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Additional Compensation:Other forms

Title: Director II, Data Science - GRM Actuarial
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!Job Summary:GRM Actuarial _ÑÐ Predictive Modeling team is searching for a highly motivated Director II, Data Science who is eager to make an impact on the very complex and evolving insurance industry. As the manager of the US Long-Tailed Lines Predictive Modeling team, you will provide analytical direction for a team of actuarial and data science professionals.You and your team will leverage primary data, advanced quantitative modeling and financial analysis to develop predictive models and tools that enable data-driven strategic decision-making. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive modeling techniques, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. You will provide highly technical analytical assessments of business issues to management and a mixture of technical and non-technical audiences so good communication skills are essential. This is a highly visible role that will connect often with senior management and other groups across Liberty Mutual.Responsibilities:Manage, coach and develop a team of up to six highly-skilled actuarial and data science staff.Collaborate with other business partners to develop appropriate statistical approaches and tools that will drive strategic decision making related to reserving, trends and other challenging problems central to our business.Understand the competitive marketplace, business issues, and data challenges in order to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and business processes.Research, recommend, and implement new and/or alternative statistical and mathematical methodologies appropriate for the given model or analysis.Supervise and perform highly complex, technical and creative predictive modeling projects.Effectively communicate results, insights and recommendations in written, oral and presentation formats to technical and non-technical audiences.Regularly engage with data science and actuarial communities and lead cross-functional working groups.Qualifications:Master's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or any other quantitative field plus a minimum 7 years of applied business/non-academic experience preferred; OR Ph.D. plus a minimum of 4 years of experience preferred; OR Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation required plus a minimum of 5 years of experience, or comparable actuarial education/designation combined with relevant experience.Proficient in predictive analytics including experience in model development, validation, and testing.Experienced in the following: generalized linear models, survival models, random forests, clustering, and Bayesian approaches to data analysis.Proficient with at least one language for data analysis, such as R, Python or SAS.Proven ability to lead and drive projects and assignments to completion through others, and effectively engage talent.Knowledge of insurance principles, underwriting and the various functions of an insurance organization, including Finance, Underwriting, Sales and Claims desirable.Exceptional planning, analytical, decision-making, communication and project management skills.Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.Ability to give effective presentations to and influence senior leaders and other groups.Management experience is preferred.Overview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.We_Ñére dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Data Engineer/Senior Data Engineer - Data & Analytics Engine...
Description: Data Engineer/Senior Data EngineerAt Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as an Agile team within a Fortune 100 company, we are on the front edge of an IT transformation for how people work and deliver solutions.GRM Data & Analytics Engineering actively searching for a highly productive member of a distributed, dynamic agile team to serve as a technical expert in analysis, design, coding, and testing innovative data warehouse reporting solutions and analytics. This position will support Agency and Strategic Partnerships within Business Data Solutions Engineering.Note: This is a range posting. Candidates will be considered at the Data Engineer/Senior Data Engineer level based on experience.Job Summary:In this role you will work collaboratively on a geographically diverse agile team to develop and enhance complex systems and/or software from user stories and technical/architectural specifications. You will analyze complex technical system problems and create innovative solutions that exceed customer expectations.This is a fast-paced environment providing rapid delivery for our business partners. You will be working in a highly collaborative environment that values speed and quality, with a strong desire to drive change and foster a positive work environment as we continue our agile transformation journey. You will have the opportunity to help lead this change with us as we grow this culture, mindset and capability.In this role you will:Work in a dynamic and exciting agile environment with Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and team members to develop creative data-driven solutions with our ETL pipeline that meet business and technical initiativesImprove speed to market by focusing on current Agency & Strategic Partners data needs as well as building out the long-term strategic data solutions using AWS, SQL, Unix, Informatica, as well as other modern data technologiesDesign and develop programs and tools to support ingestion, curation and provisioning of complex enterprise data to achieve analytics, reporting, and data scienceDemonstrate open minded and collaborative approach to creating innovative technical solutionsAnalyze data and technical system problems to design and implement effective, flexible solutionsHandle end-to-end development, including coding, testing, and debugging during each cycleDevelop automated tests for multiple scopes (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)Mentor new and junior developersIdentify and recommend appropriate continuous improvement opportunitiesQualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferredExperience developing back end, data warehouse technology solutionsKnowledge of a variety of data platforms including Teradata, DB2 (Cloud based DB a plus)Experience with AWS (such as S3, Snowflake, Athena, snapLogic), Unix, Informatica & SQLExtensive knowledge of IT concepts, strategies, methodologies.Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Test Engineers)Versed in diverse technologies and new technical architecture principles and conceptsDemonstrates leadership and active pursuit of optimizing CI/CD process and tools, testing frameworks and practicesMust be proactive, demonstrate initiative, and be a logical thinkerMust be team oriented with strong collaboration, prioritization, and adaptability skills requiredAdditional Qualifications:Java, Ruby, NoSQL, Python development experienceUnderstanding of Cloud / Hybrid data architecture conceptsUnderstanding of insurance industry and productsExcited by trying new technology and learning new toolsBenefits & Culture:In GRM Data & Analytics Engineering, we embrace all of the values of our Fortune 100 company and push our practices and technology skill sets to the next level. In this organization, we are an agile set of teams dedicated to helping impact the lives of thousands of customers every day. We embrace a modern co-working style with exceptional work/life balance, ergonomic work areas, substantial benefits, and best-in-class amenities.Liberty Mutual is one of America's Best Employers for Diversity and one of the Best Employers for Women http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacesToWorkforWomen one of the Best Employers for New Grads http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacesforNewGrads and one of the Best Places to Work http://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-BestPlacestoWork . We offer excellent benefits for our employees including generous parental leave, retirement plans including 401k and pension, education reimbursement, commuter benefits, college savings plans, and much more.To learn more about our benefit offerings and culture please visit:https://LMI.co/Benefitshttp://bit.ly/LibertyMutual-CultureEOE Statement:Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn More:

Title: Senior Director I, Data Science - GRS Predictive Analytics
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!Job Summary:The GRS Predictive Analytics Team (supporting claims) is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist Manager to join us at an exciting time as we embark on developing on several new next gen predictive models for all GRS LOBs. They will lead the development and delivery of predictive analytics tools and insights, to enable data-driven strategic decision-making to support the GRS. This person will collaborate closely with LOB Operations and Product teams, other Data Scientists, Actuaries and IT teams. This role requires expertise in a broad range of predictive analytics techniques, and their application to business opportunities. They will oversee dedicated data science and advanced analytics resources and also provides strategic and tactical direction at the highest levels within in GRS predictive modeling. This level reflects deep knowledge of predictive analytics techniques, and advanced application of applying those techniques to business issues. A successful candidate will be organized, creative, and interested in solving business problems using data and analytics. They will have the right mix of analytical, technical, and communication skills to thrive in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities:Manage 4-5 Data Scientists and provide daily guidance on model building while also attracting talent to continue building the teamCollaborate with GRS Claims Strategy, Product Teams and Field Operations to develop business cases and specifications for predictive modeling productsResponsible for building next gen predictive models using cutting edge techniques, monitor model performance, and identify continuous improvement opportunitiesUnderstand the competitive marketplace, IT environment, claims operations, and data challenges to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and business processes.Liaison with IT to develop innovative ways to deploy new predictive models in productionBecome an expert in the GRS Claims data environment and help define the long-term data strategy required for predictive analytics teamPresent findings, share insights, and make recommendations that impact claims operations.Effectively communicate results in written, oral and presentation formats.Regularly engage with the data science and actuarial communities and lead cross-functional working groups, such as on improving the Data Science summer internship program.Mentor junior Data Scientists on the teamQualifications:Strong understanding of various analytical, problem solving and modeling techniques.Has a value-driven perspective with regard to understanding of work context and impactDeep understanding of insurance operations and the procedures of Financial, Underwriting, Claims, Statistical, Information Technology, Legal and Sales departments.Utilizes significant business experience and judgment to direct work of unit and communicate results.Extensive experience building predictive models using techniques such as GLMs, GBMs, SVMs, Neural Network, etc.Extensive experience with building models using unstructured data such free text, images, voice data etc.Expertise in one more programming language such as, Python, R or SAS Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely.Ability to establish and build relationships within and outside the organization.Ability to give communicate effectively to management and other groups.Ability to train and mentor team (with junior analysts)Knowledge of claims processes preferred.MS, PhD in statistics, computer science, engineering or related fieldsBenefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it_Ñés our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.We_Ñére dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description: Title: Jr Data AnalystLocation: Redmond, WAContract Duration: 2 months with the possibility of extension up to 18 monthsCompensation: Minimum base compensation is $35 per Hour and can go higher depending on experience. Also includes medical, dental, vision, PTO, 401k Benefits.Jr Data AnalystJob Description: The team is looking for a creative, analytical and experienced analyst who loves data, is curious to explore, and wants to impact business decisions.Responsibilities:Responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data), data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records, such as organization records, in batch and real time), hierarchy management (identifying, creating, correcting, update, and maintaining complex relationships among parent and child records), and data conversion (changing / transforming the data based on business rules, usually done before the data is integrated into a new system).Requirements:Should be able to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning, and the empathy of customer experience to define and guide process improvement initiatives, innovate customer experience, and bring together new ways to create a better customer experience. (1-3 years required)Requires knowledge in project management, writing SQL queries, building Power BI dashboards. (1-3 years required)Must be_ÑËdriven, self-directed, entrepreneurial and focused on delivering the right results.Must also thrive in a team environment that values cross team collaboration and building on the success of others.Undergraduate or Master studies student with high GPA.Proficiency in English (verbal and written).Advanced computer literacy.Team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills.Commitment to accuracy, quality and attention to details.Executes project work and has zero or little experience.Plusses:Open to recently graduated students who have a degree in information system design or information system management, data science backgroundData Analysis experience (3-5 years preferred)Experience building Power BI dashboards (3-5 years preferred)Experience with SQL queries (3-5 years preferred)About Us:Neal Analytics helps companies navigate their digital transformation journey in converting data into valuable assets and a competitive advantage. With our machine learning and data engineering expertise, we leverage data to drive margin increases and profitable analytics projects. Comprised of consultants specializing in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Cognitive Services, practical AI, Data Management, and IoT, Neal Analytics is trusted to solve unique business problems and optimize operations across industries.Neal Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not and would never discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Title: Sr Global Strategy Engineer - Data Center Infrastructure
Description: DESCRIPTION -- https://www.amazon.jobs/en/jobs/1075588/The Infrastructure Solutions(ISOL) team is looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive data center engineer to drive development, implementation and delivery of enterprise data centers strategies through the use of collocation facilities and AWS infrastructure builds, which meet strict quality and performance levels across the globe. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, understands the best practices for service oriented product delivery and has extensive experience within the arena of domestic and international data center delivery.As the Sr. Global Strategy Engineer, you will lead the technical due diligence efforts for engineering site strategy, development and delivery of data center environments globally, which maintain the highest performance standards and utilize innovation to reduce budgets and increase efficiency.The Global Strategy responsibilities includesë PUE analysisë Cooling solution analysisë Long Lead equipment preparation for the proposed build design.ë Colocation assessment for new regionsë Support the power and water teams with engineering analysis.ë Work with International Utilities to understand HV/MV substation design.ë Manage/review site layouts and site plansë Provide engineering design decisions to the planning team for strategic planning and region selection.ë Work with internal teams to understand design requirements and solicit customer input.ë Collaborate with other disciplines such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, architects and compliance to create well thought out products.ë Ability to work on concurrent projects in multiple geographical regions.ë Escalate issues as required and communicate clearly and effectively at the appropriate level of detail with people from a wide range of technical abilities and backgrounds.In this role, you will interact with Design Engineering, Colocation Engineering, Power, Water, Strategy Business planning and Finance teams. You will also interact with Senior management, Directors and VP's to deliver the engineering planning decisions for approval and feedback. Successful candidates will be strong leaders who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. The business requires creative engineering balanced with high quality and customer focus. At Amazon, teamwork is absolutely necessary for us to accomplish our goals. You must be able to work within a team and depend on others to accomplish the required work.Amazon has a global presence. You will be performing technical die diligence for global regions. Travel will occasionally be necessary but shouldn_Ñét be more than 25%. International support will be part of the job.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSë Bachelor_Ñés degree in Electrical/Mechanical engineering/Architect or relevant discipline.ë 7+ years of experience with industrial/ commercial design or experience directly related to data center infrastructure and data center planning.ë In depth understanding of critical data center mechanical and electrical equipment.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSë Master_Ñés degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering/Licensed Architect or relevant discipline.ë Familiar with Substation design, HV/MV distribution systems.ë Understanding of international code requirements.ë Possess leadership and problem solving skills.ë Be a motivated, highly dependable individual.ë Ability to research new designs, technologies, and construction methods of data center equipment and facilities.ë An ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality, reliability, or maintainability.ë Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standardsë Meets/exceeds Amazon_Ñés leadership principles requirements for this roleë Meets/exceeds Amazon_Ñés functional/technical depth and complexity for this roleAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer _ÑÐ Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $120,000.00 to $200,000.00 /yearBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planSigning bonusPaid time offWork from homeParental leaveRelocation assistanceProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementSchedule:Monday to Friday8 hour shiftCompany's website:https://www.amazon.jobs/en/jobs/1075588/senior-global-strategy-engineer

Title: Employee Relations Specialist
Description: Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY:Reporting to the Human Resources Manager, this position is responsible for performing a full range of labor and employee relations activities including, but not limited to: administration of collective-bargaining agreements, grievance processing and management, internal investigations, performance management, providing support for collective-bargaining negotiations, advising management in labor/employee relations matters, and building and maintaining strong labor-management relationships with various labor organizations. This function also provides necessary administrative support including drafting official memoranda, letters and notices; scheduling; record keeping; grievance tracking; note taking; case file management; and all other duties as assigned.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Employee Relations:Is the first point of contact for employees and managers for employee relations matters.Assess UMC's employee needs using a variety of data metrics including employee engagement tools, surveys, data metrics such as turnover, exit interviews etc.Serves as an investigator for employee relations matters. Is the first point of contact for discrimination/harassment allegations.Oversees the general coordination of discovery responses, including coordinating discovery responses for assigned business units.Develops/delivers training as appropriate on employee relations issues, policies and administrative procedures.Manages the performance management program.Labor Relations:Directly performs day-to-day labor relations activities, including contract administration, labor management meetings, and information requests.Supports the Human Resources Director, Manager, and General Counsels Office during labor negotiations.Acts as a liaison between department managers and union representatives, collecting benchmarking data.Presides over Labor Management Meetings and may represent the human resources director as needed.Reviews and makes recommendations addressing variances as it relate to the CBAs and Hospital Policy.Provides interpretative guidance and serves as content expert regarding labor contracts, HR policies and procedures, employment laws, reductions in force, and regulatory requirements (e.g., Joint Commission standards).Policy Development:Coordinates the development of updates to the Human Resources Policies and Procedures, including collaborating with stakeholders and drafting new policy language compliance.Recommends policy updates to HR leadership as it relates to city, state and federal employment-based laws and regulations in a hospital setting.Updates policy and procedural documents for internal distribution.Training & Onboarding:Develops and implements the management training program focused on employees relations, labor management and the collective bargaining agreements, performance management, feedback, etc. and are aligned with benchmarked leading practices. Implements in ways that fosters understanding and provides clarity to those affected, are efficient to administer and track, and result in appropriate outcomesCreates and implements new manager onboarding program addressing employee/labor relations, performance management, human resources policies and processes.JOB REQUIREMENTS:Experience:Five years of progressively more responsible work experience in human resources.Strong project management and critical thinking skills, including proven problem solving and planning skills.Experience and interest in process improvement techniques and benchmarking. Ability to identify and analyze trends from a variety of data sources.Excellent verbal and written communication skills that are adaptive to educationally and organizationally diverse audiences.Ability to work collaboratively with diverse staff and a wide range of management levels and departments.Ability to build and maintain positive relationships internally and externally. ÕExtensive knowledge of information technology, including software technology, used in the HR function (e.g., Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Word)Knowledge of pertinent federal, state and local regulations, filing and compliance requirements, both adopted and pending, affecting employeesPhysical requirements include sitting, standing, talking in front of large groups, hearing seeing and finger dexterity.Must be able to sit, stand, write, type (finger dexterity), speak, hear, see, compare, edit, evaluate, interpret and organize for extended periods of time.Must possess excellent analytic, interpersonal and communication skills.Education: BA/BS required, or 10 yearsÕ¢_Î_¢ equivalent experience.
