Title: SOC Analyst
Description: SOC AnalystSalary Range: $89K-$99KClearance: The candidate must have an active Public Trust Clearance. The candidate must be able to attain a DHS EOD ClearanceLocation: St. ElizabethsEducation: Bachelor's degree in STEM, Cyber Security, or related field with 3 years experienceExperience: Bachelor's degree in STEM, Cyber Security, or related field with 3 years experience. 7+ years experience if no degreeMust have one of the following certifications:GCIA Intrusion AnalystGREM Reverse Engineering MalwareGPPA Perimeter Protection AnalystGISF Security FundamentalsGXPN Exploit Researcher and Advanced Penetration TesterGWEB Web Application DefenderGNFA Network Forensic AnalystGMON Continuous Monitoring CertificationOSCP (Certified Professional)OSCE (Certified Expert)OSWP (Wireless Professional)OSEE (Exploitation Expert)SEI (Software Engineering Institute)CCSP Certified Cloud Security ProfessionalCISSP Certified Information Systems SecurityCCNA SecurityCCNP SecurityCEH Certified Ethical HackerLPT Licensed Penetration TesterECSA EC-Council Certified Security AnalystENSA EC-Council Network Security AdministratorCNDA Certified Network Defense ArchitectECSS EC-Council Certified Security SpecialistECSP EC-Council Certified Secure ProgrammerECES EC-Council Certified Encryption SpecialistCyber Analyst CourseOverview/Responsibilities:Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Enterprise Security Operations Center (ESOC) is a US Government program responsible to prevent, identify, contain and eradicate cyber threats to DHS networks through monitoring, intrusion detection and protective security services to ESOC. Information systems include local area networks/wide area networks (LAN/WAN), commercial Internet connection, public-facing websites, wireless, mobile/cellular, cloud, security devices, servers, and workstations. The ESOC is responsible for the overall security of DHS Enterprise-wide information systems, and collects, investigates and reports any suspected and confirmed security violations.The DHS ESOC Program has a critical need for a talented Tier 2 Monitoring & Analysis (M&A) Analyst to join our team on this highly visible cyber security single-award IDIQ vehicle that provides ESOC support, cyber analysis, application development, and a 24x7x365 support staff. As a Tier 2 Analyst, you would work on a shift schedule, as described below. All shifts total 80 hours every 2 weeks, and multiple shift options are often available.Day: 7 AM to 7 PMNight: 7 PM to 7 AMFront: Sunday through Tuesday, with alternating 8-hour shifts every other WednesdayBack: Thursday through Saturday, with alternating 8-hour shifts every other WednesdayIn this job, you will:Conduct malware analysis, host and network, forensics, log analysis, and triage in support of incident response.Recognize attacker and APT activity, tactics, and procedures as indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be used to improve monitoring, analysis and incident response.Develop and build security content, scripts, tools, or methods to enhance the incident investigation processes.Lead Incident Response activities and mentor junior SOC staff.Work with key stakeholders to implement remediation plans in response to incidents.Effectively investigative and identify root cause findings then communicate findings to stakeholders including technical staff, and leadership.Be a flexible and adaptable self-starter with strong relationship-building skillsDemonstrate strong problem-solving abilities with an analytic and qualitative eye for reasoningDemonstrate the ability to independently prioritize and complete multiple tasks with little to no supervisionBasic Qualifications:The candidate must have an active DoD Public Trust ClearanceThe candidate must be able to attain a DHS EOD Clearance.A Tier 2 SOC Analyst should have expertise in one of the following specialized areas:Email SecurityMonitoring and detectionIncident responseCyber intelligence analysisSupporting detection, containment, and eradication of APT activities targeting customer networks.Preferred Qualifications:Ability to script in Python, Bash, Visual Basic, or PowershellKnowledge of Cyber Kill Chain (CKC) or similar frameworksExperience in cyber government, Department of Homeland Security, and/or federal law enforcementPueo Benefits:Extremely competitive salary!30 days of leave (holiday, leave, personal).100% employer-paid medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.Employer automatically contributes 4.5% to 401K no employee matching necessary.Training and Education employer reimbursement up to $2,500 per calendar year, with full tuition paid for select Masters programs.

Title: Data Engineering II
Description: Data Engineering IISalary: $108K-$118KClearance: TS with SCI Eligibility or UnclearedLocation: National Capital RegionEducation: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Cyber Security, or related field.Experience: Minimum of 3 yearsOverview/Responsibilities:Apply automated techniques to gather data from disparate databases, clean the data, and load the transformed data into a structure suited to the mission problem and analytic approach. Create and apply one-off tailored solutions for data wrangling as well as the development of semi-automated and automated Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) and pipelines. Access and clean a variety of data source formats (e.g. PowerPoint, PDF, Word, Text, Access, SharePoint, Oracle, MySQL, etc.) to access data germane to the analysis.Basic Qualifications:Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in data engineering or analysis.Preferred Qualifications:Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in data engineering or analysis and have a TS with SCI EligibilityPueo Benefits:Extremely competitive salary!30 days of leave (holiday, leave, personal).100% employer-paid medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.Employer automatically contributes 4.5% to 401K no employee matching necessary.Training and Education employer reimbursement up to $2,500 per calendar year, with full tuition paid for select Masters programs.

Title: FDP Analyst
Description: Position Title: FDP AnalystCustomer: HQDA, G8, Force Development DirectorateLocation: Washington D.C.Clearance Required: SECRET clearanceGC Associates (GCA) Company Website: http://www.gcassociates-usa.comAn FDP Analyst is required to support the Headquarters Department of the Army, G-8, Force Development Directorate and the Transparency Team.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:The FDP Analyst responsibilities include:Provide quality control assessments of Transparency data collection and submit a report quarterly to FDP leadership and the Transparency IPT.Reconcile differences between expected fielding and recorded deliveries, conducti updates on reconciliation of expected fielding quantities; and track requirements, acquisition, and deliveries.Assist in collecting, analyzing, documenting and reporting financial and equipment procurement data as it relates to the Equipment Transparency Report (ETR). This assistance will include an assessment of how current year funding changes impact the Army National Guard and U.S. Army Reserve equipment projections.Prepare summary data using the data collection files and the ETR to show progress in meeting equipment delivery targets by component each quarter. Summary data will be in the form of bar charts, graphs and/or excel data tables.Draft the Annual Transparency Data Collection Tasking Memo, review the Letter of Instruction (LOI) for necessary changes annually, coordinate with the government lead and AE2S automation team for issues and required capability upgrades in support of data collection, and prepare documents for formal staffing.Be responsible for updating and presenting the recommended status rating during the Quality Control Review phase every other day to the Government, electronically.Quarterly, the FDP Analyst shall prepare and make recommended changes to training materials and present for approval no later than 30 days prior to the beginning of the data collection phase and in support of semi-annual SSO Training materials shall explain the transparency initiative, purpose of the data collection, access to and means of using the automated tools, plus policy and procedures for data collection. The materials will include any automation changes, the format of the data collection files, quality control trends, quality control reviews and the ETR.Educational and Position Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Business or Public Administration, Management, Economics, Math, Science, Engineering, History or English. A Master's degree in one of these areas will be accepted if Bachelor's degree does not meet the criteria. Must have a Secret clearance. Have a minimum of four (4) years of experience and expertise in Force Development duties. Any experience a candidate has with equipment readiness/tracking is preferred/ideal. Must possess superior skills in Microsoft Excel to enable manipulation of large amounts of data and managing databases (especially Excel w/ pivot tables) and being skilled performing data analytics. Must be familiar with acquisition and programming (to include budget exhibits).

Title: Junior MS Access/ VBA Developer
Description: If you want an accounting career with more opportunities, it's time to join the emerging leader in financial management services Empirical Concepts. We leverage our strong accounting skills and IT proficiency to provide high-quality professional accounting, financial management, and Information Technology services to the federal government. We are seeking a Junior MS Access/VBA Developer residing in the Washington, DC metropolitan area who can provide full-time, onsite consultation and solutions services to our client also in Washington, DC metropolitan area.Our commitment to quality means we provide each employee with opportunities to achieve their career goals and advance technically and professionally. As a member of our team, you will receive off-site classroom training as well as on-the-job training from some of the best federal financial managers in the industry. In addition to career growth and development, you will also enjoy competitive compensation and benefits. Apply now!Junior MS Access/ VBA DeveloperAs a Jr. MS Access/VBA Developer, you will support the financial team and aid in the development, implementation, and management of financial software for clients. You will develop complex requirements and expand the functionality of existing solutions. To succeed, you must have an aptitude for financial reporting, data analytics and ability to adjust to changing needs of our federal clients. This position has the potential for advancement so we are seeking candidates with some leadership skills and the desire to grow with our Company.Duties & Responsibilities of this consultant role include:Work closely with management, specialists, and end-users, to create and evaluate business requirements to support delivery of effective business intelligence and reporting solutions.Assist with maintaining legacy systems; creating technical designs; developing and deploying front-end systems, data warehouse and integration with enterprise applications; implementing user access controls and data security measures, where appropriateProvide project management and client support which includes: soliciting and gathering requirements for customized solutions; facilitating end-user testing and making modifications to databases; preparing SOPs and user guides for applications; developing quality deliverables; internal workflow and processes; and presenting creative and practical ideas and solutions in a teamwork environment.Junior MS Access/ VBA DeveloperBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Finance, Accounting or other applicable quantitative or related technical field - from an accredited college/university,Must have 3+years of database development experienceProficiency in MS Access and VBA programExperience developing SQL Server, understanding of relational databases and experience programming in T-SQL, is a plusKnowledge of .Net and SharePoint development is a plus with a desire to cultivate expertiseFederal consulting experience with ability to articulate database development issues to senior government executives is a plusAbility to work independently in analyzing problems and identifying solutionsAccounting and finance knowledge and experience for reporting and internal controls is a plusU.S. citizenship is required.Junior MS Access/ VBA DeveloperBenefitsAt Empirical Concepts, Inc., we understand that providing the best services for our clients requires empowered employees. That's why we mentor our staff to assist and motivate them to achieve and reach their true potential! Our team members receive a diverse array of opportunities for experience and growth, such as our comprehensive career development path for candidates seeking an opportunity to become a member of the executive management team. Competitive compensation, good benefits, flexible work schedules, and excellent formalized training programs are just some of the additional ways we invest in our team members.Benefits include:Health, dental, and visionMatching 401(k) contributionsBonus packagesPaid holidays and PTOLife insuranceLong-term disabilityAnd more!Empower your careerApply Today!
